Dy4SvfwIewK-0Dt6a6sZKA.text: It was very good , Just not 5 star has that old-school feel, all dark wood and low light. It was a busy weeknight (the rodeo was in town), so while service wasn't super speedy, we were acknowledged quickly, and our server was very sweet and personable.

kR45NBIdjtRMJF_nIya2LQ.text: On June 30th, 2014, my wife and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary at our favorite Las Vegas Steakhouse, Vick & Anthony's. Out server Dennis was awesome, not missing a beat with his attention to detail. The food was amazingly delicious, as always. Thank you Vick & Anthony's staff for helping make our anniversary memorable! We highly recommend Vick & Anthony's Steakhouse.  The Soto's

duiPrtC6mbQJYenfFqfjUQ.text: Amazing food and service ! Florin was the best waiter and we really appreciated his suggestions. We will definitely come back here because of the wonderful treatment tonight! Way to go Florin!

Ub6XhkujJ9potb_MypXptw.text: The service and food - outstanding. Bone in rib eye cooked to perfection. Bone in filet excellent as well. Sides for the table - asparagus, mac and cheese, creamed corn and duck fat potatoes all were amazing. Table ordered two desserts - bread pudding and creme brulee both excellent. Miguel our waiter was fantastic. Only reason I didn't give this restaurant 5 stars is the noise level. It was extremely loud in the dining area. We could not have a normal conversation. We pretty much had to shout. Overall well worth dining here!

gyXxE4pTptJFSm8zrrIE0Q.text: Way over rated just OK at premium prices. Save your money and go elsewhere. While the steaks were just OK and a bit small the side dishes and salads were like something you would get at Chilis. $10 for creamed corn which was just a can of Del Monte corn is absurd.  Many better options in Vegas.

EGEFMjYSZKULdRRcx2St6A.text: I have been coming here every year for my Birthday love the food but this year not sure what has changed my husband steak was burnt, asparagus was burnt my crab legs cold the worst part we both got sick 30 minutes after eating after we finished dinner took 20 minutes to get our check to leave we won't be coming back

tuqlkYvTw1bq2sT3POhxew.text: A 5 star restaurant all the way around. Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse is really the pinnacle of great food.  The wait staff knows exactly what they are doing. Our waiter was able to recite a long list of delicious sounding specials from memory and was well-versed in proper dining/serving etiquette .   I ordered the salmon and was truly blown away. I was expecting great, but what I got was on another level. Top 3 all-time on the salmon list (and I eat salmon a lot!). Wild-caught Alaskan salmon which a creamy sauce. Yum!   The atmosphere is very similar to what you would see in a nostalgic Brooklyn mob lounge, upscale with just enough lighting to see your partner across the way.  The price is not cheap, so don't go to Vic's unprepared. But for an exceptional restaurant away from the strip, Vic's is the place to be.

lgdA4RSXmvGN_EU5Zpue9A.text: I've never had a ribeye with so much flavor and cooked to perfection. Request the chefs perpetration, cost about $65 but it's worth every penny. It's like getting a complimentary reach around from the chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum, bone in ribeye...

TfLjhWbPbJ2Nw1rNrs7Pog.text: My first time here was a treat for my birthday. Upscale, dressy vibe with a cross between business dinner and intimate dining. The portions are so large you are able to split a steak and take some home. Creme brulee is the best in the world! Not even the French have perfected as Vic & Ant has.   Dine here for birthdays, guest in town, business dinners and any chance I can!!

S0pVshnvhNeoK1WWuSo7Rw.text: Very good steak, but the review someone else had about the crab cakes was True, they are gross.  We both took a bite and asked for it to be removed from the table (the waiter had said they were the best anywhere....wow really?  Cuz yuck!  super old fishy tasting.)  Otherwise the meal was perfect.  I just wouldnt order anything containing fish.  I would go back.

ov9Kqbfn_sFxEAY9gI1U8g.text: Two days after a birthday steakhouse dinner in Seattle, we went here. The service was top rate, but the steak was well below par, and their was a group of a dozen or so that overflowed from the small bar and gathered around our dining table.......not a great setting and a piss poor meal. My wife's meal was fine, but a steak cooked medium should have some sort of juices remaining.....dontcha think?  Not again!

UgazWCrhD1YV13LvnhPxtQ.text: I am a fan of Ruth's Chris but I find the quality and service inconsistent, so friends of mine urged us to join them at Vic & Anthony's. They really talked it up so I was worried about being over sold, but it was really excellent. We each ordered the Deal for about $50 that includes a 8 oz filet, soup or salad, a side and dessert. We had to ask special for this because our waiter didn't tell us about it and it's not on the menu. (I find that strange...Ruth's Chris puts their Deal in the menu. Luckily our friends knew about it.)  The steaks were all cooked perfectly, the sides are good--better than Ruth's Chris', and the dessert was better also. The wait staff was very friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was warm and quiet, which I really appreciate when you are trying to have a nice meal.  Three hours of free parking with a validated ticket which is enough time for a drink at the Golden Nugget before dinner, dinner and even a quick walk around Fremont Street.

pv8fASi3Hh8vczmCNlZrNA.text: What an incredible steakhouse! This is my new favorite steakhouse in Vegas and I cannot wait to come back for more! All the food from the appetizers to dessert was incredible. But what we early made my experience here special was the wonderful service I received from my server, Victor, and the General Manager/Sommelier, Shawn. Both men were attentive, helpful, friendly, and knew their stuff! I've been staying at the Golden Nugget for years and this was my first time at Vic and Anthony's. I cannot wait to return!

FWMUvBolmUAMT5VusV4NDg.text: The most incredible meal that we've ever experienced. Our server Ben was amazing! Every dish he recommended was perfect! The crab cakes , the lobster bisque , wedge salad, beet salad, filet mignon , the ribeye , the Mac and cheese, scalloped potatoes and chocolate mousse, were to die for....pure heaven!!!! Did we say how much we loved our server, Ben! He really made the experience unbelievable!

-aTGcYHOHybXR2a9VYtQgA.text: It makes me a little sad to say it, but this place has declined a bit.  This past weekend we had our latest visit.  We've been there 3 or 4 times previously over the last 4-5 years.  The last time I was there in 2013, I had the best steak I've ever eaten (half of the porterhouse for 2), and this was in line with the quality of my previous visits as well.  This time, they missed that mark by a pretty wide margin.  Mind you, the steak was still excellent, but no longer outstanding, and below the quality of many other expensive, top-line steak houses.  They no longer offer the porterhouse for 2 - although they still have a porterhouse on the menu, and it is still plenty for 2 people (it is now 32 ounces, it used to be over 40, like I said, still plenty for 2 people, but you now have to split the order).  Anyway, the steak was expertly prepared as usual, but the t-bone half was tough.  I had encountered half a dozen pieces of unchewable gristle in the T-bone half.  The filet half was fine and tender, although both halves were not as flavorful as I remember.  It certainly didn't see 'prime' grade.  More like 'choice' grade.  Mind you, this steak comes in at nearly $90, so I think its justified that expectations for it be very high.  It made me wonder if with all the premium steak-houses opening across the country, it is just harder to these high-end places to get the same quality of meat as before.  On the other hand, a dining companion shared a bite of his NY Strip with me (half the price of the porterhouse -note, also 1/3 the weight), and it was absolutely perfect and delicious.    Other things that have declined.  Our favorite appetizer, "chips and strings" (home-made potato chips mixed with fried onion strings) was half the size as before.  Mind you, it also was still plenty - but it was no longer (as a waiter described the previous version) "Las Vegas over-indulgence in excess".  Now its just plain over-indulgence.  But worse was that it didn't taste good.  it had a distinct 'old cooking oil' taste to it this time, which was unpleasant.    Everything else was as before. The restaurant is elegant, the wait staff exemplary, the wine list contains many reasonable price range choices (as well as some highly unreasonable ones too, if that's you thing ;-).  But it will be hard to come back and pay the ultra-premium prices for a steak that is now a step closer to ordinary.  While I'm complaining, I'd like to add just one more thing.  While the PA music selection is nice and appropriate (Sinatra and similar), it has always been played too loud (this time and on all my previous visits).  It makes conversation at the table difficult, as you have to raise your voice to be heard over the music.  I wish they'd turn it down by half.

nrRxKdYNGZZS64aUWXsY8w.text: Went to celebrate two birthdays here on Saturday.  Had reservations for 6.  Did not have to wait long to be seated.  Our group ordered the oyster rockefeller, roasted bacon and the quail.  They loved all of them.  For dinner I had the Rib Eye with asparagus, hubby had the bone in rib eye.  Both were cooked perfectly and were delicious.  The service was spot on.  They were very attentive and brought two little desserts to the birthday boys.  It was a great place to come with friends and celebrate.

2a1Q7R2u2YqH5-O-Fn6tsQ.text: One of the finest steakhouses I have visited; comparable to a Maestros, but with service that's a notch better.  We were constantly tended to throughout the night, never having to search for someone.  Great wine list with tons of options to chose from: big appetite? Try the 32 oz. bone-in.  Steaks were perfectly seasoned.  Personally, I opted for the 12 oz. filet, which was filling as they bring tons of bread.  The calamari was the best I have had hands down. This will be my new go to steakhouse anytime I am in Sin City.

WyMRRbYye_Uc6geE4e4xYw.text: BEST IN VEGAS!!! Have been there many times and it is hands down the best steak in town. Great filet and amazing sides!!!

dB8uhON9dIiwMv08Rg8BeA.text: I I went there on January 1, 2014 around 8ish. We were super casual and sat at the bar. I have been on a low carb for about 2 months and dropped like 20lbs for my wedding.  So all I wanted was CARBS! So I got a mushroom and chicken risotto and mac and cheese and a glass of Reisling I was eating like an animal. No really animals. ..my husband ate some white fish with a balsamic reduction sauce and vegetables and a Heineken.    The bar tender was so friendly and nice despite our casual attire.  I could barely walk after wear those 4.5 inch heels for 9 hours..so a beautiful end of wedding day meal.

NkMcOy1u7OSVpFdvIgtDvA.text: We've been to Vic & Anthony's 2 times now and it's possibly the most consistently excellent restaurants we've ever been to (and we go to some pretty nice restaurants). We've had their steak, fish, and chicken, and several different sides, and all were excellent.  Literally everything is bursting with flavor in a way that is rare. I especially recommend the Brussels sprouts and mushrooms. But really you can't go wrong.  We rarely get restaurant dessert and I'm really over bread pudding, but succumbed to suggestions to try their "award-winning" version made from croissants (!). It was phenomenal!  Their service is also fantastic: courteous, attentive, friendly, professional without being stuffy. It looks and feels like an old-school steakhouse for old men with cigars but we're comfortable going as total tourists in shorts and T-shirts.  It's not cheap but it's totally worth it, and sometimes we go and split an appetizer and entree and get out of there for not a lot.

rPKyEQDu-cQx1k2QzdSFtA.text: We decided on having the chicken.  I'm assuming most people go for the steak but I'm a sucker for good chicken and I figured this place would be a hit.  We were so disappointed.   The chicken was very dry.  It came with mashed potatoes that were nothing spectacular, just home made.  It also came with two spears of asparagus that were cooked well but bland.  We both commented that I could have made a better dinner at home.  I didn't come to Vegas to spend so much on chicken that I could have done better myself.  I was so bummed out.  We did have the scallops as an appetizer and they were pretty good on their own.  The mix that came with it had dry old bacon bits in it.  So I guess my only advice is don't bother with the chicken unless you are looking for a dried out home cooked meal arranged all fancy on a big plate.  I will say however, the service there was excellent and I give that part 5 stars.

aC8HnQFYxk2sQqG7ex6Xzg.text: Ok, so I am very torn about how many stars I'm giving V&A's. Here's my break down and I think you'll see why I  had to go with four:  Food: 4 Price: 4 Service: 5 (can I give more than five?)  So now lets talk about those points:  Food: The food is delicious. Excellent quality and flavor. I also love their extensive wine selection. We ordered- -Crab cake app: just ok in my opinion, everyone else loved it. -Chips & strings: didn't like it at all, again everyone else did. -Roasted beet & goat cheese salad: delicious. -Lobster bisque: delicious. I am a freak who hates bisque and even I liked it. -Crab legs: You don't get a ton, but these are excellent quality and just cooked perfectly. Love. -8 oz. Filet: Ordered it medium rare and that's how it came out. I didn't try it but the person who did loved every bite. -Bone-in Ribeye: Thank God for cows. Again, it came out cooked perfectly and was just... amazing. -Au gratin potatoes: Yum! -Mushrooms cooked in wine sauce: Holy hell these were amazing. My expectations were low enough that these were actually the shining star for me.  -Cheesecake: The best. Just perfection. The crust is to die for. -Flourless chocolate cake: I'm a chocoholic. This was sublime.  Price: I, and everyone else in the party, eat at top steak houses on a fairly regular basis. We know great steak and we know how much it costs. I feel like because of where V&A's is located and it is Vegas, you're sort of a captivated audience and they therefore stick it to you price wise. Is it worth it? That's up to you. It was for us. We would go back, keeping that in mind, and perhaps not go as crazy with the ordering again. Bottom line is that we would go back.  Service: I feel like I saved the best for last. I am kicking myself for not making a note of our servers name because he was superb. When you think of high dining and the service that should accompany that, this guy blew those expectations out of the water. We were greeted by a very friendly hostess and seated by an equally friendly/polite seating hostess, who just blew my mind with this next thing-- I was wearing black so she replaced their standard white napkins with a black one for me so I wouldn't get white lint on my black clothes. That's honestly never happened to me and I've been to really high end restaurants before. I love that extra attention to detail, and the pleasant surprise. Our water glasses were never empty. Everyone that works in V&A's was just so helpful and attentive. So, back to our server: he asked how were enjoying our time in Vegas and we told him that we were supposed to be seeing Elton John but the show was cancelled at the last minute. So, you know, the trip wasn't exactly going great. But we were in this amazing restaurant and had a bottle of Merry Edwards on the table, so come hell or high water we were going to have a great night. Well, aside from the flawless service we received, our server remembered our sad story and brought us a dessert plate he had put together since he felt bad for us. Um, what? Maybe this is sad statement on the people we encounter in our day to day lives, but we were all shocked. Vic & Anthony's has nothing to do with Elton John or Caesar's Palace. He could have just left it at "I'm sorry your show was cancelled, that sucks." And we would have been happy and never thought anything of it. But this man went above & beyond to make sure we had a memorable evening, even if it wasn't the one we had planned.   I want so badly to give them 5 stars, but I feel like I would be cheating other people who read this review. If I was rating on service alone then I would give them 10 stars if I could. I just feel like V&A's has a small way to go with the food and especially the pricing. For my own personal taste some things just could have been better. Again, I did say we would go back if we are ever in Vegas again (which I'm sure we will eventually). Next time I'm trying the stuffed salmon.

taIk9FpKpTGUDFcRydXhPg.text: Great service and delicious food. We ordered the petit filet, porter house and New York. All steaks were well flavored, tender and cooked to perfection. We also tried the tomato and mozzarella appetizer, mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. All were delicious. Very pricy but you would only expect that in a place such as this. Well worth it. Highly recommend.

cI_0tPea1wkT_h4QGk8jbg.text: My Husband and I decided to celebrate our anniversary with dinner at Vic & Anthonys.   The wine selection was incredible and our waiter helped us pick a great bottle.  For appetizers we had the raw oysters and crab cake, both were excellent! I decided to have the special which was a filet topped with fois gras, mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts.  My husband had the bone in ribeye. We requested that both be prepared medium rare.  His steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned just right.  But my steak was overdone, SALTY, and the fois gras was cold! The potatoes and sprouts were excellent, but for that price I would have expected the steak to shine!  I should have stuck with my original plan of lobster, but the promise of fois gras led me astray! We had the pecan roll for dessert which was a unique take on ice cream with nuts along with a cup of coffee.  Both the coffee and dessert were good. The service was great.  Despite my disappointing steak, I would eat here again, but stick with the original plan of lobster

ZW8NBHaQb8Plc8nAbX8fyw.text: My goodness. I just had the best meal EVER!!!   Chopped salad - WOW Filet Mignon w. cheesy au gratin potatoes - OMG Flourless chocolate cake -  Seriously, WTF?   I just left Vegas but I am already planning to come back soon just so I can eat at V&A again.     Screw every buffet and restaurant in town.  I am coming back HERE for the rest of my life!!!    Throughout the entire meal, I couldn't stop oohing and aaahing.   This never happened to me before.  Sure, once in a while you have a great meal and you think about it afterwards.  But THIS was the best meal I ever ate!!!  Nuff said.

30CeCeGCAt-kGTh3AlALsw.text: 24 Oz. Bone-In Ribeye. Medium Rare!   Again, maybe I'm not the Steak Connisseur most of you are who frequent these establishments. I definitely have more of an Asian Fusion Tongue of sorts. But I did love my Bone-In Ribeye from Ruths Chris long ago. I had a great steak at what once was 3950 at Mandalay Bay. And I loved N9ne at Palms.  But this experience at Vic & Anthony's was Amazing! Maybe I wasn't expecting much as we were in Downtown Las Vegas, where the entire area just reeks of something so different from the likes of Mandalay Bay, Caesar's Forum Shops or even Restaurant Row down Flamingo. But it's not very difficult to recognize great service, a tasty steak, and some decent ambiance!  Like I've mentioned, I had the 24 oz Bone-In Ribeye that just may be the best steak I've ever had! Aged to perfection, and cooked EXACTLY the way I wanted, soft and juicy on the inside, some great seasoning along the outside, especially around the bone. This steak was so good I have been craving another every day since I left there! Also in our party - a Ginormous Lobster, the Sea Bass and a no-bone Ribeye. Everyone was completely satisfied with their entrees as we didn't even get to the asparagus and other sides!  Our server was extremely attentive and friendly as she also recommended a great red wine to go with our meal and threw in a couple of desserts for us to share for our birthdays (3 July Birthdays and 1 August Birthday), I thought she went completely out of her way to do that for us, but it totally completed a Great Evening there. The Creme Brulee and Chocolate Cake really did finish off our meal to Perfection!  Can't recommend it enough! Another Wonderful Dining Experience with Great friends, Great Food, Great Service!

ZHlmw1mh0LC3CVEfPAkpRA.text: The steak here was amazing, and slightly blissful. A group of us went here when we arrived at Vegas to celebrate a friends bday. It was a great decision as it was the best meal we had in Vegas. I had the bone in New York, and it was cooked perfectly.

y9gKJb6iIGI-kX6OHd5wLQ.text: Food wise, this place only gets 2 stars. The other 2 came about because I absolutely adore the ambiance of this restaurant, and the service is excellent. I really especially love the music selection (the nights I've come here, they've played 1920's-40's jazz lounge kind of grooves).  I had the rack of lamb medium rare, it was the most unflavorful lamb I had ever tasted. The sauce that was supposed to go w/it was horrible. My Grandmum ordered the filet mignon (also, medium rare). It was to die for!!! We also ordered the angel hair pasta (WAY too salty) and the buttered broccoli (very bland).  As many gripes as I had with most of the food we were served, there are also many reasons why I would come back. I will stick to fliet mignon and a bottle of wine for now on however, to ensure my visit is just fabulous!   :)

pvtSnQP4IIpXH___hL6fBA.text: Made a reservation for a large group for a birthday celebration and were seating at two separate tables with two separate waiters.  Our waiter who was male was very unpleasant, snobbish, aggressive, and condescending.  Never smiled the entire time we were there. The other table was served by a female and those seated there had a nice experience.  Overall the food was great, minus my husbands scallops, strange spicy sauce was not good. Would probably not go back as there are so many options in Vegas.  Very disappointed as it was my husband's 40th and the restaurant had come so highly recommended.

CWdVhSiB3jMji5QCqQk9Aw.text: Always consistent, always fantastic. Steak prepared like Ruth's Chris, best sides of any steakhouse, excellent atmosphere and service. Absolutely nothing ever bad to say about this establishment after 4 or 5 visits.

O9mwDM9747XOiNTYWZwkCw.text: Good gawd this is yummy... best steak I have EVER had... seriously!

j6Gf809PH_3Lwbm9OoUa3g.text: Phenomenal! My husband and I went here to celebrate our Vegas honeymoon! Staff was knowledgable, professional and personable. Food - best meal I have had in years. Best elegant find in downtown - a True gem!

PU6w9xKbMrjKobxWgFSzUA.text: Best steak dinner in town so far! I was very pleasantly surprised with how good the steaks were.  My husband & I went for an early dinner on a Saturday. The place is dimly lit & has the old school darker decor with some framed pictures on the wall. There is an intimate feel but not crowded like I've seen at other more modern strip casino steak restaurants where you are seated close to others but yet can barely hear your own conversations because of how loud it is. I felt comfortable to have been wearing jeans, a nice top & heals, without feeling under dressed. It is definitely not a shorts & sandals kind of place but how many steak restaurants are aside from Outback?   Jim was our server & he was professional, polite, & came around just enough times to make sure we were taken care of but also allowed us to enjoy our dinner. His team was also very efficient in quietly clearing the table in between courses.  We started by splitting a Caesar salad. It was good but nothing special. I had the 12 ounce filet and husband had 14 ounce prime NY strip. Both were cooked to our liking & seasoned well. The steaks were moist & very flavorful. My filet was the cleanest piece of meat I have had. I had absolutely no gristle & didn't cut away any bit of it. It was tender & needed no sauce whatsoever. They were served on piping hot plates that kept the steaks very warm but didn't cook it.  We also ordered au gratin potatoes & steamed asparagus. Potatoes were slightly saltier than I liked but very creamy & cheesy and decadent. Asparagus were cooked perfectly, al dente.  The food was so good, we laughed at how quiet we both were, just savoring every bite & not saying too much.   We finished off the meal with some really good coffee & a nice chocolate mousse  that was a perfect end to the incredible meal.   Ive been to a few steak places in town but compared to some places I have been to such as Strip Steak, Hugo's Cellar (both horrible meals & we felt ripped off by the first)The Barrymore (great meal), Flemings, Mon Ami Gabi, Morton's, SW Steakhouse, Sonoma Cellar, Del Friscos, and Hanks to name a few, this was the meal we enjoyed the most!   Now the bar is set.

TeZ-IFaSFRs-smypghFYQA.text: If I could give 6 stars I would. One of my top 3 that I've ever been to in my travels. Portion were much bigger than expected. Filet, gratin potatoes, scallops arwsome. Calamari with carmelized onions best I ever had. Wait staff also the best. An excellent nice surprise!

SfiEdmDfEbDGt1ipuYQVOQ.text: DELISH!!!! Really fantastic meal!!! BF said it was def one of the best steaks he's ever had!!! I had the stuffed salmon it was good... ITS ALOT OF FOOD... the only downside was the waiter reallllly realllly pushes the very expensive wines... but that is his job and he does want a big tip so i understand... everything was fab!!!! all the desserts were great as well!!!!

_f2QpBaCSVj3CIuuj4582g.text: I actually thought our appy's were the best part of this meal.  The quail was amazing and I could have made a meal on that.  The beef carpaccio was excellent!  The raw oysters were decent.  The ribeye was just ok- I think I make better at home.

4PNB_1zcUghaVb_fjCZRGg.text: Took my wife here for her B-day, since we always eat and stay at the newer part of Las Vegas, i decided to try the old school scenery for once. It was well worth it. We ordered the following with stars on the side 1 out of 5.  Complimentary Bread w/ garlic butter cream (share) ***** Fresh Oyster 2 kinds (Share) **** Asparagus (Share) **** Mash Potato (Share) *** HUGE Australian Lobster Tail (For Her) ***** 24oz Bone in Rib Eye Steak Medium Rare (For Me) *****  A complimentary cake for her B Day and all was smooth and perfect. Thanks V&A for a great time. Took a stroll around old town and back to our 2,000 sqft suite at The Hotel.

lJHpNq594Gvu73qfyG8-QQ.text: Excellent service, very attentive, food was delicious. If it wasn't for the enormous corkage fee of $55, I'd give it a five star. They DO NOT allow outside wine bottles. but because we were celebrating our 20 year anniversary, they made an exception. Unbelievable! They weren't doing us any favors at $55 for a corkage fee.

VzkZrXcjfAb0C1V1t1G1yw.text: The Pre-fix menu is an excellent value with fantastic choices for everyone-each entree was perfection.  The Blue Cheese wedge was enough for two (but I didn't share), Lobster Bisque was creamy, and absolutely wonderful.  The filets (Prime) were cooked as ordered, tender, and so flavorful.  I dream about those steaks.  The green beans were crisp, the creamed spinach awesome and those potatoes...OMG!  Cheesy goodness, perfectly seasoned.  The Creme Brulee decadent, rich and so satisfying.  We were such happy campers!  We ordered a bottle of the St Clements Cab, it was superb.  The servers were prompt, professional and in spite of someone a little unruly at our table, handled it with with such respect & professionalism- we left a huge, much-deserved tip.  It has been a long time we have had such fantastic service-it made for a memorable evening.

9TMhI5glnmxWW9Q0coXLBA.text: The bottom line is the rib eye was the best I've had in 20 years, seriously. I've been to the finest steak houses all over the country and only a couple of them served me a rib eye as delicious and perfectly cooked  as I received at Vic and Anthony's.  This is only the second time I've been compelled to write a positive review on Yelp. I usually use Yelp to find ethnic and other interesting restaurants but this time I used it to find a good steak house and I was pleased to see the reviews were accurate.  We were a little worried about leaving our beautiful hotel on the strip to go to the Golden Nugget for dinner but after reading the Yelp reviews we had to take a chance.  I told my wife not to worry because we weren't going to be hanging out in the Golden Nugget just eating at the restaurant inside. First, I was surprised that the Golden Nugget had been remodeled to pretty high standards. Second, Vic and Anthony's makes a very nice initial impression and it frankly it doesn't really matter what casino it's located in because you'll only see it coming and going.

wtdNoRImuvd7oqaioo7I8w.text: Service was five stars but the food was maybe a three.  The service truly was outstanding but the price for what you got for food did not measure up.

dfCc1uNDafjpiROX6v_Stg.text: I was inclined not to review this place as I think now everyone will want to go there, but feel I must. Our server, Patrick was beyond compare.  We had a non foodie with us and he guided her thru the details of how to order a steak etc  Everything was served as ordered. Tip: share your sides, they are huge!  I'm sure we will return if no one else finds out about this gem located inside the golden nugget. It's most enjoyable even if a bit pricey

FdLop0iv3ZCXbVhdX1w8pQ.text: Great food, excellent service! Enjoyed the lobster bisque. Filet was cooked perfectly

opiN4w6YUEUdnE5_CdglVQ.text: Glam'd up for Vic & Anthony's Las Vegas,NV. Take your Hunny here for a romantic dinner date. Service is insanely EXCELLENT. The Prime Ribeye was flavorful. I like it better than The New York steak. Asparagus was crispy and the mushrooms had a winey taste to it. Believe it or not, they serve Salt Sea Fries...now this one was PHENOMENAL! so unexpected it was a pleasant surprise

uen1uXGD2mFzRdkZ-S_LQQ.text: I haven't been to many steakhouses in Vegas but the ambience and food at Vic & Anthony's are definitely worth mentioning. Though we unfortunately did not get steak while dining here (since we had steak the night before) I can't comment on their steak but the pork chop and salmon were stellar. We also started with the lobster bisque which was amazing. Such a great comfort food item. I could eat bowls and bowls of it! Staff was very friendly and attentive. Overall a great experience here.

BTKgFF28fD7rLe_KzrWaoQ.text: Love this place every time I go to Vegas it's our favorite place hands down best steakhouse and the service is always good big portions so me and the husband always share a steak and get 2 side dishes but the best part is the appetizer husband and I alway get the cheese plate and every time it's always different and delicious love love this place!!!!

IqyhtLa5LBa6zK-y2OUcXw.text: Long wait for food.  Food is not great. If you're very drunk and willing to spend $50 on an entree that is not delicious come here. They also messed up our order which took even LONGER. This place was too slow. Mac and cheese was runny and soupy :(

ByyBq-YKDcqnkVjkPF-33g.text: Once again, unbelievable appetizers and cocktails...complete with complimentary desserts  for our anniversary. Thank you Efran!!

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eTAWwwy7croeuHoUXdOH6Q.text: I went here last night for a holiday dinner and hadn't heard much about this place but my boss had heard about it through word of mouth. Wow...I am sure glad we did! This was by far the best steak I have ever had. The filet was cooked so perfectly and so tender that you literally could cut it with a fork. But my dinner started off with the highly recommended crab caked and man am I glad I did. I am not sure if there was any filling used in these cakes because they were just stuffed full of crab...amazing!   Lastly the service here has got to be some of if not the best service I have ever received ...absolutely outstanding. The prices are a little high but you are paying for the atmosphere and a nice steak. This is located in the newly remodeled Golden Nugget which is very nice done.  If you are looking for an awesome steak then this is.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake wow!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice Tail!

Wy2Xj7Dgwk0BGhgBAUKPJQ.text: Great restaurant located inside the Golden Nugget hotel. Service was excellent- and we had a party of 14 people. The food was pretty good all around. I ordered a "caprese" salad to start and it was delicious. My main course was the Scallops, Brussel sprouts with grits. Fantastic. Hubby ordered the Maine lobster which he thoroughly enjoyed and finished. The king crab legs were amazing.. My nephew had six legs to himself. That 3 year old is one expensive date!   As for desserts, not amazing but good. We tried the pecan ball, which was a huge ball of vanilla ice cream with pecan nuts on the outside. Nothing special. The bread pudding was better, it came with caramel ice cream on top. I think there's slight rum in the pudding, it was good but nothing blow your mind.  Minus one star because my pineapple juice cup had lipstick stains all over the cup... That's extremely unappetizing and unsanitary. overall, for such a large party- I think the waiters did a fantastic job serving and our food was great overall. Recommend!

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rockefeller

grZQr2CtnBmXHLd0G8QDHg.text: We have frequented Vic and Anthony's for the past 12 yrs and I personally haven't been in a few years, but my family has. The service has always been great up until the past couple years. Last night's(Friday) experience was terrible. Enough to make me not want to ever go back. For the prices you pay in that place they should be giving you the beat service around. We had reservations at 8pm. We checked in at 7:45pm and was told the table was getting cleaned up and set. The hostess asked if our whole party was here and we said yes. We waiting right outside the front door and at 8pm I walked back to the hostess and asked if we were called yet (because there was a ton of people starting to congregate in the front door) she asked what the reservation name was and if the whole party was here. Again i told her yes the whole party is here and she came back with "it looks like they are getting your table ready" During this Thursday me we keep seeing about 3-4 parties being seated before us and we were there first. My sister in law asked again if we were getting seated soon and the hostess said "is your whole party here?" Hello?! It's now 8:05pm and tons of people have been seated before us and our whole party was here since 7:45pm. The hostess walks us to our table and gives 2 of us napkins and walks away from the rest of us 4 others at the table. The waiter wasn't the best either. He was slow and had us wait to order so he could take someone else's order while he was just about to take our order. He said " please give me 20 sec" he goes to the next table and takes a few minutes, then came back to take our order. I'm not sure if management has changed or not but it's horrible and not worth it anymore. The food was really good, but I honestly love good service over good food. Too bad it's gone way downhill.

_a5ermCqjJdzrsW9vP01MQ.text: I used the Prix fixe coupon from their website and what a deal. You get the full size portions . Tons of lobster in the bisque made with cognac not sherry . Bread , Filet, and the best was the au gratin potatoes . Finally bread pudding which was great . With a jim beam old fashioned and tip . Out the door for 80.00      So a splurge yes but I had so many leftovers I got a second meal out of it .  I will be back.....

_mMKBpA9qJRomZV5virw1g.text: Last night myself and two friends returned to Vic and Anthony's and it was perfection. It was one of the best dining experiences since moving to Vegas 3 years ago. When you visit (and you must) do yourself a favor and ask for the wine guru, Shawn. He made a pinot noir recommendation that truly complimented every part of our meal. I didn't take photos of the crab cake but it really is the best crab cake of my life. The petite felet with a coffee rub and the lobster tail, both perfection. And that cheesecake...... Wow!  Thank you Vic and Anthony's for a truly superb evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake and chocolate cake.
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet with coffee rub and lobster tail, with broccoli and mushrooms.

35Ab4zY553ndwPvMNeBDkw.text: Great atmosphere, although a little too dark for my taste. I saw many people using their phone flashlights (including myself) to be able to read the menu. The waiters are great; knowledgable and engaging and the food was very good. My husband had the 18oz Ribeye, I ordered the Lamb Chops & we shared side dishes Duck Fat Potatoes & Roasted Brussel Sprouts. Everything was delicious & perfectly cooked to our liking. As steakhouses go, I'd rank this place in my top 5, far surpassing the disappointing Ruth's Criss Steakhouse & a few other over-rated, pricey steakhouses!

ECSIeoz2n3yHEEu93_l6Ag.text: I usually do not leave reviews but after experiencing dinner at Vic and Anthony's Steakhouse, I was left with no choice. We (me and 2 girlfriends) went for a late dinner on our first night in Vegas. The ambience was great and the restaurant had a very luxurious feel to it. The General Manager of the restaurant came and greeted us himself and gave us some great recommendations. On top of that, he also brought us champagne and a crab cake on the house! The crab cake was to die for!   We ultimately decided to go with the distinctive dining menu since the regular menu seemed out of our price range. We thought the portions would be smaller due to the price. Boy, were we wrong!   I chose the lobster bisque for the appetizer and it was amazing. Perfectly seasoned and not too rich. Our server was very attentive and always kept our glasses filled. Our plates were also cleared at the very right time and the dishes were timed very well.  We each got an 8oz steak cooked to different levels (medium, medium rare and rare). All were cooked to perfection. We each got one each of the three available sides on the distinctive dining menu (creamed corn, au gratin potatoes, and broccoli). Each were full sized and between the 3 of us, we were barely able to get through half of each side. The sides were also seasoned to perfection and complimented the steak very well.  Then came dessert. Again, we got 1 each of the three available desserts to share (bread pudding, chocolate mousse, and creme brulee). The desserts were absolutely divine! We were barely able to even get through a third of each dessert and were very sorry to leave it behind.   The bill came up to about $300 after tax and tip, which was a lot less than we thought it would, seeing as Vic and Anthony's is quite a high end restaurant and the meal could have fed 6 people. Not forgetting that we did also order a bottle of wine for the table and a cappuccino each to go with dessert.  We exited the restaurant after paying and while waiting for the cab, we were surprised see that the General Manager had come out after us just to say goodbye and thank us for coming!  Overall, I give 5 stars for service, 5 starts for ambience, and 5 stars for the food (6 if I could!). We will definitely be coming to Vic and Anthony's again!

2ooY7MkEDtpYB-LFbTDU7g.text: The food was great..I had the prime rib and the duck fat potatoes...it was delicious and oh so tender...would definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib &amp; duck fat potatoes

N0ejpNC33H4VbPwTlklC0Q.text: Food is excellent. But when you look at the entire dining experience I think I paid too much for what I got. You could see the TV in bar from my table, no big deal but when I'm paying over $100 for a meal I don't want to watch TV. The waitress was distracted or simply tired and wanted to go home. We ate late, probably one hour from closing, so the matre-de sat everyone in a tight cluster of tables to make it easy on the two servers and table staff but I didn't like sitting that close to other guests. Especially in Vegas where many diners - even in upscale restaurants -- dress and act like they are in a pool hall. I am from the Gulf Coast of Texas. The Fertita's and Macio's are legend. I wanted to enjoy my meal and write a good review. But....it just wasn't worth the price.

Rd8EXwBOOctIAIPtKcH26A.text: I was kinda of disappointed because the last time I went to Vic&Anthony's my meal was excellent,but this time not so much.My lobster had a weird taste my husband  said so did his.My husband's filet minion was raw in the middle(he ordered it med well).My last visit I remember flavor explosions but this time  it was meh.For the price that we paid I expected so much more, but I have to say the oysters rockefeller was very good which brings them up to 3 stars and the service was good.I would be afraid to try them again because of this experience.

aAjOA0WmZe3d0XOmAJOCVQ.text: I come to this place every time I come to Vegas. The restaurant is located in the Golden Nugget Casino, but it is a world away. Dark, intimate steak house with your typical and not so typical sides. Steak is king here, but the sides, cocktails, and seafood are fantastic. If you like raw oysters, get them here. The half dozen arrived at the table cold, briny and delicious. These were served with horseradish, lemon, cocktail sauce and a bright mignonette. The crab cake was so delicious that we ordered 2. That's right, huge chunks of crab held together with a prayer and some light binding-you almost couldn't identify the bread crumb. The scalloped potatoes were cheesy and decadent, so we added roasted Brussels sprouts. Although, broccoli is usually my side of choice. Finally the rib eye. This fine steak was buttery and perfectly roasted with a bark that could make your mother cry. Hands down, a must.

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nkr3Tx79nCInIpAUb_83NQ.text: I loved the old school Las Vegas vibe and decor. The food was delicious too. It is a little overpriced for the quality and location but they offer a blockbuster prix fix menu at a discounted price. That particular aspect of the menu is an awesome value. If you find yourself in downtown Las Vegas, this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ytnbtB6tXxB45jhF1wsw0g.text: Back in Vegas and back to Vic and Anthony's.   This time my boyfriend and I had dinner with Dad and Stepmom as our trips overlapped. Again, it was perfect and lived up to all the expectations.   Dad got the distinctive dining menu with the filet option. He said it was a great steak. His side was the creamed spinich, which if you read my initial review you will know I thought it was slightly off mark last time, not so this time. The roux was prepared better and the breadcrumbs much more crunchy so everything didn't blend together. I am thrilled to see what was a good side made great. He enjoyed the wedge salad as his starter. Good as he remembered. He raved about the steak. He was thrilled everything was as good as before. Stepmom also had distinctive dining menu. She got the fish. She is not a seafood lover but wanted something different. She was blown away. However, because she is not a  super seafood lover she left the perfectly crisped skin behind. I can say it was perfectly cooked. It was just her personal taste. She enjoyed her wedge salad. Thank goodness she got the au gratin potatoes. They were ridiculously good and I cannot wait to go back to Vegas just to get them. Seriously, amazing. Seriously. Rich, cheesy, cooked perfectly, stick to your ribs perfection. Worth every calorie.  I got the pear and saga cheese salad. It was a bit overdressed and the cheese not well presented on the plate. Flavors were great but I am one who likes my salad lightly dressed so overdressed is going to be a little off for me. I should point out my dad tried some of mine and thought it was perfect, so I think it really is my personal taste. I would get it again and next time alert the server to my preference. I have full confidence they will prepare it the way I prefer. I ordered the  Veal Chop and it was as lovely as I remembered. Fatty and tender. Slightly overcooked and I do mean slight. I asked for rare side of medium rare and got more medium side of medium rare. however it was still nice and rare in the middle and near the bone, this is a slight issue, I almost feel silly mentioning it but I am trying to be honest.. If we had been at straight medium, I would mark them down a star. It worked out because boyfriend prefers some medium pieces and traded some of his near bone rare pieces of his ribeye. Yea for me!  My boyfriend got the bone in ribeye and it was perfection as before. Melt in your mouth and lovely. Simply the best steak I have ever passed between my lips with the exception of Bern's Steakhouse Chateaubriand. For those who know their steakhouses that is rare and exceptional company.  We got two crabcakes for the table and they were divine, just like before. They really are all crabmeat with barely enough breading to hold it together. I am not sure how they even flip it over when cooking it. My boyfriend who gets crabcakes at every steakhouse for an appetizer said it was exceptional and very few if any were better.  We shared some of the croissant bread pudding for desert that came with the distinctive dining menu. It was amazing. Everyone at the table is bread pudding fans and we loved the idea and execution. Although the lactose intolerant in the group was disappointed to see the ice cream on top. It wasn't on the menu he saw and he cannot have it. He ate around it. He did not complain because he knows he would have been accommodated if he knew to request it and the portion was so big there was plenty that didn't have ice cream on it.  Service was impeccable. We will return on our next trip to Vegas for a fourth time happily.

EKV3CIamvEAkCXZP3GBQdQ.text: Stop reading this review and go eat here. Seriously. I do not think I've had a more perfect meal in the longest time, if ever. I mean, from the moment we walked in to the moment we left, perfect.   I came here on a Saturday evening a few weeks ago with my friend to celebrate my 30th birthday. The only thing I wanted out of this dinner was a perfect filet mignon and a drink, and that's it. While I appreciate a nice steak, I'm very basic in what I'm looking for. I really only want to talk about the food, so suffice to say the service and ambiance were perfect. I have nothing to complain about, so let's get to the food.   Our appetizer was quail -- absolutely perfect. I wish I could use profanity to explain the amount of motherlovin' flavor on those guys. Yeah there's not a lot of meat, but oh my face they were perfect. The flavor was absolutely on point and they were cooked to perfection. I, at that point, was pretty ready to die. We also each ordered the lobster bisque: I personally thought it was on point, but my buddy said he thought it should've had more texture. My buddy ordered the special that night, which was a buffalo steak served with mashed potatoes and scallops. I ordered the filet mignon, cooked medium. Both were perfect. I mean, I'm an ok cook, but I'm in the d-league compared to the gentleman who cooked our meals.  The place isn't cheap. For us two dudes, our total was somewhere around $200. That total included 2 lobster bisques, quail, filet mignon, buffalo, and we each had one drink. All in all, totally worth it. As a matter of fact, I think I know where I'm going for my 31st birthday!

x2l2aScl7br_W02A9Y_2KQ.text: If not perfect, close enough.  White table cloth, mostly male wait staff.  Extremely attentive.  Perfect for a night out to make a special someone feel, well, special.  Fresh bread was served.  Appetizer was prompt.  We both enjoyed our steaks tremendously, cooked to our specific taste.  I can honestly say this was the best steak I've had in years, beating Chicago and certainly Virginia easily.

Kbh5__IFNOf6CjhCtujm8Q.text: Great steak and great service. We had the prime ribeye on the bone, the mushrooms, and cream corn. Top shelf experience.

fHOU2n-Rp3TxN3YT8rZzIA.text: Wonderful experience all around! The atmosphere was perfect!  Photos of the rat pack, old Las Vegas and Elvis with great lighting and the old beautiful bar, comfortable seating make the difference! The ribeye steaks and salmon were delicious and perfectly cooked.  The crab cake was the best I've ever had!  It was huge and truly the best this 63 year old retired Colonel ever tasted!  We had two kinds of mushrooms that were perfect with our steaks. The creamed spinach and au gratin potatoes were amazing!! We had the velvet cake, key lime pie and chocolate moose and they just couldn't have been better!  The wine our extremely professional server Jay recommended was again perfect!   Do yourself a favor, go check out this wonderful experience, and ask for Jay!  We will always visit Vic and Anthony's when we visit Las Vegas!

lgkVPmA-cUGlfIb9RCfx7Q.text: EXCELLENT!!!!!!  Wow! By far the best steak house I have ever been too.   *outstanding service  *High quality  *fair priced (you get what you pay for)  Defiantly will return

teJMjv9UBX0cs--hS5WTbw.text: I had rib eye with loaded baked potato.  My partner had surf n turf.  She said it was fantastic.  My steak was perfectly cooked and so flavorful.  My potato was the best potato i every had.  Creamy. .. delicious.  Drinks were excellent.  I have an allergy to crab so they were very careful about that.  For dessert we split a pecan ball, which is ice cream rolled in pecans.  This was just ok.   Highly recommend this place.  So so so good!

mcOdUFxOZDHjoO-UKsaCMg.text: This review is promptly made after we had a bad experience at Oscar's Steakhouse at the Plaza. We walked out of there and my husband and i were on the hunt for a Steakhouse to still celebrate at since we both had something to celebrate this week. We found Vic and Anthony's and there was a hour wait which was fine so we put our names in to be called at 8:45. We gambled a bit and then decided to have a cocktail at the bar. We ordered an old fashioned and the basil strawberry martini. Both drinks were delicious! At 8:40 we were seated and the ambiance was so romantic and comfortable that my husband and i sat next to each other to be closer to one another and we felt like we were in our own world. We ordered peppered maple bacon for an appetizer and their special of filet mignon with mushroom sauce and a crab topped lobster tail. The bacon appetizer was just sooo amazing!! It fell apart in your mouth but was so beautifully glazed and peppery that we saved some for our steak! The steak and lobster arrived and did not disappoint like Oscars did! At Oscars our filet was burnt and didn't come with the "Oscar style" we asked for. This steak was beautifully cooked that it just melted in your mouth and the lobster was soo buttery with old bay seasoning on the crab. We devoured our meal!! So glad we discovered this place after our first meal was so horrible at another restaurant. I even accidentally left my phone behind and returned to get it and they were all sooo friendly! I couldn't thank them enough for such a great dining experience. We cannot wait to dine here again!!!

z2-OePVUXZvQMSXPYZwEoQ.text: I'm sure you already know all the praises at this place so I'm just gonna be short and sweet about it.    This is your typical high end steak house with quality food and service.  Any type of bone-in meats are the way to go.  The duck fat potatoes were the best!  Yes I will come back!

FYyV0Mf4jM4WPOyN137MTw.text: Very nice, romantic ambiance. The food was delicious and the signature cocktail that I had was good as well. Will be visiting the location in Houston for sure !

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded baked potato!

1WexNICvvZmX-uLhdU4RDg.text: Just ate here and it was phenomenal. We had seen a prix fixe menu online on the Golden Nugget website and carelessly forgot to print it. Our waiter was super nice and printed it for is and allowed us to order from it. Thanks :)  I had the filet and the husband had the fish of the day (halibut). My filet was perfectly medium rare and the sides, au gratin potatoes, were to die for. For real. I'd die for them. Husband's halibut was a bit dry on top, but the flavor was very good. We also got bread pudding for dessert. Amazeballs. The other two diners we were with enjoyed their meals as well. Lobster bisque is apparently fabulous and the roasted chicken was perfect.   Go here. Spend the money ($50 for a 3 course, with side, prix fixe). You will not be disappointed.

Fntog4LRKCZiv57NLDBAeA.text: We are Vegas locals and picked this spot for a night on the town with friends. We made a reservation for 10 and were give the private room in the back. Decor is dark, mahogany, jazz music and white table cloths. Great atmosphere, you forget you are right in the center of Fremont Street. The service was excellent, with an extensive wine and cocktail list. I had the pear cocktail which was sweet, but a perfect start to the night. My friends had old fashioneds and sazeracs...lots of bourbons and ryes to choose from...  We started with a round of appetizers--the tartare and cheese plate. Both were excellent, but I have to call out the cheese/meat plate as outstanding. The truffle salami was superb and the three cheeses they selected were liked across all guests at the table. Next we ordered salads--all of which were VERY generously sized. I had the roasted beet salad and highly recommend! The beets were fresh and the goat cheese dressing was the perfect balance to the sweetness in the beets. For dinner I had the filet--cooked perfectly--and everyone at the table was pleased with their steaks. We tried several of the sides...MUST try is the au gratin potatoes (as long as you like A LOT of cheese) and the mac and cheese. Mashed potatoes were good, but didn't compare to some of the other options.  A few of us tried desserts...again...awesome. I had the croissant bread pudding (which was a HUGE serving...definitely share with several) and my friends had the strawberry ice cream.   All in all...great evening and overall dining experience. One of the few places that actually lives up to "strip prices"...Between the ten of us, we've tried several of the downtown steakhouses and this was one of our favorites! Great evening, service, we will all be back!

BbCz7Dw5dLNYqCJk-QyAzg.text: I really need to rate it more than 5!!! Without a doubt the best steak house in Las Vegas! Not just Fremont or Downtown, Anywhere! Nothing on the strip or off the strip can compare to this place. You MUST check it out. As you walk in from the time you leave, First Class all the way. The hostess is very professional, the bartenders are all top notch, my server was outstanding and the ambiance was perfect for Las Vegas. We enjoyed Salmon and Crab legs with a bottle of the bubbly. A perfect and romantic evening for my wife and I to enjoy a delicious dinner while listing to the rat pack and actually see photos of the Golden Nugget back in the day is truly remarkable. I WILL BE BACK!

9gdyaUpkjsqCxAJAvDnSbw.text: Our romantic evening started off with Ketel One dry Martinis, Up, with 2 olives, Lobster Bisque, Traditional Caesar Salad, we shared a 1lb King Crab Legs, Asparagus, Baked Potato with the works and a nice, warm delicious Bread! My husband and I don't eat much, and didn't want any leftovers but this delicious dinner spread was very filling, we were extremely satisfied! Tab: $150. We will return for more satisfying, dining experience when we return to the Fremont Experience!

tU9g-6S470Wj9QpjPKMb6Q.text: A second visit, and a second 5 star rating.  We wanted somewhere exceptional for our wedding night, and after evangelizing about the porterhouse for 6 months after I first tried it, my new wife was keen to try Vic & Anthony's and see what the fuss was about.  Suffice to say they stepped up again and delivered the best steak I've had the pleasure of. Our server this time was Matt (I think - he had an awesome 'tache!) was brilliant, kept the drinks coming, the tone fun and friendly, and upon finding out we were 4 hours wed brought us a free desert and drink.   The cocktails are delicious, mad strong, leg stealing and delicious. Highly recommended.  I love this place, and can't wait to get back there in the fall.

uV3zXXD0rbsEz7rEJf4M_g.text: By far, one of the best meals I've had in a long time.  Their signature crab cake is a must bc it contains large lumps of sweet carb meat.  The steak was very tender and full of flavor.  I've eaten at a lot of top Steakhouses, this one ranked up there with the best.  My wife ordered the Pepper Tuna, that was excellent.  The sides were great, our desert was Croissant Bread Pudding, topped off our excellent dining experience.  Beside our meal, I think our service was even better.  Hector is a class act and very personable.  I HIGHLY recommend him!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My check, Food was excellent and so was Hector!

REp48_V5TzkQu6sbCHZg2A.text: Food was awesome, and so was the service! The wait staff really took the time to meet all of our needs. They recommended dishes and wines that we would like so our meal was fabulous. Would definitely recommend it!

Ho3E6AE4820BhVwCbehLyA.text: Good, solid, upscale steak joint in Golden Nugget.  Old-school style and large portions.  Went in before a show and if its the weekend, better make reservations since its an institution.  The bone-in ribeye fed two us up with some left over.  The Caesar salad is one of the best in town.  service is attentive if a little rushed but activities are split up so you get lots of attention.  I do wish they had a little more room around the tables as its pretty cramp and gets loud and bustling.  Small compliant for an otherwise really good place downtown.

JRZWBbbqZ_p9DAOEqD-vug.text: We had a late dinner here and enjoyed our steaks...the crab cakes shouldn't be missed either. The service was friendly and attentive...but too fast! When spending $100 a person for dinner, please dint rush us! No sooner had our apps been cleared than our steaks arrived.  The sides are huge! The potatoes au gratin were ok...the creamed spinach, not so much...very salty.  The room is nice and has a very Vegas feel to it. The steaks were perfectly cooked and very tasty. Wasn't a bad dinner...just not a great overall experience.

Pd7vuauIWGUZdVXkyzI_9g.text: Simply excellent. We were taken to Vic & Anthony's by some of our favorite reps and it did not disappoint. It's a fabulous steakhouse with a gracious and helpful staff and an array of choices on the menu.  For starters we went with the cheese plate and a dozen raw oysters - top notch.   I selected the rib eye (duh) medium-rare and ate every. last. bite. I'm not necessarily proud of that but it was a feat for this carnivore.   The sides are huge - plenty for sharing - try the creamed spinach and mac and cheese. Heaven in your mouth, I tell ya.  Vic & Anthony's has that classic steakhouse feel. Very sophisticated, but comfortable, which makes me a fan.

lgKLsrxnYsnkK1liRvZ2sQ.text: It's good, just not great.  The cesar salad wasn't that great and my veal chop was not even close to the best I've had.

WanS0gWOE7T14rPTAjEFYQ.text: We just got home from eating here and I was extremely disappointed. I ordered the 12oz filet med rare Oscar style...it was almost inedibly  rare and 5 shells in the tiny portion of Oscar which wasn't really an Oscar at all even after I sent it back they just recooked the filet ruining it instead of making a new one. The sides we had were the au gratin potatoes ...ok Duck fat potatoes were terrible consistency mealy and tasted terrible nothing like duck fat at all Wild mushrooms were really over cooked. Wedge salad had maybe a teaspoon of dressing on it. The leftovers were thrown together and other not at all middle picture This was a special occasion and the only thing I can say good about it was the guy with the water was very attentive other than that it was a horrible experience  The waiter I believe 'Hector' was very pushy in the beginning,but really never checked on us later Also they charge $3 per hour that you are there sitting at the table Terrible experience I do not recommend this place at all we spent over 500 for terrible food that was unacceptable Also we were sat next to a window facing the hall of the casino where it was unappealing and people could look in at us very terrible seating and so dark you couldn't see the menu or the food just not pleasant and bad business I can't begin to express how disappointing this visit was ... we just felt like we were treated very disrespectfully I will not be eating the leftovers in the picture which is basically all my filet and who puts sides together and throws 3-4 over cooked mushrooms in a large to go container... also the waiter waited almost 2 hrs to take our leftovers from the table...knowing they had sat out long enough to go bad was disappointing as well considering he had walked by our table numerous times waiting on other tables. If we are going to pay for $70 steaks I expect them to be amazing mine was far from that.Quality of food and service was not fine dining steakhouse by any means. On a side note you have to leave the restaurant and cross an unpleasant smoke filled casino to get to the restrooms.We don't smoke so it was another downfall. I forgot to mention at the start I had to send the water back considering it was dirty and covered in food...also the wine pouring was not done correctly at all maybe this is why they keep it so dark so no one can see if their food is raw or cooked and dinnerware is dirty or clean. Update: I have been sick all day (the day after) in and out of the bathroom then back to bed ...

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yxvQGnWOQ7WFmfwOaR24DA.text: We had no reservations and a group of six that got seated quickly and provided with great service. But that was just the start of it, the food was quite possibly the best I've ever had. All six of us ordered different appetizers and entrees and everyone was completely satisfied couldn't believe how happy we were with everything that we ordered. The server was a little eccentric but we found that quite entertaining and just another bonus for a fabulous experience. The prices were high but nothing out of the ordinary for a high-end steakhouse. it's one of the restaurants my friends and I have talked about multiple times since leaving Vegas and can't wait to go back again!

9OODFLB46Pd7sbNoClxUsg.text: I went here for a birthday dinner and the service was 10 out of 10 we ordered the seafood tower and I had lobster mac & cheese it was so good

61Q0ZH1-lgoYYkEfdBe3SQ.text: Exceptional as always.  Server Jim was pleasant and efficient.  We enjoyed a Ribeye, 12 oz. Filet, crab cake (crazy good), potatoes, and creamed spinach.  Pricey, but everything could not have been better.  Enjoyed the more intimate setting upstairs, but please don't tell anyone.

Yga9moaF_xW0Ihsy0HGhUQ.text: Had dinner here Saturday.  I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place.  Our server was Matt. He was awesome with an awesome mustache! Lol I started with the Cesar salad and hubby had the Lobster Bisque.  Both were very tasty.  For entree I had the fried lobster mac and cheese.  When i say OMG!!  OMG!!  First of all.. i have never had fried lobster!! Especially not on mac n cheese. Needless to say it was delicious!!  Hubby had the Filet & Lobster surf & Turf. It came with white cheddar mashed potatoes and broccoli . The steak was melt in your mouth and the potatoes were creamy and delicious.  Everything we had was cooked perfectly. The service was awesome. It was a great experience and I will definitely return.

ngtBc1vuvpnOchMBSEbm9Q.text: Ordered something off the menu for the days special 8oz filet mignon with crab and lobster tail everything was cooked to perfection , friendly and helpful staff. I ordered 2 shots of Martel cognac and the bartender came to our table to tell us about How he tried the Martel blue swift and he never went back , I really appreciated the recommendation. Overall great food great customer service Worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n_VPYrXjQFgYPTyy6zoKfQ.text: One of my better dining experiences. .....ever.  Very classy atmosphere that let's you know it won't be cheap....yet worth every penny. I had the big Filet with a side of the pan seared scallops with bacon which is more like pork belly, both were awesome. I also sprung for the Russian Caviar which was exceptional, not as good as Beluga, but close. My only complaint, the wine. While exceptional, do you really have to charge 200% more than I can buy it for?   V&A, thanks for the memories, I will be back soon.

eVz0TCZ3jGgVKX3k0M5AsA.text: The food was amazing, from the appetizers to the entrees. Our server was knowledgeable and had a good sense of humor. I had the 22oz bone in ribeye; ordered it medium rare and it came out perfect.  I'm not in Vegas more than 1-2 times a year but I will be making reservations from now on every time we are in town.  Nate N.

-5ZlAqhxOUTc9HpKZiGCnQ.text: Without a doubt my favorite place to dine in the valley. For everything I look for in a steakhouse, V&A checks all the boxes with 5 stars: The ambiance is classically dim and extremely comfortable. The mixology and drink selection is outstanding. The wine list is expansive with excellent variety. The entire food menu is immaculate- led of course by their amazing steaks (I always get get the ribeye). Lastly, and most important to me, the service is impeccable. Personally, I have requested Pat my last two visits. Quite simply, he makes an incredible experience even better than that. I let him take the wheel now on any ordering predicaments I have while choosing my drinks, wine, sides, entrees, and desserts and he's never let me or any of my guests down. When I direct friends and clients to Vic and Anthony's, I always tell them to request Pat. Just like V&A, he's a rarity in the business. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

bcunQuCa5hjuCsPivPqqow.text: This place is beyond amazing ... best steakhouse!!! The service is impeccable and the food is so delicious. We went for dinner and we had the 3 course meal. My wife and I like our meat well done (cause we can't stand seeing red or pink in our meat) and they cooked it to perfection. The filet mignon was huge and thick, cooked well done and juicy.The chef is incredible to pull it off specially with a thick piece of meat like that. Most restaurants would ask you if they can cut the meat into a butterfly but there's no need for that at Vic's & Anthony's. I highly recommend this restaurant and I will definitely be back.

r_zfkpA9q16PDNItnia3Kg.text: We dined here on 3-22-19 to celebrate our anniversary. Our server James was excellent!  Friendly and knowledgeable. All three courses of dinner were absolutely wonderful! Ribeye steak, filet and lobster tail were cooked to perfection. The creme brulee is amazing!! A big thank you to Sarah for sending us the complimentary champagne and desert wine and to Martha for stopping by with well wishes.  It made a memorable dining experience!

AK0rAAqpEcdhhLX51mdczg.text: I would like to start that if I paid 15 for this steak they would be getting 5 stars.  It is my understanding that Vic and Anthony's is a chain.  This one happens to be in the lobby of the Golden Nugget in Vegas.  I love the thought of a steak house with old world charm and add that it was my birthday and the we just came in from traveling, this seemed like the perfect place to celebrate.  My favorite things to do when I travel are visiting the best steakhouses.  St whats- its- name in Indy, G something in Chicago.  Steak should always come med rare and by the most attentive staff.   I ordered the Oysters Rockefeller (my Favorite) and we each got a filet.  It was difficult to look at the menu.  It was DARK!! Not great ambience dark, but if that big screen at the bar were to lose reception no one would have been able to see. At first, since I was celebrating getting a year older, I thought my eyes were going bad.  That was until I witnessed the youngsters at the table next to me take their candle to the menu.  Tonight I was not eating with my eyes but pretty much by taste.  Our server and front server didn't show up that often, which was sad since it was my birthday, didn't need to drive to the 19th floor, and it was vacation.  I left sober.  (that's sad)  The steak was ok.  I am assuming it was cooked ok since I couldn't see.  The taste relied on the meat which in my opinion could have used a bit more salt.  The sides were ok.  Nothing to oo and ahh over.  The oysters- well I will leave them out because they did not make me happy since I couldn't see them  I will assume it was simply a flavor issue.   We decided to take our deserts to the room.  We couldn't take the creme Brule since obvi.  It was served on a plate..... not a ramekin on a plate... custard maybe  1/2 inch thick on a plate.  Odd is not the word.  But why?  The burnt sugar ratio to the creme was off and not great.  I you prefer crust over the rich creme then this is your place.   I won't come back to give it another go next time I see them.

lSOqecXcKdOMsNCZoGZfKQ.text: A very good high-end steakhouse, to be sure. The service was excellent and we were taken well care of. My wife had the shrimp scampi which featured incredible shrimp and a delicate sauce. She ordered the Wedge salad which was Roquefort, instead of Bleu, which was delicious. I had the SRF pork chop with the bone-in. I ordered it medium, which unfortunately may have been the reason it was extremely tough. It did have portions which were what the entire chop should have been, but it was a let-down. Still the experience was pleasant.

7WtD4pzEkTgmAt0XkqGLdA.text: Awesome juicy steak. The food, the ambience, the service... A+ to all. Hence, the price is a little on the nose as well... but so worth the money!! You have to wander inside the Golden nugget hotel a little to find it.

E4NjhZwk_zehO-U-J4J7og.text: Just inside of the Golden Nugget lies an intimate steakhouse in the midst of chaos.    A friend and I decided a steakhouse was on our palette for the evening.  We walked in without reservations.  Luckily they do offer a full menu at the bar.  The three bartenders who helped us out were readily available with professional helpfulness.    Noah suggested the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake was not to be missed.  I concur that it was indeed a treasure on the appetizer list.  It's definitely jumbo with so much crab packed in.  The flavor of the sauce enhanced the full flavor of this lovely cake.    I am always thrilled when my friends want to spilt entrees so we can try more than one item.  This evening it was split between Roasted Salmon and Filet Mignon.  The steak was medium and perfectly pink.  It was so tender that it felt like slicing through butter.  The steak was delicious that it didn't need any sauce or extra seasonings.    The roasted salmon was good being served over asparagus and potato puree.  The roasted salmon was supposed to be stuffed with Gouda and Jumbo Lump Crab but I didn't taste much of that if any.  I still enjoyed the dish very much but has room for improvement.    The broccoli we ordered on the side was really eye opening! It was as if two huge heads of broccoli were steamed and put on the plate.  Yes this side will feed a village!   It was a pleasure to dine here and I look forward to my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz Filet Medium
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of broccoli
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Salmon with asparagus and potato purée

CdKTCl1JbwIU-dFpw-VY0A.text: This steakhouse is FANTASTIC steak is top of the line. I took myself there went along and had a very wonderful dinner first class treatment waitresses and waitresses extremely nice management very pleasant very elegant very exquisite a place that you want to take your woman

OsLn-WVOji7RGVr1w6VN4A.text: We noted with our reservation it was a special occasion there was no acknowledgement to prep. Filet & potatoes were dry. Service was good. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again especially to celebrate a birthday.

CsabE4zG0bNNTl_93KaOUQ.text: While I might say I have had better I would be hard pressed to tell you what other establishment was  more outstanding.  Make no mistake this is and expensive dinning place.  It is 4 $$$$ for a reason.  Everything is a la carte with steaks starting at $45 and going up to the high $60's range.  I ordered a shrimp cocktail.  For $19 you received 3 jumbo shrimp with their "atomic" sauce.  Nothing was atomic about the sauce but it was a great compliment.  While not the most outstanding shrimp I have ever had it was top notch.    For my entre I ordered the prime rib eye steak which was $64 and well sized for the price.  I also had a baked potato which was good but $9.00 good? I guess so.  What really impressed me was the whole service team.  From the waiter to the buss boys they worked seamlessly to make the evening special.  They were not the hovering type they would look at your table see what you needed and bring it.  Very intuitive service.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye.
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 oysters $29
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prices

DHpsuqo8_SOSClMM7K76Qw.text: This restaurant definitely deserves 5  . We decided to eat here spur of the moment, not checking Yelp reviews and waited about 10 min. Our next visit to Vegas we couldn't wait to dine here again! The steaks (rib eye & filet mignon) are cooked to perfection, broccoli crowns are huge and potatoes were perfect. Service is 5  too. The atmosphere is comfortable, a little romantic with dim lights and candles on the tables. It's definitely a mature quiet vibe - total opposite of the wild, dirty atmosphere on Fremont Street.   In our opinion, Vic & Anthony's beats HK by Cesar's hands down! Don't waste your time and energy trying to get RSVP over there. Vic & Anthony's serves up hot food from the kitchen, has great service and nice atmosphere, all of which HK lacks.  I recommend Vic & Anthony's to anyone who's looking for a satisfying meal in this area.

Ja0Af3s15pya67PMPBayxA.text: My wife and I had dinner here again earlier in the week. This place is simply amazing. My wife are here maybe once or twice a year, and yet I was greeted by name when we checked in. The manager remembers us, each and every time.  As always we started with a dozen oysters and as expected, they were delicious! The horseradish still clears my sinuses, a feeling that both my wife and I enjoy. Now to the main course. My wife and I always share a tomahawk here. I noticed the change from Heartbrand to Cape Grim beef, so at first I was a little apprehensive as to how the quality would stand up to our previous tomahawks. We ordered our usual side of asparagus as our accompaniment to our tomahawk.  The Cape Grim tomahawk was nothing short of spectacular! The darn thing had a bone on it longer than our previous tomahawks. My wife and I actually took the bone home because we knew no one would believe us when we told them how big the bone was. The flavor of the Cape Grim tomahawk was even better than the Heartbrand we've eaten before. 40 some odd ounces of tender, incredibly flavored beef that needs NOTHING! No salt, no pepper, eat it as is, adding anything else would be an insult. I was informed by the manager that the new tomahawk is being sourced from Australia and while it did cost more, it was worth each and every penny...and then some.  My wife and I got a complimentary creme brulee despite the fact that we were stuffed after putting down that monster steak. But, we did finish our dessert as something sweet after eating such a comical portion of meat really hits the spot. Make no mistake, next time my wife and I are in Vegas, we're eating here again!

XcYto1qTnRbMgcCd1JcqlQ.text: This was really an expensive joint - yes, the meat was delicious but it didn't come with anything - no salad, no vegetables - so you are paying roughly $50 a head plus tip for just a piece of meat - so for five of us the bill (with two sides and drinks) was around $325 (including tip) - that will give you an idea of what to expect.

poPM0TYZLR2B_FCYMARk-g.text: Located inside the Golden Nugget. Frank Sinatra music playing and a cool classic vibe. Service from Dennis was excellent. Everything we ate for dinner was fantastic. The steak was top notch. Appetizers were good as well. Pricier place though. Plan on spending $100 a person with a drink or 2. Not a fan of the downtown Vegas scene but we will be back!

DC9yuHqWApuYFTBESQD-Ow.text: Went last Sunday with family after a wedding weekend and it was great.  Try the spiced pear martini, it is unique.  Service was outstanding, with the water refills coming constantly and all needs promptly solved.  The steaks were great, with the highlight being the 16 oz Waygu NY Strip.  It was melt-in-your-mouth tender, but you pay serious coin for that pleasure.  The huge lobster tail was fresh and allowed the 7 of us to each get a small portion.  The $50 distinctive dining menu can not be beat.  Highly recommend as a special treat visit, bring your wallet.

7-GpcOLtuBozkEiRbbgBQA.text: My Filet was fabulous and perfectly cooked, however my friends was over cooked! They cooked another but the rest of her meal was now cold. I feel they should have taken her meal off the bill. Other than that it was fantastic and service was exceptional. Be mindful it is pricey but the food and atmosphere made it worth it.
