m8Mj7lUGkLdKM06hORQo5Q.text: I love this place! The employees are so friendly and helpful! They give great customer service. The signature drinks are amazing and the food is to die for! You have to make a stop here and experience the greatness yourself!

qm-hJS3BWx2PqBz0ucZiGQ.text: 4 of us went to dinner here this past Saturday night and could not have asked for a better meal. We were seated right away for our 9:15 reservation (tail end of the dinner rush) and our waiter Miguel was great and very attentive.  I ordered the filet mignon and it was cooked perfect and so easy to cut. Two friends has the filet mignon special with lobster tail which they totally enjoyed.  Had the maple bacon and it was one of the best I have had.   Our drinks were never empty.   Looking at some they comments here is my take:   Being from NY and Italian bread is a staple of life. The bread they served was hot and quite good. Add the butter on top and yum so not sure what others thought.  People were upset dinner is a la carte and sides are extra but that is what you get at most steakhouses in any major city.

j0ELkQ7rjpjpG77iMcgzBQ.text: This place has an authentic rat pack vibe and delicious food as well. We went back 2 nights in a row because we were so obsessed with our meal and experience.

wDG7YdDJYD8LvHDB17WEJg.text: Really nice service. Made a reservation in advance and we were seated quickly which is nice to not be kept waiting.  Our server was a seasoned professional and knew good customer service and timing.  Drinks and appetizers came out quickly and the waiter recommended the best dishes.  Never felt he was pushing certain dishes as he asked what we liked and recommended accordingly.  Steaks were cooked perfectly and served hot.  Side dishes were well prepared and did not disappoint.  I had the ribeye (no bone) and my dining companion had the 12 oz fillet.  Both were perfect and delicious.  This restaurant knows how to cook a steak!  Passed on dessert but wished we had room for it.  A great dining experience!  My only complaint is that they don't have a restroom inside the restaurant.  You have go out into the casino, but all in all not a big deal.

E5xjVVW7EFZ8rVpPYH2Z-A.text: I don't say this lightly: one of the best steakhouse experiences I have ever had. Top to bottom, perfection. To start, the staff was attentive and competent. The hostess guided me to the bar, where a random waiter ensured that I got a seat. I ate at the bar -- Noah was the barkeep that night -- and wow he delivered. Noah has a deep knowledge of the food menu, as well as cocktails and wine. He even went so far as to sample up several different wine varietals that could pair perfectly with the steak.   I went with the 8 ounce filet and lobster tail combo. Both came out superbly. Many restaurants err on the side of cooking a medium-rare steak too long. Not here: it came out just the perfect shade of deep red in the middle, yet still warm, and nice pinkness on the outside. The lobster tail was fluffy and tender -- no need for a knife, just melted off the fork. The chef himself even made an appearance to talk meat with the bar patrons.   I am telling you, treat yourself to an epic dinner and get in here.

Nqo876t2pteyuQIhAaZMqw.text: Came here with a big group as a nice way to end a crazy bachelor party weekend in Vegas.  Really, really delicious...  Many of us had the special, which that night was Surf 'n Turf (Filet Mignon and Lobster Tail). Many of us got a side too, all of which were large, and we shared them among the table. Portions were large, it was hard to finish it all. Definitely worth the $$.

9uiwpXYLoVuH2-Nol4cVLw.text: A little late, but had had to get it in. By far, the best dining experience I've ever had. I believe our waiter's name was Hector (sorry if I'm wrong :/) but he made the experience one to remember. The food was soooooooooo spot on. I actually enjoyed the sides (loaded baked & bone marrow) more than the steak - but the steak was phenomenal! Worth the price. Atmosphere was fantastic - except for a couple of bros acting way out of control behind us. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

v7u98V1VZDMgHyWRU4ILgQ.text: BT and I went here because it was recommended by our friends. I didn't realize it was in the Golden Nugget and was worried it wouldn't be that nice inside. Boy, was I wrong. I was completely blown away by the gorgeous woodwork, the ambient lighting, and overall old school "fancy" feel. The hostesses were great and welcoming. Our server was amazing. He recommended great wines and let us have tastes when we were indecisive of what to order. We were lucky to have stumbled upon the distinctive dining offer. What an amazing deal. We first started off with the lobster bisque. My goodness was that ever decadent. So flavorful with big chunks of lobster. They did not skimp with the serving size either. Next, we had the 8 oz filet mignon. Perfectly cooked to our desires of medium rare and medium. They also had this peppercorn sauce on the side. It was a perfect complement to the meat. Not overpowering, but a great enhancement. We chose the broccoli and au gratin potatoes as our sides. I was awe-struck by the portion sizes. The broccoli was HUGE. I am not exaggerating either. It had an awesome flavor- far from your average steamed broccoli taste. The au gratin was rich and decadent. All of this yummy goodness paired with a nice, generous pour of Malbec. For dessert, BT had the bread pudding, which he LOVED and I had the lemon sorbet. What I appreciated most is that our server was very concerned with my allergies, and went to find out what I could have in lieu of the pre-set dessert choices. The service was top notch and we never wanted for anything. This was a very special experience of amazing service, food, and setting. Definitely worth the 151 dollar tab (not including tip) So, Treat yo' self to Vic & Anthony's. You deserve it.

4nTnTN0hJlleGIMLvwaGaw.text: The meal was AMAZING! Well worth the money.   I had their pre-fixe menu (check their website, you have to bring a print-out with you to get the price); I got a Caesar salad, 8 oz filet mignon, au gratin potatoes, and creme brulee all for only $52. Amazing! My husband got the special of the evening; an 8 oz filet mignon and 5 oz lobster tail.   All of the food was phenomenal, but I have to say the potatoes au gratin were above and beyond the highlight of the meal. They were by far the most amazing potatoes I've ever had in my life--possibly more cheese than potatoes? Creamy and delicious and just to die for. I also really enjoyed the creme brulee; it was provided on a dinner-plate-type dish, so it was only about an inch deep or so. This meant that every bite had a piece of delicious caramelized crispy topping (which was beautifully done without a bit of burnt sugar).   The atmosphere was lovely; dark and intimate and quiet. The service was wonderful, and the cocktails were good as well. All in all, the meal was in the top three in my lie! And for less than $200 for two people, that's downright affordable!

EL_hO7UmS46itlPcH-5jyA.text: Celebrated our anniversary early last night and it was our first time here. First off, ambience was amazing. Old Las Vegas at its best! Service was spot on and food was delicious! We ordered from their Distinctive Dining menu (see their website for details) and was not disappointed at all. Ceasar salad and Lobster Bisque were our starters and was delicious.  The fillets were seasoned well and medium rare-medium. Potatoes Au Gratin was superb. Brocolli was cooked well. But lastly,the highlight was their bread pudding ~ a must have to order!  Will definite be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread Pudding
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brocolli
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes Au Gratin

pOn0CL1RGgCe69s1zNhO2A.text: From the time we stepped in the front door without a reservation we felt welcomed; service was excellent, Heather, our waitress was attentive to every detail and the food was exquisite; we had an excellent evening!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the Grand Finale!!!

llV3Cy15CPsxrPXZXLoXlA.text: I'm just going to be honest and let you all know that my memory of eating at this particular steak house is a little fuzzy because I had been playing blackjack and drinking champagne for, oh about 7 hours before realizing that if I didn't eat dinner now!, then I would have to eat at a diner or some form of 24 hour place and it probably wouldn't be as good. Also, Nick has a tradition of wanting to eat at a steak house at least once while we are in Vegas and this was our only chance on the short trip we took there recently.  With that said, I was pleasantly surprised with how much I enjoyed the meal and I'd easily go back again. I ordered a classic filet and Nick ordered a strip and both were cooked perfectly. We also shared some of the mac and cheese (sooooo good), the Brussel sprouts (eh, average), and a chop salad that I really enjoyed. And while I know it's not part of the menu, the bread and butter were worth mentioning as well. I'm normally not much of a bread person, as I prefer my carbs in the form of purer sugar, but man alive! I couldn't stop eating this stuff.  While it isn't the high roller steak houses you can find on the strip I think the quality is definitely great here and you also miss out on the waits and attitudes you might find in some places on the strip. Plus the cost, while high, wasn't as high as some of the other steak houses I've been in Vegas. More money for doubling down is always a good thing!

ElS9sK9Ah8uqW4WtMo0MsQ.text: I apologize for being late with the review but got a little busy.  First off this has got to be one of the best restaurants I've been to.  The experience was amazing.  You know the workers are attentive when you don't have to asked for a different napkin for your close color.  Our server was Mario. He was awesome.  He knew the food and drink menu very well.  He even had the chef prepare an item that was not offered on the menu that came out wonderful.  The atmosphere was great. It was an awesome evening and experience.  I'll be back and recommend anyone to try them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and Steak
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked potato
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Lobster from Alaska...salmon stuffed with lump crab meat with baked potato

MvPRDzBvRJkPX56EKmd5YQ.text: One of the best meals I've had in Vegas. Top notch, classy, fantastic service and delicious food. I ordered the filet and lobster special-fabulous!!! I want to eat here every time I'm in Vegas now.

OTdm7XWOwpExm5uPM8ua6Q.text: Dez might be the best waiter we've ever encountered. We weren't planning on coming to Vic & Anthony's but at attempts at four other places downtown - 2 were closed, one had some kitchen problems which made about 90% of their menu unavailable and one where we waited 20 minutes without even getting water before we left - so we were pretty over it and hungry by this point.  Our waiter Dez was above and beyond, giving recommendations and really getting a feel for what we wanted.   We went with a Caesar salad, crab cake, Mac and cheese and a rib eye with red wine. The meal was wonderful. The salad had just enough anchovy taste but very light dressing so you could really taste the crisp lettuce and shaved parm. The crab cake had generous lumps of crab and was breaded nicely. Our steak was perfectly cooked with a nice char and salt on the outside while being tender and pink on the inside.   Coupled with amazing service, it was a meal way above and beyond what we were expecting.

HjSnUNz13E2UAhZjmNxetQ.text: Best steakhouse in Las Vegas - skip the Strip! Go downtown to the Golden Nugget and have dinner in this extraordinary restaurant instead.

RCYPDIVOhV-609IxcuCDwQ.text: apologies for the late review Yelper's, we had dinner there January 31st.  Jimmy was our server and he was terrific!  First class service with excellent attention to detail.  We had the filet and it was cooked perfectly.    Going above and beyond, I asked Jimmy if he could help arrange a car to take us back to our hotel.  He did that and Shawn, one of the managers, walked us out to the car.    It was my girls first experience at Vic & Anthony's and she loved it.   Great job everyone!

3DoQixkoqNIDxjpD27Jq1w.text: Best steak house in Vegas.  This is an old school mahogany,  leather, martinis and steak place.   Fancy for Freemont St but anytime I come to Vegas I eat here.   In fact my favorite steak house.

iYlSLhfx6kpJq3_7ZJSG5g.text: We were welcomed warmly by the hostess even though we didn't have a reservation. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive to our needs. I had the special which was the filet mignon (was melt in your mouth tender)with a lobster tail (cooked to perfection) asparagus and mushrooms. My husband had the New York strip steak with wild mushrooms and au gratin potatoes as side dishes. The bread was crispy, with a soft inside and warm. We were sooo full there was no room for dessert! Incredible meal all around...I will recommend this restaurant to our friends for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very delicious and service was incredible!

kmIyu2LeURPDxsNo4E3vTA.text: When we came to Vegas we tried to locate a restaurant that would have a delicious steak. We were not disappointed by Vic & Anthony's. The appetizer crab cake was phenomenal. The Caesar salad was delicious. I ordered a filet mignon and it was perfect . I also ordered a loaded baked potato on the side and it was the best I ever had. The baked potato was huge so you could consider sharing it with someone. The service was impeccable. Parking was pretty good. We parked in the Golden Nugget self-park and Vic & Anthony's validated our ticket so it was free. They do offer complimentary valet parking also.

sSnK3s8KPECwepxpusr05w.text: This place was amazing , had the 8oz filet, side of wild mushrooms and Brussel sprouts. My girl had the salmon , we also had a couple of glasses of wine . Place is nice and dark but in a good way , cool atmosphere of old Vegas times , all the food was Delicious, Ofcourse a lil pricey but you get what you pay for , and that's great food , will visit again if in the area

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food and service ain&#39;t cheap lol

DaaSYlKo8whVQ3XGAviqzA.text: My wife and I started off with lobster bisque and she had tomato n moz salad and we were both satisfied and happy we didn't look at the photos of it first cuz we might not have ordered it....  we had a filet and crab cakes for dinner w mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts, filet was good had to send back to get it to medium but it's not easy to get a fat filet medium on the inside, the crab cakes was one of the best I ever had, plenty of crab with lumps of it on the outside and on top...  the only thing we weren't real fond of was the Rose wine we got, we usually like a moscato w dinner but they didn't have any, the Rose wine wasn't a great substitute....  also, the service was excellent

LQE1QWwkHX7OhWn3D5fqFw.text: This was the best porterhouse steak in Vegas at the Golden Nugget and our waiter Matt was amazing in explaining the menu and specials with us.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere of this restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AWESOME STEAK

DPBV6y-y5ght5lMzd9Czuw.text: My husband and I recently ate dinner here, for our fifteenth wedding anniversary. He had the Prime Rib  and the Duck Fat Potatoes and I had the Shrimp Scampi. Both dishes were fantastic; well-seasoned and beautifully presented. The wait staff was highly attentive, frequently checking on us throughout the duration of our meal. All in all, a great dining experience.

7II4G-nqaPLsBSo-ddrElQ.text: BEST STEAK HOUSE IN VEGAS  I've eaten here many times -- you can't get a bad meal and the service is amazing

x2AMPqoAhQOm5c9gcHqacQ.text: A $$$ cab ride from the strip and a $75 meal at Vic and Anthony's is well worth the visit! A local gal suggested I try it out and she did me right. A bone-in Ribeye with a side of Cream spinach and a big glass of Cabernet was most fabulous. An old school steakhouse decor with courteous service is not only bookmarked, but has made it a regular stop every time I'm in town!

KB7-PCeCzehm3v0c_DxbCA.text: After doing research I decided on Vic and Anthony to take my boyfriend for Valentine's Day - BEST DECISION EVER. We ordered the Tomahawk with macaroni and cheese and au gratin potatoes- best I have ever had. Heather was great, she for warned us the extra time to cook. Brought it out, presented it and then cooked a little more upon my request. Will most definitely go back again and again.

Ab2X_IplziEnxEi4TnQkJA.text: We were going off of reviews, good thing.  We were blown away.  People have become really picky and everyone is a critic.  Lobster Bisque, 8 oz Filet, Au Gratin potatoes, Cosmopolitan, and Creme Brule.  All amazing, service outstanding! We can't wait to come back.  Don't deprive yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert done right!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They know service!

PIku1I9o5HnMEuWkloebAg.text: Had an amazing experience, Miguel our waiter was spot on, and the manager James had Shawn the in house sommelier help us with the perfect wine pairing for our seafood tower!!  Amazing food and great staff.

VfVLpMdF3I3bEQBbG2ukQQ.text: Ruben and I celebrated our anniversary here a couple years ago and we had a wonderful experience. It's been a while for me, however, Ruben took his mother for her birthday last year since we enjoyed it so much and they had a great time!   We started our meal with the Calamari with Sweet and Spicy Peppers ($13), Beefsteak Tomato & Onion Salad with Roquefort Cheese ($11), and Lobster Bisque, finished with Cognac ($11). I enjoyed the sweet and spicy sauce on the calamari and the bisque was delicious. The salad was good, but disappointingly scarce with three slices of tomato and four very thin slices of red onion.  Ruben and I both enjoyed an 8-ounce Filet Mignon ($39) with Wild Mushrooms ($11), Steamed Asparagus ($10), Macaroni & Cheese ($9), and Sea Salt Fries ($8) as our accompaniments. Their steaks are USDA Prime Midwest Grain-Fed and were perfectly prepared (medium rare) and really delicious. We were very pleased with all the side dishes as well.  Service was spectacular and we enjoyed a complimentary chocolate cake at the end of our dinner. Vic & Anthony's has been a highly recommended steakhouse choice for both of us and we will always love to return!

IZ39U8YIhVYJ28bTWWvbAg.text: Had a staycation at the Golden Nugget for Christmas. Decided to go all out and splurge! My bf and I prob spent about $250 on dinner and drinks. It's a pretty pricey place. Had apps, steaks, sides and drinks. Omg def one of theeeeeee best steaks I've ever had!  If you're looking for a great steak this is the place to go!

NcY1dop4MdJ_z-NpisSB2Q.text: Phenomenal food, outstanding service, charming ambiance.  Now I see why all the 5 star ratings.  I had crab cakes to die for, perfect bone-in ribeye and the smoked bacon. My friend had the pork chop and shared a couple bites.  That was the juiciest pork ever!!  I will be back.  Best high end meal I have had in years.

3yYMruZtOqdou0sSrll8Rg.text: Happy holidays Las Vegas Yelpers!  I came here this past Sunday night for dinner :) My boyfriend and I joined his dad and step mom visiting from Hawaii for a delicious meal at V&A. I was really excited... never been here before and it was my first time meeting his dad & step mom.  I'm not a steak eater but I fancy other things :D For starters we shared the calamari, crab cakes and portobello mushrooms. The crab cakes are phenomenal here! Probably one of the best I've had. My bf ordered the prime rib, his dad ordered a filet and his step mom and I ordered the lamb chops... with baked and mash potatoes. Everything was perfect! For dessert I had their flourless chocolate cake! If you love chocolate, try it... it's on the rich side.  Our server Bo was really excellent in customer service!  Great ambiance and amazing food!  If you're looking for a steakhouse, make it V&A!  - Miss Yelp 2011

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nwK5Qd1fEGz87Noq2mzZGg.text: Tomahawk steak was excellent! Lobster was nice and juicy! Service was excellent! They even went as far as providing something that was not even on menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ncn_hSBeJOCOI2Gh6vokdQ.text: My friend was adamant that he wanted a great steak as soon as we got to Vegas. Since we were staying at the Golden Nugget, I found this place and made a reservation. Couldn't have been easier to find; it's located right at the front entrance, right by front desk. As soon as we entered, we were very warmly greeted.  Our server couldn't have been friendlier. He was very helpful in letting us know all about their menu. The service was so prompt, every time I used a  packet of sweet and low, he was there to pick up the mess. I found this very impressive considering they were very busy.  In short, the service was first class.  As for the food: Simply Amazing.  I had the Prime Ribeye and my friend had the combo Lobster with Filet Mignot.  Hands down the best steak I've very had. No fat whatsoever and very tender. I also wanted a salad and when I asked how big they were, he told me he could split it. So they brought it already prepared in two separate bowls.  I thought this was awesome cause they could have been dicks and said, "no you have to buy them separate".  This place is a bit pricey but for Vegas, it's actually fair. Only negative: believe it or not....this place has no restrooms.  That's right, NO RESTROOMS.  You have to go into the casino to use the restroom.  When I asked why this was, he told me because this was a very old building and it was never restructured to accommodate restrooms. Aside from that minor hiccup, I highly recommend this place for amazing steaks.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon and Lobster
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Ribeye
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Vegas Ambiance

WtwDBz4EAoZPiQGPmZNDYg.text: WOW...  I don't give many 5-star ratings. That being said, Vic and Anthony's earned all 5 with ease....  We dined here on our last night in Vegas.  Being from Houston, we were familiar with the Vic and Anthony's brand, as they have a restaurant there.    We actually stayed in the Golden Nuggett so we wanted to have a good last night dinner somewhere in Downtown Vegas.  We'd already been to Hugo's Cellar before(awesome by the way) and we had heard Binion's Steakhouse was quite good.    We dropped by Binion's but changed our mind at the last minute and went to Vic and Anthony's instead. In retrospect, this was a excellent decision.  The restaurant is not that spacious however, on the other hand, the coziness provides the dining couples with a much more intimate and romantic experience.    The waiter was very courteous and immediately wished my wife a happy birthday (earning valuable points) and then guided us through the wine menu and liquor/after-dinner menu.  The wife had a crown and 7.  I had a Makers Mark 46 with a splash of 7.  If you like Bourbon, give Maker's Mark 46 a try.  Both drinks were prompt, cold and stout, just the way they should be.    We skipped the appetizers altogether and went straight the entrees.  I do hear, however, that the crab cakes are quite good  Because they serve such large portions, we shared a 16 oz. Prime Ribeye cooked to perfection.  As sides, we had the Creamed Corn and Truffle Mashed Potatoes.  All were wonderfully flavored...  If you order a topping for your steak, I highly reccomend the Port Peppercorn. Have them serve it on the side, instead of on top of the steak. You won't be disappointed.    For dessert, we shared the flourless Chocolate Cake.  This was quite good but a little too rich for us.  Should have stayed with the tried-and-True Creme Brulee.    This place was almost as good as Hugo's Cellar in Vegas and Pappas Steakhouse in Houston.....very very close.  If in Vegas, either Hugo's or Vic and Anthony's would be an excellent choice.

mbRiEDSVmOM0C-WOeVu_AA.text: We always make the trek downtown to eat at Vic and Anthony's. I can't miss the maple glazed quail appetizer. I often order it for my entree. The restaurant is dark and old school - what a steak house should be. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Service is always excellent. Make reservations- there is not much room in the small bar area to hangout and wait.

BYEhRR6NjzcXUh22LuMJNA.text: I rarely, if ever, have a meal where every single thing I eat is incredible. This was one of those meals. We started with the crab cakes, they were huge chunks of crab meat and held together well, and with incredible flavor. It is not often to find exceptional crab cakes. The tuna poke (I often eat poke all over the world) was also exceptional with complex flavor and I always love generous helpings of avocado.   We ordered a 40oz tomahawk rib eye, which surprisingly, was my least favorite item of the meal. I think I would have preferred a boneless ribeye, although it was very tasty as well.  The mashed potatoes and spinach dish were flavorful and enough to go around for 3 people. The finish of the bread pudding was out of this world delicious. We also enjoyed a couple of bottles of wine and appreciated the sommelier's recommendations. Can't wait to eat here again!

ehLRt_lNKEKWUNq3MYPClA.text: By far the best steakhouse I have ever been too! The food is supberb and service to match. Plus I liked the environment, upscale and not too loud. We are definitely coming back!

TFHO0NCS6ffZCISTm4IgsQ.text: 100% the best meal I've ever had. Hands down. So good.  Service was spot on from hostess to server.  The food though was phenomenal. We got a cheese plate to start, great cheese selection and accompaniments. I ordered the filet with lobster for dinner, it had a raspberry rhubarb reduction on it and came with wild mushrooms and carrots. Cooked a perfect medium rare. Lobster came with a chive butter sauce on top.  My man got the filet as well with a side of macaroni and cheese as well as the broccoli. It was all so so good. I honestly can't put into words so much I enjoyed this meal.   When I made the reservation on open table I had informed them we were celebrating a birthday. Usual nothing comes of this, however this time we were surprised with a duo of delish mini cakes and a lit candle. It was nice.   It was an expensive price tag, but so worth it.  If you want a good steak, come here.

ZkO49tuMlsdCRPaN1ltffA.text: We stay at this hotel every year and had never tried this place.  Our server Hector was definitely a 5star server, maybe even 6 stars.  We had calamari, bacon, shrimp, and lobster bisque to start. All tasted very good.  Then we got a bone in prime ribeye with spinach with abalone mushrooms, and Mac n cheese. All tasted very well.  I was disappointed by the live Maine lobster though and lack of flavor.  We also got duck potatoes which were just ok.  Overall rating is mostly of service, but not so much the main coarse.

hJLW6KcP-1dOSCs2usHy3A.text: Our waiter Dennis was fabulous! Highly recommended steak house, we had a party of 11, each trying different foods. Particularly, the filet and lobster, pork chop, and scallops, all of which were cooked to perfection. The lobster Mac N cheese was delicious as well! I don't think anything here would be a bad choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mHGMevW0Mz-sWZqMGm6eVA.text: What an amazing dinner. The service was spectacular and the steaks were superb. This is a very much recommended place if you love rare meat. The drinks are spot on, and the atmosphere is very nice and relaxed. There was no pressure from our waiter to be quick, which we appreciate it since we were with a group of friends for a nice night out.

PXub5phrzOnZYlfO3n34uA.text: Fantastic birthday dinner!  I started with the lobster bisque and it was so good I just about cried when it was all gone, lol.  Then I had the 8 ounce filet mignon medium rare cooked to perfection seasoned beyond my imagination our sides included onion straws and the broccoli once again each thing was seasoned and cooked to perfection. To top things off we had the chocolate mousse cake and the bread pudding. Really all I can say is whoa!!!! I can't wait to go back.

vk6MBStl5qPhAhT1N0MeTQ.text: I had a great experience at this steakhouse during my most recent Vegas trip. A group of work colleagues and I decided we wanted a nice meal after walking Fremont street and this restaurant was recommended. Although it was later in the evening, our party of 8 was quickly seated and drink orders taken. Our waiter (Matt) was attentive and offered many recommendations for starters and house specials.  This is a high end steak house, so expect to pay high end prices - but, the food we had was well worth the cost!  I recommend starting with the crab cake and calamari and then having the filet and a side of the duck fat potatoes (oh so good!).  I deducted 1 star, as one of my colleagues had to send her steak back, as it was too well done (she'd asked for medium-rare). She said her second steak (ribeye) was phenomenal though and now has the nickname "2-Steaks".   If you make it down Fremont Street way, check this spot out.

0zDQ5T4XnW1I7JbpKsxvXA.text: Went with four of my ladies based on excellent reviews, the experience was phenomenal! Very romantic & classy ambiance. Our bartender was Noah & he made us each feel special with his drink making presentation. We could tell he was good at what he does & ensured we were pleased with our drinks. Our server was Luciano & her treated us liked royalty! We were all extremely delighted with our food. I had the salmon stuffed with crab AND gouda!!! Beware the portions are huge!! We all took to go boxes, except my showoff friend LOL! Sides were delicious, especially Potatoes Au Gratin!! My friends liked macaroni, but it was not cheesy enough for me...needed same amount of cheese as Potatoes Au Gratin. If you're in the area, GO! Not an inexpensive place, but worth it for portions and overall experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster &amp; Steak

2JF1KaJeoFkVqFjr1hLe4w.text: Worth the visit to old Vegas if you are staying on the strip. Excellent service. Phenomenal wine selection and of course the food quality is top notch. Dare I say, best steakhouse in Vegas? Bring an appetite. It's located in the Golden Nugget. Worth every penny.

7hjirBFY59HMtJxqhJMFIw.text: THE BEST! Whenever we get a chance to make it downtown we always come here. There's a "dinner for 2" menu online that you can order from. They don't tell you that, there. Look it up. It has the best of their menu items and they have TVs at the bar so we can watch whatever games are on. So delicious! And service is always superb.

7mSB6YD2Ge54oaMLABGoVw.text: I have been to this steak house twice before.  Once when I first moved to Las Vegas over 10 years ago,  and last year with some friends.  The steak was amazing both times, really solidified my belief in Las Vegas being the leader in Great Steak and wine  This night I went to a special dinner where they paired one of my favorite breweries, evil twin with a special tasting menu. We had a cocktail in the bar before dinner started, I had the lavender lemon drop martini, which was outstanding. Our dinner started out with an oyster Grenada accompanied with a wonderful sour beer. Second course was a soft shell crab paired with another sour beer. I'm not a huge fan of sour beers but they paired well together. The third course was by far my favorite of the foods. We had a smoked chicken fried duck breast on top of a Savory waffle with a stout syrup. Dinner on fleek! The main course was a trio of Sliders one of which was ostrich, the second wild boar, the third was bison,  all accompanied by a truffle tater tot.   The dining experience was amazing our server for the meal, Matt , was attentive respectful, knowledgable, and gracious. He really made our night, and I will definitely be back because our dining experience would not have been the same without him. Knowing that he is there full time for Great Steak and wine will make me come back. I can't wait to experience this little slice of old Vegas again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef preparing instant ice cream table side

toJaDpoFxfSguv6XHPbUSA.text: This place is amazing! We were looking for an old school steak house with fantastic food and impeccable service and this place delivered! We ordered the porterhouse for two and enjoyed every bite. The service was flawless and the setting intimate - just what we were looking for to celebrate our wedding anniversary.

2zJC3Huv38eQwth5anvLdQ.text: I haven't written a review on Yelp in YEARS.  Not because I'm lazy or selfish... just nothing has really inspired to commit to giving a public opinion.  That is, until I went to dinner at Vic & Anthonys with my father a few weeks ago.  My father, a True meat and potatoes man, is a hard person to please when it comes to steaks.  He's had some of the best you can imagine, so as you might think, it would be a tall order to find a spot that could meet his lofty expectations.  Well in all honesty, it's actually not too hard to do so in Vegas - being the steakhouse-heavy city that it is, but to do so without breaking the bank, with unmatched service, an inviting ambiance, and excellent food is nearing on the impossible.  But my fellow Yelpers, I am proud to say that Vic and Anthony's has done the impossible.  Their secret online menu is arguably the best priced prix fixe menu in town, everything we consumed was A quality (+steaks cooked to perfection), ambiance was quiet and welcoming, and our server was classy, respectable, and friendly all at the same time.    One Example from the Evening -  So we just received our steaks and had forgotten to order bernaise sauce with them.  I got my waiter's attention and told him we would happily pay for the additional cost.  At which he told me that the kitchen was about to close but the chef was going to whip it up for us for free... awesome.  After about 5 minutes of waiting, he felt bad for making us wait for the bernaise and brought us by two free cocktails, double awesome.  Mind you, we had barely waited 5 minutes and were in no way offended with the wait thus far.  Going the extra mile when you definitely don't have to really sealed the deal on an already excellent meal.  TL;DR - Vic and Anthony's is one of the best steakhouses in Las Vegas.  Fabulous service, excellent food, and amazing price (especially if you use their secret menu... found on their website).

50HhaHzY3TvvJ6ONiad11Q.text: I really enjoyed Vic and Anthony's.  I had scarfed down a ton of prime rib, the other night, I decided to switch it up and go with the pork chop.  This wasn't a terrible idea because the steaks were more expensive  than the pictures of the menu posted on Yelp.  If you go with  steak, expect to pay no less than $50 without any sides.  I was impressed with all the great flavors of the pork chop, but the thing that convinced me to award 5 stars instead of 4 was the lobster bisque.  Hands down, this is the best lobster bisque I have ever had.  If you're on the fence, don't be... It is amazing.    As someone who loves to take pics of my food, I was little bummed that Vic and Anthony's was too dark to get a good shot.  I took 6 pictures and none of them do this meal justice.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome pork chop

cAtlZ6cPz7-6kIuMznuSlg.text: If you are looking for a romantic get away and a steak to melt in your mouth this is the place for you! My boyfriend got the wagyu and it was phenomenal. The buttery garlic of the steak just melted away in your mouth. Made you're everyday filet look like Walmart steaks. I got the smaller portioned lobster 3.5 pounds and it was so tender. It all came cracked and was presented beautifully. The bone marrow was to die for and our waiter was a sweetheart. The only negative I can say was out wagyu carpaccio was a bit overwhelmed by olive oil. Besides that amazing atmosphere and staff!

DxuVs2lBUbSYrhjw77__9w.text: This is my all time favorite classy steakhouse. Steak is always cooked perfectly.  Medium rare with an Australian lobster tail.  All sides are amazing.  Service is APlus.  Very hard to find.  Can't wait to go back.   Go Downtown.  You will be glad you did.

WmAhI3P02Wf1mArpQKPamw.text: Darn, I really wanted to give this restaurant a 5, but just couldn't do it because of the service we received. Our server made us feel we were bothering her the whole night... It was very awkward.  We tried joking a little with her, being very polite, etc. but nothing worked.  It was a real bummer because everything else was amazing.  The restaurant  has an elegant, but intimate feel to it.  Everything we ate (salads, bread, and entrees) and drank was excellent; I had the tuna and my partner had the scallops.  We both agreed that they were the best we ever had.  The next time we're in Vegas we will give the service another chance...but will ask for another server immediately if we get HER again:).  BTW, the restaurant is on Fremont Street inside the Golden Nugget... which seemed a little odd considering the restaurant is top notch!

vCa_VkpjUtPJ-sWN521yXQ.text: We went last night to a birthday celebration. The ambience, service, and food were all outstanding! Will make this a go to restaurant. John made our evening fantastic!!

wuk-jsd2hbS9Sl6IEGK0Qw.text: The best.  I'm never disappointed when I go here.  Ive been with friends and on a date and it was perfect both times.  Try to find better food and service at this price, I dare you.

8lZD6_-PGeelOiNytENgsw.text: Vic and Anthony's is one of the finest steakhouses in the country.  The food is exceptional and the prices are VERY reasonable.  I went with 10 guys and we all ate and drank for around $75 a man with tax and tip.  This was for a bachelor party too, so there were pleant of drinks served with that tab.  My only regret is no gettig the rock lobster tail to split for the table.    Being in the golden nugget reall sets the scene.  The atmosphere inside the restaurant is great as well.  Service was 5 star also.  This is a must do while in Vegas.  Many people forget how fun old town can be and V&A's is worth the trip alone.    Don't miss out on the crab cakes either!  Can't wait to go back.

f0HSsxP5vbY6PoapSpD1ng.text: I think this place is great try the bone in rib eye price is high but you get what you pay for.

5hgWZx0I0dr7ud-w4bNH0A.text: Was there in March with some friends, excellent steak, also had the mac & cheese, that was good too.  My friends had the shrimp, which I was told was also good.  We went out on Freemont Street after and had a great time.

L35Udy-eOKLqrWLK87NSKg.text: This being the first time I'd ever staying in Downtown Vegas, I had low expectations all around.  However, Vic and Anthony's was amazing--a shining beacon in a land of sad, $7.95 steak dinner offers.  As said by others, this place is comparable to any fine dining place on the strip and the prices are very reasonable.  Our waiter (coincidentally named Anthony) was incredibly helpful and friendly.   My boyfriend and I had wedge salads--huge and very good.  The only thing that would have made them better would have been some bacon.  (But honestly, doesn't everything need a little bacon?)  We then split the ribye and crablegs special.  OMG.  Best. steak. EVER.  It was perfectly cooked and amazingly tasty.  Perfectly seasoned, tender, and had a great beefy taste.  No steak I've ever had (Ruth's Chris, Mortons, Mastro's, Houstons...) was this good--and I love my steak.  Plus, the crablegs were huge!  I can't even imagine the size of the crab who lost his legs for my meal--he must have been the Shaq of crabs.  We also had the creamed spinach, which was good, but not great.  It was very cheesy and a bit spicy--in a good way.   Based on the fact that I came for steak and I was rewarded with the best steak I've ever had, I give Vic and Anthony's 5 stars.

f3rX85HUyGaSp-6tlfb13g.text: Filet mignon & lobster tail was wonderful.  I had the beet salad which I loved.  My sister had the Caeser salad which she loved.  Service was great.  Expensive (like most fine dining places) but the whole experience was great.

R5LuAN5U9g-vBpYq2o4Tlg.text: I have lived in Vegas for over 20 years and  this is without a doubt the best steak house in Vegas. The service is unbelievable, the wine list will blow you away, and the food is incredible!  Go eat, drink wine and enjoy.

W_w1rliie7qKedxR-WsZPw.text: Steak was really really good, I had a hard time finishing the rib eye, probably because we had 3 bottles of red between the 3 us plus a few cognacs.  I rarely ever venture to downtown vegas when I'm in town but its worth going if you end up down there for some reason.

3xpjY5I91ZjY8lTmStE6Gw.text: We had our rehearsal dinner here the Friday night before our wedding for 16 people and it was absolutely fabulous.  We went with their silver menu and I cannot express how delicious everything was.  I was so full from the jumbo crabcakes and shrimp cocktail appetizers that I could barely eat my perfectly cooked filet mignon or the au gratin potatoes.  Also, the slice of cheesecake they put in front of me I thought was to share with my fiance, but then they put another slice in front of him.  I mean they were absolutely huge and the seasonal sorbet was delicious as well, ours was strawberry.  I know that everyone at the dinner fully enjoyed all the food since we took all the leftovers back to the hotel and every piece of leftover was eaten by the time we left the following Monday.  The servers were great as well with drinks, as soon as you started getting low, they would be asking you if you wanted a refill.  This was the perfect place for a smaller, intimate group dinner and hanging around Old Town the night before was amazing.  I will highly recommend Vic & Anthony's to everyone having their special day in Las Vegas.

IEMHoxwGTlgivTGP2vq20g.text: I have to admit i was treated to dinner here. We had high rollers that took care of the tab. Anyway it was great had appts,soup,steak/lobster and dessert. needless to say it was delicious. The maine lobster was crazy.  The steak was great.  The server was good, and very helpful.  Loved it i like the bread pudding, girlfriend liked the choclate.  Great fun.

rKdFgDxLcGqP2qosGrfUQg.text: I had high hopes for Vic & Anthony's. The food was pretty good but nothing amazing or special in any way. The service was great, our waiter was very friendly, attentive, and helpful. Maybe I just had too high of expectations, but I've been to a better steak house in Reno. I'm not saying it was bad, but just not great. I ordered the Prime Strip and it was cooked exactly how I ordered it, but I wasn't too impressed. My husband ordered the veal which was pounded very thin and breaded, it seemed there was more bread to meat ratio. I also ordered the onion strings on the side, which came out as a huge mound on a plate (not very appealing) and they were mediocre, no better than you would get at a fast food joint. Luckily the desserts were delicious. I ordered the pecan crusted ice cream with caramel sauce, it was amazing. I can't remember the dessert he ordered but it was so good he was tempted to order another. So overall I think it was worth 4 stars. I don't think I would go back during future trips to Vegas, I'd like to try somewhere else.

3ctfs7iLW44pQ7JxYXQDuA.text: I visited this place on the recommendation of a colleague.  I dined alone at the bar and everything was excellent.  My only suggestion for improvement is to expand the wine list.  The service was impeccable.  The meal perfect!

TL2FZO0NOxwtx155hmnXtA.text: A friend gave my husband and me a gift card for the Vic and Anthony's at the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas.  We do not drink alcohol, and the waiter (Ben) seemed to take it as a personal offense when we declined to see the wine list.  My husband does not eat red meat, so he inquired about the chicken.  Even more offended, our waiter proceeded to tell us that "it's cooked in a pan" and literally just stared at us.  Finally, he said "We're known for being a steak house." I think I saw him roll his eyes, but it was kind of dark in there.  I even chuckled to myself when he mentioned the high priced lobsters that he is sure we noticed in the tank on the way in.  What made that statement funny was the fact that I did look at the tank as we walked by, and it was completely empty!!  Our waiter was so rude that we basically couldn't wait to get out of there.  Needless to say, he treated us with absolute contempt when we declined the dessert menu and the after dinner cocktails.  When my husband put the gift card and additional cash in the bill binder, the waiter actually said "I presume this is a gift card of some sort?" then scampered off to verify it before we left as though we were some losers who planned to "dine and dash".  Although our meals tasted really good, it was a horrible experience.

uBnDjBdho4fNzOinY1uR2Q.text: The best steaks expensive but worth it  very large portions that can be shared we have tried many prime steak houses in town this rates with cut and envy

ka4adn8Z9v44YX5SkI8cSQ.text: Ok. the bottom line is i ate the BEST steak that i have ever eaten in my life at this place. I was familiar with all the stellar reviews and decided to venture to Freemont to check out Viv and Anthony's. I am a huge foodie and use yelp and trip advisor to help guide me in selecting top rated establishments. I was in the mood for a steak that rivaled my previously favorote steakhouse in Vegas: Mandalay Bay's Strip steak. I was a bit skeptical that Vic's could equal the cut i had at Strip Steak. Man was i wrong. Big time! First off, i don't mind splurging for a pricey steak every once in a while as long as it is worth it. Even though i really liked Strip steak a lot, i was simply not impressed with the 18 oz size. I know for most people this is plenty big. But if i'm paying a premium i expect at least 20, preferably 22 or 24 ounces for a 65 dollar steak. Vic's bone in ribeye clocks in at either 22 or 24, and let me tell you: when i first saw it the first thing i thought to myself is " it's a good thing i'm pretty hungry." The server brought it out and warned me to be careful because the plate was piping hot. He then told me to cut into it to make sure it was medium rare as i requested. I did so and it could not have been cooked more perfectly despite it's size. i took the first bite and the flavors burst through like no other steak i had ever tasted. The damn thing was so juicy that i had a little puddle that formed in the botton of the plate that allowed me to simply enjoy at as a de facto steak sauce. I cut the steak into multiple bite size pieces and completely destroyed every bite. The most amazing thing i noticed was that each bite was just like the first. It was as if my palate was cleansed after  every bite. The ladies sitting at the bar next to me were in awe that i devoured the sizeable cut in such short order. I told them that i simply couldn't help it. The damn thing was just that incredible. Needless to say Strip Steak is a thing of the past for me. THIS place is where i will eat steak exclusively in Vegas from here on out. Keep in mind how incredibly difficult it is to garner 4 1/2 stars on yelp after 200 plus reviews. This place has earned every bit of the hype. The atmosphere is intimate and has that old vegas vibe. I went on a Saturday night and there was a line, so i sat at the bar. I knew when i saw the crowd that the place must be something special. And it most certainly was. My meal consisted of oysters rockefeller that were pretty good. A bit too much spinach and parmesan, but the oysters were big and very tasty and their flavor wasn't at all overpowered by the toppings. Unlike most places. Next time i'll simply request a little less of both. I ate my steak a la carte because i knew it was huge and i didn't even want a salad to go with it. The 65 dollar cut i had is known as the chef's cut and believe me: It was worth every single penny!

5XPPEjr8ifvNE4duRpQ5yg.text: WOW.  Yum.  Perfection.  Came here for my friend's wedding dinner in July...now, I wasn't expecting much...but everything was so delicious, I think that even the water was perfect!! hahahahah! !  The waitstaff was friendly and professional.  My favorite looked like Doc from Back to the Future; he even did a voice impression for me!  Everyone, EVERY single one of us was perfectly content with our meal:  from the calamari and tomato/mozarella (?) appetizers to the Salmon, chicken and Filet Mignon.  Before you leave Vegas, take your hungry butt here.

F33xY3t3DHb1L8muZF7BZA.text: We ate here when we visited Las Vegas.  The atmosphere was very classy and relaxed.  We started off with amazing salads and fresh bread.  We also had cocktails, that were great.  But what was really amazing was the steak and chicken.  Everything just melted in your mouth.  But if you eat here you absolutely have to have the creme brulee.  It is served on a plate instead of a dish.  The best meal we have ever had by leaps and bounds.  If we go back to Vegas, we will be stopping back here.

37fQxnsPlVmkS8kXlHufhw.text: My wife and I ate there to celebrate her birthday, although a little early. Stopped by around 2PM to make a reservation and the girl seemed to be bothered by the request. The first thing that put me off was the fact that most people were wearing jeans and t-shirts, a few had shorts. When I am spending $300 on a special occasion I like to dress up a little, if I wanted to sit next to loud and drunk people in jeans and sneakers I could have saved over $200. Service was very good but not perfect, plates stayed on our table for 10 minutes after we were done. Filet mignon was the best I ever had while the rib-eye was ok, lots of fat and one side was very tough. Both meat dishes were done as we ordered. Quail appetizer was sublime, I would like to see them try this with duck or pheasant. Asparagus side was very good while the scalloped potatoes were very very rich, enough for 4 people. Creme brulee was good but on a saucer plate and only 1/2 deep. Espresso was the worst I have ever had, looked it was a cafe latte as it was not black. Waiter took it off the bill and said it was a little lite? We will go back for the filets and the quail.

S_ejl1LpNDkuqkL_F5oN4Q.text: Great spot for a Prime Ribeye. The service rocks as does the food time after time. I had a bunch of ladies from the Bay Area in town and so being the Big Baller I am I took them here for dinner. We started with Dom and oysters (can't ever go wrong with Dom and oysters) the n on to the stuffed quail and a cheese plate for apps. Now mind you we were a bit intox. so we were probably high maintenance but the staff took very good care of us. Our drinks whether it be cocktails, water or wine were never empty and every time someone got up to go to the bathroom (which was frequent as we were partayin a little especially towards the end of the meal) our napkin was collected and folded neatly and left in its place. We all ordered steaks and a few of us split a 3 lb. lobster. Everything was fuckin incredible. We ended up drinking a couple of bottles of Quintessa as well as some Silver Oak. The service and the meal really flowed well. We were never waiting for the next thing. One of the best meals I've had in Vegas. I highly recommend it.

KM1d9dl0fZ90IzKGFuPdgA.text: good restaurant with very good food and very  good service i would like to eat here again i think it's one of the better Steakhouses in las vegas it's expensive but it's worth it.

L4MUMllTqHECOst0M12hNA.text: If this place's prices were 20% less, I would give it 3 or possibly 4 stars.  This review is probably a 2.5, not fully a 2, but I can't go to a 3.  Don't get me wrong, it was a good, but not great meal.  The problem is that it's priced like it's Delmonico, Cut or Carnevino.  And, it ain't those places.  My wife had the special, which was crab stuffed lobster.  The lobster had a strong fishy odor, which indicated to us the lobster was not totally fresh.  Perhaps this was why it was used for the stuffed lobster rather than being steamed and served whole.  She had the filet, which was fine, but not overwhelming and certainly not worth the cost.  I had the ribeye, which again was fine.  Certainly better than your neighborhood Outback, but not worth anywhere near what they charged.    Service was adequate.  The wine list was average I would say, probably decent for downtown.  If you plan on spending this much on a meal, I would recommend Prime, Brand, etc.....

BJ4_iHce0HbYYLWRLGQ30Q.text: Snuck in here at the closing bell and was treated to an an amazing filet mignon and lobster dinner.  The filet was prepared to perfection and the lobster was as good as it gets - almost sweet.  Bartender was heavy handed.  Jay, my waiter, was top notch. The creme brulee was very good as well.  5 star meal and 10 star service.  Definitely the spot I would frequent if I was a local, and I'll return the next time I'm in town.

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stiff drinks :)

BPLd7AMrEKdDwNSrd4o25Q.text: This place is fine dining at its best. Attentive service and delicious food. This hidden gem located inside the Golden Nugget was a refreshing change in decor, ambiance, and service. Both the veal and filet were cooked to perfection and practically melted in your mouth. I loved the au gratin potatoes - I would come back for the potatoes alone. The strawberry basil martini was a little strong but I enjoyed the flavor. I would highly recommend this classic steakhouse.

FBUIw6igVXiB8pozk9GNpQ.text: What can I say this place is good. You must get the crab cake!!!!! It is very delicious along with the steaks.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Most delicious crab cake I have ever had!!!!!

6uGvJxRfrnzIPlCHoI6G4g.text: This will be our 4th time here!  Going tonight. Love the food and the service. . We go no where else to have a steak. It's all about the sides and drinks are amazing. Jay our server was fabulous. We had he perfect table in the back. Thank you Vic and Anthony's for a great celebrations.

fm_RT6DyRsAWeqh7Xwxe6g.text: One of the best Steak house in Vegas and that's in the good old Golden Nugget casino / hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good

3YTqs8H-gswOYiyCQBYw0Q.text: I really enjoyed Vic & Anthony's.  This was actually my first time walking through the Golden Nugget after the renovations and it was great to have had a dose of Fremont after spending so much time in the past few years on the Strip.  Alas I digress!!   Okay... so, you come to Vic & Anthony's for the fine dining, great steaks and dark atmosphere that really gives it that nice touch of "Oooh, fancy-smancy!"  V&A delivers on all fronts, walking in across the selection of cuts and lobster aquarium, through the dark corridors and to a nicely spaced dining area you really get a sense that you are in for a treat.   The service is wonderful, our server was very accommodating and attentive.  Our food came out fast and drinks were consistently filled to the brim.  Absolutely NO complaints here, I would say the service is some of the best I've received in all of Vegas.  FANTASTIC!  The meat (the important part right?) is great but not pinnacle of all steak houses in my opinion.  I ordered the rib eye ($55) and had a taste of the bone in cut that clocked in at about $69 dollars that night for a 21oz cut (Market Price).  I enjoyed the marbled taste of both ribeye but the flavoring was a bit peppery in some areas as the seasoning did not appear to have been spread across the entire cut as well as I had hoped.  I had a chance to sample the filet mignon as well and that was great, but again not something that I immediately fell in love with.   Overall a very fine experience and I will definitely be back, however when it comes to my FAVORITE steakhouses I'd have to still say Ruth's Chris and Craftsteak are still my favorites.    Definitely worth the try for EVERYTHING as an overall package.  Thank you Vic & Anthony's :)

CUoiXfi9ewFc5kblBMvZiw.text: The atmosphere was excellent. Our waiter was very helpful although he did say something inappropriate or maybe it was a skit, I don't know. That my fiance must have a twin or it was him in the night before but with another woman. I thought it was funny, my fiance on the other hand DID NOT. I ordered the NY strip steak with the blue cheese bacon butter sauce. Mine literally tasted like what I cook at home. Not pleased at all. My fiance ordered the special of filet m. steak, mashed potatoes and lobster tail. He is a harsh critic when it comes to food. He was very satisfied with his meal. Although he did not enjoy the sauce on the lobster tail. Also, I tried a bite of the lobster tail per fiances request with the sauce (I dislike seafood) and not only was it good, it was phenomenal. I was very surprised.

bEYQ-8DgM8LlN4oWiy5y0w.text: A Las Vegas Staple. Great Drinks, Great Food, Great Atmosphere, Great Crowd.

lMjiAffGCCwPHtplITbAbg.text: Thank you for the most beautiful evening heather was the best server the food was A little busy but absolutely wonderful service all the way around

2ZwSnzT9D0EkVZukfOLO2A.text: This is average at best, service was excellent, but not impressed beyond that.  Wine was overpriced and oversold, and I consider myself a wine junkie and am glad to pay the restaurant markup.  Had to send my Filet back because it was over cooked and the flavors of the accompanying sides was just average.  To their credit the Oysters Rockefeller was one of the best orders I've ever had.  My recommendation is to walk across the street to Hugo's Cellar, just my honest opinion.

zyNmXNRN3_YMZPTd7cmsDA.text: Wow! The whole experience was absolute perfection. The crab cakes are the very best. Luciano was our waiter and I have never had better service. Enjoy!

5uA9XkcW6Pa6npJ6rphrJA.text: Terrible service from Jay! We went here for my cousins 21st birthday. It was a family dinner, there were 12 of us, including my 19month old twins! We were seated, it is a nice place like any other nice steak houses in Vegas. When the waiter, Jay, came over to take our order, I felt he was very rude!! He acted very impatient with us, as if we couldn't order fast enough. When I would try to ask him a question, I felt he ignored me! He pretended he could not hear me. This happened quite a few times. They also didn't leave he right number of water glasses on the table so when we let him know, he made my mom feel as if she was bothering him!! It was terrible!!!   Then dinner came out... And the steak was actually pretty good!! They were cooked just the way we ordered, which I have found a rarity in the steakhouses around Vegas! The salt they sprinkled on top really made the difference!! The creamed corn was delicious! Kids loved it! Mashed potatoes were not good, over whipped and you could taste it was really gummy. My mom ordered the plain 3 oz lobster... But our waiter Jay brought out the stuffed lobster. Well my mom thought it was what she ordered and we didn't know until we reviewed the bill later in the night... But Instead of her $30 lobster she ordered, He wrote down the wrong thing (feeling as if it was an intentional mistake) and charged her $80!!! So watch out!! Clarify your order because they can be sneaky!!!!   And RIGHT after dinner came the bill!!!! Not once did Jay ask if we wanted coffee or dessert!!!! We had two tables side by side to fit us all, well the other table got coffee, he didn't even ask our side!!!! Who does that????? Very rude!!   I truly feel our waiter Jay did not want to "deal" with any of the women at the table, he just wanted to talk to the men!!  He was the one who brought the credit card back to the table for us to sign... He handed it to my dad (it was my card), so I told him "I'LL TAKE IT!" Loud enough to make sure he heard me!!! He then handed it to me and said "this card?" I said "ITS MINE!" And once he knew I was paying, he was all smiles and thank yous! "Thanks for coming have a great evening blah blah blah!" Unfortunately the tip was included since we had such a large party. He was lucky it was!  Not sure if I would go back there because of JAY! For $400+ I expect MUCH better, more respectful service!!!!!!   The gentleman who bussed our table, Richard or Ricardo (I can't remember his name!) he was amazing!!!!!!! I wish he was our waiter!!! So attentive, very polite! He acknowledged my kids!!! Made sure no hot plates were in front of them!! Where as Mr Jay put a giant steak knife right in front of my son! Hello!!!! Moron!    Hope the steakhouse smartens up and hires more appropriate staff!

pd8Wa0amFIe1hz-Hn8UnAw.text: The ambience and service are top notch. The server was very attentive and provided great suggestions. They offer Kobe steak and Australian lobster tails both for over $175 and $130 respectively. The lamb, steaks, and fish were very tasty and worthy of a top rated steakhouse. The sides were good but nothing spectacular. The creme brulee was the best I have ever tasted.

wsXZbCke4eaZRCK3iiYwRw.text: This was one of the best dining experiences my wife and I have ever had.  This is very much a "class operation".  Service was excellent with waiters/waitresses assisted by servers and bus staff seamlessly and quickly. My wife and I both had the Filet with shared Potatoes-au-gratin.   B0th were exceptional.  I had the crab Oscar topping, which only added to the taste treat. They only small downside was the noise level in the dining area was a bit louder than we expected. But, overall a 5 star experience.

gG5Q_Lac0w69s1WN3_Bvvw.text: Was here with family and friends on sunday Sept 14 With a party of 10. Was seated in a private room and the service was impeccable. Our server Victor was perfect and I like that they served our lady's first when dinner came out.  The manager Deandre was very polite and professional.   Food is delicious and we will definitely be back. Thank you for this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Stuffed Salmon dish was delicious!!!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and lobster special was to die for!!!

yj3zJ3_fyGzd1BaRENIzEw.text: This place is the real deal! Fine dining with an Old Vegas feel. From sublime Martinis with blue cheese olives, incredible oysters Rockefeller, the food is great. But it was the service that set this establishment apart from the rest. Our server Hector must have been telepathic because he and his team anticipated our group of 8s every need, down to calling for and escorting us to waiting cabs.  And i can't forget to mention Noah the Bartender, the alchemist behind those Martinis with ice crystals. He set the tone for the friendly atmosphere and was part showman as he prepared our "poison".  There was Sinatra crooning in the background and a fine dark wood paneled ambiance. Not to be missed downtown. Take a chance and leave the Strip. You won't be sorry. Best recent meal in a flurry of fine dining.  They also handled a special order birthday cake with aplomb for one of our party.

UweR57hNvOvSlcX0gYP0cQ.text: One of the best steakhouses.  This place is excellent with the old Vegas feel.  The food was excellent.  Service was great which I tried the waiter's recommendation of the pear martini to start the night off.  I will definitely go again next time I'm in Vegas.  I tried this place based on all the Yelp reviews.  Thank you all for posting such wonderful reviews and pictures.  My bf and I ate so much.  We started off with baked and fresh oysters.  The most tender cut of filet mignon I have ever had, along with the lobster tailed, served with mashed potatoes.  And for desert..... YUMMMM, the bread pudding.  This dinner was worth the price!

L7nAWggpfF33cVhYLw0v3Q.text: Noah the bartender is simply amazing! Words cannot describe how much of an asset he is to Vic and Anthony's. 3lb lobster was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had the ribeye and lobster and shared. It was plenty of food. And look at that giant asparagus!!!!

hr0c4cxZYryNPsxw2ASDpA.text: I loved everything about this place. I'll try and describe why...  Ok, you know the pictures of your grandparents taken in a Vegas roundbooth in the 60's? It could have been here. The atmosphere was old school, the staff super professional and the overall vibe unpretentious and classy without being stuffy.  We ordered the heirloom salad which was the only thing we didn't love. We thought the vinaigrette was a little off - kind of tasted like creamy Italian or something. Not our favorite but I still wanted to give it 5 stars because I think that small shortcoming was trumped by a really impressive overall experience. We also had a couple of amazing Moscow Mules and for our entree we had filets, which were perfect, and delicious along with a baked potato - which was huge and more than enough for two, and asparagus. The cherry on top came in the form of a traditional and HUGE piece of NY style cheesecake with strawberry sauce. It was so big we had to take half to go. Our total check for dinner and 4 cocktails was $200 and worth every penny!  We are still talking about this place days later - always a good sign - and will be back asap!

Nu7M_DiU-LPRN_XsljKwVA.text: This is why I rarely trust reviews. I posted an honest review and it was taken down. My fiancee and I just ate there Sunday night. Our waiter Jay was very vague and made no menu suggestions but of course people stereotype their table. He was energetic and talkative to his other tables. I ordered filet mignon...it was very bland. We usually go to Ruth Chris in Vegas... much better dining experience for what you pay. I ordered a bake potato and a side of broccoli. They didn't even cut the broccoli up. The potato was nothing special. I've had better potatoes at chains like Outback. This was just ridiculous overall. Perhaps we ordered the wrong thing but when you get a nonchalant waiter, it affects your dining experience overall.

xU1QYCwGdPYwoPHxxYm6fg.text: I would have given Vic & Anthony's a 4 star rating however the service was very slow for an upper scale establishment, we expected a better service experience. We were a party of 5, Reservations made, seated promptly, waited 15 minutes to be acknowledged by the wait staff. Little things regarding the service were noticed such as unfilled water glasses and the lack of removing dirty dishes (the empty appetizer dishes were still on the table when the main course arrived) plus the cocktail service was painstakingly slow. I felt the waiter had too many tables and not enough time. From start to finish our meal was 3 hours...not hateful but to us was a bit long.....  In summary the food was excellent as expected, the service was lacking enough to detract from the dining experience. I would personally recommend Delmonico's Steak House at the Venetian for the better overall experience at this dining level.

nb39Hxky6z-ezks0JzyY-g.text: It was amazing. I had the salmon and it was perfect it melted in my mouth.  The service was also amazing which was a bonus.   Nobody complained about their food  The only thing we send back was a mixed drink. I do not recall the name but everything else was amazing including the wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

viAaU0rk3JVHUQ2IgpUjdQ.text: I visited Vic & Anthony's this Saturday and had a great experience! Everyone was friendly and we were sat immediately, as we arrived right on time for our reservations. The ambiance and music gave a very old school speak easy vibe, which I loved. It was a tiny bit too dark inside which can make it difficult to read the menu. I saw various people using the light in their cell phone to view it. The service was fantastic and the food was tasty. I had the ribeye steak which was cooked to perfection. I also had the au gratin potatoes which were also amazing! The only part of the meal I wasn't impressed with was the spinach. It would of been good had it not been drenched in salt. It was pretty much inedible due to the amount of salt. Regardless, I think that could of absolutely been a one off situation and it wouldn't keep me from visiting again. They had a large menu and there's so much I'd still like to try. Check this place out, you won't regret it! Highly recommend!!

9x8fuaXrsAd8OgJxSygHjg.text: As you enter the steakhouse it is very dark. Seating is cozy and service good. We ordered the special 3 course menu for $52 each. We also ordered the crab cake and wine. The food is well seasoned and tasty.  The dessert was too sweet for our taste. Final bill was $200+ which is average for a steakhouse in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5PShHm1v94Tv5GpDQMQuPQ.text: I have eaten at many different steakhouses in Vegas and generally walk away very satisfied. My wife and I ate here 3/9/19 and it was just okay. The service was excellent, but I felt like the food was lacking. We started with oysters on the half shell and they were tiny. Each was probably the size of a dime. Both of us decided to order the special which was an 8 oz filet, 5 oz lobster tail, green beans and fingerling potatoes. My main disappointment was in temperature. Everything on the plate was lukewarm at best. Steak was topped with chopped garlic, not garlic butter as advertised. Finished it off with cheesecake which was good. The entire meal was $250+ and left me feeling unsatisfied. Doubt I will be back with so many better options.

thjd4nHuvMXKTpBbeepuUg.text: Four of us went for dinner on November 24th and we each ordered a filet mignon steak with a couple of sides to share. The steaks were so tender and perfectly seasoned. Sure, they are pricey ($42 each plus $14 for the "Oscar" style) but pretty much all food in Vegas is expensive. You'll likely forget your $25 breakfast, but you'll definitely remember the steak at Vic & Anthony's.   We ordered some wine and other drinks with our meals, and had creme brulee for dessert. It was a bit of an odd presentation, served on a plate instead of a bowl, but that allowed for maximum bruleed surface area lol. It's a good thing we were sharing - that's way too much sugar for one person. I prefer a deeper dish, but that's a personal preference. Still had a great flavour and texture. Excellent service, great food - overall a wonderful evening with great people.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème brûlée for dessert
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus and puréed potatoes for sides
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon - Oscar style

xdTeruSCn_JmavxK07Ujww.text: I see most of the reviews gave 4 or 5 stars, but I just can't. First off,I know most steakhouses try to set the mood with candles and all...I get that, but damn it was dark! We had to turn on the flashlight on my phone just to see the menu (had 2 other tables doing the same) this place was a little too dark. My wife had the filet mignon, which was so-so. My father-in law had the filet mignon with lobster tail, he said it wasn't bad. My son had the salmon, which he said had a weird tasting seasoning on it, he didn't like it. And I had the prime ribeye cooked medium, but when it came it was more like well done...dry, hard. I didn't return it because I felt it was rude, so I just settled for it and pretended it was good when the waiter asked. Also, everything is ala-carte, nothing comes as a meal...you know with soup or salad, potato or rice, etc. So the bill keeps getting higher and higher just to get a side dish. The baked potato was huge though, the waiter joked around and said that was only half of the potato and he's bringing the other half...haha. so they highlight the potato being so big, so what. The place is WAY over priced. I don't mind the prices, it's the whole package I didn't like

EE-Ok6lsRGw2l8wygnJDsg.text: I don't think I can add comments that are any different than the reviews I've read.  This place is really fantastic in every way.    Appetizers - tuna poke and crab cakes had excellent flavor.  Tuna was so wonderfully light and healthy.  Crab cakes were True chunks of crab.  We were in heaven.   We all had filets that were perfectly done. Au gratin potatoes and broccoli were very good (yes even the vegetable was not bland). We finished our meal with the Elvis dessert (ok) and the mint chocolate pie (I have the name wrong but it's the first time on the dessert menu; it was like eating a Thin Mint cookie - yummy!)  Our server was very good.  I'm so sorry I don't remember her name, but she was great (I believe she is from Hungaria).    Great place.  We will definitely be back!

22cHx3HXhzI0715-rAu9qQ.text: Service Issue: Be careful when the waitress/waiter says they can "just" up something, to make your meal more appetizing.  Waitress: You don't see anything that you like Me: Well not really. I'm sure it's all good, but undecided Waitress: (Comes back)You still don't see anything Me: Not really Waitress: What are you thinking about eating Me: Surf and Turf Waitress: I can just up the turf a little Me: What do you mean Waitress: Just add a little more seafood....(then the food comes) Me: That looks like a whole extra lobster, is that what you call upping it Waitress: Yes, it will just be a LITTLE more Me: Are you sure? I thought you were talking about a seafood bisque or something for a topping Waitress: Just a LITTLE up charge (mind you after the food came out)How about of course like I thought, that changed the entire meal and charged double the price... O-O I knew better, but she was very clear on "just a little more"...disappointing when I clearly asked what do you mean...She should've asked do I want a whole lobster tail & been straight forward on the meal pricing change...

sX8H-qOLJwHQyV5ZnUFJ6A.text: Just to keep things fair, the manager called me just a few days ago and left a msg., wanting to know a little more about my experience at their restaurant, genuinely seemed concerned and welcomed me to visit again, so they could do their best to make a better visit for me and I appreciate it very much, but it will not be until at least next Nov., that I will plan another trip to Vegas and I always try to choose a different location for my big night out for dining, but thank you all the same!

DHt43Sy3cFKT3WoSuOWWNA.text: First, let me start by saying I don't give 5 stars easily, and this place deserved every single one. Vic & Anthony's delivered the perfect atmosphere, exceptional service, and  an incredible culinary experience. The atmosphere is very dim and perfect for a romantic night. Victor was our server and he delivered flawless service. I've been in food and beverage for 9 years and have worked at some of the top steakhouses and restaurants on the strip and I was very impressed by him. If I had my own restaurant, I would want him on my team- My compliments to the restaurant for finding him! He was extremely knowledgable on the wine list, recommending the perfect wine pairings for our meal and even brought tastings to ensure we would be happy with our choice. Now for the food:  To start we got the infamous crab cake (I don't even like crab) and every bite was delicious. You have to try this!!   Pear & saga salad- I was skeptical about ordering but I'm so glad victor recommended it. The BEST salad I have ever had. Everything about this salad flowed and it was perfectly proportioned. I could go on and on but do yourself the favor and get this!  For entrees I got the 8 oz filet with a side of peppercorn (loved the peppercorn but the steak was cooked so nicely and was full of flavor so it didn't even need it) and my date got the American Kobe filet special that came with lobster. Also got a side of macaroni & cheese which was good but very rich (what Mac & cheese isn't?)  For dessert- OMG CROISSANT BREAD PUDDING. To die for. I was already in a food coma from the appetizers and main course but this was so amazing I finished it. Thank you chef!  All in all, out of all the restaurants I've tried, this is definitely one of the best culinary experiences I've had. I underestimated it, being located in the Golden Nugget and all, but wow- I was mistaken. Definitely don't come here unless you've got the money to spend. Our bill was $240 for 2 people but worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm 8 oz filet mignon
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The infamous crab cake
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This bread pudding is unreal

DHlNhj43NyQZx6PvMaHblQ.text: Wow!  I came here for dinner last weekend for a friend's bachelor party and was absolutely impressed!  Victor, our server, was fantastic throughout the entire night.  He thoroughly explained the specials for the night including the prices, and made some great recommendations for us.    I went with the 16oz Prime Rib Eye where as most of my friends went with the 21oz Prime Bone-In Rib Eye.  I also tried a piece of the Filet Mignon.  Filet was absolutely melt in your mouth and the Rib Eye was full of delicious flavor.    Lobster mac n cheese was amazing as well with huge chunks of lobster and cheesy goodness.    Victor also recommended the Croissant Bread Pudding for dessert which was pretty good but the Key Lime Pie was fantastic!
