All 6 of us were completely satisfied and thoroughly enjoyed our meal/experience at Vic & Anthonys!

oDMG8JCTXeY49ZV_sjtYqA.text: I wanted to like this place, but there were several things that kept it from getting 5 stars.  1. The restaurant is DARK. You'll notice many of the photos are either filtered or have flash.   2. Our party ordered a steak medium, but it came out rare. I even had to toss some bits out that looked absolutely raw. The other filet mignon was ordered medium rare and came out perfect.  3. There's a television+bar that the entire table area can see. I'm usually a fan of TV to watch a game, but not at a steakhouse. It was distracting, especially at the darker venue.  Beyond those things however, the service was great, the sides were good and plentiful, and the cheesecake was huge and delicious.

WG7hTxs1er6V1e-lCiwYpQ.text: Usually good, tonight my steak was comparable to a badly cooked McDonald's burger patty. Waiter was distracted by another table, so the service was terrible too. I eat here every time I come to Vegas, but will look at other steakhouses when I return. Guess they have lost their touch.

a2tBbcietmFUklJBKMR_DQ.text: Lots of great reviews here. I have to agree.  The steaks, lobster bisque, and creamed spinach we're fabilous, and our server, Luciano. Made it a perfect dinner. Thanks to all who made this such a good experience.

KUZVYSzkeL7jrLoXvaKOXg.text: Overall 2.5 stars  Decor: 3/5 -very dim -seating for seven was a bit cramped at a round table  Service: 4/5 -overall good. Drinks were refilled and food came out in timely matter.   Food: 2/5 -surprised I was disappointed and let down based off the stellar reviews and ratings -I ordered the 22oz bone in ribeye cooked medium rare to share -The ribeye was not as flavorful, tender or juicy compared to a similarly priced ribeye at Nick and Sams. Also there were burnt parts of the ribeye that surprised me -the party I was with were not impressed either and the consensus was we have had better -Vancouver oysters were my favorite part of the night. Meaty, creamy and briney at about $2.5 each.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Ribeye

0bbB6jfFIwLl6aQKOymkLw.text: I'm so lucky that I was invited here for a work event and got to try just about every appetizer. All amazing! We recently took our 22 year old son for a special dinner for his graduation.  We ordered the seafood tower, it was great! Rock lobster, king crab, shrimp, oysters and the (in my Oprah voice) the seafood martini! It's very pricy (175ish) but worth every penny.  I noticed they had a "Distinctive Dining Deal" it's a 3 course meal that's under $55ish per person, and great selections. Must try, I suggest dress up a little, but I did see people in shorts. Nice place to celebrate a special occasion!

3nwQuKvpa6q1RYkkvKEZtA.text: Having eaten in their Atlantic City Location and given it top reviews, we very much looked forward to our dining experience here in Vegas our here on our annual Golf trip with 8 Hard core restaurant Gentlemen who are very much a difficult bunch to please.  So we roll downtown into old Las Vegas where we normally dine next door at Hugo's Cellar but thought we would give this place a try.   Arrive to bustling place heart in the Golden Nugget where our party of 8 is seated immediately at a nice round table.  Service is brisk where OK bread is provided as we peruse a fairly overpriced wine list and a similar menu as its NJ counterpart.   Everything is Ala Carte and pricey as a top steakhouse is but if they deliver you don't mind   After selecting some wine we are off to the races.   Wedge Salads with Blue Cheese "Homemade" dressing is truly outstanding with a rich Roquefort cheese chunked in.    The Shrimp Cocktail were large fresh and cold but the cocktail sauce in short was extremely disappointing.   Cesar salads were OK nothing special.   Entrees:   Veal Chops Absolute perfection, grilled and charred to proper temperature and as tasty as they come.   The Rib Eye's were in short OK but not as good as the Veal Chops.   I'm not a filet Mignon person and this large piece of prime beef did nothing to change my mind as it simply has no flavor. This is a personal preference.   The NY Strip was top notch.   Sides were good but not great as baked potato was a disappointment while the mushrooms were excellent as was the creamed corn.   Service was 100% outstanding all night.   All and all a bit pricey, gratuity of 20% already added on so no problem there, but I've had better steakhouse experiences for the price points, and I certainly think they A.C. Please is much better.   Good but not great is the only way to describe the experience.

g9BqvSKERegt4KO68EYygQ.text: This steakhouse was absolutely fantastic. Everything about it was top notch. First the ambience was romantic and super classy. The service from our waiter Mario and the service staff was also the best. They were very attentive, courteous, and patient. The food was on another level. Well worth the money. My husband and I got the filet mignon cooked perfectly medium rare. I got the port peppercorn sauce which was so tasty. The sides were so freaks and delicious and HUGE! Easily could be share 3-4 ways. We got the broccoli, potatoes au gratin, and the creamed spinach. We were so full by the end of our meal and wish we could have eaten it all. We got desserts to go which we will be enjoying later. An exceptional experience and we will definitely be back.

tb-digcU1V55kiVwHAO1tg.text: Fabulous dinner!  Excellent service.  Lovely old school steak house ambiance.  We had a reservation, so waited only about 4 minutes for our table.  Both had steak, shared a baked potato and asparagus - delish!  Will definitely dine here again on my next Vegas visit.

rwRotYNxc5-N9WUCX7Upug.text: I still dream about the bone in ribeye I had here.  Best creamed spinach ever (Peter Luger's being #2).  We went on a pretty slow Thurs night so our waiter was cool enough to bring us several samples of the huge wine list they have there at no charge.  I imagine very few places are better than this downtown.  You can't go wrong with this place!!

XWci2PN6rGQ41XRgYiW9gQ.text: Thursday night dinner. We had a 4 lb lobster, bone in rib eye and boneless rib eye, baked potatoes, scalloped potatoes, and mac & cheese. Everything was amazing. The mac & cheese and the baked potatoes were the best I have ever had. Steaks were cooked perfectly. Lobster was delicious. The wait staff was very attentive. I would dine here over any other steak house in Vegas, it was that good. May have been the best dinner I've ever had.

Z8Bi1oPBeiq-NUNT5ptERw.text: Vic & Anthony's is located in the Golden Nugget in downtown  Las Vegas.  Who would have known there is such a great steakhouse in dt las vegas!  Make reservations because this place gets packed.   Jumbo lump crab cake: the best crab cake I've had outside of Maryland.  They are not lying when they say jumbo lump and they are not stingy with it.  Barely any breadcrumbs which is what crab cake should be like.   Broiled portabello mushroom: great especially with a piece of mozzarella cheese.  Iceberg wedge salad and Caesar salad: standard salads nothing out of the ordinary.  Lobster bisque: yummy!  There is a strong  taste of cognac.  Sea bass a la nage: the best fish dish I have ever had.  This is how all fish should taste.  It was heavenly and not only that they sprinkle it with jumbo lump crab!  Prime ribeye: cooked to perfection.  Au gratin potatoes: simply delicious!  I really liked the cheese it was baked with.  Mac & cheese: good, but the potatoes were definitely better.  Vic & Anthony's is one of the best steakhouses I have been to.  No complaints here.

tDG5TPBMUt_DZMG_OCQFqw.text: Same awesome food and great service as you find at other V&As. This is a group that knows how to pick and cook a steak. It seems appropriate it is not on the strip and located in downtown Vegas. Cheers.

RieOshUrAPhrFzlPshVaNQ.text: Don't be fooled by the location. V&As is a great steakhouse. It's a must visit for us every time in town. Dry aged NY strip and bone in ribeye. Sides are great as well.

8rtcewmta7mI947_7Wx78A.text: This is simply the best steakhouse in the country.  You must try it.  While on the pricey side we always walk away thinking out meal was worth it.  When was the last time that happened to you?New York Strip is my favorite steak and the Mac and cheese is a must.

Ou2CVZspe2zSLcPdg09AUg.text: It deserves the Michelin star and 4 stars from me because they do something a lot of places, with fine meat, don't-- they cook it perfectly. This isn't a tucked away bargain on Freemont, its a destination restaurant. A great guy's place for that one "big meal".  It's not in a league or price range, with Crafsteak, but it could very well be the best steak you eat all year.  Yeah, the service was an issue. They were friendly but they delivered our entrees one at a time, while the rest of us were still working on our appetizers.    The apps were fantastic-- here's what I say: They have the best crab cakes on the strip,  topped with a sweet and tangy chive sauce, bold but complimentary to the pure and rich crab. Sensational  The sirrachi quail was ordered as a lark--  I've always wanted to bbq with "the rooster sauce" but, now I actually "get" why they have the rooster on the bottle-- it works with bird amazingly well.  The quail was delicate, juicy and a bit gamey, but the sirrachi glaze was such a strong contrast that every bite was an experience. Excellence!   The freshwater oysters were also a hit, they were in fantastic condition, and with a little rock salt sprinkled over them and some seriously coarse pepper, delicious. We also tried the shrimp cocktail which came with about #4 shrimp, huge babies! The sauce was a compote of cherry tomato, chunky garlic pieces, that beautiful coarse black pepper and some sherry. There was a hint of the sarachi in this as well. This is one of the best shrimp cocktails I have ever tried, and it was in my opinion, a value. If a couple were splitting this, it would work as a first course for sure.  Now to the steak. I ordered a bone-in rib eye, others in my party also ordered the fillet, the stuffed sea bass (amazing) the stuffed salmon (creative and maybe the standout) the lamb rack (4 to a rack) and of course there's always one...he ordered the chicken.   My steak ordered Medium rare was cooked to perfection, lightly seasoned, every bite was juicy and had that tangy-tease on first bite, followed by the deep beef flavor. Magnificent!    And rib eye lovers take note, the meat near the bone was intense, a True sign of proper aging.  It was delicious and I left nothing but the bone.  I tried the stuffed salmon, which was filled with gouda and onion compote, and flakes of fresh herb, it was sensational-- I believe it was cooked on some sort of exotic wood because it had a unique flavor. This is the best salmon I have ever tasted. The cheese, the herbs, and the wood flavor only made the flesh of the perfectly cooked fish blow up, it was raining slamon flavor in my mouth, with dimensions I can't explain-- I want to go back and have this dish!    The sides were of course above average. You don't get a Michelin star for slacking in detail, but I am tired of baby veg, and chunky mash potatoes. but they were very very good. The onion strings, and asparagus (cooked with truffle oil) were fantastic. Also, I really liked the wedge salad. It was huge of course, but the cheese and two types of bacon, house dressing really was impressive, I mean its as if this great sounding salad we've all ordered before came to new life. It's perfected here.   Parking: work with the people at the Nugget and you'll have less of a walk.  Service: Knowledgeable, and very friendly, good reccomendations without seeming like they are up-selling. Above average. Young table runners though seem a bit out of whack. Wine service is a True value here.  Highly Recommended  Per person with wine, drink, app, salad and entree about $95 with tax. Per glass wine service is generous and reasonable, and they are known for heavy pours.  Clean restrooms, and old school decor. Men should wear a "going out shirt" gals dress up here, but there's plenty of clientele going casual on the night I was there, so I can't say any dress code is firm. I'd call.

ri2qVV9brqignxXYfyTTkw.text: And you thought Downtown Las Vegas was a place for cheap drinks, thrills, gambling and titty bars.  This place rivals most of the fine dining places on the strip and the pricing is actually very reasonable for the caliber of food. The portions are very large and the service is very fast and friendly. The atmosphere is dark and very intimate though there are spots in the middle perfect for casual dining, if you take your significant other then make sure you get a table along the walls of the place for an even nicer experience.  I would recommend a good cut of steak, the veal or the big 25 oz rib eye is the way to go. Pair it with a Pinot Noir and the lobster bisque soup. If you are not a meat fan ( you really shouldnt go to this place then ) but seriously if you just are not feeling steak then i would definitely get the jumbo shrimp and crab cakes.  I would definitely recommend this place, it is also a great last minute nice place to eat just in case you forgot to make plans or need a place to impress with little or no time advance or reservations.

Lv39tALAES61HakD-lZY0w.text: Great service and food. Historic old school Vegas style. Lobster bisque, oysters on the half shell and filet was perfect. Timely food service.

AG8vum01WojCxu0Dx4N1ag.text: Lordy, they try hard here. I adore them for that. The service was attentive and friendly.  But sadly, this is a mediocre steak house. A little better than Binion's, which has gone downhill since the casino was sold, but compared to the vast selection of other carnivore feeding-troughs in town, this is only a few dozen notches above a Sizzler. I mean where's the damn kobe?  My medium rare ribeye was delivered medium. The steak fries, which I asked them to double-fry, were the best thing of the night. The wines by the glass were few, and uninspired.  As I continue to do my tour of the steakhouses in Las Vegas with the goal of definitively finding the top 5, this one is not even in the running.

17M_6856utyFVjqnvPYQqQ.text: On a beef feast, 3 dinners in Vegas . . . Texas de Brazil, Chart House and Vic & Anthony's.  What can I say 'The Best Beef Of The Week'.  I was tired and want a steakhouse and did not want to leave the hotel.  It ambiance is traditional steakhouse along the Morton's line . . . Morton's has always been a place I loved to go when on the road too long but that is another story . . . centered on familiarity.  And so it is with Vic and Anthony's.  I started with a Booker and suggested that an associate try one.  I thought South Africans could drink . . . well now I have two.  I had a beefsteak tomato salad, excellent, and followed it up with a ribeye and some creamed spinach.  Next time I will upgraded to the bone in ribeye.  The quality of the steak was Prime and it sang out its quality on the first bite.  The creamed spinach was spot on.  Stag's Leap bottles were 1/2 off on selected bottles.  I had some with dinner.  Finished with a espresso.    In summary, I would have not searched it out.  But is a very good steakhouse and hits all the right notes.  So why then only 4 starts . . . now this could be really pissy but the service was over attentive . . . there is a fine balance when serving between attentive and annoying.  To be fair, I would have given them 4 1/2 stars, maybe even 4 3/4 stars, but I just can't give them a 5 star review.  I know I am a bastard . . . but in the end it comes down to the fact that I would return only  if it was convenient but I would not search this excellent restaurant out.  Instead I would be more adventurous.

uF0qUE4ue4L5lnN6vT4v8w.text: My husband and I dined here on our recent trip to Vegas after reading about it on Trip Advisor and we're so glad we did! Even though we were staying at the NY, NY on the Strip, we ventured into the old part of town for this meal at the Golden Nugget. After the $30 cab ride, we kept our fingers crossed that the meal was as great as we'd read about and were not disappointed.  Ambience: The restaurant exudes that traditional steak house feeling! The dark wood, leather, and dim lighting made it the perfect environment to enjoy a lovely meal.  They even had very beautiful stained glass ceiling pieces in the area where we were seated that were unlike anything I'd ever seen. The restaurant was busy, but the tables were nicely spaced and my husband and I never felt as though we were being invaded upon by other guests. There was even a large table nearby, but again no issues!  Food: We decided to enjoy our bread and butter and also a cup of their lobster bisque which was perfect. Off to a great start! We also ordered two reasonably priced glasses of merlot (recommended by our waiter, Mario) from Washington State.  It was so tasty that we bought a bottle upon our return home and have bookmarked the winery (Sagelands) in our favorites. My husband ordered the rib eye (rare) and I ordered the filet (medium). These steaks have to be among the very best we've ever had, and we've dined at several of the finer steakhouses in the US.  The meat was seasoned perfectly, and so juicy that we savored every bite until the end. We chose the asparagus spears as our veggie to share, and they too were wonderfully seasoned (huge stalks, by the way!) We did look the dessert menu over, and there were many choices that looked appealing but we passed.   Service: As others have mentioned, the service was top notch. Our waiter, Mario was friendly, knowledgeable, and visited our table just the right amount of times during our meal. We were so impressed by the quality of his service that we asked to speak to the manager on our way out to share our compliments. Needless to say the manager was concerned at first that something had gone awry with our meal, but was very happy that our first experience had been so positive.  Bottom line: While expensive, Vic and Anthony's triumphs over the typical Vegas steak. Make the trip! I know the next time we are in Vegas; we will definitely stop in for a repeat performance.

DHRycj8v2aQMiAZ34CbZUg.text: If you happen to be in downtown Las Vegas and find yourself hungry for some of the best steaks in the country, I highly recommend Vic and Anthony's steakhouse.  The food was what you would expect for a top notch steakhouse... the best.  For starters, their lobster bisque and seafood chowders were wonderful.  The pear and blue cheese salad was very good and was large enough to be a meal in itself.  Now to the heart of it all.  The 18 oz. Australian rock lobster tail was amazing.  The meat was sweet and crunchy, but not chewy.  It was so good, I've ordered it twice (and I'm not much of a lobster eater).  The steaks here are some of the best anywhere.  The 24 oz. bone-in ribeye and 18 oz strip were both juicy and flavorful.  The extra marbling really gave these cuts quite a lot of flavor.  Also, everything was cooked as ordered.  It is also worth saving some room for dessert.  The bread pudding here is excellent and comes with a scoop of ice cream.  It goes well with a cup of espresso.   Service here is excellent.  Servers are both very knowledgeable about every dish and wine selection on the menu, and may even make a suggestion for something that is not on the menu.  They are also very amenable to splitting orders into smaller portions (we had our lobster tail cut into medallions) since the portions are quite large.  Everything arrived as expected and any requests were handled promptly.  The only warning I would give is that every dish here comes in large portions.  You might have to pace yourself to enjoy the full spectrum of what Vic and Anthony's has to offer.

zoRNY1oK0AAj1ZB-QItP5w.text: Great meal; great steakhouse. Loved the steak & side dishes. I had the 8oz fillet Mignon and appetizer of raw oysters & a side of broccoli.  My only complaint is that the waiter was not friendly, nor unfriendly, he also did not warn us about the size of the side dishes. Our group of 6 ordered 5 and were overwhelmed. We expected better of the waiter. Otherwise it would of been a 5 star. Though, other tables seemed to have had better staff serving them. We will try them again on our next trip to Vegas

yV_X66qsxGi2EruAToH-9Q.text: The ambiance is great albeit a bit crowded. Great service but not intrusive. Fillet was the best I've ever had and I love steak. Went with the Peppercorn Port sauce per the waiters recommendation. Really good. Only downside was we were there for a birthday and they charged us for the birthday dessert they brought us without ordering. Place is classy without being stuffy.  On site wine expert made excellent recommendations and was cost sensitive.

9hcbIikxQ54TgRLVm0mb8g.text: Superb, friendly, efficient service.  Had a great Tom Collins to start.  Enjoyed a Tuna Tartar appetizer.  Could have had a pinch less salt.  I had the 16oz Ribeye and Potato's au gratin.  The steak was done just to my perfection.  Our waiter had me cut into it at the beginning to make sure.  Tender, succulent tasty beef.  Yum, yum.  My wife had the halibut and it was also very fresh tasting and delicious.  Really a very nice treat (it was my birthday, and since I had let them know on the reservation, I got a little chocolate mousse cake, very nice). If you are looking for a special occasion place, I would not hesitate in recommending you consider Vic & Anthony's. .

Reamg_FVoxWr1fFBxWeplQ.text: The steaks tasted like steak... when you add their sauce the steak's flavor is enhanced.  Hubby took the rib eye and I took the 8-oz filet... very happy with our choices.  We also took a side of asparagus which was enough for two people and the asparagus was cooked al dente... perfect!  This restaurant is pricey but well worth it.  The servers were very attentive and respectful.  We'll definitely bring the family the next time we're all in Las Vegas.

RbyytwmLcgeDWVyohkJCRA.text: Choosing Vic & Anthony's over the plethora of other great Vegas steakhouses wasn't easy.  I'm sure many, if not all, of the other options would have been great as well, but we were very pleased with our choice.  The service was absolutely wonderful and the food was amazing (me the filet, her the crab/lobster/filet combo special).  We'll be tempted to try another Vegas steakhouse the next time around for a new experience, but we may well end up back at Vic & Anthony's because it was so great.  Our only complaint (and it's a big one) is that the Golden Nugget valet was full (at 7p) and the parking garage was one of the worst we've ever experienced (long delays, nearly full, expensive (though V&A's validates), with a slow/crappy elevator, and stairwells that lock behind you, preventing you from re-entering the garage!  But since parking isn't the restaurant's fault, we won't ding them for that.

cvdGWpBgi0PBLbGGmE47NA.text: Great food, good service. Husband loved his filet mignon & I had shrimp cocktail & crab cakes, which were both good. The creme brulee was the best ever... So good. Good place for a nice meal.

p-6_XFiW6ErHGSZ05BGh3w.text: One of the best steaks we've ever had...  The filet was so tender it just melted in your mouth. The oysters were amazing and the service impeccable. This is just what I expected from a top notch restaurant like this. Dine here and you will not be disappointed. Worth every penny.

RtEkIB_EEuK9d9m38xhm_A.text: The wait staff was incredible so that bumped it up from 3 to 4 stars. Solely base on the food, it would have been 3.  Appetizer: We ordered the oysters Rockefeller and while I'm not a huge fan of oysters, these were amazing. Really fresh and the sauces to accompany them were perfect.   Dinner: My NY strip steak was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious. Worth every single penny. I would suggest splitting the sides though...they're huge and way too much for one person. I asked for a wine pairing and I expected the server to suggest the most expensive one on the list, but it was the second least expensive and went perfect with my steak.   Dessert: I ordered the creme brulee and it was great but, again, enough for two people. Being that I had the Tahitian vanilla bean creme brulee at Le Cirque (Bellagio) the night before, it didn't stand up. Still very yummy though.   Definitely worth the money if you're a steak fan.

ta_4TYj8Yw9yQGg0PRferA.text: Third time here.  Each experience is better than the last. Old school steakhouse; Sinatra, Clooney, and Bobby Darin singing maybe a little too loud.  Menu very strong.  Service 5 star.  D'Andre, a True professional, reseated us to the private dining area because music was too loud; John, our waiter for all three visits is as good as you could wish for in a server.  Two filets at perfect temperature.  Peppercorn sauce and Bernaise.   Mushrooms are incredible, trust me!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monster lobster tails!

yL7rOqUNV8TZkHCM9DMv9A.text: We had a salad, crab cake, and Mac and cheese! Perfect way to end a night of sipping on ever clear slushies :)

guC-R5R-UNWE4RSoStq8ug.text: The best steak and service of any restaurant I've eaten. Must try the crab cakes and the creamed spinach. Great selection of wines.

OI-JtD3tL76JpP_7i6ya1A.text: Jumbo crab cake is a MUST HAVE! Tons of crab, way less cake! A++++ service! Biff, the manager and our server Laura were amazing!  Potatoes Au Gratin were to die for!  Also had the Mac n Cheese as a side....this was great too.  Portions are giant and bring an appetite!  5 star restaurant in my opinion. Steaks melted in our mouths!!!! Very happy customer and highly recommended! We will be back!

l0Defk2rShKLCRUb-E4odA.text: Before I get to what a terrific restaurant this is, I have to depart into the bloody mary, my thing:  I expected more from the bloody mary here. Demitri's is my favorite mix, but for a cocktail that pairs so well with meat, I'd have expected a house-made mix. And, "spicy" meant extra tabasco, not the right answer in our age of scotch bonnet, bird and ghost peppers.   The soups: fantastic. I ordered one for my dining companion, took a taste, and was so impressed that I immediately ordered their other soup option for myself, to try both.   The large ribeye was delicious and well-cooked, but I have to be straight to my readers about the bone-marrow sauce option. I chose to come here specifically for that sauce, and I can't fault it for being what it is: I just had to learn, somewhere, sometime, that it's a black, salty, sticky sauce with chunks of greyish paste-y marrow.   My dining companion had the salmon, and was relieved that the Roaring Fork's is better. It'd be a shame to have raised the bar on one's favorite entree at such an inaccessible place. The grilled wild mushrooms came in nice variety, three of four types.  Dessert, the flourless chocolate cake, was too rich for words, of course, and fabulous, but if you're reading this in Austin, go to the Mesa Grill in Northwest Hills for its rival.  We went for the old-school atmosphere and the interesting menu, but the service was top-flight, the best waitstaff I've had outside Paris, the kind of service that makes you remember that serving can be one hell of a classy profession.

WZJwOTD6k2pkV4yHbStqmg.text: Outstanding service, Excellent decorMarvelous steak, Lobster bisque is to die for. Creamed spinach and the au gratin potatoes made to perfection. Would have given it 5 stars but wine list is a bit pricey. Desserts were all outstanding with tbe bread pudding winning the best reviews. Be sure to ask for the prix fixe option. Outstanding deal $50.00 per person for a 4 course meal.

0V2biskv13CkNBP1A0BkNA.text: Well, I thought I had been to some GREAT Stekhouses in the Phoenix area . . . boy was I wrong . . . this place puts them all to shame . . . from the atmosphere, to the service, to the food . . . I don't think it can get better.  We started by telling the Sommelier that we were looking for a good reisling . . . while he had three specials for the night . . . he actully recommened the lower priced one . . . and he was spot on . . . it was unbelievable.  Knowing we were going to be having desert . . . we did not opt for an appetizer . . . my wife had the wedge salad, and I the lobster bisque . . . both were very very good.  The main course . . . the 16 oz. prime ribeye eith augrautin potatoes and wild mushrooms . . . the steak melted in your mouth . . . the potatos very cheesy . . . and the mushrooms very tasty.  And finally desert . . . wife had the creme brule, and I the croisant bread pudding . . . I thought I had died to and gone to heaven . . . my wife, I thought she was going to move into the kitchen and live on creme brule for the rest of her life.  Pricey yes . . . but it is definitely worth a stop once a Vegas Trip . . . WE SHALL RETURN . . . .

S8YXS8nqQPrzhH91j451Yw.text: We had $75 in free dining vouchers and had already eaten at the Grotto twice. We had reservations at 8:45 and didn't get seated til almost 9:15. Glad I happened to look online and see the 3 course tasting menu. We had lobster bisque (decent flavor and small chunks of lobster) filet mignon (tender and delicious but slightly undercooked) potatoes au gratin ( tasted like American cheese coated these things and it made me want to gag) creamed spinach ( decent ) and the creme brulee ( the brulee is my favorite part so I  how they served it ) and bread pudding. ( my bf enjoyed it and it's a massive portion )  After coming here I wish we would have eaten at the Grotto again with our vouchers but the filet and creme brulee made the stop worth it. But only bc we had $75 in free credit. I don't think I would go back.

tEVEpXZKMQqbMzjAzyrqyw.text: First tried calling for a reservation for the tasting room (private room).  I'm dinging a star from the review because I had to call multiple times to get everything correct: finally they just gave me the manager's email address and we corresponded that way.  After you visit the restaurant you can see why they have so much trouble: they take the reservations from the front desk, and it's just too loud.  So I was in charge of preparing everything for 10 Japanese executives. Over email with the manager we created a set menu that had everything except dessert already decided.  They did a great job getting everything ready for us.  Our menu was three appetizers (quail, crab cakes, jumbo shrimp).  My guests liked the quail and crab cakes, but the jumbo shrimp was pretty ordinary for them.  I liked the quail.  What I thought would be the most boring part of the meal got the most positive response: the iceberg wedge salad.  The dressing was very good, and they way it's presented makes it appetizing.  Next up was the filet mignon.  I had them cook the steaks medium with only salt and pepper.  Vic&Anthony's has a lot of options for sauces, but I think simple is always best with great meat.  I met with Brian who manages all of the wine and explained the budget ($50 per person for initial drinks: beyond that each person must pay their own way).  This is a typical way Japanese groups handle these outings, because it gives some slack on what drink choices are available.  Brian suggested a magnum bottle of a good cabernet sauvignon, which hadn't even occurred to me.  It really impressed my guests because you don't see magnum bottles in restaurants very often in Japan.  We ran out of wine just before they served the steak, so I went in half with one of our younger guests for a standard sized bottle of wine.  I wanted to get an idea of the wine markup, so I asked for a bottle of something I knew they would have.  Based on the price they quoted me, expect to pay between 2~3 times winery prices, which is a little on the high side for restaurants, but they brought out the decanter as well, so factoring in everything involved I can understand the higher prices.  On the tasting room: it's private but not closed off from the rest of the restaurant.  Think of it like a VIP room in a club and that should give you a good idea.  The service charge was included in the bill (20%), and if you pay with a credit card they'll ask to see some ID.

1x2Tl4i4F_JmeeC7H31Bew.text: The best darn steakhouse ever!!! My husband and I were introduced to this place by his politician friend and everytime we're in Vegas we try to come here. We had the crab cake, lobster bisque, filet w/baked potato, chicken dish (can't remember) and the creme brulee. Morton's, Flemings, and Ruth's Chris have nothing on this place! Beware though...it's very dark in here. Good for a romantic dinner!

QN4Z2pNpN0Z8SVfIhG6Btw.text: EXCELLENT.  I know there are a ton of options for fine dining in Vegas, but Vic and Anthony's was really exceptional for a number of reasons.   FOOD: I came here with a group of 7 and 5 of us ordered from the $50pp 3 course prix fixe menu, which boasted some great options. I opted for the lobster bisque for the first course, fresh fish a la nage for the second, and creme brulee for the third. The lobster bisque was HEAVENLY. It was rich, butter, and full of lobster meat. The fish (it was salmon) was served with delicious sauteed carrots, haricots verts and zucchini and was topped with crab meat. Very tasty. The creme brulee...... I had a bit of a spiritual moment with that dessert. It was served in a large, flat dish so there was a lot of crispy, delightful caramelization to break with a spoon. Beneath the crunch top was an absolutely decadent creme, chock full of vanilla bean. It was so good I actually cried. It was so good I turned down bites of my boyfriend's chocolate mousse cake. It was so good I kept eating it and eating it even though I thought I was going to burst at the end of the second course. I have seriously never eaten a dessert THAT good.   SERVICE: Exceptional. Our waitress was patient and attentive, making sure that we were well taken care of. My glass of water was never left empty. My empty plates and used utensils were taken away at just the right time. Our food was well-timed and we were treated very well.  AMBIANCE: Personally, I think Downtown Vegas (Fremont Street) is about 1000% cooler and hipper than the strip. The Golden Nugget, in which Vic and Anthony's is located, is a classy establishment with a dash of funk and fun from the vibrant promenade outside. The restaurant itself is dimly lit, very classic steakhouse decor with white table clothes and dark finishes. There are candles flickering on every table. Frankly, I would have happily eaten this food on a bus or in a cab or at my aunt's house or anywhere because it was so good it wouldn't have mattered, but the ambiance and feel of this restaurant really amplified the experience.   Overall, superb restaurant. Go if you have the chance!!

ns4auCVVPeA4osoWyKimKw.text: I am giving this place four stars even though I want to only give three and a half.    Pros: the wait staff was awesome and very attentive.  The food was all cooked to perfection (which one would expect when buying $30-50 entrees).  The maple bacon was AWESOME.  The salmon tasted good and came with a side of potatoes.  Saw Nicholas Cage there.   Cons: food was too expensive.  My in-laws picked the place, so I went, but the thought of a $50 steak (and nothing else on the plate) makes me want to puke.  The music was too loud. Even my kids, who are super noisy, thought it was too loud.  The lights are so dim you can barely read the menu.  The steak, while perfectly cooked, had no discernable taste or flavor.

z7TF2Q7CJb-P2uPmXHiR1Q.text: My husband and I are wine connoisseurs. We go to wine dinners and events regularly. We have dined at 3 starred Michelin restaurants, and we have NEVER EVER seen an unholy markup on wine as we did at this restaurant. In fact, the table next to us were saying the same thing. They were in total disbelief. Of course, there is significant mark up at restaurants for wine, but this was just plain insulting.  My husband got the $155 steak which was a rare beef and that was great. I got the prime bone in rib eye, and was severely disappointed. I get bone in ribeye regularly (it's my cut) at Fleming's, Mastro's, Ruths Chris and other high end prime steakhouses, and the bone is always long and runs across the steak. Here, it was a "bone" that was barely an inch! How is that possible? It just didn't look right or taste right--it lacked seasoning, and it was 3/4 fat. Rib eye is a fatty cut of meat, but I get it regularly and never experienced this much fat.  The sides were disappointing other than the mushrooms. Brussel sprouts lacked seasoning, duck fat potatoes would have been superb, but some pieces were not fully cooked. Au gratin potatoes were okay, but the consistency of the cheese was like Velveeta. I prefer a firmer cheese with a crunch at the bubbling top. Also, the creamed corn was salty. Weird.  Our bill came to about $550. Not worth it. Our server Luciano was spectacular, or I would have given it a much lower rating.

_LDjHQAPMCyJYgQwah1Hag.text: Great restaurant.   Food was excellent. I had the Bone in Ribeye and Au Gratin Potatoes. If you visit ask for Mike. Very Knowledgeable waiter who made great suggestions and recommendations on both food and wine.

be17fnVpsylSBCBsxKo5EQ.text: We came here for a small reception dinner after our wedding at 702 Weddings. This place is to die for. The steaks melt in your mouth, you don't even need to cut them with a knife, they are cooked to perfection. Writing this review 4 days later is making my stomach rumble and mouth water. This is fine dining, and yes it is very pricey but reasonable for what you get. The waiter warned us that the sides are meant to be shared, we ordered broccoli and wild mushrooms...... they were fabulously cooked, and seasoned perfectly. I would not change a thing. Yes, the steak is a piece of meat that comes on the plate, by itself. It does not need to be garnished, it is perfect by itself, it is rich and flavorful. All these low ratings for it being expensive.. HELLO it's a steak house, mind you a FINE DINING steak house, go to outback plebeian if you want to complain about the cost of your steak vs quantity/quality.  Also the low ratings about garnishing, again HELLO steak house,  you're getting a steak or meat... it's not coming with anything unless you ask for it. Also if clearly states on the menu upgrades for  sauces on your steak will cost you, so people complaining about hidden fees/cost, learn to read. Honestly, I'm 28 years old and I understand how to read a menu and how to punch in numbers on my cellphone and decide whether I can afford to eat some where.   If you're looking for a seriously nice dinner that you'll remember, come here. And please at least dress nicely. Nothing ruins ambiance like jerks who wander in with jeans and a T shirt.

u6MbszAffArTs15J_veibA.text: This place is THE place to eat if you are at Freemont Street!  My sister had her wedding at The Golden Nugget so she had her reception dinner here. There were about 30 of us and they had no problem accommodating us in the back corner of the restaurant. Everything about this place was good.   The service: Our waiter was Matt. He was THE DUDE to have. He knew everything there was to know about the wine, beer, food and specials. He was courteous, fun, attentive and cute.  The food: The food was outstanding. Our appetizers were crab cakes, calamari, beefsteak tomatoes and cheese, crab legs and bread. The crab cakes were to die for, they will spoil you forever for crab cakes anywhere else. The steaks were cooked to perfection, the seafood (I had the salmon) was excellent and the salads/soups were a good round up on the entrees. Their side were said to have been good, I only had the mashed potatoes which were decent.  The drinks: The drink list, wine list and beer list is extremely impressive. We had a double magnum (yes, DOUBLE MAGNUM) of Prisoner that served the entire party no problem. The beer was exclusive, you don't find what they had on their menu anywhere else very often. The bourbon my husband had was 180 proof, crazy!  All in all a great experience. I would definitely come back here again!

Wn1cdLIAIwBwRCvZWWIw4Q.text: Amazing experience! I thought I was dreaming the entire time   Staff was friendly and attentive. They did not miss a beat and were not overbearing.   Our table started with the calamari and oysters. We each then got either a salad or soup before our sizzling plates of deliciousness greeted us. It took one bite to know I was hooked! I ordered the filet and it was cooked to perfection. We paired this with a nice Pinot noir.   In case we didn't have enough we ordered the bread pudding. Even though we were all plenty stuffed , we were able to find room for this decadent treat!

BR7K-rGrvwUmPCaNSsPiAQ.text: I read quite a few reviews on here that defend their less than 5 star review simply because of the prices. You get what you pay for here and then some. The service here was excellent and the food was beyond what I had expected. The "sides" were generously portioned (we ordered the wild mushrooms and broccoli and had left overs). Steaks were flawless, like melts in your mouth flawless. We will definitely be visiting Vic & Anthony's again if we make it out here to Vegas.

E-as-2H6mQqgJlaPNQK3Fw.text: I just had my wedding dinner here, and it was amazing.  Three weeks before my wedding, my original venue tried to up their prices, so I went seeking an alternative.  Vic & Anthony's was more than accommodating.  While their private room could not fit our group of 26, they made sure to place us in a somewhat cloistered area at 3 large tables.  The service was amazing.  The lead waiter was constantly checking with me, my husband, my father, and my father-in-law to ensure that everything was to our satisfaction.  Even though we had a large group, the kitchen and servers managed to get each course out to the entire group at the same time.  When it came time to cut the cake, the lead waiter brought it out for a very nice presentation, then took it back to be cut.  The restaurant gave us no problem for bringing in our own desert, and only charged a small cake cutting fee (which is pretty standard).  The food was some of the best I've ever had, and I am a real foodie.  The restaurant allowed my guests to order off of the standard menu which was really nice since so many places require a large group to have a smaller set menu.  The crab cakes were the best I had ever had.  Everyone who ordered steak really enjoyed it, and my in-laws said it was the best steak they had ever had.  Thank you to everyone at Vic & Anthony's who made my wedding dinner an amazing event.  It was well worth the cost!

3JpLz3oPpguKmxhi4rZHmg.text: We haven't been here in years and had a dinner Tuesday night and went back Sat it was that good.  We eat at most the high end steakhouses in town but this place is really top notch!  Def have to try the traditional favorites like the ribeye and porterhouse!  All the sides and salads were huge and great!

JfhwP07RuqYYudPLUW3nWw.text: I just got back from one of my best steak dinners ever.  When I arrived, I was seated on a great table close to the bar where I can sit on one of their cool leather chairs and watch the NFL Draft at the same time.  The decor is totally awesome, a cross between the Capital Grille and Craftsteak.  It is furnished like an old school steakhouse with deep rich cherry woods and leather chairs but with beautiful trendy stained glass ceilings and low mood lighting....very sexy.  I love this type of steakhouse....truly a Frank Sinatra hangout with Suits, Steaks, Whiskey and Cigars.  My meal began with their delicious warm sourdough bread and their incredible lobster bisque.  The bisque was super creamy and spicy....one of the best that I have ever had.  For dinner, I ordered a bone-in rib eye steak and a side of sea salt fries. The steak was super tender and juicy with the right amount of marbling. The fries was a perfect side with the great steak.  For desert, I had their famous croissant bread pudding with ice cream and a toffee stick.....super sweet and good.  Vic and Anthony's is one of the best steak houses that I have been to in the U.S.  The decor and ambience is sexy and romantic.......the service is outstanding.  I felt like a celebrity......the hostess and waitress made me feel as if i was the only customer in  the restauarnt.  The Mgr. came by my table a couple of times to check on me and when I left, they comped my desert and gave me a complimentary glass of cabernet franc to finish my meal.  I came in my pants twice.......it was that good.  No sex needed for a week....I am so satisfied!  I can see why they are a Michelin rated steakhouse and was voted as one of top 10 steakhouses in the country.  I wish there was a V@A in California and NY!

ASskHhC7GPHxmOGGqddgsg.text: I did not expect the old strip to have a nice steakhouse but this place was great. I thought the old strip in general would be super ghetto and don't get me wrong it is a different scene for sure but it's really come a long way. The golden nugget has been updated nicely and Vic and Anthony's was delicious. Probably one of the better steaks I've had in a while! Nice wine selection and great service as well!

DK1Yz4AXKosuYdfnNLZQJQ.text: I've read a lot of good reviews about this place before I even decided to step in. So, my expectation is very high. Walking into this place on a thursday evening is a fairly easy. But its very very busy in there.  I am a little dissapointed that we dont get to seat in the side seats somewhere instead of being seated in the middle of the dining room. But let me tell you that the experience is that great. I cant never drink my water glass till its empty.  Its always full somehow. I think they have ten servers assistant who just walk around filling up water. Their server assistant are wearing chef uniform to make the whole place looks very classy and elegant.   They even take the time to bring black napkin to my fiance's black dress so that it match her outfit. All I can say is, this place rocks.  Alright, lets get on to the food. We try the lobster bisque for $9.95 absolutely worth it. Have lots of lobster in it and taste very seafoody.   Next, the appetisers, we try the maple glazed quail thats to die for. The maple glazed on the quail is so damn good, we wouldve swallow the quail bone if its not because the head saying dont swallow it.  We ordered a couple of fillet mignon and prime rib eye thats to die for with peppercorn sauce. Keep in mind that everything is not free.   Peppercorn sauce additional $2.95 and sides like mashed potatoes are $6.95. I dont mind paying but some yelper might find it helpful that I write down some prices.  The fillet mignon cost $38 something and its absolutely worth it. My rib eye cost $45 and its HUGE!!! I cant finish it and lemme tell you something, I can eat some steak!!!   All in all, its a great experience and we definetely put it up there as one of the best steak we ever ate and our server BEN is really great and on the ball as well as fully knowledge in his craft!!

H1vhqg6D0oPpzBYLU9o95w.text: Always stop here when in Vegas to have a fabulous dinner. Have never been disappointed. Had the 20oz lobster tail, done to perfection. Choose the wedge salad, and a great glass of wine. Service was top notch,  never had to want for anything, waiter was right there. Highly recommend!

MJNrazpiFZ1RHdarDH6E_g.text: My girlfriend and I had been planning a trip to Las Vegas for quite some time and finally the day arrived where we were in our car and driving through the desert. I can be classified as a meticulous planner. I had everything planned from what shows we were going to see, to where we were going to stay to where we were going to eat. My girlfriend and I are HUGE fans of Steakhouses and I knew Vic & Anthony's happened to be in the lobby of the Hotel we were staying at the 'Golden Nugget.' I figured since we were driving around it only made sense to enjoy a dinner close to our Hotel this just happened to be in our Hotel. Quite honestly even if this Steakhouse was the other side of town we would of driven there, it is that good.   I made our reservation for Vic & Anthony's using the Yelp feature on my phone. We arrived and from the moment we checked in with the receptionist we were treated like absolute royalty. I due honestly believe we were given the 'STAR' treatment because of the whole 'Yelp' reservation.   As other patrons were being seated on the 1st floor of the restaurant we were taken to a small 2nd level that overlooked the entire restaurant almost like you were on a balcony with curtains obstructing the view of the commoners below you=) As described on the Vic & Anthony's website 'Our Las Vegas locations offers a Private Tasting Room in an elegant setting, featuring beautiful wine country murals. The tasting room will seat up to 18 guests, and features our award-winning cuisine with and extensive wine list.' We were the only ones seated in section until just before our dessert arrived. We were also dressed the part which added with the 'Yelp' check-in was the icing on the cake. The decor was stunning. The chairs we sat in were leather with 'brass tacks,' the menus were hard/thick leather. The music playing was everything 'Old School' Las Vegas offers you, it was a medley of Dean Martin, Frank Sinatra and various other artists from the day. You honestly felt like you had been transported back to the 1950's, you were literally looking at the front door of the restaurant want for Bugsy Siegel or Al Capone to walk in the front door.   From the moment we sat down we were treated great by the staff. If you asked for anything they were on the ball and it was done. The staff brought out fresh bread with whipped butter and hard butter upon request. Our waiter 'Hector' arrived soon after our bread did and 'Hector' was one incredible waiter/server. Hector had us laughing, smiling and made our night so much more special than it already was. I am not a drinker at all and nor is my girlfriend but we will enjoy a glass of wine every now and then. We immediately asked 'Hector' what wine pairing would go great with a Filet Mignon, Hector quickly suggested 2006 Rutherford Hill Winery Napa Valley which was amazing. As I stated above I do not see what all the hub-bub is about wine and how is pairs with a meal until this glass of wine and this meal. The wine 'Hector' suggested was fantastic. It was so good (and by 'GOOD' I mean 'GREAT' and by 'GREAT' I mean 'AMAZING.') that several days after we left Las Vegas I actually called the restaurant to get the name of the wine we drank so we could purchase it on our own.   My girlfriend and I were debating if we were going to split a Cesar Salad or also order Tomato & Mozzarella as an appetizer. We asked 'Hector' who asked what we were planning on having for dinner. We told him and he suggested we go with something lighter, we ended up just splitting a Cesar Salad 'Good call Hector.' For an entree my girlfriend and I both ordered the 8oz Filet Mignon, my girlfriend ordered hers Medium rare, I ordered mine Medium. All of the side dishes are A' la Carte. My girlfriend and I decided to go with the Wild Mushrooms & Sea Salt French fries.   Our meal was fantastic; you could literally cut through your piece of meat with a spoon if you wanted to. The steak was cooked to perfection. The edges of the steak had a char to it that complimented the Filet so well. I have been to several top end Steakhouses and nothing even comes close to Vic & Anthony's, I mean they are not even close to being in the same Ballpark.   Right when my girlfriend and I thought we could not eat another bite of food 'Hector' brought the dessert menu and we decided to split a piece of cheesecake. Be advised one piece of cheesecake can easily be split between 2-3 people, so do not eat with your eyes here, order 1 piece=) We ordered out cheesecake with the blueberry dressing on the side and it was simply mind boggling it was so good.   There are several other Steakhouses I want to try in Las Vegas but it is so hard to give them a shot when you know you are going to get such great service and such good quality of food at Vic & Anthony's. I am counting the day's until I can come back here and have another meal.   My girlfriend and I wanted to thank 'Hector' and the entire staff for making our meal such a special one.

m61203d2ctsEHwA2unACLQ.text: My husband and I come to vegas 4 times of year and stay on the strip. We always make it to this steak house which is in downtown. This steakhouse is in old town vegas but worth the drive and effort. Service is above and beyond but the food is 5-star above any steakhouse in Las Vegas. Ambiance is very welcoming for a original las vegas hotel. We always have crab cakes, unreal chop salad, filet migion with recomended wine parings. Please try sanbucco as after dinner drink. You'll fall in love as we have. As of today over 9 visits and looking forward to the next one.

9vAfdIjebN2YQ9qWeJK3vw.text: Located inside the Golden Nugget Hotel & Casino in the Downtown area is Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse. Classy w/  "Old Vegas" ambiance and style.  To call this a "Steakhouse" is a disservice. This restaurant is flawless fine dining. From the food, to the service to the fine details everything here is perfection.  My wife and I dined here on our recent trip to Vegas and had the absolute best meal I've ever experienced in the more than 14 years that we've been coming to Vegas regularly. Every course was perfect. Honestly, we didn't even have reservations upon arrival at 6 pm and actually were somewhat under dressed upon entering but the hostess was kind and graciuosly seated us almost immediately.  Our meal:  Appetizers:  Soup of the Day: Chicken Tortilla - Rich and smoky w/ fresh grilled corn, cotija cheese & fresh toasted tortilla strips. It was the perfect balance of  layered spice, crunch and smoothness.  Spinach Salad - Seriously the best sald I've EVER had!  Warm, fresh leaf spinach w/ bacon, chopped eggs, kalamata olives & artichoke hearts served w/ a citrus honey vinaigrette. This could have served as the perfect light entree on it's own.  Entrees:  Jumbo Fried Shrimp with Broccoli and Mashed Potatoes - My wifes entree. Classic ingredients done flawlessly. She loved it. Simple,  seasoned and cooked to perfection  Sea Bass A La Nage - My dish and our servers suggestion.  Chilean Sea Bass poached and topped w/ jumbo lump crab meat and paired with roasted baby vegetables. My favorite course of the night.  Dessert :  Croissant Bread Pudding w/ Caramel Ice Cream - Another of our servers suggestion as a must try dish and It was everything he promised and more. Layers of Croissant stacked, combined and plated into a delicious bread pudding with cinnamon and caramel sauce and paired with a toffee brittle with freshly made caramel ice cream.  The actual plating itself resmbled a swan with a caramel ice cream body with a toffee brittle neck and head perched on a crunchy tuile and balanced with the bread pudding sliced into a triangle alongside.   Overall, a wonderful meal and one we plan on repeating again soon the very next time we're in town. I especially can't wait to enjoy the Spinach Salad, Sea Bass & Bread Pudding time and again.

aGOOYQJC0EOTRtUV5-zjEw.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said...maybe that the food is orgasmic? :")  My new husband and I enjoyed a meal here during our honeymoon.  From the moment we walked in, we were impressed.  The staff is extremely professional and courteous.  The ambience is classy yet relaxed.  One can (and should) dress nicely but we saw many shorts, cargo pants and even a wife beater.  My husband is a big fan of single malt scotch and we were fortunate enough to be served by John who knows more about scotch than anyone we've ever met!   The food was superb...so much so that I moaned throughout the meal! ;)   I enjoyed a perfectly cooked 8 oz. fork-tender filet mignon, pan broiled rock lobster tail and grilled asparagus.  My husband went for straight beef and tackled a perfectly cooked 12 oz bone-in rib-eye.  We shared a side dish of creamed spinach which was topped with seasoned broiled breadcrumbs.  To finish the meal, we shared the homemade cinnamon bread pudding with a scoop of gelato.    Every bite was scrumptious and we were able to enjoy our meal at a leisurely pace. The staff here is helpful but unobtrusive so we were able to enjoy a very romantic time together.  Do not miss this place when you are in downtown Las Vegas!

oVuX-YZH8QSurM7dWtvPPQ.text: It is located inside the Golden Nugget Hotel & Casino in Downtown Las Vegas. Don't be fooled, its surprisingly very nice for downtown! The atmosphere is extremely classy and although our waiter was super knowledgable and nice, the hostess was not. She didn't smile, and seemed like she didn't want to be there. Also, even though we had reservations, it still took about 20 minutes to get seated and it seemed we got seated at an awkward table right at the entrance.   The steak here was delicious but I do wish they had a smaller sized cut that was not a filet mignon (i like a lot of marbling, something the filet mignon cut does not have). Definitely cooked to the right temperature. Everything you can ask for in a top tier steakhouse. In comparison to Mastro's and Ruth's Chris, I would say the taste is slightly less than par. Don't get me wrong, still delicious but nothing out of this world. With all the steakhouses in Vegas, it wasn't so good that I'll return here again.   Try their crab cake! (Singular, because theres only one). Super chunky crab meat, great flavor and great sauce. If you want to make your visit extra special and different from other steakhouse visits, you must try their crab cake!   I believe our total for 2 was about $150 and we got the crab cake and a side of creamed corn.

Oo3aLZUdPREv82CBY_MyCw.text: This place has a very nice atmosphere - 5 stars -  but the food is really just A-OK. Basically, it was too salty, buttery, and lacked the finesse that such a high-end restaurant should have.  We got a variety of meat and vegetable dishes. The meat was very good. But the vegetable dishes - potatoes au gratin and mushrooms - were very mediocre, too fatty and salty, and lumped in such a big quantity in big dish, slightly unappealing. No elegance.  The deserts were also extremely mediocre. We got the key lime and the chocolate mousse. The key lime had a huge crust... the chocolate mousse didn't taste interesting... it felt basic.  Also, I didn't like the fact that the waiter pushed the most expensive wine first, then the next expensive one... it was a bit obvious.  This is not a place I'd come back to. If the prices were half of what they are, I might, but at this value, it doesn't seem worth it to me. I guess what I'm saying is, it should be priced at half the price it is. That would be fair.

7wpQ-zOQimhwU-h_NB2rQg.text: When you walk in to speak with the host you see a nice display of steak and lobster which starts your appatite. The ribeye was cooked perfectly and the waiters were decent. Best steak house off the strip.. great selection of wine

oZ2jHusVq10d7Jdfw2-rUQ.text: This place is the real deal. Located inside the Golden Nugget it is the quintessential steak house. We had a delicious foie gras appetizer that wasn't on the menu followed by Maine lobster and a lovely rib eye. All of it was superb and I am very fussy about such things. The service was knowledgeable and professional.   I have to drop a star because they charge $10 for a baked potato. I expected this place to be expensive and it certainly was but I think that's ridiculous. They also allowed a large group of tourists to come in and stand by my table which was like being in a fish tank. That was undesirable.

VppaLmJgsqgAfEFDhJ1hcQ.text: Service was great, food was decent. They sure rack up the random charges... All and all I would say they have good food, but it's definitely overpriced. I have had way better dining experiences for much cheaper.

bqFnoFel6SlfN4l1vCRw3A.text: Yum!   My boyfriend was very sweet to take me here during a dinner break while we were at The Golden Nugget. We don't usually go to downtown LV, but it's actually pretty cool!   Anyway... this steakhouse is great! We ordered:   Crabcake appetizer -Yumm, it's basically all crab meat and no filler. Totally great. The crab pieces are gigantic and plump. It comes with a little sauce drizzled on the top with a few chopped tomatoes. Delicious! I wish I could eat some right now. This was probably the best thing I ate.   Filet Mignon -Perfectly cooked medium rare. They're great cuz they verify what medium-rare means to them, so that no one gets something they weren't expecting.   Australian Lobster Tail -Mmm... So many times I have overcooked lobster and it just tastes so gross. But this was so good. Dipped in butter... yumM!! I forgot prepared, but it doesn't matter!   Au Gratin Potatoes -Just cheesy potatoes. I couldn't stop eating it. So good! The potatoes are chopped into little pieces rather than sliced and the cheese is perfectly burnt just a little on top.    We also ordered the most amazing red wine, per recommendation of the waiter. Wow it was so good. It was the first time that I actually saved the cork. Unfortunately, I can't remember what it was (perhaps I drank too much!)   We didn't have time for dessert, but I'm sure it would have been good :) Or if you're here you can skip dessert and then go across the street and get some deep fried oreos to end your night! If you are in downtown LV, definitely stop by Vic & Anthony's!

PTbE2tZZ6aqEDenGMb8s0Q.text: Food was awesome. Calamari was some of the best I've ever had. I had the 8oz Filet and it was cooked perfectly. The service is top notch which you would expect from a fancy steakhouse. The must try is the Creme Brulee.  If you dont mind shelling out the money then you should definitely try this place out

sEdnsOQpYfl-NCOYqkNrHg.text: Stayed at the Golden Nugget and we ate dinner here all 3 nights-it was THAT amazing! The pan-fried chicken is the best chicken I've ever had...and the Lobster Bisque is even better! The steaks are so tender & seasoned perfectly! For all you wine lovers-they have a very extensive wine binder...yup no list here! We will definitely be back!!!

XZzZZeJbX-PsVkq2FFD8uQ.text: We enjoyed every bite. The Oysters were fresh. The filet cooked to perfection and could be cut with a fork. Our wait staff, Josh, was as good as it gets. He was knowledgeable regarding the food and the wine, making excellent suggestions. We will definitely return next time we are in Las Vegas. We felt extremely lucky to have found Vic & Anthony's.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Josh, thank you for a perfect evening!

Od4WKg-aMytE63-riHD7Aw.text: Came here for our 7 year anniversary. Our waiter Jim was just lovely and the food was exceptional. The chilled seafood appetizer had the most amazing oysters and my filet was perfect as was my fiancee's ribeye. The au gratin potatoes were as decadent as grandmas. Jim brought us bread pudding dessert made from cinnamon croissants that topped an absolutely perfect meal. Lovely ambience, Sinatra in the background. Love love love this place.

ZWQw6maNClOQqsbSqswBTA.text: My fiance works at the Nugget so we came in for dinner...Jay was our server and Sean was the wine guy. Both friendly in their own way and knowledgeable of menu and wine without being pushy.   We ordered oysters, crab cake, beet salad, filet, ribeye, Mac and cheese and au gratin potato's. OMG. Everything was delicious and devoured. Highly suggest making a reservation. We will be back!

BukyTor6LcI1NFoJOgg_yg.text: Came here for a birthday dinner. The food is delicious. I'm not a meat eater, so I enjoyed oysters and lobster Mac & cheese. I love it. I will love to eat there again!

J5ZVAwd61Vu3eLSvHju8Ew.text: Excellent! One of the best meals I've ever had. By far the best steakhouse downtown. Would highly recommend.

cNGBziFCuWlkTHzLYc5cLA.text: We ate here during one of the three nights we stayed at the Golden Nugget Casino. This steakhouse is pretty nice one, with a simple menu, I ended up getting a rib eye from a farm located in Boise, ID, ( Snake River Farms Wagyu), the rib eye was cooked to perfection, and very tender! I basically melted in your mouth! I went ahead and added the Bearnaise Port Peppercorn Beer Onions, which were ok, nothing special though.  I also went with a baked potato and a beer. She (my wife) went with the Greek Salad and the Pan Roasted Chicken.

QQYNZWwVG1OaGcjiuM5NfA.text: I had the seared scallops with creamed corn and bacon. Would have loved the bacon to be seated as well, but overall the meal was great. The corn was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ntWvurtvD2ycx_iXZOZ-6w.text: I'm definitely coming to Vic & Anthony's every time I come to Vegas. This place is amazing! I came here with my boyfriend recently, which was our second time dining here & we had a wonderful dinner. The service here is on point. Our server was awesome! I forgot our his name but if I remember it I'll update this review. He was very attentive & friendly. (This review is for our most recent visit here not the first)  Drinks: I ordered the Apple Mule. If you love Crown Apple like I do, you must try it.   Jumbo Lump Crab Cake: Seriously the best crab cake I ever had. No fillers, just huge pieces of crab meat. My boyfriend does not like seafood but it's so good he actually ate it. The sauce & chopped tomato they put on top really completes it.   Roasted Bacon: They give two thick slices of bacon. Sweet, smokey & salty. I usually don't like pork cut thick, but rather thin & crispy. But it's delicious, I would order this again next time.  Tomahawk Steak: First time having a tomahawk & it was delicious. It was perfectly cooked, medium rare just how I like it. Although it was delicious I probably wouldn't order it again. I'll probably just go with a filet or ribeye. Did I mention how huge the bone was? It looked like a dinosaur bone. I really wish I asked the server to pack it so I could've taken it home for my dog lol.  Au Gratin: Super cheesy & very rich. My boyfriend seemed to have enjoyed it more than me.  Brussel Sprouts: I love brussel sprouts, especially when it's cooked with bacon! Some of the brussel sprout leaves were kinda crispy, burnt-ish tasting but I liked them.  Overall our experience here was always wonderful & we will definitely come back again the next time we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Au Gratin Potatoes
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk Steak
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk Steak

9FxaHidIQB2wsk7RppdEFQ.text: We visited on 7-7-19 and all of us were blown away! We chose Vic and Anthony's for our after wedding dinner and we were not disappointed. We ordered the roasted bone marrow, crab cakes, and mushrooms for our appetizers. If you're going to order just one app I wouldn't go with the mushrooms but Omgosh the first two mentioned were to-die-for! There were six of us dining- filet mignon, scallops with porks belly, and the roasted chicken were all a hit. I didn't care for my lobster but that's probably just a personal preference. Cocktails were fantastic! The spiced pear martinis were a hit. Now, for dessert. We ordered two for the table to share. We had the crossaint bread pudding and the chocolate globe, both desserts knocked our socks off and I must say....leave some room an order both. The chocolate globe was such a cool presentation for our wedding guests, they're still talking about it :)

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers

X7BlkDPttXPjFKXk2wtuEg.text: This Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse is located at the Golden Nugget in downtown Las Vegas, Nevada.   Our reservations were for 10:00 PM on a Saturday night, in consideration of the fact that we stayed up all night the night before and did not mind waiting for a table to become available.   We showed up at our reserved time and waited because our table was not yet ready. After several minutes of waiting, we were notified of the availability of our table and followed the hostess in. But we were then turned away, because our table was in fact not ready, forcing all six of us to march our empty stomachs back to the front.   We resumed our wait. After some additional waiting and confirmation that our table was ready, we again made our way into the restaurant and were seated.   After a brief wait, our server appeared and took our orders. The food was on the upper end of decent. The service was also decent, but not to the upside. I could tell that the bussers were anxious, and overtly so (as exhibited by the hasty fashion in which they removed empty plates from the table, including a partially finished appetizer plate--they took it without asking) to boot us out, due to the quickly approaching closing time, all in spite of our patient wait to be seated.  I peg this Vic & Anthony's at a "dirty" 3--dirty because Yelp! does not allow me to enter 2.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2f29SRD_3BIIX1amHXtKug.text: This is gonna be a long one. We were lucky enough to have our boss take us here on a Friday night for dinner. It was phenomenal. Our server was Ben, and he was very patient, knowledgeable, and friendly.   Drinks: I had a McCallan 15 on the rocks that was a generous pour. Our boss also bought a bottle of the house Cabernet Sauvignon that was great.   Appetizers: the bacon is awesome. The glaze on it is sweet and smoky. I usually don't like to eat too much thick bacon/pork belly because it's salty, but I could've eaten this all night.  The oysters Rockefeller were very good.   The calamari was crispy and seasoned well. What made it great was the bed of grilled onions and peppers it sat on. They were so flavorful and tender.   Sides: we shared some sides. The mushrooms were charred and tasty.  The creamed spinach was my favorite. The creamed corn was really good. The duck fat potatoes and the Mac and cheese were good, but I wished I had more spinach and corn.  The entrees: I had the 12oz filet with bearnaise and crabmeat on top. The steak was very good. Cooked to my liking and had a good flavor. I didn't care for the bearnaise but others in our group that got it loved it. I just scraped it off and ate the crabmeat, no big deal.   There was an 8oz filet/5oz lobster special that a few people got. They loved it.   The atmosphere was fun. Even though it was fine dining we were still able to enjoy ourselves. It was louder than your normal high end place which we all liked.   Hopefully we'll come back here next year. We had a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IO4I_DcYLy3ZJ8t6UteaWw.text: To set the stage my wife and the rest of our party were there on May 8th for our Anniversary.  We had renewed our vowels and were still dressed from the event.   Service and food were great.  I didn't mind paying the price for a nice dinner, but it is not over priced for the quality of food and service.  Everything was outstanding.  I had the snake river farms ribeye.  It literally melts in your mouth.  If I had a complaint it would have been our table location.  We were sat at the closest table to the bar.  There is a hall wall dividing the bar from the dining area.  Avoid the area if your there for the ambiance.  The TV was on and the glare was a bit distracting.   It definitely took away from the ambiance of the restuarant.  There should not be a television in that atmosphere.  Then as it got busier a customer used the half wall as his leaning post right behind my wife bumping her a few times.  Staff told him to move a couple times, but he never did.  It did not ruin the experience.

YHoTAtQo0H45YkvXQuojGA.text: OMG. This is the best old school steakhouse in town as far as I'm concerned. Dark and cozy, intimate seating, ambiance. The main menu is wonderful but asked the the SPECIAL menu. Same options better prices. You will get salad, entree, sides and desert for less than ala cart on main menu. Service was amazing. Looking forward to going back soon.

QAZgLc1G1ga09H-L568Atw.text: Went here for dinner with my hubby, I got the special of the day lobster with steak and it was delicious, with a house margarita...wow that was delicious too. The restaurant is a bit on the dark side. Will definitely go back great service & food.
