iJ5iUE-T9d_xydR7yJhrog.text: Awesome environment. Had our anniversary dinner here. Service was spectacular, was constantly checked in on and was offered a vast explanation of the menu and wines. Only negative was we showed up maybe ten minutes late to our reservation and they had already given our table away. Despite that, we were still seated very quickly. Will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vv9Qp-vYf-uIEjt68Xvo8Q.text: I just came here for a dirty martini, it was amazing! I had a feeling they'd be pretty good at making a vodka martini, they were wonderful. The food looked very delicious but I really was going go for the liquid dinner. The menu is extensive and great options. Enjoy!

lGeouc9s6gnG9EVEEV7VYg.text: I wish I could say this restaurant is as professional as others within the GOLDEN NUGGET Casino & Resort in Las Vegas.  Unfortunately, I don't see this as being an accurate statement.  I made a reservation thru Open Table 7/25 in the early afternoon for the following evening of 7/26.  It was accepted.  I showed up at the Nugget the afternoon of 7/26 and suddenly, my cell phone text stated THE RESTAURANT had arbitrarily canceled my dinner reservation.  As a woman who dines solo (widow) this was most disconcerting.  I therefore made a reservation at the lovely Chart House within (undoubtedly better in ALL respects I discovered...) but returned to V&C's restaurant and inquired, "what happened" ???  They took my name and number and a day later, STILL no response as to WHY.  I don't deal well with such poor service and rudeness.   I don't need to.  So I think it's pretty clear I won't be choosing this restaurant in the lovely Golden Nugget in the future, for myself or visiting family and friends.

ja6BG55nBfhTokncSlxe7A.text: It good food  Everything good Good time in here If next time come to Las Vegas I gonna be back again

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eXt-a5RtYGkZAnuSnl1Iig.text: I am this steakhouse's biggest fan! I highly recommend that you dine here if you haven't already! The service is great and the service is even better! They truly understand guest service and how to properly treat people. By the way, server Matt and Ben are awesome! Ask them when you get sat!

cp-l6LURtwMusDWTvin_Vg.text: Still superb after an 8 year lapse between visits. It seems the decor has had a nice refresh since our last visit, either that or I was too drunk to remember what the place looked like the first time I was here. It is very dimly lit, but the huge Tiffany-inspired stained glass lamps and dark wood give this place a very many, classic steakhouse vibe. Hector, our server was spectacular and service was prompt. Our water glasses never saw less than half full at any time and our cocktails did not take long to arrive.   The food speaks for itself. I had the very best filet I have ever tasted, which was only made better by the seared foie gras I happily paid extra for. Sides are huge and shareable, but my bacon and garlic enhanced Brussels sprouts made it down my gullet without assistance from the other members of my party. We mentioned that my brother-in-law was celebrating his 40th birthday and he received a lovely birthday dessert.   This certainly has to be the best steakhouse in Vegas. Be prepared to be well served, well fed, and to pay for it.

v3yPs4WSGDbg8SXzOwMYSA.text: Heard great things about this place but was really disappointed.   Aside from being inside a hotel with no parking, the restaurant was so dimly lit we needed flashlights.   They had no restrooms and the place was very cramped. However the trendy NY style decore was somewhat worth it.   Now on the food, had the surf n turf and the portions were tiny, like, one or two bites.   The steak was really aged and didn't taste that great. Seafood was actually decent but portions were tiny and expensive.   Just not worth the price or parking hassle.

LBqrmDFHhAkw739u93IP0Q.text: Delicious dinner after a day at the pool.  We had a delicious crab cake that was outstanding and then a pear Gorgonzola salad and the the surf and turf option.  There was a wait on a table but we sat in the bar with a full menu option.  The service was impeccable and the food was delicious.   The steak and lobster was delicious and I would order it again.  We did not finish with dessert but watched the table beside us as they enjoy the most amazing dessert that opened as a chocolate sauce was poured over it.   I would order that if we came back to the Golden Nugget to stay.

My7YlCeDkQra8DLSvKocFQ.text: If you are looking for an inexpensive steak dinner, Vic and Anthony's is not where you should be focusing your attention. That being said, if you are looking for a great steak and are willing to part with a few Andrew Jackson's (or more), then Vic and Anthony's is worth a visit. All of the steaks come ala carte and the side dishes will set you back a few bucks as well.   I opted for the 8 oz. Filet Mignon and Garlic Mashed Potatoes. The steak was cooked to perfection and the potatoes were outstanding. Although the side dishes are a little pricey, the portion size is generous enough to share. I would rate the steak and mashed potatoes as some of the best I've ever had.  They also offer chicken, fish and lobster, but all in our party opted for beef. I will say the Australian Lobster tails on display looked rather tasty though. If you are a salad aficionado, they have you covered there too with eight to choose from on the menu. They have a fairly extensive beverage list, including specialty drinks, wine and bottled beers.   The service was impeccable and the atmosphere was what you would expect from a high class steak house. Located inside the Golden Nugget Casino, the clientele ranged from those in tuxedos and dresses, to others in blue jeans and T-shirts. Typical Vegas tourism in an upscale environment.  My 8 oz. Filet was $41 and the side dishes ranged from $9 - $12. The three of us split two sides, or Accompaniments, as the menu refers to them. We ordered a Crab Cake appetizer (not listed on the menu) at the recommendation of the waiter. It was outstanding, despite the $21 price tag for one four ounce Crab Cake.  For dessert, I went with the Chocolate Mousse. One in the party got the cheesecake, which rivaled any I'd seen before. All total, for the three of us, including a few adult beverages and the tip, we left happy and satisfied, even after dropping just north of $300.  If you are looking for a great meal, in a great atmosphere with outstanding service, and don't mind dropping a few bucks, I would recommend Vic & Anthony's. Their menu is also available on the Golden Nugget website, so you can peruse it before you go.

6THEAlODajyERpHFBq0awg.text: Had dinner here with my wife on Monday.  This was my second visit and once again the food was incredible.  We started off with the spicy calamari, which was a fresh take on one of our favorite appetizers.  We both had the fillet and lobster special for $75.  The steaks were cooked perfectly medium rare.  This is my go to steakhouse in Vegas going forward.

S2TqHwROmScCXlq_-Ksh3g.text: Absolutely one of the best steaks and service I've ever had.   Really lives up to the hype!!   The sourdough bread and butter were a great start. I ordered a New York Strip with a side of wild mushrooms.  Absolutely delicious!!!  The special was an 8oz filet and lobster with a side of potatoes which the man got.    The lobster had a small kick to it but definitely not too spicy.    The filet just melted in you mouth.   Can't wait for next year's visit to Nugget and out return visit to Vic and Anthony's.

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet/ lobster tail combo

y0obb-IMg-pNU3keYO2FrA.text: We were staying at Golden Nugget, and we decided to just go downstairs for my birthday. I was taken upstairs this time. Even tho I had a couple of groups near me it was very quiet and private. Their service was professional. I liked Oyster Rockefeller for appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m8wZ9BnpYBUD17yz4Zs5Hg.text: The service here is impeccable. I had an 8 oz filet and my son had the rib eye. Both were cooked to perfection and very flavorful. The wine selection is impressive and side dishes are almost unnecessary due to the delectable presentation of the entree. The dessert selection is mouth watering. Can't wait to return. Thank you Vic & Anthony's for a lovely dining experience.

wB6IImcVoSFBZU9XWi3fLg.text: Seriously the best Tomahawk Steak I have EVER had! Impressed!!! Amazing Lobster too!! Great service!!! Not only is downtown Vegas a must, this place is the best place to eat! Hands down! I come here for business twice a year and now this place is a must every time we visit Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C1au_I4sud64JIBZJEXAcA.text: A wonderful old school experience. We ate off the Distinctive Dining menu.Our server Anika was friendly and helpful. We started with Lobster Bisque which was delicious ,followed by Filet Mignon which just melted in your mouth. Anika helped choose some great wine and we left with an enormous portion of Bread pudding. If I had to fault something it would be the lighting-we are all for dimming down but when your server needs a torch to show the wine list......????? Nevertheless we had a wonderful meal and will be back.

hB1f-w_XyJ-jlxWwOizF2w.text: I fully expected to be giving Vic & Anthony's five stars, but it turns out that I can't.  First impressions were excellent.  A beautifully appointed room in "Old Vegas" style, with lots of dark wood and leather.  The hostess was very nice, and seated us immediately.  The drinks were generous, and reasonably priced.  The bread basket was crusty French bread - not terribly innovative, but good.  Our waiter took our order timely.  So far, everything was as expected.  So, we get to the food.  My lobster bisque was good, but not the best I have had.  Ditto the Oysters Rockefeller, which was kind of drenched with Parmesan.  My side of potatoes au gratin was also along the lines of a lot of cheese with some potatoes mixed in.  Not that I mind that, but just know that your dinner is getting to be rich, rich, rich.  Then there was the filet.  It looked right, but the texture was a little bit mealy.  I could still have given five stars, but for the prices which I will get to in a moment.  However, I then asked my wife about her meal.  She said that her tomato salad was kind of ordinary, and her fried lobster mac & cheese was simply not to her taste.  So let's talk prices.  There are many excellent steak houses in Las Vegas, including downtown (Joe Vicari's Andiamo Italian Steakhouse, for example) with equally nice ambiance, even better food, and generally lower prices.  That fact would have convinced me not to go back to V&A's, except for one thing - after we had dined I became aware of the little-known "Distinctive Dining Menu."  In order to take advantage of this discounted prix fixe menu, you have to print it out off the web site, and bring it in with you when you arrive.  This menu has a three course dinner, including some fine choices (both my lobster bisque and filet would have been available off of this menu) at a fixed price of $52.  That's a pretty good deal, and I would go back for it.  If I had to order off of the main menu, though, I would go elsewhere.

p9bnduRzNs1klJGc4xDQyw.text: Delicious dinner. $205 later and the food was the best we had so far during our stay here.   For appetizers, my spouse ordered cold shrimp and crab martini while I had the lobster bisque. For dinner he ordered a prime rib steak with asparagus and au gratin potatoes. I had shrimp pasta. We paired all of this with a bottle of white wine.   Sounds crazy that we went $205 on food when we can get this anywhere else for cheaper, but it was the best food so far since we've been here. The service was excellent. Our waiter I believe his name was Mario kept checking in on us, laughed with us, and congratulated us on our engagement.

4PCaOo6oYvDvdP0kTBOcjg.text: Prior to our trip to Vegas, I went on a Yelp bookmarking spree for places to eat and visit, and one of the restaurants that I bookmarked was Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse. Luckily for us, the restaurant is located at the Golden Nugget, where we were staying. We also received a $125 gift certificate for the restaurant after attending a timeshare presentation. It seems like we were destined to dine there!  We were able to make a reservation easily through OpenTable on the Yelp app. As we entered the restaurant, we were awed by the restaurant's display of live lobsters as well as steaks and huge lobster tails. The restaurant itself was dimly lit and had jazz music playing in the background.  The food at Vic & Anthony's was delectable! To start off our meal, we had the seared scallops with crisp apple slaw; the scallops were perfectly seared and paired well with the mouthwatering apple slaw. We also had the pear and saga blue cheese salad; loved the combination of flavors! My boyfriend and I both ordered the filet mignon and shared a side of au gratin potatoes. Both of our steaks were tender and cooked perfectly to our preference. We ended our meal with their vanilla bean creme brulee...yum!  The service at the restaurant was fast, attentive, and accommodating. When we first got there, the hostesses were friendly and they promptly guided us to our table. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu, and even gave us some wine samples to help us choose what we wanted to drink. Our water glasses were never empty, and our completed dishes were taken in a timely manner.  Overall, Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse has tasty food and amazing service!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Bean Creme Brûlée
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon and Au Gratin Potatoes
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pear &amp; Saga Blue Cheese Salad

nXFQbK_3rN_KSRyEEEXV1g.text: It's a unique hidden little gem. Very old school playing great music with a dark & sexy atmosphere. The food is always delicious with huge portions. We can never finish it all!  I highly recommend them to all who enjoy steak houses. Parking is never available so plan on parking somewhere near the Golden Nugget but the hotel itself is beautiful, they've done an amazing job renovating the old place. The food is amazing so it's all worth it. I'm a huge fan of this place. Great service as well & bring your appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croissant bread pudding &amp; chocolate mousse!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon, halibut, potatoes &amp; creamed spinach! So so so delicious....
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque &amp; wedge salad! Amazing!

CYG4_ozv-8CUcoJ0q5yDqQ.text: First time at Vic and Anthony's last night.  Del Frisco's is our go-to but wanted to compare and V & A's is right with them!  Five stars.  Delicious steak.  Split the porterhouse with my husband.  The creamed spinach is to die for!  Au gratin potatoes - fantastic.  I did the strawberry basil martini - nice pour.  Husband did the mule.  Very tasty.  And cannot leave out the best crab cake I have ever had!  Great vibe.  Dark, romantic, cool.  Prices are on par with Vegas and for a high end steakhouse.  Awesome service.  Stayed on top of us all night as we had a show to get to.   Would of loved to have stayed for more drinks and conversation; the ambience is great.  I will totally bring the whole family back when they are here for the holidays.

UnjlvCrhIUerdDFnVxLeEQ.text: I'm sure this place is often great but it was run of the mill the night we visited for a business dinner.   The restaurant seemed more concerned about themselves and their desired processes vs. the customers. Restaurant was extremely dark with no rest room. You had to leave and go through an extremely smoky casino. Not a big deal for a quick meal - but not a good setting for a business dinner where you're doing a lot of talking.  Food was good / very good. I wasn't thrilled with the recommendation from the waiter and it was just okay for the price.   Worst part - they delayed us on the food order - and then brought out all our food at once! If this happens at Applebee's - no problem - this should not happen at a high end steakhouse. Even worse - the wait staff never took away my plates (salad) and it was saddled next to me for the duration of the meal. 1st class pricing with 3rd class service.  Again - I'm sure you can have a better experience here. I won't be back to enjoy it with you. Too many options in Las Vegas to sit in a dark restaurant with zero ambiance and so-so service and food at high end prices. I have no problem paying for high end food / service - I just have some higher expectations.

K07MkMdXcDvftj7rvt7QSw.text: We decided to stop in because it was rated the #1 steakhouse in Las Vegas. There is also a Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse back home in NJ in Atlantic City so we decided to try it out. We ordered from a $52 pre fixe menu that they have. They do not put this menu out but after looking at reviews on here, we decided to ask about it and our server was nice enough to print it out for us. The pre fixe menu included an appetizer, entree, and dessert. I got the lobster bisque soup as the appetizer which was amazing and my boyfriend got the Caesar salad which also delicious because it tasted so fresh. As an entree, we each got the 8 oz filet mignon. The filet was by far the best we've had out of all the steakhouses I've ever been to. For dessert, I got the bread pudding and my boyfriend got the raspberry toffee cheesecake. I got the bread pudding after our server, Hector, recommended it. It was amazing! It was topped off with a scoop of ice cream as well. The cheesecake was also delicious. Last but not least, the service was incredible. Hector was not only professional, but was also very helpful when it came to recommendations! We will be returning again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Au Gratin Potatoes
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of Broccoli

3E-B6NKmdM90dCTYJrmnOQ.text: Terrible place to eat. The food was decent but the service was terrible. The evening manager apologized to us for some network issues they were having that prevented us from paying a portion of our bill with a $150 gift card that we had. He said that he knew we were locals and would like to invite us back to enjoy the place properly in the future. That was several weeks ago and he hasn't called us as he said he would. As far as I can tell, he was simply lying to us because he wanted to make sure he had our phone number available in the event that our gift card didn't have the amount on it that we said it did. Could've been handled much, much better. The relatively small cost of dinner for two, including a credit card on hold for the remaining balance after the gift card was applied, meant more to him than our review to others and the fact that we won't visit the establishment again.

aA1JXRQcAwFaXXOa2vi3PQ.text: AMAZING. This is the best restaurant I have EVER eaten in my whole life. This restaurant is located in Downtown Vegas in the Golden Nugget hotel. Compared to other restaurants I have seen in Vegas this one is a bit smaller, which isn't a bad thing because it provided a more intimate/romantic feeling to it. The staff was amazing and on top of everything. The only thing I did not like about this restaurant was the bathroom. It was located outside the restaurant in the casino. Seemed a little out of the way to me. The Food. Appetizer 1: Oyster Rockefeller yelp.com/biz_photos/vic-... This was my first time trying oyster Rockefeller. It tasted amazing! This was a great way to start our dinner. It also came with half a dozen. Appetizer 2: Steak Tartare yelp.com/biz_photos/vic-... This app is served on a salt block (which was amazing because I have never had anything served on a salt block before, only seen it on iron chief) comes with chips, cornichons and whole grained mustard. TASTED AMAZING. I think everyone should try this. Entree 1: 8 oz. Filet Mignon I ordered this for dinner and added the Jumbo Lump Crab Oscar topping. Wow. It tasted great. Entree 2: 16 oz. New York Sirloin My boyfriend ordered this for his entree and he said it was amazing. Side: Mashed potato GOOD! Overall, this restaurant was fantastic and everything tasted amazing. I will 100% recommend this place to all of my friends that go to Vegas :)

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Tartare (MUST TRY!)

KJikrUIOWGDe8CfXt2Ulug.text: Great atmosphere, wonderful service & the food was a hit! We had filet, lobster, wine and salads. The steak was cooked perfectly and just melted in your mouth!

bjD0Ej7-8hPVcBs1WUtn6Q.text: Excellent restaurant. The filet mignon was perfect. The tuna was delicious and the sides were perfect. True old school steakhouse with the vibe to match. I need to add the outstanding service.

q127YbgEZi8x3qxvcEjJzw.text: If I have to rate top five steaks I'd ever had, this is one of them. It isn't cheap either. And remember, when you order steak, it is steak only. There are no salad or potatoes.   Make sure you make an reservation first because the line is long. Parking can be an issue too. I had to park at palaza casino across street .  The steak was made perfect. Every bite was succulent, and full of flavorite. No need pepper, salt, or steak sauce. Service is very good as well. The bill was 140 for three of us and we didn't order wine.  1 year later, second time is still memorable .

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect steak

MUfdoxrCkd-jyJpqeNsS-w.text: I love this place. The food here is incredibly delicious. It's located in the Golden Nugget. We were seated right away, but of course we had reservations.  I ordered the filet as my entree, medium rare. This was one of the first times I wished I had ordered it medium. It was seasoned really well and had great flavor, but a couple more seconds on the flame would have been perfect for me. They have a variety of specialty cocktails. I can't wait to go back! Too bad there isn't hoverboard parking or else I'd be there weekly.

-86xfEJ0iE0PIc8fWkf8fw.text: Amazing absolutely yummy! Steak was cooked perfectly !! Duck potatoes to die for! I also had the salmon that was so yummy!!!  Had the lobster bisque yum yum yum!!!Pleasant atmosphere glad we tried it! Perfect for celebrations!!

ax-JRq5jkFpf_XwPx1ybdQ.text: We went to Vic and Anthony's for our five year wedding anniversary and it did not disappoint. Located in the Golden Nugget in front of a chocolate shop, you walk in and see their meat display and lobsters, dim lighting, cozy setting with the chairs close but not too close to each other, friendly and quick service, and oh the food. My husband usually only gets one thing when we go to steak restaurants and that is a filet mignon. Lets say he has had quite a number of filets and this place served it just perfectly. The filet was the perfect texture, not rubbery or chewey, melts in your mouth, wonderful color when cut, and does not need any help to boost the flavor because its all there. I had a few bites and it was excellent.  I have never had a sea bass and since they had it on special I went ahead and ventured on in there and ordered their sea bass. I was not disappointed at all. I like my fish a little salty and again this did not need any salt or boost, it was everything I expected and more. Their potato puree is amazing as well. Their bread is great and since it was our anniversary we got a complimentary cake. Layers of chocolate, peanut butter and raspberry. It was a big slice as well and we were already too full to finish it but oh it was delicious as well. Our server was polite and fast.

BYKBYwa0Ul4Q3mpPTCOjjg.text: If you are looking for a really great steak but don't want to pay the crazy prices on the strip, Vic & Anthony's is the place for you! The food and wine were FANTASTIC and we loved the dark, intimate, old-school Chicago steakhouse feel of the place. If you're staying on the strip, coming to Vic & Anthony's is also a great excuse to check out Fremont Street, a must-do in my book!

FnyFIKFy9ASUCxqqj0axCA.text: Just a bad night. Maybe but, bad service and food is unforgivable when paying big dollars. Nothing more to say.

LRmSeKLVZGRYnPRF-87JkA.text: Whatever you say I don't care. I was amazed by the chefs choice. I had prime bone in Ribeye. Delicious delicious super super. I do recommend this place for the steak! !!!

nFCrFxYgo1Et4U82uTzMtw.text: Great steakhouse with wood and leather decor with Art Deco stained glass chandeliers. Wait staff is attentive without being obtrusive. A half pound of crab legs was plenty for me, but they also offer a full pound serving size.  TIP: the quail appetizer can also be made into an entree size. Definitely save room for their croissant bread pudding.

WdflibzFhMX3gp2kmYWK_g.text: Best steak place I have ever been to. Restaurant was very nice, service was great, filet was perfect, baked potato was out of this world. Only complaint was bad key lime pie. Wasn't fresh, graham cracker crust was hard.

L_tRAGZlRNKkeDchW1yBig.text: Authentic atmosphere. Classic service. Good ambient temperature for our preference (means not too cold). I love here.

l5InUbUBuDOUsXVU_GKjDQ.text: Excellent service, beautiful atmosphere and delicious food. Perfect way to celebrate my BF's 40th. The staff was extremely attentive and helpful with our selections. We had a promotional dinner special I received via email, it included soup or salad, 1 entree, 1 side and 1 dessert, per person. Turned out to be way too much food...we all ended up waddling away with "to go" boxes...but it was well worth it. The sides are enormous, they are meant to be shared so keep that in mind when ordering. For the 7 of us I would say 3 sides would have been sufficient. We had  2 potatoes, 2 creamed corn, 2 broccoli, and 1 order of onion strings. My favorite was the creamed corn (which I would have never ordered on my own)...and the onions strings which went well with my perfectly cooked filet. I also enjoyed the rich lobster bisque...had just the right amount of yummy, chunks of lobster. Delicious! But the real star for my sweet tooth was the creme brulee...it was HUGE! It's served in a shallow, but wide bowl so you had a lot of hard shell to share :). Although the promotion was an excellent deal, I wouldn't order again (way too much food)...That said, I will be returning...very soon.

7YP-7_yigC9TfZnGgcrYzw.text: Consistency!!!!! This is the word that you can expect when dining here. Our visit this time was with a group of new customers that we needed to make a favorable impression with. Not a problem!!!! Over the top service, food was A+++, ambience for our group in private dining area was excellent. Menu selections for every taste!!

E93MEW1twsDWnVYQIyJKoA.text: Awesome restaurant it's my favorite place in Vegas. They have New York strip to die for. They have a romantic atmosphere. Warning the restaurant has dim lighting perfect for a dinner date. They do offer a delicious lobster bisque. And they have the best creme brulee in town!

vb09pYPJZnzofrmJen9SBw.text: Love the old Vegas feel. Best bone in Ribera and creamed spinach. Great service..! Will b back. :) nice to get off strip 4 fabulous meal.

OfCJ1q5bEOAR2YFI_R2x_w.text: Not a bad place at all so don't let my 3 stars think that is is not a great place but we ordered 2 dishes-the filet and the tuna. The Filet Mignon was some of the best steak i have had-yummy yummy yummy. The tuna was not that great and i barely ate any of it.  Wouldn't recommend it to anyone at all.   Decor is dark and almost feel like you walked into a SpeakEasy. The TV at the bar kind of threw the whole thing off though. Unless there is some big event that everyone wants to watch like the Derby or Super Bowl, it should be turned off. It really detracted from the cool ambiance the restaurant had.  The wine list is extensive and they truly have it all-even Screaming Eagle which is rare to find. If you go, get the Filet Mignon and you will have a fabulous dinner!

xEzwHmbNysx3R3hx4RpwOA.text: Just had the best steak I've had in at least a decade tonight. We had drunks before we got here which I should've slowed down on but once we got out food, I was just blown away. And to make things worse I was so toasted I forgot to take pics. Damnit. Haha. Next it's dinner before the drinks. My dinner date had so much wine she's passed out next to me. This place was money well spent and we'll definitely be back sooner than later. Our waiter Jim? was excellent. Best lamb cutlets I've had since Australia. Next time no scotch since it doesn't mix well with lobster bisque. Anyhow, if you want great food downtown on the old strip off Fremont, this is a small place but you'll enjoy it. 5 full steins from me..

tfGtuSJtaliGMAX-Vn8c0w.text: 5 star from start to finish.. I dined with a party of 8 and every person was happy.  All servings are huge.  You could easily share salads, sides, and deserts.  I loved the ambiance of the restaurant.  It felt, sounded, smelled, etc. like a steak house.

OHP_PDNhL3-68xtREDHWBw.text: Overall an average steakhouse. Steaks were not cooked to order but only slightly off. Not enough to complain to management but enough to complain to your dinning partner. When we ordered a side of lobster tail with the large steak we assumed it was a side. But it was actually the $169 monster tail that we would never have ordered as an add-on. The appetizers and some sides were good but the potatoes au gratin were salt with a side of potato. Place has potential but not enough for me to go back

yxJAh1ezS7w0vD6rxDVVAg.text: My mother and I were excited to spend our recent winnings on a great steak dinner and Vic & Anthony's turned out to be a major disappointment. After seeing the 4.5 star average on Yelp I was expecting greatness, however the food and service were mediocre/poor. I hate to give negative reviews, but this place deserved it in my mind. I hope my Yelp friends who gave this place 4 or 5 stars would crusify me.  My mother had the Tuna Tartar with avocado, citrus vinaigrette & chips. We both liked it, but it didn't blow us away. I ordered the Prime Ribeye with the au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach. My ribeye came out and we were told the side dishes were coming in "ten seconds".  A few minutes later our waitress came by to see how everything was and I informed her that I still haven't started to eat my steak since I am waiting for my sides. She assured me they will be out shortly. Seven minutes after my steak they finally came! Bullshit! I expect my sides to come out at the same time as my steak so I can enjoy them together. I think that is pretty standard and not an outlandish request. When they were brought to our table there was no apology for the delay. Unlike other steakhouses I have been to Vic & Anthony's didn't serve the first scoop of the side dish onto your plate. I know that makes me sound like some regal, high expectation asshole, but I'm sorry, that's one of the many things that makes the best steakhouses stand out (Mastro's for example). I wasn't crazy about the creamed spinach and the au gratin potatos were waaaaaaay to cheesy for my liking. The steak was not what I was hoping for.  Lastly, our waitress was inattentive, unfriendly, unapologetic, and I don't think smiled once throughout our meal. Maybe it was an off night, but when you are paying big bucks for a nice steak dinner there should be no off nights. I'll be back in downtown Las Vegas in two weeks and I will be sure to avoid Vic & Anthony's.

pnB1_5JJoMc3BWYgJUTiIQ.text: This was a fantastic dining experience.  First of all, the meal was perfect but the service was incredible.  I regret forgetting the name of our waiter, a young man from South Africa, but I will say his level of service went above and beyond.  He really made us feel special.  We started our meal with the Oysters Rockefeller and they were probably the most amazing Oysters Rockefeller I have ever had.  Soo good, so creamy and perfect.  We then had the lobster bisque and just that soup was worth coming in.  It was incredible, so delicious, so perfect.  Later on that night I wanted to go back just to have more soup.  It was the best Lobster Bisque I have ever tasted.  We shared the Porterhouse for 2.  The meat was perfection and we had the Mac and Cheese side, yes it was rich, but I was on vacation so I treated myself.  It was perfect.  Finished off with a complimentary Creme Brulee to celebrate my sister's birthday.  It was very delicious.  I will say the meal was amazing and the service was 5 stars.  Will definitely eat here again.  I hope I get the same waiter.

f4rTlirSAKkyADtTFLSMAw.text: V & A lived up to all the reviews!  Service was fantastic, lobster bisque was creamy and delicious, and the NY strip melted in my mouth.  Highly recommended!

0qkaa7SH7dj9MQcymGALZw.text: One of several restaurants inside The Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino, Vic & Anthony's is a classic steakhouse, full of old Vegas charm with a modern twist. While not inexpensive, the menu provides value if you order correctly because the portions are HUGE - almost too big to share between only two people! My best friend and I shared an amazing artisan cheese plate (market price, $26), each had a salad (she, the Pear & Saga Blue Cheese; me, the Classic Wedge) and finally split Chicken Paige. In the salad course, we questioned how we could even ATTEMPT to eat our entree, so large were the two previous portions.   Our table service was perfect: a charming, well-informed waiter, at the ready with suggestions. The host/hostess stand could use a few pointers, however. Our 8:30 PM reservation became a 9:00 PM seating, seemingly because a wedding party staged an impromptu post-ceremony dinner. Likely because the restaurant sits on the main corridor of the Golden Nugget's shops, bars and restaurants, its seating area is limited to one, very small, two-person bench. Waiting consists of wandering around in the fluorescent horror of the meeting point of consumerism and casino gambling or clinging to the wall inside the dark hipness of the restaurant, with the glow of the cold case and lobster tank as light sources. That's jarring enough, but the hostess and host talking about how much they hate Friday nights while failing to recognize incoming guests isn't exactly a confidence booster. Thankfully, we shook the wait off easily once we were seated.     This is old school, coursed dining, so don't expect a quick meal between table games or use it as a stop on a stroll of Fremont Street. Prepare to linger in its dark, vintage ambiance over an incredible wine list, a menu filled with a options a plenty (even vegetarians can find something) and some great people watching. DO heed the warnings about entree and side sizes: either go hungry or attempt to choose one side for every two to three people at the table. The desserts we saw were far closer to individual size, but - especially after a meal like one could easily have - sharing those might be an excellent idea too.  While casual dress seems allowable, select something finer and have a time-honored, high roller Vegas dinner, even if you don't gamble!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Tank!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderfully fresh lobster tails available for perusal at the door!

OWnn5W6nnK28XN6l8ERScg.text: Never in my life have I had a Fillet Mignon like this. It is impossible for anyone to make it better. Wonderful food, outstanding, actually more than outstanding service. Clearly one of the best, maybe THE best meal of my life. This place is heaven, expensive heaven, but heaven none the less.

1u1dtm8UQJjC2h7mSScYvA.text: The wife and I almost never spend $150+ on a meal, mostly because the expectations are so high, the results have a hard time living up. I would have been happy to pay double! This may have been the best meal I've even eaten. Steaks cooked perfectly, seafood risotto was amazing, and enough for two. I would seriously consider eating only one or two meals a week, just so I could afford to eat here!

j5EMA67sLRPhfcSsblkfsQ.text: The last time my father in-law was in town, he went to Vic & Anthony's with a friend and enjoyed it so much, he needed to go back... I was a little hesitant going to a steakhouse as my last few experiences have been bleh sides and grumpy waiters.  First, the atmosphere is perfect. We sat at the bar as the 4 of us were very causal. Very comfortable bar stools, spacious, nice dark lighting, perfect old music...  The portions are huge so be careful of over ordering as we did. The broiled portabella was juicy and tasty. The caprese salad was very well prepared. The tower of chips and onion strings were ok (the chips were better, but a gigantic portion of onion strings)  Next came the wedge salad. They cut it in half for my husband and I to split, and my plate alone was a huge dinner portion salad! Very crisp fresh iceberg lettuce and they served it on a chilled plate! Very smart touch.  Finally, my husband and I split sides: Broccoli, creamed corn, grilled asparagus, and the baked potato no bacon. Again, huge sides. But all very good and very fresh. No microwave tasting potato or rubbery canned corn here.  OH I forgot another fantastic part. The Pinot Noir from Oregon is fantastically smooth. The cheese platter is delicious. Its pricey though.... says market price on the menu so ask if you are interested. Ours came out to $27 I think, but they gave us a variety of 8 cheese (good portions of each), honeycomb, seasonal, sweet blueberries and blackberries, and dried sugared orange rinds. Perfect spread to construct many tasty little cheese breads.  Will be back... great romantic spot for couples!

5o3xm1F95pqbcad_QvEIRA.text: I think Vic & Anthony's is, by far, the best restaurant downtown. I live in downtown Vegas and try to patronize the area as much as possible and I'm glad I tried V&A. My wife is in a wheelchair, and we had to wait a bit for a table, even with a reservation, because of the stairs to certain parts of the dining room.  No matter, the servers were all very solicitous, without being overpowering. All of our needs were met quickly; we never waited for anything.  Everything was delicious...Darlene had the lobster and filet special; I had bone-in ribeye. I've dined in many steakhouses here in Vegas, and this is up with the best (LV Weekly had it in its 2nd town). It's the slightest notch below CUT/Carnevino/ Prime triumverate. If I could award 4.5, or 4.7, I would. I just cant give it 5 stars, due to the ADA-unfriendly dining room and the fact that the above 3 (and apparently Ramsay and Old Homestead)are ridiculously sublime. But on a price/location/quality nexus, this place is in the top 10 in town. (Going back next week)

Agre4lNwd73hSA0Qv4DhXQ.text: Me and my party ate here last night for my friend's birthday. It was recommended by a friend so I thought to give it a try and I was not disappointed, It is located at the Golden Nugget Casino and near the entrance of the casino. We got there early. I recommend making reservations. We waited at the little bar which was small but well stocked and the service was good.  The atmosphere is old school steakhouse, dimly lit, leather chairs and wooden decor and even had some Frank Sinatra style jazzy music, how Las Vegas. It was crowded for a weekday and the noise level was a little loud. We were fortunate to get a very good waiter by the name of Hector. He was very professional, attentive and knowledgeable. We started with the lobster bisque, $9.99 which I would highly recommend. Me and my guest shared a porterhouse for 2 ($59.00 per person) and ordered sides of wild mushrooms and steamed broccoli. Everything is al a carte which is typical of fancy steakhouses. The wife had the grilled salmon that comes with lump crab meat. Well prepared and delicious. Her dish came with mashed potatoes and asparagus spears. The steak was a little undercooked for my taste, lots of rare for ordering medium but wonderful just the same. Along with a couple of nice glasses of Cabernet the bill came out to about $250,00. Not to bad for the money, after all this is Las Vegas, even if it is in the old side of casino row.  There are lots of great steakhouses in Las Vegas and I would like to check a few more of them out for comparison. I really liked this one though.

O_1KNJStaUGmcSxck1-NLA.text: I was excited to eat at Vic's in Vegas, I have been to the original in Houston. Our server Benjamin was nice and described the menu with his vast knowledge.  I wanted wine with my steak.  The wine list is extensive, so I asked for a reasonable priced bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon, nothing too expensive.  I thought he would recommend a 100-150 bottle.  He suggested a bottle that was $450.  I laughed.  He gave me attitude, so I ordered a kettle One martini.  After that his attitude and service changed.  The other server was nice and more helpful.  I ordered a Rib eye on the bone.  Extremely rare cut and it was delicious.  But the whole dining experience was tainted by the stuck up waiter.  We ate the next night at Hugo's Cellar at the Four Queens and had a terrific dinner.

nzc60RBOFNq41DT2-BOGSQ.text: Can't say enough...continues to be the most amazing meal in Vegas! Not to be missed. Its elegant, romantic, and top notch from top to bottom. All of the staff is highly trained to give you a 5 star experience. Everything on the menu is outstanding! Smart, friendly, and well worth your time/$$. Love it more everytime! Thank you Victor and Brian for an amazing anniversary!

XdXbTfagn9NTILayur6FyQ.text: I consider myself to be a True food snob. I have two business partners who think that I am too picky when we go out to eat. When it comes to fine dining I am more than picky. I do not smoke so I truly can taste my food. Vic and Anthony's was my best experience I have had at any fine dining establishment. I had the 12oz filet and a 3lb Maine lobster which both were perfect. I had the bone marrow to go wiht the steak and again along with the wild mushrooms it was just mouth watering good. My wife thoroughly enjoyed her food too and the service was outstanding. I will be back without a doubt.

6E9Un2KJHO50AeWYLGWKXw.text: Great exerience! Had the 8 oz filet mignon, it was cooked to perfection. Ordered a side of lobster risotto-delicious! The sides are MORE than enough for 2 people to share so  keep this in mind when ordering. Even the baked potato is HUGE, probably about equal to 3 average potatoes. Would eat here again in a heartbeat.

BE3PYuqFGAnf3J5kjMIpdA.text: I make it a point to get down to Freemont street to eat at V&A every single time I'm in Vegas (about twice a year).  They never fail to prepare steaks, chops and fish to perfection!  But the real charm is the service, they are formal and old school, the wait staff and bar staff know what they are doing, they are prompt with food and drink and don't steer you wrong when you have questions.  The wine list is fantastic as well.  The dark paneled atmosphere and big leather chairs make you comfortable to sit down and enjoy your meal.    This past visit (5/3/10) was no exception, we were dining with clients and part of our group was running way behind.  The hostess was able to work with us on our reservation and we happily split the time difference between the bar and munching on apps at the table, again perfect!  This is a steakhouse not to be missed!

wwlMbjtKnfGCfB9k2KYTDQ.text: This place was fantastic. Usually I am very cautious about eating at one of the restaurants in the hotel that I'm staying in. The Service was fantastic. We were there for our end of the year office trip and had 5 people. All of the food was served perfectly with no mistakes and was great. The atmosphere was perfect. You don't have to be super dressed up, dressy casual is just fine. It is a bit pricey though, that would be the only reason I didn't give it the full 5 stars. I would say it was apparent because the place was pretty empty for a Thursday night. Will I go back, yes!

cQqCQ6zDv-8I3tPbI7l3Hg.text: Absolutely delicious food and first-rate service.  Make sure to get the au gratin potatoes.

wILl9xhC_gHsBsLavUgNJg.text: My sister and I went here a while back and I can't say that I was blown over by the experience.   First off, let me say that the ambiance and service in this restaurant is impeccable. I wasn't crazy about being seating right next to the kitchen, but that's what you get for being two gals out on the town rather than a romantic couple in embrace. ;)   I ordered the bone-in rib eye, and my sister got the boneless rib eye. For sides we had the broccoli and the mashed potatoes. The sides were fantastic, and the steaks were well prepared, but they just seemed to be lacking in quality. They were a little tough and just didn't have much flavor, which is what I go to a steakhouse for.   I would actually try this place again, just to try their enormous lobster tails that you see on display in the front of the restaurant. And because it was a wonderfully run place. Maybe next time, I'll go for the prime rib and maybe it'll be better than the rib eye.

OAub1Rfa-3iDUFZ0t0IOgQ.text: I recently found myself in Vegas on business and decided to head down town on my last night on a recommendation to try Vic & Antimony's. I had read a few reviews and was excited to enjoy some of their signature items.  When I arrived I was impressed with the decor, which I like to describe as 1977 meets 2007.  It's got dark woods and some cream colors with heavy curtains, that adorn large windows and decorated walls. Very tasteful.  I immediately noticed the glass display case featuring rib-eye, new york, and porterhouse cuts as well as LARGE (and i mean HUGE) Australian cold water tails that were 18-20oz EACH. They also house two lobster tanks with 3-4 pound lobsters which they offer at $29 per pound (which I think is a little high).  We were sat at a nice table in the center of the restaurant and ordered several items.  I did not opt for the lobster tails, as they are $145 each (not a bad price, but a little outside my range for the evening). Next time though I will bring my brother and split a 12oz filet and 20oz lobster.  To start, we got the Calamari, which is tossed in a onion-pepper sauce. The portion was large and included LOTS of really nice caramelized onions, however in my opinion the sauce was too thick and the rings should have been tossed in it instead of just placed on top. Also the breading on the rings was more crumb based and heavy. Would have been better with panko. Rings and tentacles were nicely cooked however, not stringy or rubbery.  $12.95 7/10  Next we received the Pear and Saga Blue Cheese Salad, mixed field greens with teardrop tomatoes, candied pecans and house-made creamy vinaigrette.  A really excellent salad.  The pears were nice and ripe, the pecans crunchy and fresh. There was quite a bit of avocado as well, just enough dressing which was sweet, tangy and slightly thickened. A nice compliment to the pear and cheese.  I would go back for this one again. 11.50. 10/10  Our third course was their famous lobster bisque. It's not an overly large portion, but what was lacking in quantity was more than made up for in quality.  I've had few better bisques.  Rich and creamy (but not overly so) this dish did NOT suffer from having too much sherry cream, but at the same time the sherry flavor was front and center but not overbearing. It's also finished with cognac, and that is easily tasted too.  Decent amount of lobster meat, intense (in a good way) lobster flavor. I could eat it non-stop! 10/10 A STEAL at $9.95.  Main Course was the Sea Bas ala Nage.  They use Chilean Sea Bass as the protein, sauteed in a Dunginess crab butter sauce, balsamic, harcourt verts, roasted tomatoes and topped with a few lumps of dungeness crab.  I've eaten a lot of chilean sea bass in my day, it's probably my favorite protein. This ranks in the top 2 for sure.  Wonderfully cooked, perfect crust on the fish, perfectly accompanied by the butter sauce, nicely cut by the sharpness of the balsamic. Verts were al dente, and nicely cooked. The mound of roasted tomatoes also helped cut the natural oiliness of the bass.  Melt in your mouth. A True triumph. $36.95 10/10  I also tried some of the 8oz filet, and it was beautifully done and seasoned. Rock salt in the preparation makes all the difference! I definitely would not hesitate to order cut beef at this restaurant if I was in the mood. They offer a number of sauces including a bone marrow borderlaise, which wasn't ordered, but I would love to try it in the future.  9/10  For desert we ordered their famous bread pudding, which is served like a layer cake slice in a pool of whiskey sauce alongside praline ice cream, and a brittle sculpture (edible).  Amazing.  Totally moist, amazing flavors. Everything you want out of a bread pudding without the sloppy look. Ice cream was divine.  I ate pretty much the entire brittle decoration which was killer good as well. 10/10 We also got a flour-less chocolate cake topped with unsweetened whipped cream and surrounded by chocolate sauce. VERY DENSE, very good.  Somehow not overbearing and dry-tasting like ones I have had at Ruth's Chris. Difficult to eat all of on your own. Split the chocolate if you get it. 9/10.  I also got earl grey tea, which I wouldn't normally mention, but it came in a very interesting tea pot of stainless and blown glass. Hard to explain but I thought it was neat.  If you're a tea drinker try it.  The tea itself was excellent as well.  All in all, this is one of my new favorite restaurants in Las Vegas and I will be returning as soon as I can for that massive Lobster!

8ygBVGXEwHfr1TIgly2OCw.text: My new favorite steakhouse in vegas, and I've been to many. Great service, drinks, and huge portions. Make sure to share sides and desert, they're enormous.

WSWbIHQ0ykGIh1Hai2tg8w.text: Best steakhouse in Las Vegas.  Excellent service, the food is amazing, and they have a great wine list.  Try the wild mushrooms, I swear the sauce with that is made with crack, it's that good.

Hg8Xf1rVkqQYTC0FZEdQ8g.text: Au gratin potatoes are amazing. Both steaks I've tried we great. Service? Meh.

nGcupn43536tByseXRcVpw.text: I real gem in old downtown. I've been to this restaurant 3 times and every time it gets better. The service is nearly perfect and the food is consistently excellent.  My most recent visit a friend and I started at the bar and decided to have a few appetizers, oysters rockafeller - Scallops (with a slaw that will knock you out) and an heirloom tomato caprese style. All we're awesome.  The atmosphere is great as you'll hear conversation, laughter, great tunes in the background and little else. The staff are veterans that know the hospitality gig cold. Treat yourself to a good time and give this place a whirl.

Qxzw71zmuRA9irIsedX6Kg.text: One of the great things about living in Vegas is that we have some of the best restaurants! Last night we had a fabulous dinner at Vic & Anthony's Steak House. The Tuna Tartare and The Steak Tartare were delicious, the Filet was so tender it melted in your mouth, the cream of corn and the potatoes were delicious. The service was impeccable.

xPIOEYZPrYTBVvv2qJXmcw.text: Maple glazed quail, prime ribeyes,  awesome mushrooms, and potatoes au gratin.  Enough said. You will not be disappointed. I have dined at fine steakhouses all over, from Chicago, to New York and between. Definitely worth the visit!

jorRyrJkTzDwnUfzwTNXKA.text: Hands down, this is my favorite restaurant ever! I always stay in the Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget (which is fabulous) when I am in Vegas and going to Vic and Anthony's is always an event. Anything you order on the menu is to die for and the service is impeccable. The atmosphere is very classy but not snotty at all. The most amazing part is their prices are extremely reasonable, especially for a nice steakhouse. Save yourself the trouble of breaking the bank at one of the fancy steakhouses on the Strip and head downtown :o)

s4Z6x8M9Qpv7tWMFbeEmxg.text: Great Service, Great food!  Came here with a bunch of friends for their bday. Waiter was courteous and polite. everyone there had a smile on their faces.  I loved my dish. I ordered the Roasted Salmon stuffed with Crab meat, with asparagus & mash potatoe, omg, sooo delicious!  My husband ordered a steak, forgot which one, very tasty.  Ordered mushroom on the side, a bit too salty to taste. Everything was great, but it was a bit pricey. We had 8 ppl, ordered 1 bottle of red wine, most ordered steak except for 3 of us, maybe about 6 sides, came out to be $650. Or maybe that wasn't too bad...but given that this rest was inside Golden Nugget Casino Hotel...didn't think price would be high...but the food was delicious.

H0AW4TUB-IifTElHOHS92A.text: This place has so many good reviews already, but let me just try to further persuade whoever is deciding if they should go to Vic & Anthony's for a good piece of meat and excellent service.   I took my family here for my mom's birthday on a Sunday night.  A party of five.  We arrived fifteen minutes late from our reservation.  We had to wait for a couple minutes and were seated shortly after.  I love the mahogany decor and the dimmed lighting - very romantic.    Our server, Victor, was very nice.  I was skeptical of his nicety at first - thinking he is going to try to sell me the most expensive item on the menu.  As it turns out, he kind of knew what he was talking about.  He recommended a promotional red wine, which our party loved.  The boyfriend ordered a bombay sapphire, and he liked it.  (He then finished up the bottle of red wine also.)    For appetizer, we had the steak tartar, the infamous crab cake, and a dozen of the fresh oysters.  All were delicious except for the crab cake.  Not that the crab cake had anything wrong with it, but it was "a crab cake with an edge" to quote the boyfriend.  It was chunky crab meats, which is always a plus, but it didn't have as much flavor to it as I would have liked.  So go ahead, give it a shot if crab cakes are your thing.  It was by no mean terrible.  The steak tartar was very fresh - no one got sick afterward.  The oysters - almost comparable to those served in Santa Monica, CA.   Our group shared a caesar salad and the spinach salad (recommended by Victor), and they were also delicious.  The spinach salad triumphs the caesar, however, in my humble opinion.  The spinach salad is tossed with this honey vinaigrette, that is to die for, really.  It is a very flavor dressing but not one that weighs down your palette.  It leaves a fresh, light, summery feel to your mouth after each bite.  We also tried the lobster bisque, and it was also very good.  However, Joe's Stonecrab at the Forum Shop might have a slightly better one - just slightly...   Onto the entrees!!!  We had the bone-in ribeye - medium rare, prime ribeye - medium, organic lamb chop - medium rare, and the shrimp scampi.  The bone-in ribeye was to die for!  I mean, the meat literally melted in my mouth!!  The perfect texture and temperature - I couldn't believe that I had found a better place for ribeye (Flemin's and Joe's was previously my favorite.)  The prime ribeye was good, but maybe because it was cooked to the temperature of medium, it made the texture a bit tougher than I'd like, but still very good.  As for the lamb chops - I don't personally like lamb chops, but I had a bite, and to my little knowledge with lamb chop, it was passable.  The boyfriend had the lamb chops, and he killed it - finishing it by picking up the rib and torn what was left off on the bone.  Lastly, the shrimp scampi was good, but I think by the time we tried the shrimp, we were so full.  What was interesting with this shrimp scampi was the sauce - it was of a spicy tomato sauce, which was very good with the fresh ciabatta bread they serve throughout our meal.    We also had the wild mushrooms and mac and cheese as sides.  No one, except the boyfriend, liked the wild mushrooms.  Mac and cheese was okay...  Nothing special.   We didn't have dessert since we had cake at home, but they do have the largest scotch menu I have ever seen.    Last but not least, I promise to wrap this up, the service there is great!!!  I mean, I am a True believer of good, friendly customer service.  If they serve good food, but terrible service, I wouldn't see the point to come back.  Our glasses were always filled, and Victor was so honest about what was good (or maybe the menu just didn't have anything bad...)  Anyways, the service is what made me give this place the fifth star.   I hope I have convinced those who want to come to Vic & Anthony's but are skeptical of going downtown to the Golden Nugget thinking how could downtown has good steaks to offer.  I was skeptical once, but now I am a True believer.  I would definitely come back to Vic & Anthony's.    Enjoy!!!

ioltaYdjZrYbYjb31X6H5w.text: The Mash was incredible! Great wine, and the food... very flavorful! recommended all the way!

BYob4TVUXNyEdWnFBSXwNw.text: My wife ordered the lobster tail ($85) & I ordered the filet  mignon ($45).. We also ordered asparagus & creamed corn & wild mushrooms As our sides..  In all fairness the meal was just okay..the service was top notch.. Our bill was ( $210.) without the tip & with no drinks... If you want to go to THE BEST STEAK HOUSE  by far .. Walk across the street to the four queens hotel, and go  to HUGO's Cellar.. After eating there for more than 20 years, it simply is the best!! We thought we would try Vic & anthonys, but realized quite quickly this Place is just an average place to eat!!

U2aNTPbYxM4AvHyLtGmBdQ.text: LV Steak House with bad L.A. Attitude!  I would have given this place a higher rating if it weren't for the AWFUL service  and SNOBBISH attitude we received from the blonde hostess when we walked in!  If I wanted to be treated terribly, I would have stayed home and dined at "Mastro's" in Beverly Hills.  Take my advice guys, dine else where!  There are plenty of better steak houses in LV that will treat you like a human being!    I have always wanted to try this steak house but always dine across the street at Binion's Ranch.  But this trip I had a party of 5 that I needed to entertain and they have all been to Binion's, so we decided to try a new place and Vic & Anthony's was the choice.  I booked the dinner reservation about a month in advance for a WEDNESDAY night when I knew they would NOT be busy, however when I arrived EARLY for our reservation, I was immediately greeted by a RUDE, OBNOXIOUS, SNOBBISH, L.A. wanna be little blonde starlet who treated me awful and refused to give me any service or grant me the option to seat us at a comfortable round table!  Her response?.....oh, sorry sir, the round tables are RESERVED!  We can only seat you where we can seat you!  (This was coming out of her mouth at 7:30pm on a Wednesday night with a total of 2 parties dining in the entire restaurant and probably only 5 reservations for that night!  What a joke) and by the way, the round tables were available the ENTIRE NIGHT we were there!  4 hours and $860.00 later, I left Vic & Anthony's with a bitter taste in my mouth but not from the meal, it was from the blonde hostess who's unwelcoming attitude will assure that I never return to this restaurant and discourage others from dining here as well.    The Bottom Line: Awful rude service from the front, an extra salty steak that isn't great (but good), but surprisingly; probably one of the best Veal cuts one could ever taste!  "Try the Veal, it's one of the best in the city" - Godfather  Enjoy!

mlLWTNJN4xwWbDKpCZXNTw.text: This place has the best and most flavorful steak I have had in a long long time. The waitress was attentive and the menu was mouthwatering. I had the bone in ribeye with crushed peppercorn and I haven't been able to stop thinking about it since and it's been over a week now. It's located in the Golden Nugget and it is a must stop for anybody looking for a great steak dinner in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone In Ribeye

xQoMx5j7AKaVvLzUooPUXw.text: The filet mignon was among the five best steaks of my life. My wife had the best seabass she's ever eaten.  The atmosphere is romantic but not stuffy or overly formal.  The service is good (thanks Dennis) the drinks are reasonably priced ($6 beer) and the entrees fetch standard steakhouse prices of around $40 for a steak.   The sides are nice but the creamed spinach could more accurately be described as cheese with a bit of spinach. The pear salad was amazing and the potatoes Lyonnaise were great too.   I'm a steak lover and the filet was really outatanding. It had a nice flavor as if it had been seasoned or marinated, but the taste complemented rather than overpowered the meat. The filet wasn't so heavy that I felt like I was biting into a cow.   I would dine here again in a heartbeat.

QU7sD62UT9aBjsCJ0adZ0A.text: 5 stars for amazing customer service. Dave, Victor and Brian could not have done more to ensure our evening was unforgettable experience.

U6kdX8RczoP5GvEXWPXOMg.text: My theme of this review is a shout out to my boy Drake because it's one of  "The Best I Ever Had" and you'll read why.  Located in the most unpretentious hotel, not on the glamorous side of the Strip, Vic & Anthony's is a hidden gem within a hidden gem.  Sure, I was apprehensive but V&A's is Michelin rated, granted it's just one star but, that's one more than most of the restos on the Strip.  First off, do your research, check out their menu on the Golden Nugget website and make reservations.  They offer a prix fixe menu, which is a super deal.  It comes with your choices of soup or salad to start, three entrees to choose from, a selection of sides and a dessert to share.  For $46.95 per person, it's a super deal.  If you calculate it, between two people, you're getting one side and the dessert for free.  However, you have to know to order this PF deal, as it will not be listed on the menu nor will they offer it to you.  Think of it as an exclusive secret society menu...mwahaha!  However to start,  we ordered the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake, which seriously had to be the,  "Best CC I Ever Had."  Why do I say that?  Well, it was jam packed with pieces of lump crab just as the name states, not crab shreds, crab filler or krab with a k.  The s/o and I had the Lobster Bisque, which was truly rich and creamy with bits of lobster in it.  We both literally licked our respective bowls and used pieces of bread to clean the bowls!  This LB was the,  "Best LB I Ever Had."  I was going to order the Sea Bass but the s/o gave me a dirty look about ordering seafood at a steakhouse.  I'm just not a fan of Filet Mignon and it's thick cut but, the s/o's right, it IS a steakhouse.  However to my delight, the FM was so tender, juicy and flavorful.  Hmm...V&A has made me a believer, maybe I've just had crappy FM in the past?  So again, this was the "Best FM I Ever Had."  We both got a choice of side, which is big enough for 2-3 people to share.  We ordered the Creamed Spinach and Au Gratin Potatoes.  Both were not necessarily the, "Best I Ever Had" but both were quite delicious.  For dessert, we choose the Croissant Bread Pudding.  Wow, there's something about the elegance of a croissant that just made this bread pudding like no other.  Instead of being flat and heavy, it was just the opposite.  The side of ice cream was a pure delight.  So, was this the "Best Bread Pudding I Ever Had?"  Damn right!  The service was truly outstanding!  From the hostess, to our server and other wait staff.  My only thing was that the restaurant was really dark, or maybe my eyes are just going bad?  V&A is top notch and is worth skipping the toney Strip restos.  And in closing, I'm ending this review the same way Drake ended his song, "Best I Ever Had,"  "See this is the type of joint you gotta dedicate to somebody, make sure it's that special somebody...."

xQVmp74EP69lijXDtk67xA.text: Now that Ruth's chris has closed it looks like we found a new steak house !! Priced high but very tasty. I liked the decor, dark and rat packy.  Service was great, I had the bone in rib-eye , with broccoli & mashers. My date loved the huge lobster tail !  My steak was perfect, the big broccoli bushels were yummy and the mashers were great .They included a free chocolate layer cake that was incredible . Loved the location also .

s5n8de1rm9Ua90GH4C5jWg.text: Great Steakhouse, perhaps the best in Vegas. We usually eat here when staying at The Golden Nugget. Top quality steaks and service.

82lRQwoF6xGfRRK90Jd7XQ.text: My experience at Vic and Anthony's was by far one of the best I've ever had.  My guy and I had our last dinner here while on vacation in Vegas. We went all out and had the porterhouse steak for two with a side of broccoli and mashed potatoes with the added bonus of a fresh 3 1/2 pound lobster which I was able to select.  The mashed potatoes were OK, not the greatest I've ever had as they were not quite mashed enough to my liking..there were still chunks of potatoes mixed in. The broccoli was good, hard to go wrong with a simple steamed broccoli. The lobster was outstanding and cooked to perfection! Super buttery and delicious, im salivating just thinking about it as I type this.  Now, for the porterhouse...what a beautiful thick chunk of meat!  The server brought it out to us and asked if it was to our liking, we gave him the OK he took it back and cut it for us. The meat was delicious up until the end where one side of it was a little tough but definitely still edible (this is the only reason why I'm not giving V&A's 5 stars).  The service was impeccable, our server who's name I've forgotten was amazingly helpful and attentive. He genuinely seemed happy to be there and very knowledgeable about the menu, both the wine list and the food.  It was our anniversary dinner and I had let that be known to our server whom at the end of the our meal brought us out a slice of cheesecake. And oh what a slice it was! I thought the portions they give out at the cheesecake factory was big! haha  In conclusion, I would highly reccomend Vic and Anthony's as a place to go for a nice dinner. You forget that you are even in downtown Vegas when here. Good food and outstanding service! :)

yqOEa55nGCN_kYgWcTClng.text: The best meal I have probably ever had.   My husband & I eloped a year ago and renewed our vows for 20 family members & friends in Las Vegas.  We wanted a steak house for a couple of reasons; one to please the men in our party and also I have allergies to gluten and know that a steak-house menu is easy to order from.   We picked Vic & Anthony's based on their yelp reviews and availability on a Friday night (during a fight weekend).  We were sat right away and our server Annette was funny, curteous, and most importantly put up with our motley crew.  The sommelier on site was great too.  I forgot his name, but he had great suggestions.  The food - oh the food! - came out at a reasonable pace and was delicious!  Our friend actually said "I don't want to swallow because I want the taste to last forever!" Because we had a large party, we ordered a number of different items.  My personal favorite was the scallops and the cheesy potatoes.  The best part were the steaks!  They were seasoned perfectly and cooked to mouth-watering amazing-ness.  Most of us in our party work in the restaurant/bar/service industry and we were over the moon with this restaurant. It was a wonderful evening of food and family.  We will recommend this place again and again. PS - it was fun to walk out on to Fremont Street afterwards to people watch!

InSAxoRiMelecnbiBXM1Ww.text: I like the dark, leather booth, steak houses around vegas and vic and Anthony's does it well.  there's a large beer, wine and specialty drink menu.  like most tourist places in vegas, the prices are high (16 bucks for a duvel). for dinner I had a Caesar salad.  it was very good.  the shaved parm, however, was a disappointing lower quality.  it lacked the nuttiness and crystallization of the real stuff.  for dinner I had veal Milanese.  it was pounded thin and cooked well but it lacked seasoning.  the veal should have been seasoned before breading and the breading would have benefited from some parm and herbs.  still, it was pretty good.  at 45 bucks i'm glad I wasn't paying.  finished with key lime pie.  it was ok.  service was excellent.

5Ez_4xq37wqE9TSp6fFtvA.text: Favorite restaurant for an outstanding Filet! Excellent food, excellent service! Worth every dollar.

PqmV4u4ryopgqP-9UsxVHg.text: I had the 24oz Ribeye and it was great. Service we excellent and the prices were as expected. This is still not one of the best steakhouses but if your in Vegas and you love steak you have to try this place. Stripsteak and Gallaghers are better but this place was still very very good.

ODadhEzafehYBBqIGugePQ.text: VERY GOOD FOOD!   This is the second time coming here. We decided to eat here before the Gordie brown show (Which was awesome by the way) at the golden nugget.   This place is very good and super nice. I liked that they made my buddy take off his hat, respectable..... I like that. This place would get 5 Stars but I think the price is a little high for what you get. None the less I would eat here again and both the steak and seafood was AWESOME here.

KXM_tB1HDUFCncHxPIPNBw.text: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THE AUSTRALIAN LOBSTER TAIL.  Can never find the same size any where else!!!  Had reservations, but ended up waiting an hour!!!!!!  ..... minus 1 star.

7sAt_dIT-tcC1TsS1_jXHQ.text: Vic and Anthony's is awesome!  Best seat in the house is at the bar.   Do not forget to order the crab cakes.  Best ever!    They really take care of you!    Ordered a bottle of wine and they were out so they gave us a complimentary bottle of $150.00 cab.  We go when ever in Vegas!

I13O1zUmdPoAJv5YBazUzQ.text: It you ever do anything in life make sure it is eating the crab cakes here. My life will never be the same! Beyond excellent!

l7OkfxcE5m-2u-H94bplGw.text: Great food and excellent service. We sat at bar because of the wait. I had lobster bisque and oysters (bisque was very good!!) my husband had the ribeye and lobster tail he loved it.

8cF_HTYnSepfvXSMhk0c1A.text: We decided to visit Fremont Street for Christmas Eve.  A stroll under the lighted canopy and by the huge Christmas tree before heading to the Golden Nugget and dinner.  We arrived 10 minutes early and were greated warmly by the hostess.  They offered to seat us immediately or to let us enjoy a drink at the bar.  We chose to be seated immediately.  Our waiter, Hector, arrived quickly with the menus.  Bread, butter and water arrived before we even opened the menus. The sommelier accomodated our request quickly and spent some time discussing a couple of our favorite Paso Robles wines.    Great choice for dinner.  Had a great meal, great service, and a reason to dress up on Fremont Street.  Thank you for a great evening.

WDATY8kF81mG07kiKS4KJg.text: We had a 10pm reservation on a Wednesday, got in town a bit late, got to the joint about 10:15 and decided to just sit at the bar have a drink, actually many drinks . So we ate at the bar and it was a great dining experience. Not a huge fan of downtown Vegas, but had been years since I've been there. We shared the ribeye, mushrooms, and cheesy potatoes. It was all quite delicious and would definitely go back. Well at least from what I remember... :)

DnixQmhwgos6YJchCZb1Sg.text: I will be back!  Had so many steaks in Vegas that on our last night I decided to have crab legs.  The wine and water service was great - the music playing was fantastic!  I would love to go back and have a steak!    Now for the not so great:  The crab legs came out in a pool of melted butter  - with more melted butter in a ramekin on the table.  Yee gads so much butter!  I could not get the meat out of the shell as the legs were slip slidin away on the plate.  I finally had to use the bread plate to move my crab legs over out of the pool to dig into them.  Our server never dropped a discard plate for the shells and I had to ask for a hand towel to wipe my hands from the buttery mess.  Overall we like the place and next time if I order crab I will ask for it steamed with butter on the side

U9eIGUpKA3CEKIN1vnhpOQ.text: If you're looking for amazing food this steak house is the place to go! My boyfriend and I absolutely loved our dinner, the food was to die for! The staff and ambience were impeccable. I would highly recommend dinning here.

DrpJhajLvocqhX693xSHBg.text: We were greeted and seated immediately according to our reservation. Our waiter was very nice and courteous. All was well until the bill came.  We were never told of the "upgrades" made to out steak and to our surprise ended up paying twice as much without notice. We had clearly pointed to what we wanted on the menu. When brought to the attention of the waiter he said there was nothing he could do.  We knew the cost per plate and were expecting to pay for our meal but feel when we clearly pointed to what we wanted regardless of what's being offered bringing out what was suggested is not a way to upgrade and stick customers to unwanted items.

7FYba-YR0OOgaIuP5nZ7AA.text: Absolutely loved it! Thankful for the staff. Payton was amazing, by staying on top of the reservations. Couldn't thank you enough. Service, Food & atmosphere was amazing!

lYXefmAMku0NjhrfJ7yFvw.text: From start to finish, this was top notch! My husband took me here for my 40th birthday and everyone knew, the meal was excellent, my husband really enjoyed his seafood soup ap, and his halibut. I loved my seared tuna, and for dessert we had croissant bread pudding, Devine. Every patron leaving kept shaking their servers hands and gushing about what a wonderful experience they had, including us!  Only sad thing for me was I was a little hungover from the previous day and was unable to partake in their fabulous looking cocktails.

GS5CMCL0RB6YY2mW1tnmpw.text: Old school Vegas steakhouse. Was a bit hesitant because it's located in the golden nugget downtown Vegas. If you've been downtown Fremont street you know what I'm talking a bout. It's a freak show, my retinas are still burning from the human filth that scoures the area.... Well once inside the place it's old Vegas , high back leather, dim lights, service was spot on, real good, but not bothersome. They tend to your every need. Good wine selection and wow, I drink bourbon, they had a list of high end stuff to choose from, very nice, we had roast beet salad, Caesar salad which they were more than happy to split for us, filet mignon, and of course lobster tails. Steak was great, cooked to our likes! Perfect. And the lobster was fantastic... Tender, sweet, and cooked so well. They don't give you the greasy butter bath to dip it. It needs nothing but cut and enjoy, so we'll done. It's not a cheap experience, dinner for 2 was over 300 with of course a well deserved tip ! When back in town, I will go back to Vic's! Tackle the 35 oz cold water lobster tail. One more thing. We dressed nice, you'll see tourists wearing hawaiin shirts, one ass wore shorts and flips, dress right people, they won't stop you from dining if your that guy. But you make the place a lil less with your old ratty clothing.... Oh, I would of went 5 stars.... Take away one for the young snooty girls who work the front desk and seat you. Lighten up ladies, your not solving the worlds problems, they don't make you feel welcome... They act like they are doing you a favor! Not a good first impression. I almost told them to stuff it... But my girl kicked me in the shin.. And off to the table we went... Vic, retrain the desk girls plz......

BqmAjAwgbVYhkIQ8d_ULtA.text: Officially my favorite steakhouse hands down!  As if Vegas doesn't have enough to write about, this little gem is in one of the remaining standouts of what some call "Old Vegas".  The meal got off to a great start at the bar as we waited for our table.  The service was fast, the drinks were well made and naturally they were top shelf.  I was particularly pleased with the professional look and feel of the place.  Its very old school, mafioso, dark, white linen, with the sounds of clinking wine glasses and lively conversation in the background.    The food:  Excellent!  Your steak is served as intended, well aged beef cooked to order on a hot plate...nothing else!  Fantastic.  The sides are of sharable portions so agree on one for every 2 or 3 people unless you plan on toting a box of leftovers around Vegas.  The mac and cheese is perfect as is the smooth and creamy lobster bisque.  The other members in my party had several cuts of meat and one had a chicken dish...my sincerest apologies for not having info on those.  Fact is, I wanted every square inch of space in my belly for the rib eye on my plate.  Like sooo many other reviews about this place, it was melt in your mouth good.  We also ordered a chocolate gnash desert that could only be made better by eating it off of your favorite super models body, otherwise it was absolute perfection.    Service was superb.  Our waiter was attentive, informative and practiced.  He was professional and friendly.  Over all a fantastic experience.  I will definitely be returning.  Highly recommend this location to anyone.  You will not be disappointed.

UbvsgiWgnrbOr2F6d7iwZw.text: Good service, dark, pricey, but decent eats.     I wanted a good steak. I knew this place was pricey, which it is, but I was craving meat.  My girl ordered the steak-lobster special and I ordered a 8 oz fillet, we both ordered them medium rare.   When the steaks came I was instructed to cut into the center and check it, if you dont like it we can fix it.  I'm like what?, but I'll get to this in a minute.  So the steaks come, hot as hell, I'm guessing they didn't even let it stand, anyway we cut into them as instructed and the suckers were cold and raw in the center.  It was even too rare for my girl which She will basically eat hers usually very rare.   The waiter instructs we we can just heat that up more.  Ok here's what I find wrong.   Medium rare should be warm in the middle, even by just pressing on the steaks I could tell it was rare.  Shouldn't a steak house charging these types of prices know better.  Once you cut the thing in half then put it back on the grill its going to dry out.  Away, so they give it a good again, steaks come back, plates hot as hell, but the damn thing is cold in the middle, huh?   The servicer quickly says , I have them make another one and hes gone.
