So what comes out is this tiny fillet thats about 3/4" thick, dry and over cooked.      At this point, I realize this is not going well, I just shut my mouth and eat.  I'm  not all that hungry, since I was snacking on her lobster, which was good.  The pesto and basil mash potatos were very good.   So in the end, I left not filling my desire for steak from a steak house, bummer.  I can't knock the service, I found the service to be excellent, but in the end the steak was the disappointing.

_LVtlR7DbghYjOSQvISHOg.text: Great experience in an old chop house style steak place in the Golden Nugget. Never thought I would say that but if the shoe fits wear it. Quality seems to be very important along with a nice collection of wine offerings.  The Somm in training was knowledgable but I don't bite on the uncharged game as I am pretty comfortable with a wine menu. That being said our group enjoyed our time there and love the huge ice cube.

40J-uRrmmTgaCbY85l-yQg.text: My wife and I have been dining here since it opened(can't remember what year that was, but I believe it was right after Landry's took over the Nugget).  We have dined with just the 2 of us and with over 12 people and we have NEVER, EVER been disappointed.  My wife and I enjoy well prepared food and attentive service and have tried nearly every top end restaurant and steakhouse in Las Vegas. Though there are many fine establishments in this town, we prefer Vic & Anthony's over all the rest.  We've ordered every item on the menu at one time or another and have yet to be disappointed.  Do yourselves a favor and dine here.  You won't regret it.  Just don't come so often that it becomes hard to get a reservation.

I9XXaiYtqt1yUsXpUcwv8g.text: The roasted salmon was absolutely off the charts! We love their location in downtown Houston, and this may be our overall favorite in Vegas too! Yum!!

fKf-9LehqloTUNQekFcZig.text: By far the best steak I've had in years.  Great atmosphere and a truly elegant dining experience.  Attentive service without being intrusive.  This is a True definition of a world class restaurant.  I highly recommend this fine establishment.

h85je1lcAolTGtCRvmacqA.text: I love this steakhouse!  Food is great.  It was the biggest  capreese salad I had ever tried.  (like 2 pounds salad HUGE!)  Stakes were amazing too. and the best thing was their potatoes with cheese on top. I tried to cook the same thing home after we came back from Vegas. The thing I dont like about the place is that they display raw pieces of meat and half dead lobsters  - I felt so sad about those poor creatures who were killed for our pleasure. (but C'est la vie.) Also they dont have a bathroom in the restaurant   and just to wash your hands you need to travel all the way  through casino.

AX0VDPtISU2Rab49Oc1X6w.text: 4.0/5.0.  Bone in ribeye cooked perfectly med rare. The mushroom side was the best I've ever had, highly reco. The creamed spinach was outstanding.  Waiter and service was great.  Felt non-pretentious like an old school steakhouse should.

90KcOd6PKi4RkUpw9smJ3g.text: VERY nice.  Maybe nicest dinner I've had in vegas.  Of course Wait staff can make or break an evening and our Lady was sweet, knowledgeable and very personable . Would definately recommend.  Then you're right in the action on Freemont street!

XKi8-31dzfDB3usyFA_zYg.text: Easily one of the best steakhouse in Las Vegas! It is located inside the Golden Nugget Casino.  Filet mignon was excellent (no need for additional sauce), melt in your mouth - this is one of the few times that I actually finished my steak and the croissant bread pudding is to DIE for ! :)  Service was excellent ! Oh yeah, hubby and I will be back with others.  Tip: Go to their website and print out the Distinctive Dining  Deal menu (You will get 3 courses w/ sides for a great price)  Note: It is not a very kid friendly restaurant - I called a few months ago to make reservation and was told that if the child is too young and start making a fuss, we may be asked to leave. We decided not to risk it with my 2 year old niece. Having said that, when we were at the restaurant, we did see children that's about 5 or 6 years old. So, parents:  use your best judgement :)

KbGR5R52qNp6j9UmLd8UeQ.text: Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse seem like it was going to be a high end steakhouse. Went here for a meal based on amazing Yelp reviews (never let me down before- thank you!)  But had a really disappointing meal. Perhaps it's American steak in general but even the starter wasn't the best. I had Calamari which was enormous, embarrassingly large portion with sweet peppers. Not fresh tasting or a light crispy batter. My friend had shrimp cocktail which was fine and a more manageable size. The cocktails were nice and the wine list was very extensive and expensive of course, but the steak, which was the reason we visited this place was not good enough for a $200 meal. And the service was not amazing either. Disappointed.

sWf4j1eXfhmWvQGwP1zgKg.text: Came to Vic and Anthony's this evening to celebrate my birthday, and I could not have picked a better establishment. Our server, Patrick, went above and beyond to make sure we were happy. His attentiveness and knowledge of the menu set the night for smooth sailing. Our drinks were never empty and the table was promptly cleaned after each course. It was a great way to celebrate my birthday and I will be back, asking to sit in Patrick's section of course.

Jem_wiewXCPqQPUQVknnxg.text: Just amazing. The service and food was stellar. The best  crab cake we have ever eaten. We can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

frAnEF4E1W8ga1Jm-lMXhA.text: Amazing gem in downtown Vegas!   The service was nothing short of flawless and everything was cooked to perfection. If you're in the sharing mood I recommend the crab cake, the porterhouse, and the creamed spinach. We're looking forward to trying the original in Houston.

dByaDnI2YZyn4fHeBBWeZQ.text: We made a reservation for my birthday sale day with no problem. First off the service was first class.  Second, the food was outstanding to include the Tomahawk 40oz Steak which we ordered. It was seared to perfection on the outside and juicy all the way throughout the inside.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for an excellent steak house.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 40oz Tomahawk Steak!!

oZiBVY3IzeykQ1o-hb4fHA.text: My husband and I had our Christmas dinner here.  Our waiter was Friendly and Professional. The food was prepared to perfection, we enjoyed our Choices. For dessert I had a Chocolate Martini, Yummy,  The Atmosphere was warm and inviting. Only 1 complaint, the server brought my Check along with my Drink, what came to mind was,  "Thank you, please leave now"!! Dinner for Two $150

f-GsejNdo8A26sqS35MkWA.text: food was great here!  Great art deco design. The service was interesting to say the least.  We walked into  the restaurant where we stood for 10 minutes without the hostess acknowleding we were standing there or even looked up. Our server came by several times to check to see how the food was or if we needed anything.  At one point he came by to make small talk that was painfully forced.  The busser was subpar...he came by several times to fill up water and spilled it all over my phone and didn't even notice even when I said something.  We ordered the foie gras apppetizer, lobster bisque soup, bone in prime ribeye, onion shoestrings, mac n cheese, and creamed spinach.  The appetizer and soup were okay, but the ribeye and sides are top notch.  The ribeye was cooked perfectly rare as requested. It was super tender and seasoned perfectly.  The onion shoestrings came out as a heaping pile of crispy salty perfection on a plate...enough for 4 people. The mac n cheese was creamy and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente. the creamed spinach was loaded with cream and cheese and had a crumbly topping. All the sides were large enough for at least 2 people.  My only wish was that I had room for dessert...will definately save room next time for the creme brulee or the bread pudding!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed spinach and onion shoestrings
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n cheese
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque

NN28v5vUgA1BZrOkj2JWAg.text: I've heard people talk highly of this steak house and through fellow yelpers I found out about the $52 dinner menu. You get an appetizer, entree, side, and dessert for that price! I got lobster bisque, 8oz fillet, at gratin potatoes and the bread pudding! Service was fantastic and so was the meal! I will definitely be back!

ob1TkltDt4BZBlU5hSxaOQ.text: Great place, great quality, and great prices. Went with the crab cake and boneless ribeye both done perfect. Great drinks and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iHhyuQQaQRe0cog1RUK_5A.text: Very solid steakhouse.  I loved the Sinatra-esque feel to the ambiance.  With enough imagination and style, you could really fool yourself to feel part of the rat pack.   The crab cake is the best item on the menu for me.  A generous portion of lump crab with very minimal breading is pan fried and served piping hot.  The steak tartare is just a must!    I appreciate the method of preparing their steaks.  It's seasoned lightly with salt and nothing else.  You have the option of ordering a sauce but I really see no point with quality meat.  Just be sure they understand what medium rare means.  My steak was medium to medium well.  I could have sent my steak back but the service was superb.   Excellent list of wines.  A variety of notable Napa wines that most restaurants do not carry such as Shafer and Peju.  Also, nice selection of Mendoza Malbec wines.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good selection of Malbec wines
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent crab cake

29U0N2QnDQNJcHiP7_FtOQ.text: Made reservations for Christmas Eve, and looked forward to this dinner to start our stay in Las Vegas. The crab cake appetizer was delicious and maybe the best we had tasted in a long time. Wife ordered the surf & turf special - lobster tail and 8 oz filet; I ordered the 12 oz filet with a side of wild mushrooms. Both filets cooked to a perfect medium rare, with the lobster broiled just right. The wild mushrooms tasted great with the filets! Waitress was nice and brought us a dessert plate with a small cheesecake and chocolate mousse as a comp - much appreciated and very tasty. Ordering any more would have been far too much food, we were pleasantly stuffed without being uncomfortable. We will definitely repeat this order on our next trip to LV.

KOkwZkrF5Feo36_QDPOEAg.text: We love this restaurant!! All worker is amazing nice and great Service. We order AustralianWagyu Ribeye it was amazing taste We had great time at this restaurant

F3KQTzGPlhdjAX8-kRtbcg.text: I celebrated my birthday at Vic and Anthony's on Aug. 22.  The food was great! I am very unhappy with the organization of the wait staff. They brought me three different checks that were wrong, then they said my pre paid credit card did not work. (I got the card from a time share presentation.) We paid cash. The next day I went back to the restaurant to get my money back. They said my card went through. I feel we over paid. Vic and Anthony's gave me the run a round. I will not be going back to Vic and Anthony's. My cousin also got three different checks for her dinner. Vic and Anthony's need to turn up the lights so their employees can see what they are doing. They made too many mistakes with other people's money. Not cool.  Very unhappy customer.

bTCzIP8_NXfk-6o7U3m7qw.text: This Steakhouse rivals all the other upscale steakhouses and Vegas is home to plenty! We visit here a few times a year when we're staying at the Nugget. The service is impeccable and the food speaks for itself. None better! We like coming with a group and trying different things. From steaks to chops and chicken to seafood-you won't ever be disappointed. Excellent sourdough bread and butter as you wait for your appetizer/salad/soup. Try the beet salad. Yummmm! We had the special that consisted of an 8oz. Filet and lobster tail with assorted vegetables ($79) and added the potato puree. The steak was exactly medium rare, as ordered and that lobster was out of this world! We have NEVER been disappointed when we visit here. Must try the crab cake and if your budget allows- get the lobster that's market priced and you must order the 3 1/2lb lobster. Ours was $165, but was worth every penny!! It's so huge, they slice it for you. Bread pudding, creme brulee, cheesecake are all a fabulous ending. You'll be glad you ate here!!

oQWcshyU82wR9GMYSLPjXQ.text: My Hubby took me to celebrate my birthday with a group of family and friends.  The accommodations, service was very nice.  The food is delicious... I will definitely recommend and will go again!

3jJeyy4dJs917WA8XlQSKg.text: My high expectations were met with disappointment. The food was just okay for me. The meal was rather forgettable, nothing really stood out enough for me me to say "I'd order this again!" The dinner service got off on a very rough start when they refused to seat our party of 11. They refused to seat us because 1 out of 11 of us was running late. ONE person out of 11......does that even make any f'kng sense? The 2 doctors in our party tried repeatedly to request to the servers and even the manager, but they refused and kept us waiting at the small narrow bar area for almost 45 mins. Some of us got tipsy while waiting for our tables, while most of us just got agitated for having to wait so long. It would've been 35 min wait, but the manager seemed to be OCD or unsatisfied w/the table set-up so he made the staff move and rearrange our tables further down from the its original location. Tacking on additional wait time for us at the cramped bar. As I said earlier, the food was alright. Nothing spectacular, nothing memorable. CHICKEN PAIGE ($26.95): yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC... Scallopined/thinly cut chicken breasts lightly breaded and pan-fried in a lemon butter sauce. The menu also listed capers and sundried tomatoes cooked into the sauce, but I found cooked down regular tomatoes. No biggie. The portion size was generous and it was tasty. FRESH FISH A LA NAGE (halibut was the fish special that night, $36.95) The halibut filet was stuffed w/jumbo lump crab meat and served w/baby vegetables. I didn't get a chance to take a pic of it, but I was able to steal a couple fork-fulls. The under-seasoned halibut was unevenly cooked, some parts were dry and overcooked. I'm not so sure if the "a la nage" or poaching part was entirely True. Perhaps the poaching liquid or "nage" was just used to dress the fish after it's been cooked. JUMBO LUMP CRAB CAKES (1 crab cake for $19.95): yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC... Yes, you read that right. It's $19 for ONE crab cake. The crab cake was topped off with additional crab meat and a chive buerre blanc. For me, a good buerre blanc should be light and airy, yet rich and thick enough to coat whatever food it's drizzled on. This sauce was darker and more orange, I've never seen any buerre blanc (means "white butter" in French cooking) that dark before. It looked very similar to the sundried tomato sauce that was in my Chicken Paige dish. yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC... BROILED PORTABELLO MUSHROOMS W/RED WINE VINAIGRETTE ($9.95): yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC... Dressed w/basil oil, fresh diced tomatoes and "fresh mozzarella." The mozzarella had no flavor and was a bit on the dry side. Some cubes crumbled very easily, almost like feta cheese. When I see "fresh mozzarella" on the menu, I'm expecting the cheese to have a higher moisture content, resulting in a more soft to semi-soft cheese. This was not the case. RAW OYSTERS (6 for $14.95): Plump fresh oysters. 'Nuff said. OYSTERS ROCKERFELLER (6 for $15.95): Everyone raves about this dish, so of course we had to get a couple orders for our large party. It was okay. I got chopped herbs, bread crumbs and butter. I wasn't wowed by this dish. FRIED OYSTERS w/malt vinegar tartar sauce (6 for $11.95): yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC... Out of the 3 oyster dishes, this was the one I was looking forward to. Like the raw oyster and oyster rockerfeller, these fried oysters were also plump and juicy. The crust (although very greasy) had a nice crunch to it, but that's where the buck stops. There's nothing more unappetizing than biting into a crunchy fried oyster, only to be disappointed when you find out that you're chewing on some RAW BATTER. Perhaps they should go back to the basics and use deep-fryer thermometer? Just a thought. FRESH SPINACH SALAD ($8.95): yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC... This was a favorite amongst most of us (I only got input from our side of the long table, the other half of our large party didn't mention anything about it). This spinach salad had a mixture of chopped bacon, eggs, kalamata olives, and artichokes. That's my kind of salad! Can't go wrong with crispy bacon! The citrus vinaigrette was the perfect addition to the salty bacon and kalamata olives. I enjoyed this dish very much. Ironic that my favorite part of the entire meal was a damn salad.....especially when I don't even like veggies. That's actually the very section that I avoid like the plague when I dine out.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Spinach Salad ($8.95): bacon, chopped eggs, kalamata olives, artichokes &amp; honey-citrus vinaigrette
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broiled Portabello Mushrooms ($9.95): topped with basil oil, diced tomatoes &amp; bland (stale) mozzarella
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Lump Crab Cake($19.95 per cake): Diced tomatoes, chive beurre blanc

D5QA4DT7bNB1hogrmGbFbA.text: Where to start... I searched and searched for a place I could have an excellent dinner with my husband while on vacation. After reading about every Vegas hotspot I found Vic and Anthony's. I perused the menu and realized there was no way I could afford a dinner here. Then after reading my trusty yelpers I saw a review that explained the distinguished menu.   The distinguished menu is posted on the website and must be printed prior to your arrival. It is only $50/person! It includes your choice of starter. We had the wedge salad and lobster bisque- ahhhhhmazing! Next is your entree, we both chose the 8oz filet which was unbelievable and I really couldn't choose words to explain how wonderful they really were. The meal comes with your choice of sides. Be sure to choose 2 different sides as they are more than enough to share. We chose the au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach. Delicious! After all this, yes, you get dessert included in the special! I had creme brulee and my husband had the croissant bread pudding. Again, ahhhhhmazing!   To seal the deal was our waiter. He was attentive and not overbearing. Excellent service and I highly recommend asking for Victor. Easy name to remember given the name of the restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oops... Was so good I forgot to get a picture!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Before dinner

X7fIGYc18vsJw4QP3B3GtQ.text: This was our first visit to Vic & Anthony's and it was hands down the best meal we've ever had. The service was great with the staff very welcoming and attentive. The food excellent! The Crab cake appetizer was so good, full of crab with lump crab on top. So yummy! Save room for dessert, the bread pudding is to die for. We will definitely come back next time we are in town!

WSgk5c548lIN1hbMRAh5TA.text: Swanky little restaurant inside the golden nugget! So glad we have this place a chance because it was good.   Excellent & attentive service, old Vegas charm, great decor & ambiance, food was tasty, and good wine list. This could be a special occasion place OR come dressed casual. Just don't come dressed as a slob. ;)  I recommend the steaks, cream of corn, appetizers, and salads were good. We will be back again!  The creamed spinach tasted different this time, too intense with the cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QFe-hx_NxMcFqk88HnrqTw.text: What can I say that hasn't been said before about this wonderful restaurant nestled in the Golden Nugget... When I first visited Vegas in 2011 I tried this place and became hooked! Now it is at least a yearly visit for me.  I always find an excuse to travel across the country because of this restaurant.   From the moment you walk in to the moment you leave you are treated to a wonderful dining experience. The ambiance is such that you can get dressed up and make it a formal dining night or make it a semi-casual evening filled with mouth-watering food.  The steaks are cooked well enough that sauce is not needed, but I love their peppercorn sauce so I always order it.  This time I ordered the creamed spinach as a side dish and it was all that you would think a creamy cheesy spinach dish should be. My husband ordered the 12 ounce filet and I ordered my usual prime ribeye. When the steaks came we didn't speak to each other until we devoured the steaks lol.   Oh the drinks there are also made to perfection! There is nothing bad I can write about this place other than I wish there was one in Miami. :-(  Until then, I make a point to visit at least once a year.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My prime ribeye medium well to perfection!!!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our dinner.... Yummmmm!!!

d_dHomnYsL_azPzOuEDaFQ.text: I've been told many times to try the crab cakes from Vic & Anthony's. Finally I decided to pull the trigger.  The crab cakes were FILLED with crab shells. I asked my friend who recommended if this is normal, and she said no, she's never had that issue with any crab cake from any restaurant. I've had crab cakes maybe 5x and never had that issue either. Each bite was crunchy like I was eating a SANDwich from the Little Rascals.  Not to mention it was $24 for one crab cake, smaller than a hockey puck.  I hate to leave negative reviews but this was just a terrible experience and a complete waste of my hard earned money.

DIX2dKW9gw2NO9kzFSj1bA.text: I'm writing this from the perspective of a frugal tourist. If you are not price conscious add another half star.  Apparently they got rid of their old special - they used to have a promotion where if you printed out a coupon you could get a set menu (appetizer, steak to your taste, and  desert) for 75 + tip.  That being said, they're still a solid four stars. I really want to be clear they're not *bad* and if I was the kind of person who money was not an object for, I'd probably not leave the GN to eat elsewhere if I was already there to gamble or sleep, but for me I can only afford to pay for a fancy steak dinner once  a year.  Unfortunately, I can't recommend making a special trip from the strip to downtown just for this particular steak house if there's no coupon or you don't have points from their rewards program.  (I do however, recommend checking out the poker room - when I was first learning poker their limit game was a great way to learn the game without breaking the bank)  Also if you're less price conscious, such as planning a business dinner where an extra 20-30 per person isn't a big deal if you can get a group together during a busy convention, they may be a good choice they're less popular than some more trendy spots may be more able to accommodate your part on short notice. If you are having trouble finding a place a group of friends/coworkers can meet during a convention consider checking out here - there's more to Vegas than the strip ;)

Clx6aWkVQzM1LXcMOXdcNw.text: For our anniversary every year we do it up right at a top notch steakhouse and celebrate.  Generally, we are home (in Denver, CO), and have our 5 star places we frequent, but this time we happened to be in Vegas doing a 10 year vow renewal and decided to have our steak with some Vegas glitz :) Enter, Vic & Anthony's which by all accounts and many recommendations was THE best steakhouse (and had a bonus of being in the hotel we were staying in, The Golden Nugget).   It will get to it. I thought our dinner was lovely, but not as great as I am used to elsewhere. Here is the thing, it is dark, like really dark in there.  Also, we were seated in between 2 huge tables with 6+ people at them.  It was loud!  So dark and loud, eh, not the greatest. Then we had our waiter introduce himself and get our drinks, only to be handed off at some point to another waiter (probably because of the large groups) who really mostly took care of us.  He didn't introduce himself and at several points could not hear us and would answer questions we didn't ask. Or assume we said things we didn't say. Did I mention it was loud?  Anyways, the food was mostly wonderful. The calamari was sauteed with peppers and onions and had a delicious flavor.  I ordered a filet and it was tender and perfectly cooked medium. I topped it with the Texas jalapeno bacon thing - which had a spicy flavor, but is sauteed in oil because when I decided to dump out the last bit it made the plate oily. We aren't seafood people and a lot of their stuff was seafood based, so we just added a side of salted fries, which were limp - definitely the worst part of the meal (and could easily be fixed by not serving them in a pail).   At the end of the meal they did wish a happy anniversary and gave us two bite size desserts (a chocolate torte and a cheesecake). It was nice and the food did seem high quality, but the vibe wasn't for me. I felt like the corporate accounts that surrounded us were far more taken care of than us (and when you drop a few hundred for dinner, I just expect a little more personalized service).   If you are going on the company dime, go for it. If you a want romantic and special meal, eh, know it might not be here. We are used to personalized attentive service the moment we walk in the door and it didn't happen here, but the food for the most port was top quality. It is Vegas, I guess!

HqiTX8uzfnvz91V336gXEg.text: Delicious Steak is life!!!  Well to me it is.  Vic was an unexpected amazing dinner.  I was hungry experiencing the Fremont Experience.    Steak:  Bomb!! Cooked and seasoned to perfection.   Crab cake:  Delicious!!! 80% meat to 20% breading. The sauce was amazing.  I licked this dish cleaned.   Bacon:  Satisfying!!! Thick and flavorful.  Note to self must come back to try their amazing-sounding appetizers.   Spinach and Shroom:  YUMMY!! Thrilled that simple saute can taste so amazing.  Garlic lovers must!!!   Desserts:  He insisted.  We tried two.  One was runny and the other one had this hazelnut crunch la BomB!   Coffee: Illy.  Free refill.   I would come back to Vegas just to eat here.

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Illy coffee served here.
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasted good but runny!!!

6s2_KWkGe_atSoBxMKK42Q.text: Lobster mac & cheese was out of this world. My filet was so tender it just melted in my mouth.  The service was superb too.   Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1iR3m2bzKLsmjb8HuFZQqQ.text: We took my wife's family for Christmas dinner and Vic and Anthony's did not disappoint. Started with the seafood tower and a reasonably priced bottle of vintage champagne -- excellent. We all had steaks, along with a pound of Alaskan king crab legs, along with the onion wedges, augratin potatoes and the spinach with mushrooms. Too full for desert.  Nice, never rushed service.

cc_lo2jc_Dp6DUds01n3IQ.text: Ambiance is nice. Food was good. But as far as meat, Gordon Ramsay and Golden steer was a bit better. Cream spinach was salty. I can tell when a server is trying to upsell, when I catch it, its mildly annoying but it's ok. When my brother asked if they have a restroom he could use, instead of directing my brother where it is, the busser simply said "no". Indian woman. But I'm still not bothered.  So as we left and had some food to take home, we strolled to Fremont. Then I was like "didnt we forget something, our food". I didnt realize our food to take home was tied in a plastic bag. White plastic bag. The kind of bag you can get anywhere. Other restaurants will put it in a customized paper bag with their logo on it. Vic and Anthony's will give you a plastic bag. I'm still tripping.

OUF_W68XodbSJrKhu2I45Q.text: Loved the ambiance, service, and food. We had seafood platter, bone marrow, filet, and a huge Caribbean lobster tail. Everything was delicious, hot, and great presentation. We enjoyed the entire meal. Only complaint, the restrooms were a bit of a hike.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caribbean lobster tail

xRgZSQeXXj9KjBWaajrBIg.text: The food was average it is nowhere near as good as I was expecting it to be according to reviews I have read. The atmosphere is nice although in is inside a casino. I would eat here again but it definitely would not be my 1st choice.

4nxIV1WSeHfyu_Iy7NuOGA.text: I would say, this is one of the best steakhouses I've been to. We had a party of 4 and came in on a Saturday evening. The moment you enter the restaurant there is a tank full of lobsters and a display of raw meats you can choose from. The restaurant itself is very dimly lit, intimate, and decorated like an old school steakhouse (most places downtown are like this).   The menu had amazing options, full of seafood and steak. The appetizers were quite large as well as the sides which are served family style. My boyfriend and I had the surf and turf which was fantastic! The lobster bisque and lobster mac and cheese are a must try! The quality of their meats are just amazing. Each of us had different cuts (filet, ribeye, ny strip) and all were delicious.   The service was quick, but our server did a great job of explaining everything and he was continually checking to make sure we were happy.   This restaurant is upscale, finer dining so expect to pay around $120 per person for dinner. It is well worth it, however. Our dinner was fantastic!

GDwkAHl5wrv3iA1c-rb0LQ.text: My husband talked about this place many times for grilling the best steak! So finally, we made a reservation (which was super smooth process) and dined.  Really amazing customer service, great ambiance, and perfect food! I had filet mignonette and my spouse had the special with lobster tail. My goodness!!! I usually can't finish even a small steak because I get sick of it quickly. This steak was cooked just as I asked, with perfect crust and texture all throughout the steak. I don't know much about good meat, but my tongue and stomach were truly at bliss. Shout out to the server who told me about Jameson cask mates! I recommend this place wholeheartedly! I heard the seafood platter is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vQHAs56u5iT9orpwRXBj0w.text: Hadn't been in V and A for quite sometime. Forgot what I was missing. Warm greeting from Noah and Kai the bartenders. Nice bar with full menu. Tomato and onion salad followed by the steak tar tar. Perfect amount of food. Great Vegas steakhouse atmosphere with a great staff. Still my favorite even though I don't gamble at the Golden Nuggett where the restaurant is downtown but that's another story.

Fb7sLpa0hJGTC4lhtH7Jfw.text: We made reservations here for our anniversary dinner. We figured top ten restaurant, it must be amazing. Everything was perfect from the service to the food. They literally have the BEST bread & BUTTER I have ever tasted in my life. I ordered a 12oz filet mignon and wagu ribeye with mash potatoes and Mac and cheese for sides. However the only problem was we both asked for well done steaks we received bloody rare steaks. We still tried to eat it and was still damn good.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artisan Cheese Board, Mac &amp; Cheese, mashed potatoes, 12 Oz . Filet Mignon and ribeye  Prime wagu Ribeye

XKmDYpW9bgN0kwFsn7e0WQ.text: Absolutely one of the best meals I have had in Vegas.  The food was outstanding.  We started with gin and tonics and they were A+.  We sat in the bar since we arrived a bit early to restaurant early and they were packed, so we thought we'd have a drink.   We did have a reservation in the dining room, but ended up staying and eating at the bar. Jose was one of our servers, I can't remember the other guys name.  But I will say the service was impeccable!!  They went above and beyond with everything and it was a very pleasant experience.  Their wine menu was excellent with lots of great choices from all over the world and descent prices. If your looking for a excellent Cab Sav for a good price try the Long Shadow Pirouette (2014). Yummy!!  I started with the lobster bisque soup and my husband had the Cesar salad.  Both were great..the soup was actually outstanding!!   I ordered the shrimp pasta dish and it was out of this world!!  And a pretty rich combination with the soup starter.  My husband ordered the petite filet and I had the shrimp scampi pasta..soooo good!!  I am not kidding this was melt in your mouth delicious!!  We ordered sides of broccoli, scallop potatoes and cream corn.  I loved the broccoli and scalloped potatoes but cream corn was on the sweet side for me.  The sides were very large portions and for us...we were filling up fast.  We may have had two bites of each side.  Of course we had to try the bread pudding and creme brulee...both were excellent and sharable sizes...we only had room in our bellies for 2 bites:(  All and all a great spot for a business dinner or date night dinner.  Prices were awesome, service A+ and in my humble opinion, better than any restaurant on the Vegas Strip.  I know because we have spent 3 times more $$ at other places and had lousy service and average food.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cemer brûlée
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cream corn

a6ieSojgIItYhUcQg_6gGQ.text: Vic & Anthony's was amazing!  There was a little bit of a wait on a Saturday night, but it wasn't a bother at all. It was maybe only 10 minutes until we were able to sit at the bar which had exceptional service.  Jose the bartender is the man! He was inviting and friendly to our group and gave us spectacular menu recommendations. He recommended having the pork belly and crab cake, which was enough for us to share after already eating here and there while hopping around Downtown Las Vegas. Both dishes were cooked to perfection and made a great surf and turf meal.   The dessert was definitely an Instagrammable moment. This liquid of the gods was poured over a chocolate sphere that melted which ended up revealing a chococlate-y banana-y cake. Not sure the name of it as this was another Jose recommendation that we rolled with. I was totally full at this point, but I couldn't stop myself from grabbing another spoonful.  The drinks were also very well made. From what I remembered, my group had a manhattan and I asked for some girly drink that ended up being the lavender lemontini and Jose nailed both of them. Both were delicious and we will definitely be back at Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse in the near future.

AoIVrU2vG89wUqYqNJr-nQ.text: Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse is located in the Golden Nugget Hotel in downtown Las Vegas. We decided to dine here as it was rated amongst the best steakhouses in Las Vegas! This place lived up to its reputation! Vic & Anthony's is amongst the best steakhouses I have experienced! This restaurant is very beautiful, very elegant and classy! A True dining experience!  It is dark in there as tables are lit by candlelight! A romantic getaway, or, yet a beautiful ambiance amongst friends!  My friend found a very reasonably priced prix fix menu online! Talk about a score, comparable to a "restaurant week" menu! We started with our house and Caesar salads, all which were very delicious starters! The four of us ordered Filet Mignon! The Filet Mignons were very tender, juicy! Our steaks were complimented by a wide array of side dishes, such as the Au Gratin Potatoes, Onion Strings, Steamed Broccoli and Stuffed Baked Potato!   For dessert, we ordered the Creme Brulee, Chocolate Mousse Cake and Croissant Bread Pudding! All were to die for! Yummy.... :D   Our post dinner drinks included nice glasses of Port and Cognac! Our waiter was the bomb (sorry couldn't remember his name as we were drinking a lot! Hehe) but he was very energetic, entertaining and lively, which made our dining experience a memorable one! LOL  The ambiance, our dining experience, our waiter and of course our close group of friends who dined here made this a memorable night! We look forward to dining here again! This experience rates a 5-star review in my book, to go with the wonderful dishes and 5-star service by our waiter! If you are ever in downtown Las Vegas or at the Golden Nugget, be sure to check out Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croissant Bread Pudding
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Au Gratin Potatoes

AXOmlViYdGLvlGa_pWo94A.text: 4.5 stars.   I like this place. It's walking distance from our house and they always feed me delicious fresh foods that are properly prepared. We are nerds who always order the same things....but, that's why we come back, its comfy and easy and we always leave fat and happy.   Crab Cake - perfect for sharing. Wedge Salad - so yummy. Special delicious huge chunks of bleu cheese.  Bone-in Rib Eye - who doesn't love big fat steaks?! Asparagus - the roasted one with balsamic.  1 star off because they never get our table just right. We want to be anywhere that isn't on the main walkway or next to the kitchen door.   #landrysselect

AHKrQSeYiQ2kLP2eBy3ToA.text: I was told about the crab cakes and I have to admit, they are literally the best I've ever had. The steaks are good, but not phenomenal. What does make them above average is the toppings, so whichever steak you get, opt for adding one.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e9N0aBFZMriwjXwTiCPNNg.text: This place was recommend to us by a friend that worked in one of the best known steak houses for years and he said this was the best steak he had ever had. He was not wrong. Best we have ever had! Our server Luciano was amazing! He had excellent recommendations right down to wine pairings! Filet surf et turf and strip with bone marrow was delicious and like no steak we have ever had! The Spiced Pear cocktail was a great introduction to the meal. The shrimp cocktail and roasted bacon were amazing! We also had wild mushrooms (wish I had a stomach as big as my eyes), wedge salad, and mac & cheese (good but not phenomenal like everything else). We finished with the best cheese cake (surprising to us) that we had ever had! Wonderful atmosphere, staff, and experience. Side note,  The golden nugget is a great hotel and pool to stay at. Only wish Las Vegas became smoke free!

CbSAU2oXtI-kdmmu4q3STg.text: We last minute reserved a spot at Vic & Anthony's at the Golden Nugget in Downtown Las Vegas. Tonight we celebrated our 5 year anniversary and of course, we opted for a steakhouse.   My fiance ordered a 16oz prime rib and I ordered the pork chops (medium-well). Interesting fact by the server: Trichinellosis or Trichinosis was last reported sometimes in the 1900s deeming it safe to order pork chops different forms of cooking styles other than well-done. With some sides of asparagus and Au gratin potatoes... yum.   Although we didn't go for the full three-course meal and headed straight to the entree, we did have complimentary bread to go with the drinks we ordered (Pinot Grigio + Old Fashion).   Upon being served our meal, I slightly mentioned that it was our 5th year anniversary as I was embarrassed to ask for a photo in such a dark setting (flash can be so distracting... sorry to the people around us). Our server, Victor, was extremely attentive and kind. He made our experience remarkable. Thank you Vic & Anthony for another memorable night!

WzAvOwcMSF91QApxE8lT9Q.text: Fine dining, romantic atmosphere. Great steaks, exceptional bone-in filet mignon. Definitely a place to come back for more!

A93A1zYLDad9rQxUzNVQ7g.text: Simply awesome. As good as it gets. I had the 32 oz porterhouse.....can it get better than that??? My wife had the 12 oz filet....awesome as well. We both did the au gratins. They were extremely cheesy in a good way, and also very big. We've been told so many times "it's big enough to share"  only to be totally disappointed. These are! No worries though as they were so good we ate most of them and took the meager amount left home.   We had the creme brulee and chocolate mousse for dessert. Both were very good and the creme brulee in particular was large enough for two.   The bill was over $200 and I didn't bat an eye because everything was so good. That's what I expect in a high end steakhouse. Vic and Anthony's completely delivered in every aspect from food to service.

sRHS7pOadUD4xYV_MR6gDg.text: Delicious! Probably one of the best meals we've ever had. I got the lobster mac and cheese and hubby got the filet mignon special they advertised. So yummy.

Nfv6eWMpjiZQ7KVoLx69eQ.text: My taste buds are forever altered, after having experienced the deliciousness of the Vic & Anthony's experience.  The restaurant is located inside the Golden Nugget. My wife and I made reservations for 9:45. We are greeted by the hostess who was very friendly. The dining room is not very large, but it did not take away from the fact that it has a very intimate / romantic atmosphere. Perfect since the wife and I were there celebrating our 5th year wedding anniversary that night. The room is dim lit, with candles burning on every table.   As we are escorted to our table, every single waiter is gretting us with "Good evening", which was a very classy touch.  We are seated and served our bread basket. The bread alone was so fresh and warm. We start looking through the menu and I plan a strategy. My wife is set on the New York steak which is pretty big. I know for a fact she will not finish it. So I order the 8 oz filet mignon. That way I will eat my steak, and finish her left overs!   Our waiter finally comes around and addresse's me as Mr. "my last name" the entire evening which made me feel like a big shot. My wife's New York steak is at market price for $46.50. My filet mignon went for $38.50.  On the side we ordered the Au Gratin Potatoes.  Let me just say that my plan worked perfectly. My wife did not finish her steak, so I got to enjoy them both. I order my filet medium, and my wife requested her's medium well. The steak's literally melted like butter with every bite. Whatever seasoning they used was simply amazing which only enhanced the flavor,. By far the  best tasting steak I have ever had. I will consider it a crime for someone to come to Vegas, and n ot dine at Vic & Anthony's.  The Au Gratin Potatoes were incredible as well. They were baked with cheese on top.  The sides are portioned to share by the way. Very generous portions.  For dessert, we ordered the croissant bread pudding. You seriously do not know what you are missing if you dont try this piece of sweetness. According to our waiter,it won the dessert of the year award. I believe it. It was too good.  It is a pricey restaurant, but well worth every pennie!  We will no doubt be dining here again on our next Vegas trip..

V_DuSQvUuRwzonTjm0ZUbg.text: Visited 06.26.15  OMG wow.  Wow wow wow.  First off, this place was amazing, the food was excellent, the service was superior to many other "fine dining" establishments and all in all it was a great experience.  The only tiny downside is how close the tables are to each other so it was a bit hard to talk but other than that everything was on point.  Hector was our server and he truly made the experience phenomenal.  His recommendation of the Peju wine made a good meal great and even though my friend and I sat there for 2 hours he never rushed us, checkin when it was appropriate, kept our wine glasses full and all in all gave top notch service.  You rock Hector and I would come back just to hang out with you again.  The food consisted of three courses of mouth watering goodness.  We both had the preset menu and it was worth every penny and then some.    Lobster Bisque - I seriously could have just had a big bowl of this and been completely happy.  It was creamy and smooth, rich but not too rich, a hint of tomato and nice sized pieces of lobster.  Creamed Spinach - ok confession.  I love, love, LOVE creamed spinach.  And when a place does it well like Vic and Anthony's does I love it even more.  Ugh just cannot say enough good things about this dish.  Filet Mignon - excellent cut, cooked just right.  Soft and flavorful.  Excellent.  I ordered mine medium while my friend ordered hers medium well and both came out perfectly cooked.  Chocolate Mousse - ok lets be honest.  By this time I was stuffed so it was hard to eat anything else but I did try it and it was creamy and fluffy and if I wasn't ridiculously fully I would have probably ate the whole thing.    So, all in all a great night of eating and drinking and seriously one of the best meals overall I've had in a long, long time.

zMEuaAauXPdQ_wGvn3LM4A.text: We came here after our wedding for dinner and it was so very delicious. The Caesar salad was the best ever and our steaks were fantastic! Everything was great. Highly recommend if you're looking for a suburb meal.

gebQryV3ZNY6AmVS1buk1Q.text: The first time we dined at Vic & Anthony's was for our Anniversary on 4/19/16. The food, the service, everything was absolutely phenomenal. That is was brought us back for round two a little over a month later. The food again was absolutely delish. We both ordered the 8oz filet and a 1/2 pound side of crab, puree potatoes and asparagus. We also had the creme brulee for dessert which is a must!!! The second time around, the service was absolutely dreadful. Growing up in this town and seeing how things work, we more often then not get mistaken for "children who probably won't tip well." It is ridiculous. Just because I'm young doesn't mean I'm going to tip like shit. Now that you have given me terrible service and only touched our table once since we got our food, that is what will give you a bad tip. We constantly needed refills. Our server at one time glanced at our table, saw my husband needed and coke, then proceeded to greet the 8-top that just sat down. His spiel took almost 10 min. Fortunately we both work in the industry so we know what good service and bad service is, but when you are paying $100 per person to eat, you think the service would be above the rest.   **One server does not make a restaurant terrible. It is just unfortunate that a great restaurant hires incompetent servers.

XLNCrwdk0CQDqszzmWabuQ.text: Superior service and food make this place a standout on Freemont St.  The wait staff happen to be some of the best I have encountered over the years.  The food was delicious and cooked to perfection.  If you do decide to go get a reservation as I did to help get a seat promptly.  The restaurant is in the Golden Nugget which has become quite the hot spot since it has remodeled.

VoEoZvwzH1_KAxK3ikmr-Q.text: VEGAS OLD SCHOOL  I'm a trendy Angeleno.  I KNOW good food...especially steaks.  That's because LA is blessed with the swankiest steakhouses:  Boa, Mastro's, Cut ($130 filet mignon).   During our stay in Vegas, my sweetie said she wanted to try this place she found on Yelp called Vic & Anthony's.  My face said "sure!" but I scoffed inside.  Why am I leaving our suite at Cosmopolitan, not to go downstairs to dine at STK, but to drive all the way to the business district of Vegas for...Vic & who?  My first impression was that this restaurant's decor was dated, sort of Sinatra old-school.  I scanned the room and was surprised it was full of people all seemingly in rapture with their meals.  Probably local Las Vegans whose desert-baked brains can't comprehend modern upscale dining.  I ordered the filet mignon, medium rare, no accoutrements.  Juicy.  Tender.  So good I sat up from my slouch.  I was enveloped by a wisp of humility as that savory hunk of steak yelled out to me:  IN!...YO!...FACE!  When my sweetie asked if my filet mignon was up to par with those from LA, I answered, "It's not bad".    Damn, I really got ripped-off at Cut.

fais8PqBJ7rBXVbT-5KruQ.text: Outstanding from the service to the food. Hosted a bday dinner for my wife. From drinks to apps to dinner and desert and more drinks it was perfect.

0k-HJc2ybT9NIWZcvxzGXw.text: This was an amazingly delicious restaurant. Our server was excellent, just wished I remembered her name to post it. Every part of the meal was 5 stars and worth the price. The Golden Nugget was also really cool to walk around afterwards. We plan on visiting this restaurant again the next time we are in town.

bTuQEAx2KFgrukCiFBxWFw.text: This is a definite hidden gem downtown....top notch steakhouse inside a 3rd rate casino. Be sure and ask about the all new distinctive dining deal.....at $49.95 its a great value . I had the iceberg wedge salad and it was very good. Wife had the beefsteak tomato and onion salad..a little weird=no lettuce. I had the 8 oz. filet mignon,...melt in your mouth delicious...wife had the sea  bass with jumbo lump crab and loved it. my son opted for the rib eye steak off the regular menu and he was extremely pleased. we shared au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach. everything was tasty. for dessert...the croissant bread pudding and the creme brulee come highly recommended. Our meal was enhanced by our waiter..patrick. he was incredibly attentive and enthusiastic. a waiter who obviously loves his job! we were amazed that for a prix fix meal..the portions were normal size huge.sometimes restaurants skimp on the prix fix..not here. ambiance here is all old vegas steakhouse with rat pack type music a little too loud for my taste. also parking here can be a problem. golden nugget parking garage was full....we considered just cancelling things but a valet at the nearby golden gate let us park there and we walked over. we all left vic and anthonys very happy.

6HFJV58krxI0IWOQTfwGJg.text: I was not impressed with the wagyu NY strip and the crab legs were seasoned with sage (which it didn't say on the menu).  Great restaurant and atmosphere, but you would be better off with the filet and lobster.

nEO_NMYT4p_9_yMBv_2VMA.text: Hate to be the bad review guy, but here goes. Dressed to the nines, the wife and I step out to dinner at this joint. We've been dining out in Vegas for over 20 years and this is a first. Upon being seated I am asked to remove my hat as they have a no-hat policy. I think to myself, must be fancy, as I remove my hat and begin to enjoy a great dinner. Food and service was very nice. As I am enjoying this succulent filet mignon, I notice that most other guests in this place are dressed for an outing to Wal-Mart. Shorts, dirty tee shirts from 80's rock concerts, etc.. I ask the waiter why they are offended by people wearing hats. His answer was very polite as one would expect. Hate to ramble here, just make sure you don't wear a hat around these folks and you'll have a great time.

_UhXvH3jM6T07fNQyYcBiw.text: Wonderful dining experience all around.  The  Filet was perfectly prepared.  Creamed corn was to die for but the potatoes were just ok.  Wonderful service from beginning to end.  And let's not forget the desserts!!

bIT8YrFB9vbbWuZez7HPjQ.text: Looking for a fabulous dining experience and we picked Vic & Anthony's.   Bad choice!   I had the filet and lobster and my husband had the rib eye.   Lobster was very small and ok,   filet and rib eye were ok but not good enough for either of us to finish eating.   Chopped salad was excellent.   Wine list was huge,  we picked Seghesio Zinfandel a top notch Zin but they were out of it.     We opted for another bottle of Zin which was good but wines are so overpriced it was not surprising only one other table within our view had a bottle on their tables.   When asked how our dinner was we gave them our opinion and offered dessert which we declined but they did reduce our bill by a small percentage which we did not ask for but accepted.  Going back??  Nah!

lcdGpXvdhEYifrMvMhcp9Q.text: Delicious food but it's pricey. The waiter was not very friendly otherwise it would be 5 stars. Recommended for special occasions and business dinners!

QzYwwQ97mBi5RCRsesKYLw.text: Ribeye was off the hook ! Get one  you won't regret it ! Service was top notch .. Vic & Anthony's know how to treat you right !

61oYvByCDin12GdzWVZnsA.text: Simply Outstanding, What a wonderful evening at Vic and Anthony's, the service is always outstanding and our waiter (Luciano) was very knowledgeable and professional.   Now , to the food , for myself , the Colorado lamb chops were delicious , cooked to perfection, and served with a flavorful mint jelly, bread was warm and replenished as needed, I truly enjoyed it. My dining companion had the tuna with a pear salad and enjoyed hers as well, the companionship, service , quality of food and over all ambience was top shelf across the board, so good in fact I had to make it back, pan seared chicken one night ( moist , flavorful , perhaps best piece of chicken I have ever had) and then another round of the chops on another visit.   Check out this eatery  in downtown at The beautiful Golden Nugget , you will be glad you did.

vidFzYgLDGEg6ksbCpkhsA.text: I absolutely love this place! All of the food is delicious here.  We had the filet and ribeye with the risotto with salmon,  and I must add that it was the best risotto I have ever put in my mouth.  The steaks cut like butter.  Do yourself a favor and eat here your next trip to Vegas inside the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street!

Ma_5B67IHPmqyuQHcC9wOQ.text: Okay, if you're a guest of the casino, Vic & Anthony's has one particular meal that you simply can't pass up.  It's an Australian lobster tail they fly in and it is gooooood.  The reason I mention guest of the casino is because while I love an awesome lobster, this particular one is outside the range of what I'd pay for a single meal; it's I think around $120 to $130, and that's before you order drinks, apps, sides, etc. If Golden Nugget is picking up your bills though, oh mama, you better order this monster.  It's very close to a pound, post-cooked weight, so you could probably even split it if you wanted.  It's an unusual taste, kind of sweet, so completely different than what you'd get from a Maine lobster tail.  I had it twice on my last visit, saved half and turned it into breakfast the next day; simply fantastic.  As far as everything else goes; I've always been very pleased with the food and drinks here.  The place is very dimly lit but still has enough light to see some of the old Vegas memorabilia on the walls; lots of photos from days gone by.  The service has been excellent every time I've visited.  They, along with Golden Nugget, are also very accommodating to guests of the casino, so if you're a last minute kind of person, and they are full, ask your casino host to get you in and it will happen; love the service from them and Golden Nugget.  Their caprese salad is excellent; large fresh crisp tomatoes and big blocks of mozzarella with just the right amount of balsamic vinegar and basil.  Steaks; fresh and always cooked perfectly.  Their servers, and more importantly their cooks, understand how to cook a steak Pittsburgh style so don't hesitate to order it that way if that's how you like it.  Even the sides are excellent; cream corn, onion rings, etc.  There are a million steak houses in Vegas, and this is probably my number three option; good enough to go out of your way for.  Just as a point of reference, my #1 is N9NE at the Palms; their surf & turf is simply the best meal I've ever had, so it will be very hard for anywhere else to ever displace them.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jQ2mL7E9dhP_qqDh90Hrzw.text: Had another stellar meal here during a staycation at the Golden Nugget. Only the noise level and TVs in the non-separate bar stops this from being a 5* review. They are serving high end food, at big ticket prices, while food and service are top notch, it just takes away from the ambience to have patrons yelling at the NHL game during a meal, IMO. YMMV.   Our waiter started us off with cocktails and suggested the Shrimp & Crab Martini appetizer, it sounded chaotic: jumbo shrimp, crab claws and lump crab meat with kimchi slaw, plaintain chips to "dip" out of eponymous glass...but boy did we love it! Very unique, and a great kickoff to set the tone for the meal.   Forgoing wine for a second round, he had the filet mignon special served with truffle mashed potatoes and asparagus, savoring every bite. My twin lobster tails were perfectly executed, we shared a side of spinach which was simple and delicious. Before dinner, we (I!) decided to order the Artisan Cheese Board in lieu of dessert: it was magnificent, we battled over the accoutrements as much as the five excellent cheeses which were chosen by the Chef.   This was a superb meal, with 5* service throughout, Vic & Anthony's remains a favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas, but for a quiet, romantic evening, not my first choice.   * great for group celebrations *  ** still have fantastic gynormous whole lobsters & the biggest tails (3# is not unusual ) I've seen in Las Vegas  **  *** my pics do not do the food justice, but I abhor flash photography in fine dining settings ***

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon, truffle mashed potatoes and asparagus.
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twin lobster tails

GR-a0jdRUNY2XIaS0zUAvw.text: This is one of the better steak houses I have been to.  There are great selection and the staff are polite and prompt.  Our server was great and had the perfect balance of checking in and allowing us to enjoy our meal.  I was also impressed by the matradee being vigallent in subduing a loud and obnoxious party that was seated next to us during our meal.  The food was excellent and the steak was cooked to perfection.  I would recommend this steakhouse to anyone that wants to have an elegant experience.  Amazing service and great food, what more could you ask for...

29lHFb_KXK1aUgSQmicf4w.text: Great food, awesome service, large portions. Be careful of the broccoli side order it's enough to serve like 6 people. It's like a whole tree lol. The best bread pudding ever! Our server Laura made our experience priceless. I can't wait to go back.

q-c8DMRtnalZOR0nsFVpQA.text: This is a wonderful restaurant ! The service was extremely friendly and professional. We had to eat at the bar because there was no hope for dinner reservations till 9:30. The bar was fine plenty of room to eat. We had the special filet and lobster it was wonderful.

TFDtrakGkYQQ5Z68lNGD_A.text: I eat steak; a lot of it!  Lol seriously, very good place and the food is amazing. The server was a pleasure to work with as well. I had the ribeye and it was cooked to perfection.   Liquor was also on point and they some really wonderful selections of cognac.    The desert was awesome as well and the servings were extremely generous.   I will definitely be back in September when I return to the strip.

YWediE2FpSlC-ugSye2jeg.text: Well here we are again 1/15/17 at Vic & Anthonys First are waiter Patrick was spot on with great service friendly conversation. We order from the Distinctive dinning menu (Which you need to print off and bring with you $52 each ) Great food Ceasar salad , Lobster bisque,  Main entree 8oz Filet Mignon perfect. We split a side of Asparagus yummy. Desserts Chocolate mousse cake 5 stars My favorite Croissant bread pudding The Best.

TfApqtY-fTbug8aqvMoxag.text: Almost four stars, but I just couldn't pull the trigger for that.    Most importantly, the steaks are excellent!  Had the 8 ounce filet, medium, and it was cooked as requested, very good flavor, but not quite as tender as some other elite steakhouses in Las Vegas.   The sides were good, but not great.  The au gratin potatoes tasted good, but had way way too much cheese, and was also too greasy.  The onion strings were good, but nothing to write home about.   One side that did stand out was the lobster bisque.... very well balanced, and rich (that gets an A+)  The gimmicks didn't impress me, like the "distinctive dining menu" that had to be referenced on the website, as it wasn't included with the menu provided by the server.  Other reviews mentioned that the "distinctive dining menu" must be printed... I call BS on that.  When I go to a great steakhouse, I don't want to print special menus as part of some procedure before dinner!    When the server presents the bill, they also give a song and dance about some club to join to get special dining discounts.

BQP2m8-S28cza0U4Dw_ESw.text: This is now my favorite steakhouse. They were able to accommodate a late large party reservation for us. The Ribeye was great. The creme brulee was excellent, it is served on about a 10" plate so you get all the great part of a creme brulee. My multiple bourbon pours were generous. I tell everyone that I know that is going to Vegas about this Steakhouse.

OPqJGclh90HS8L3YI5LtPg.text: Wow never thought old Vegas would have theee best restaurant in Vegas our family decided to spend Christmas in Vegas so we made reservations for Christmas Eve and it was by far the highlight of the trip the service was top notch I ordered a bone in ribeye my go to at any steak house and this one was the undisputed best enjoyed it with a side of Duck fat potatoes and my mouth still waters thinking about the Bread pudding desert I have had countless trips to Vegas and have eaten at many restaurants and this is absolutely the best

PudUM6aRSJdegZbHOOEwuA.text: The best steak dinner ever! Filet w dark mushrooms and creamy potatoes.. yum! Amoshere is so classy but casual excepted... Our waiter Luciano was the best... he made suggestions and was a real pro!

-J_vYUIyogj0lp-T8RQvaQ.text: Everything about Vic & Anthony's is great. The ambiance, the service and of course the food was fantastic. They have the best creamed spinach that i have ever had. The location in Lake Charles is just as good . Will be back next time in Vegas (or Lake Charles)

MHbpjyVc6s6SViyD-aoT8g.text: Wow wow wow wow & wow   We have tried about 90% of the steak houses here in Las Vegas. Whether it be a bizarre me at SLS or CarneYvino at Venetian,  This steak house is so far above the rest you can't even compare. It's almost in its own category. Chef Eric has his steak cooking method down to a T.  From the second we walked in the atmosphere; the server was so knowledgeable yet not pushy in the slightest way. The food from ...the crab cake to the Tomahawk, to the bone in filet, to the bone in ribeye, to that lobster tail was unbelievable.   I work at a steakhouse on the strip here in Vegas, but was beyond impressed tasting Chefs food. It was an unreal experience.   Crab cake- sorry but holy F@&k!!!!!!! So much crab. Big, thick, a light lemon bur blanc sauce. 5stars  Quail- enough to share for 6 ppl, the nice spice was perfect for the dish  Tar- tar make it as salty as you'd like, as it comes on a salt block.   48oz tomahawk Australian Wagu- speechless. Full of flavor. The best cut of beef I've ever had  15oz 180 dry aged Bone in filet- bucket list. Crossed off. Couldn't ask for something more worth trying.   Other guest got the bone in ribeye and the lobster tail. Both biggest steaks I've ever seen.   Dessert- biggest cheese cake ever, a chocolate cake that was as rich as some of the gamblers here in Vegas, and a bread pudding that would knock you off your feet.   To finish with the beat espresso Martini I've ever hat.   By far...  The best steakhouse in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Australian Wagu tomahawk
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged bone in filet 180 days

Gp8XQg4aH6akCttjDoVong.text: UNBELIEVABLE!  The food: OUTSTANDING  The service: IMPECCABLE Four in out party for dual anniversary. Steaks were perfection and the four pound lobster we split was delicious & flavorful. Sides, dessert, all were great. Everything about our experience was perfect. Wish I would have gotten our servers name! Now we are headed back to Vegas and I can't wait to dine at Vic & Anthony's again!

SRToI_8SWMPLPJPJGFpdzA.text: I like to write reviews on all types of dinning experiences. But this one is going to be the shortest one I have ever written.   - Drop the Microphone SIMPLY PUT!!! EXCEPTIONAL Dinning experience. OUT

gBNlGMXlsYg1r9NnUtijSA.text: Probably one of the best meals I've had in a very long time. Service was fantastic, the steak was flawless and the ambiance spectacular. Can't say enough about out dinning experience. We have been to V&A in Houston on many occasions and now will make sure we visit this location every chance we get when in Vegas.

BwfbVRsZLrxf5fG5w3HyzA.text: This is our favorite upscale steak house. The service is outstanding. Our wait person was a gentleman named Dennis. He made us feel like family or long lost friends. The food was just totally outstandingly. When we were leaving we got to meet the manager/ Shawn. We let him know that his establishment has just became our yearly wedding anniversary / birthday restaurant . Sorry Morton's! Shawn gave us his card and informed us that we should let him know when we will be coming back so he could make sure that Dennis would be available.   Update of the above review: I will not change a thing about what is posted about except to say. I only wish I could give them 6 stars

NhEAPwlLpyXSglUrNhbs6w.text: Absolutely the best restaurant in Las Vegas!! The crab cakes are the best anywhere period!! Staff is as good as it gets!  You would be crazy to come to Las Vegas and eat here!

zbaZQT_Hsld0rytos3nsEg.text: Absolutely phenomenal restaurant!!! And if you want an amazing experience, make sure to ask for Ben as your server

Jc_T6xndBc2KvPy_mF6bQw.text: The Bone in Ribeye is a great steak for a good price and it is 21oz. The flavor is very good, very juicy and perfect seasoning.  The staff is all very nice, attentive and have all the answers. The menu has an excellent variety,  with desserts also. We  will definitely be back to try more sides. You have to try this place.

5zGRDavM-hYH1SBvqtD3NQ.text: Awesome!!  Located in the Golden Nugget, the setting is 'rat pack-like'. The background music is mostly Frank. Really cool. Classy joint. I feel I should use the word 'joint'. Ha, ha.   We came on the recommendation of the Machine Guns Vegas lady, Carol. She had picked us up at our hotel and dropped us off at Machine Guns.   We ordered the special: a 45 oz bone-in porterhouse for two. It is sliced and served with roasted carrots and fingerling potatoes. Enough food for four people, honestly. Glad we hadn't eaten since breakfast.   It was cooked perfectly medium. The carrots were sweet and charred. Yum.   We split a chopped salad. Superb.   And we were so stuffed, of course we had dessert. The ' lightest' item on the menu was the creme brulee'. It comes in about a foot-long ramekin, barrow and long. Another four person eat. Topped with fruit. Yum.   I also had an Irish coffee and a beer. Roll me out, please.   Service is impeccable. Expect to spend some money. Our bill was about $250. So worth it.   Go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The special, a 45 oz sliced porterhouse with roasted carrots and fingerling potatoes.

PFWqP1uGAFYA45gTYMXHsA.text: Wow, 'nuff said!  What a marvelous dinner and equally, an experience!  As you can see from our reviews, we love eating at steakhouses and appreciate attention to detail, steak temperature, crust, cut and aging.   Vic & Anthony's delivers on all of our important criteria!  Simply said, they just deliver on all notes of a great steak.  Imagine sitting down with a great Manhattan cocktail and taking all the aromas in anticipation of what is to come.  We ordered calamar and it was the best I've ever imagined let alone eat.  I was a commercial squid fisherman and have had calamar all over the us and especially in Monterey, CA.  Just the appetizers are worth the trip.  The bone marrow is  silky, smooth and full of flavor and somehow the bread points were extra special as well.    I'm speechless as to how to review their steaks with adequate language because it was almost a spiritual experience.  With that said, the steak was perfectly marbled, cooked the right temperature and had a lovely crust.  I guess if you have not experienced a steak like this, trying to explain it is impossible.  There are a lot of steakhouses in Las Vegas but Vic & Anthony's, in the Golden Nugget, downtown is worth the Uber ride from the strip.    M-A-N-G-A!!!!! with all 5 exclamation points.

gSwKmUoyxvabeIP7D30oLQ.text: We eat at Vic & Anthony's every time we are in Las Vegas. It is truly our most favorite restaurant on the planet. I always order their Ginormous Lobster tail and my husband orders steak... then we share. The food and service is consistently 5 star plus. We ate there again on 8/21/19 and Jim was our waiter. Top notch is all I can say. My husband ordered the Vic's Old Fashioned for the first time after having read an article on the bartender here. He says it's the best cocktail he has ever had. So once again, Vic & Anthony's has exceeded our expectations.  I highly recommend this restaurant over any other in Las Vegas if you're wanting the best of the best.  Guys.. if you're really wanting to impress the girls, look no further. It's also one of the most romantic settings.

kEXwIoEDPiiH-VRnK9-FdQ.text: This was literally the BEST meal my husband and I have ever had. Everything was superb. The atmosphere was intimate and intriguing. Service was first rate. The only thing we didn't love was the bread right at first...the crust was so hard it was almost impossible to eat. I mentioned that to the server and she immediately brought us out another serving of it that was only warmed and not toasted. It was much better. The price was quite expensive but you certainly get what you pay for in this instance. HEAVEN!!!  We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon, mashed potatoes, asparagus, and a side of mushrooms. Perfection!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and butter to start off the meal.

wXtl00AvEvMBQGE-2fIBLw.text: We came in to Vic & Anthony's for a dinner date during one of our monthly Vegas trips. Great interior and decor inside, but rather dark. We made reservations and we're quickly sat at a nice table. Very attentive waitstaff and our water glasses were never empty.   We ordered our food from their online-only "Distinctive Dining" menu which is a cheaper option that is only $50 per person for a 3 course meal.  If you have ever eaten here, you will know that this is an excellent deal!  We started the dinner out with the Lobster Bisque, which we always judge a good restaurant by.  This one did not disappoint!  Creamy and warm with chunks of lobster...  fantastic.  We also tried their Caesar salad which was good.  For main entrees we went with the filet and the shrimp scampi, both of which were amazing.  Buttery, garlicky shrimp and the steak was cooked to a perfect medium.  We paired these with mashed potatoes and a side of the lobster mac & cheese.  Out of this world and a must try for new diners!  Dessert came out and was a perfectly browned creme brulee.  We were so full at this point, but couldn't not finish this thing.  It was just so good.  Overall, fantastic evening with delicious food, drinks and attentive but not overbearing waiter service.  If you are looking for a fun, elegant old school dining experience, give Vic & Anthony's at the Golden Nugget a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ix3aHd3q1-2i3Q8LO8Hr1w.text: Best service in Las Vegas!  The staff here is very accommodating, fast and friendly.  Our server was very kind and attentive. She frequented our table and was great wig helping pick out some of the best menu items.   We enjoyed a very large cheese plate that had several options of cheese and toppings. I also had the salmon stuffed crab cake. This option was MORE than enough for one to dine on, which was nice as the restaurant is quite pricey.   My meal came with a side of asparagus and potatoes. The fish was cooked just right and had a lot of flavor. The size of the fish was delightfully surprising.  It was a great portion size and the crab cake on top really set it off!  I would've LOVED to enjoy dessert but I would've probably fell over at the table. I'm really looking forward to trying this restaurant again!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and Crab Cake

e1SiXP6AgkRJDJb9DTIaPA.text: Everything was above and beyond here! Our waiter, Matt, was very thoughtful and helpful. Our food, oh man, worth every penny.   My husband ordered the wagyu rib eye accompanied with potatoes au gratin. Holy wow! Upon delivery of his steak, he couldnt help but lean in and take in the amazing aroma. It cut like butter and melted in his mouth like a spoonful of Belgium chocolate. The potatoes au gratin were quite literally the most cheesiest, seasoned, blend of perfection to accompany his "Man Dinner". Let's face it, what guy isn't in love with a good steak and potato dinner.  He paired his meal with a fresh and crisp IPA "top of the world".  I am a crab lover. It's quite literally my favorite food. I had every intention of ordering the king crab, until Matt described the surf and turf special. An 8oz filet mignon with sage/garlic butter melted over the top, a 6 oz Australian lobster tail simply brushed with butter, seasoned haricots vert (green beans) and fingerling potatoes. My mind was effectively changed and I'm so glad it was! My steak was so tender and flavorful. My lobster, sweet and delightful, my green beans, cooked perfectly and the potatoes,  well, they were overshadowed by everything else, but still very tasty. Lol.   We decided on a dessert, it was our anniversary dinner, after all. We chose the "in the globe". Its basically a hollow sphere of chocolate hiding within itself a bananas foster gift from the gods. They finish it at the table by pouring a banana liquor sauce onto the globe which then melts it open to reveal the gift within. It's quite the little show, so have your camera ready!  Dinner for the 2 of us was $233. It was expensive, but it was definitely a whole experience that every one should treat themselves to at least once.   The ONLY thing I was disappointed by was that I had told them it was our anniversary at the time I made our reservation and the service hostess said she would make a note and let them know. However, nothing was ever said. I should have mentioned it again, but my husband isnt the guy that likes a spectacle to be made. I let it go, but regret it. I would have liked to have seen what they would have done as a "special extra".

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu rib eye
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat counter
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drawn butter jacuzzi

4pw40tUAiIKiDOJncav2Iw.text: I seriously love their appetizers!  I came here on a Tuesday night with my girlfriend after our speakeasy adventure at the Laundry Room. We sat at their bar and ordered some of their amazing appetizers. So we end up ordering the following:  Crab cake was recommended by our bar tender and it was really packed with real crab meat and the breading was so light that you can taste that they did not use some fillers inside. Its loaded with crab meat, yum!  My second favorite was their Pork Belly---I just love it.   Calamari was good but I'm not a fan of the sweet sauce. I'd rather have it plain with shishito peppers. Next time I'll ask them, no sauce.   I had a great time, the bartenders even if they are almost closing they keep interacting with us while finishing their side works.

exB2TbTfzyhgAcv0g-ARcA.text: Had a fantastic A5 Kobe steak, the best cut of steak I've ever had, as usual service was outstanding walked in without reservations and was seating right away. My appetizer was 1/2 lb of Alaskan king crab and it was perfectly steamed. If you are ever in the Vegas area this is a must, best steakhouse hands down

Wv7aNqTIQphl-ADayMMsdA.text: This is a regular stop for us even though we never actually stay at the Golden Nugget.  I also realize that there are more fine dining steak and chop houses in Las Vegas than seemingly anywhere else on the planet.  I mean the choices are so infinite that just picking the right place is almost a joke.  So let me give you my best shot at why we enjoy this particular location...  1. The food--So we are never disappointed at the quality of the steaks, seafood and sides.  Steaks are always cooked perfectly and the seafood choices have always been prepared perfectly and if you have non steak eaters with you they will be happy.  I love the brussel sprouts and I am a semi expert in their preparation.  The lobster mac and cheese are worth the trip downtown and we also love the duck fat fries and all of the other vegetables (hungry now that I am typing this)  2. Service--great service makes all food that much better for me so I could give them a 6 instead of a 5 because we are always and I mean alway well taken care of.  More than one person keeps on eye on things and like all cool, older places the wait staff are always long time employees that know and care about your experience.    3.
