I love getting off the strip and a trip downtown is always fun for a change of scenery and a bit of straight up crazy.  UBER is $7-15 from just about anywhere on the strip with no waiting so I don't even have to drive.    This place won't disappoint so do yourself a favor and try it out!

c3-7fkcEqKwHZ1HR6WmVOw.text: Inside Golden Nugget hotel  As a local, I took a Group of 6  for dinner, overall I would say 5 Star, except my server didn't fix my steak problem. Furthermore no GM came by to check in so I couldn't even comment on the servers dismissive attitude and let the make it right.   Ambiance is average, nothing too eye catching.  Drinks were perfect pours- I had a Gin and Tonic martini of some sort with a special tonic- it was amazing.   Food- All of the appetizers were yummy Calamari and the Oysters were some of the best I've ever had. The Mac n cheese never disappoints, along with the duck fat potatoes and Mac n cheese.   Service- our Server seemed annoyed though I have no clue why. He forgot to Add the Cajun to my steak even though I ordered it that way and didn't offer to fix it after I asked him if he forgot it which he said he did. I don't really like ribeye unless it's Cajun so I would have ordered something else if I knew he was going to forget. Disappointed for a $60 steak.   Our bill was about $700 for a party of 6 which is reasonable since we ate like kings and had1-2 cocktails each.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YLPbacM1UtycjJRfRkwx_A.text: Had Christmas Eve dinner with very dear friends and. Had reservations for 5 pm.   We were seated promptly. The restaurant has a beautiful rustic look.  Our waiter was very informative in explaining the menu to us and the specials as well.  All of our food was amazing. My friend had brazed chicken , her boyfriend had pork chops I had scallops and my husband had lobster Mac and cheese and everyone lived there food  Definitely an amazing experience.    I would definitely recommend restaurant to anyone who wants to experience quality seafood or steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decoration in restaurant
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and cheese
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and lobster tails on display when you walk into the restaurant

ZKib4Gy5LW7JuC0oXdXNng.text: We've had more Thanksgiving turkey than anyone really needs. What does this have to do with Vic & Anthony's, you ask?  Not coincidentally, Thanksgiving 2018 found us at the Golden Nugget with reservations at this steakhouse with no intention of ordering anything turkey related and, considering that steaks & cocktails have no known consumption limit (or so I've been told), we heeded the call for cattle.  We enjoyed pre-dinner cocktails and then our prime grade steaks of filet mignon on the bone, rib eye, plus a shared appetizer of brussel sprouts (with bacon). This was more than enough to satisfy our appetites, but not so much that we couldn't enjoy casino fun afterwards.  The restaurant is nice, very dark & romantic, and provides top quality food and service. Expect to pay good money, but if you charge it to your room bill, it almost feels like you got it comped.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fuuoJABIX40YT9Vg5f7X0A.text: Amazing food and great service. I have a broken arm and they even sliced the steak up perfectly in consideration. The mushrooms and potatoes are great too. Steak is amazing.

4TwzmYblxrYoS3JpdsMJCA.text: My overall experience was good.  The service was top notch.  Jim and James made it especially nice.  Jim's knowledge of Vegas history was a welcome learning experience...When my steak was not cooked to my liking they did everything they could to make up for it.  They were very kind and understanding when I told them "No Blood"!   My steak was good, my salad was good and my drinks were out of this world!!!  Was fairly priced also... can't complain.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign outside
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped salad
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spiced Pear Martini

bSh2Y_OzlUBIYCD1jjX2OA.text: In my opinion, this is one of the best steakhouses as well as restaurants in Las Vegas. When you walk in, you see the display of different types of steaks to your left. And when you enter the dining area, it feels like a 50s classy restaurant with grandeur, luxury and happiness. Then, the lighting, the waiters outfits and the decor feels like a 1930s atmosphere. So it's set up like the 50s but blends with 30s elements...so awesome. Now on to the food, the crab cake is definitely small but you won't be disappointed; the texture is perfect. The Colorado lamb chops is not the best I have had. I have had better like when the Alize was still open at the Palms. But still decent. But the lobster filet special was my favorite. The lobster is cut perfectly. When I eat the lobster there is no blandness (which tends to happen to large seafood pieces) but one long tail of heaven. As for the filet mignon, I had it medium rare, and every slice I made was the correct ratio of raw to cooked. There's just too many things I like this place including the great service. Check it out yourself to see it.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chef Special: Part lobster tail and part filet mignon.
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Colorado Organic Lamb Chops
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Lump Crab Cake

qh4boPzt7nUhRxkGov285w.text: An excellent restaurant with great food, great service & ambience!  This is a wonderful place to bring that special someone for an elegant meal.  Those looking for a cheap experience or fast meal, this isn't the place for you.  Linen napkins, Crystal water goblets, formal dining settings, uniformed staff, are all items you will experience.  Songs sung by the Rat Pack, plays softly in the background in a darkened room, helps to add to the ambience.  (Rat Pack was a group of singers from the 50's.  Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin & Sammy Davis Jr were the more well-known members.). The Filet Mignon was cooked to perfection with a side of Au Gratin mashed potatoes.  The Salmon with capers was flavorful and moist.  The 3 scoop Gelato was a wonderful finish to our meal.  I noticed they had a full bar and large selection of wines.  The service was exceptional with the servers & bus boys appearing without having to hunt for them.  It was an enjoyable dinner & we will be back.  Btw for fellow Yelpers who belong to the Landry Select Club, don't forget to show them your card before paying the bill.  For those who aren't members, it's a good $25 investment!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BeK0d7CsSJ4jlU-Q_yPd_A.text: Omg! They have the most excellent food & service! I had the A5 filet. It was the best I have ever had. Rare & melted like butter. Seared tuna, portabella mushrooms, duck fat potatoes & asparagus - - - YUMMY. Michael made our experience OUTSTANDING. I forgot to take a picture before we desimated the food

iSZLUiMmrvhHH6U68RWqQQ.text: Fancy schmancy. I came here with a bunch of friends in order to celebrate a bachelor party (party of 11). They were very accommodating and gave us a private room in the rear of the restaurant. We started off with some appetizers, fresh oysters and calamari with sweet and spicy peppers. By far the freshest oysters I've ever had. Very good, and I'm not even a big oyster fan. The calamari was interesting, served on a bed of sweet/sour sauce with peppers. I'm accustomed to eating calamari with a marinara or garlic-lemon mayonnaise sauce but this was a nice change. Onto the steaks; we got:  On the bone prime ribeye. A solid steak that you can't go wrong with. Flavorful and juicy, mine could have actually used a bit more char on the outside; the inside was impeccable with just the right amount of warm red in the center.  On the bone Prime Porterhouse. I only had a bite from one of my friend's steak and it was impeccable. Perfect amount of char and red center.  Tomahawk chop, a 40 oz monstrosity of a steak. The outside was a bit more charred than we were expecting but the inside was still succulent. Really, you're only ordering this just to say that you ordered this.  Overall, 4 solid stars. The food was great, but nothing wow'd me to warrant a 5 star rating. It felt like your typical high end steakhouse, but nothing to really set it apart from other places. Located in the Golden Nugget Hotel, so valet. Or uber.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vesper martini
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

TUZD_AbbLNzTeXw1Ym6nXA.text: We came here for our anniversary dinner while we were in town. Service was excellent.  It was quite loud in here, but it's Vegas so I'm not sure what you can do about that.   I ordered the bone in filet and the meat was very tender and very yummy. The bone was gigantic and I think it was at least half the weight of the steak.   They were prompt and attentive and wished us happy anniversary with a little dessert dish. We'll be back!

BA2pD1buMK5PMyZjHvvsrQ.text: Some of the best service and food that I've had in Vegas. The servers are attentive but still give diners their space- a rare trait. Tried the ribeye, splurged on the caviar and had the wedge salad. All were impeccable and delicious. Dinner was so good that I almost forgot that I was at a work function. Yum.

FNpeUG9LwXZvqH5qSR1zZg.text: AMAZING i loved loved there sea food cocktail ..  i don't eat meat but my fiance and father were equally impressed.. large portions huge we weren't expecting such portion and ordered 5 sides , too much.  we had left overs for two days

6fzZKSaOzmtbBQ9tfpa6kQ.text: Excellent experience overall. Good selection of scotch, excellent appetizer. Main courses were delicious!! And our waiter, Victor, was very helpful and knowledgeable. Highly recommend to anyone who wants to have a quality dinner around Fremont St.

mz5Ku_s63TnDxnRRaFvMjw.text: This place is amazing, we had crab cake appetizers and I got the 8oz Filet Mignon which was perfect. I expected it to be more expensive than it was since the service and food were top notch. I am getting married at the Golden Nugget in the future and can not wait to come back.

ZvDZ0bB1PE-o5Dn-uT9mZQ.text: Great Wine Selection  Good Food  Great Service  Outdated Decor   Maybe everything in the old part of Las Vegas is supposed to look like a wiseguy era, cigar smoking, handkerchief mouth covering type place. Whatever it was, I felt like I was paying for the food, wind options and service only. They really need to modernize this place.   I don't eat steak, but my friend made me try it - it was exquisite. My chicken was amazing and the Grgich wine was spectacular! Make the trip out here to see the Fremont Street Experience and Vic and Anthony's!

gkc_sPwWyhhCsEb1MJuC8g.text: Miguel was our server and he was outstanding!!! We were a party of 8 with several peeps in high demand of attention and he accomodated every request with a smile. If you order any of the side dishes, they can be shared amongst your party, they are huge portions!!! Caeser salad was heavy on the dressing with few crutons. Also had the crabcake; it was moist and very tastey!!!

3Sk77LjS_3rMOdBjukm-lQ.text: Our experience here was that of an average steak house, comparable to Ruth's Chris. Except Ruth's Chris has better calamari. Sorry.  Maybe it was the high expectations from the raving reviews, maybe people who reviewed have been to the Outback too many times, I don't know, but Vic & Anthony's, while good, didn't stand out at all.  Like a good steakhouse, they're going to give you a black napkin if you have black pants on. They're going to put it on your lap for you. They're going to expect you to use your forks and knives in the right order and take them away as the courses progress. The steaks are going to be about $30-$50 bucks. You're going to order sides to share. Your steak is going to be served on a hot plate and they're going to tell you to cut it in half to make sure it's served correctly. It's going to taste well seasoned and melt in your mouth.  This.... I can get anywhere. So is there anything else that makes me want to come here rather than any other steak house? No.  The only note of originality here is that the wedge salad is huge (too big, really). The Prime Ribeye is also A LOT OF MEAT.   The Au Gratin potatoes are covered in a Velveeta-like cheese that sticks to your mouth and sits like a rock in your stomach. Not in a good way.  They have a good wine list and I recommend the Cab/Syrah wine by the glass if you're leaning in that direction.  Still giving it four stars because there's nothing to really complain about... the food was good, the service was boring but standard... there's just nothing to rave about. For $150 bucks we were pretty well fed, but I'd rather have spent it somewhere else.

lVoxe-e9Qsxa1gUvF4-zng.text: Service here is on point. Seriously. From the water and bread refills to the waiter inconspicuously asking one of the guys helping at the table to get an extra plate (what ARE they called?), these guys are on point.  The food didn't blow me away, but it was solid.   The sourdough bread that kept on coming out had a nice crunch with a soft interior and was served with a whipped butter.  Chopped salad was just a chopped salad - nothing special there.   When all our dishes came out, our server immediately asked us all to check the temperature of our meat to make sure it was ok. Mine was not, and he profusely apologized for it and took it back immediately to correct the temperature. Definitely have not seen this done before. (But then again, I haven't been to THAT many steak houses).   I had the veal chop which was good, and tasted like pork chop, but I kind of wish I just stuck with a regular steak to get that meaty taste. The bites of steak I did have from the other people in my party had a nice salt/pepper exterior with a nice crunch and was really flavorful.  As far as sides go, the mushrooms were good, but a bit too seasoned (marinating in something balsamic for too long?), asparagus was good, potato au gratin was exceptional, as well as the creamed corn.   Would recommend coming to this restaurant. It was also a nice surprise to check out the Golden Nugget. Who knew that it would look so fancy inside! I'm always on the strip, and this was my first venture to downtown Vegas

XqYTUXMO6T50bNddzaSNhA.text: The wine and drinks were very good and very reasonable. My steak came out and one bite proved so extremely salty that my wife (who digs salt) could't eat it and recommended that I wipe off the seasoning from the 21-oz masterpiece before me. After summoning the waiter and letting him know that I really couldn't actually eat the awesome cut of New York goodness that had been placed before me he disappeared immediately and I enjoyed some of the entrees that had landed in the meantime. Our waiter was fantastic. Nice moustache. Great care for the patrons. He came back out with the maitre'd and a totally clean unseasoned and perfectly medium rare masterpiece of a NY. Probably pushing 3lb to be honest. I ordered more wine for the table and made sure the waiter was taken care of. Here is my guidance to the establishment: Almost everything was over seasoned that night. I don't know if that's typical. The vegetables, particularly the beet salad, were perfect. If you could arrange to have a restroom that was in your own space and not in the casino that would be helpful. I would eat there again in a heartbeat even though I had to send my steak back the first time around.

6A1zEnso1986y9FiaGT7PQ.text: I have eaten here a couple of times and food and service has been very good.  Old school feel inside of Golden Nugget.

iF5A6-WetURFvCsETNNQoA.text: Went to visit our favorite steakhouse on our trip with friends last week, and again failed to disappoint.  We've tried most steakhouses in Vegas over the years, and this is definitely the one that is most consistently amazing...  The older arrogant, and a little rude waiter was a surprise this time, but he still got the job done with a little prodding.  Must haves are the bone-in Ribeye, and the Australian Lobster Tail. My wife's 8 ounce fillet cooked medium was also amazingly tender and juicy.  You must also have the Wild Mushroom side, and the creamed spinach and the asparagus is awesome...  Calamari starter was great too.  Wine is a little pricey, as is the food, so be prepared for that..2 cheaper bottles of wine and food for 6 was $900 with tip but the food is great..  Look forward to my next trip.

c9qQbrcA42Y6j4XFX3yj8Q.text: Amazing! We truly enjoyed our dining experience - a second visit for us. Ever bite was filled with flavor. . .the atmosphere and servers excellent. We will be going back again!

cGRHJ9t0QLARcwiIh0hEDA.text: It's a rarity that I "fancy dine" in Vegas.  I'm usually too busy being intoxicated to appreciate that really fancy meal.  Frequently, I end up at a food court somewhere, passed out in my Nathan's french fries.    On a recent trip to downtown though, I decided to avoid the intravenous injection of cocktails for a day and actually peruse options for a good meal.   Since the wife and I were staying in the nugget, we decided to keep it local and try Vic's.     I have nothing but positive things to say about the evening.  The food was near transcendent.  I opted for the bone in rib-eye,while the lady chose seafood.  The steak literally melted in my mouth, while the side of Au Gratin potatoes served as a welcome compliment to the meal.  The wife raved about her salmon as we also slowly enjoyed a recommended bottle of bubbly.    Service was beyond amazing and the atmosphere was beyond comfortable during the entire dining experience which is important for a Vegas fine dining rookie like myself.    Hopefully, I'll be back downtown in the future and will be able to avoid the football full of liquor long enough to appreciate Vic and Anthony's for a second time.

fNn4xmh9j6xtB3viLzMHEw.text: I've been to some of the best steakhouses in the states and this one takes the cake. Service was amazing always making sure you are well taken care of.   I had the bone in rib eye and it blew me away, my wife had the three pound Maine lobster which I helped eat which was great. The apptizers were awesome being from Florida we get good seafood but the oysters rockefeller omg it was the best I ever tasted, the wife had lobster bisque I sopped up every bit with the bread on the table.   If your looking to take your wife to a intimate dinner this is were I would go.

TzCRMlD6eIHN7cYYFOeGxg.text: I started off annoyed that they wouldn't seat us on a Tuesday night at 7:30 until all of our party of 6 was there. Generally, that is not the practice in Las Vegas. However, the giant aquarium nearby (with a tube for bathers to slide thru among the sharks) makes for a pretty entertaining place to wait. And, in fairness, once we got seated, it didn't seem like there were empty tables.  Once we were seated the service could not have been better. Our waitress struck the right balance between friendly and intrusively friendly. There were always assistant wait staff to fill water glasses and take plates away. One never had to look for the waitress for help with some item. I liked that our waitress told us the specials and the prices. I don't like to ask what the price is but I do like to know. I was a little annoyed that some of the menu items were "market price."  The complimentary hot bread was not really great; it usually isn't in Las Vegas.  I had the salmon which turned out to be the value meal as well as the allegedly heart healthy one. It was $29 and came on a bed of mashed potatoes, and with three big asparagus spears cooked just right, along with some diced tomatoes and capers.  My wife had the 16 ounce prime rib eye steak at $46 by itself. I had one bite and had to admit that it was delicious. It was rare with a charred surfaces. I avoid charred meat out a concern that it might be unhealthy, but it sure tasted good. She also got a monster $9 baked potato that was shared.   One of my sons had the $10 roasted beet salad as an appetizer which we passed around. It was impressively good. Another had the pepper crusted tuna which was a generous portion at $36.  I would have preferred slightly softer music.   It was a tough decision whether to give this a four or five star rating. I think you can expect consistently good service and food, albeit it pricey.

AnwqV6FFynTBaxcXKvODoQ.text: The bone-in ribeye had the best flavor and texture of steak I have ever had. Being a native Houstonian, I've had my share of steak! I ordered my ribeye medium rare (which at Vic & Anthony's is nice and pink) and it literally melted in my mouth. I hardly had to chew--it just melted! The steak cuts like a tender piece of meat, but when it hits your mouth is it truly similar to the texture of butter. Unbelievable. I never quite understood what people meant by comparing foods to butter, until I tasted Vic & Anthony's steaks. The meat isn't overly seasoned or overly salted---its a perfect balance (maybe just a dash of salt and pepper) with a quality cut of meat. When you taste a steak from Vic & Anthony's, you are tasting the meat in its best form--not covered up with a bunch of spices and seasonings. Simplicity at its finest!  Be careful though---once you eat there, you'll have risen the bar so high on good eats, that you may have a hard time tolerating food from other Las Vegas eateries. No matter where we went, nothing we ordered compared to the experience of our Vic & Anthony's meal.   The asparagus and the mushrooms were wonderful accompaniments. The asparagus was medium-sized, lightly seasoned and al dente. The mushrooms tasted like they were tossed in a wine sauce of some sort. Served sauteed and whole, these mushrooms were firm and absolutely delicious! A fun appetizer to order is the steak tartare. Delicate and whimsical, the steak tartare is served with a mildly spicy ground mustard, chips and an egg yolk in the center (which becomes like a rich sauce when you break it open). A slab of salt that resembled marble was used as a platter for this appetizer, which added some light salty flavor and lots of fun to this dish.   The decor inside Vic & Anthony's is dim, warm, soothing and elegant--as is the music playing in the background. Be sure to check out the photography on the walls, as they are all tributes to Las Vegas history. Beautiful restaurant, and excellent food. You are making a huge mistake if you miss out on Vic & Anthony's!

tUBi9C-U8_NiiUg4vFRbpg.text: My favorite steak house.  Excellent meats & seafood selection; great service & atmosphere; fine service too. Buoy can keep Gallaghers, RuthChris, etc

Zyh2KccwhgkLao_P1TrOng.text: This place is Truely the best dinner i have ever had in my life.the cold water lobster melted in your mouth and had good melted butter.the bone in filet with potatoes and asparagas was a special and it was killer!so much flavor.there was this creamy white sauce and fresh herbs tossed with these flavorful fried red potatoes.none of the food needed any salt and pepper at all.the service was the best service i have ever had in my life at a restaurant.they brushed this knife over the table and picked up all the crumbs after appetizers and constantly replaced your fork and made sure everything was perfect.the ladies were served first n get to order first.i thought that aas nice too.the waiters/waitrssses were all so knowledgable about the food they gave percect detail and we asked lots of questions too!this place is a jewel in las vegas

ma7m1jD1GNk17PBTd-PFRw.text: Truly one of the best steak and lobster restaurants in the world!  If you order a steak and lobster to share and ask them to present family style they do all the work and remove the lobster meat from shell and slice the steak into bite size strips, they so spoil you!  Awesome sides and wine selection.  Wayne Gorsek

SuV3vHU6WGLnCnI307aEiw.text: Went there for a celebratory dinner, and was wowed by how great the food was. Filet mignon was very flavorful, wife's tuna was superb, side dishes amazing. Even vanilla ice cream had deep vanilla taste.  Wait staff capable and friendly.  Pricey, but for a special occasion well worth it.

CL5SJZisPEBvRdjm9qKHEA.text: Very nice, upscale dining experience... classy, but not stuffy.  Waitstaff was friendly, prompt, and efficient.  Everything we had was excellent, try the beet salad or the heirloom tomato panzanella, the filet  (medium) was 'melt in your mouth' good.  They know how to make a perfect Manhattan - Bulleit Rye, with a twist, up. We dined upstairs in the quiet, small, dining room.

SC5X5eek8u-2HrPu95NY8A.text: My wife and I ate dinner here last weekend for our 28th anniversary. We were seated promptly at our reservation time. Our waiter was professional, knowledgeable, and personable.   Our food was outstanding! For appetizers we had Oysters Rockefeller & Mushrooms. We both had fillet Mignon's and I had a lobster tail all of which were outstanding. Our steaks could have been cut with our forks; tender and well seasoned.   Their wine list is extensive and the entire experience was over the top.   We were even comp'd dessert for our anniversary.   The dinner, no alcohol, was $150+ tip. While pricey, very well worth it.

-8EnedYUStoPHjZgHpXUow.text: My fiance and I were having such a good time on Fremont Street that by the time we were thinking about dinner it was 10:15 pm. We had planned on going to Oscars in the Plaza but got there and realized they closed at 10:00. Someone recommended the steakhouse in the Golden Nugget. We got there at 10:30, they closed at 11:00. We were able to sit at the bar and order.... Such excellent service and the food..... Soooo amazing! I will definitely be back!

zdG11Sf1yyur2-0icU6cAQ.text: I ate at vic and Anthony's last night and had a great experience. I have eaten at several of the top 10 steak houses in the country from berns in Tampa fl. To Peter lugers in NY, and this place is almost as great from the quality of food to the impeccable service . I highly recommend vic and Anthony's if you are in downtown las vegas looking for a great place to eat. I know I will definitely be back

E-aekANDeMd5fXzjPuGREw.text: Reall great steaks! Perfectly seasoned ribeye and cooked med rare to my request. I ordered the mash and green beans which were both excellent. The bread served pre meal was eh. Not great. Dry and tasteless but highly recommend everything else. Service was top notch as well. *side note- VERY dim lighting so bring your readers!

S__eVMDF-FraAiuutru53w.text: This place is amazing and a hidden gem. As we walked in we were greeted by numerous employees and they brought out fresh baked bread and filled our water glasses immediately.   We ordered the lobster bisque, crab cakes, potatoes gratin, rib eye and the salmon dish with lobster topping.    The lobster bisque and crab cakes were amazing. Extremely flavorful and the crab cakes was majority crab.   The steak was cooked to a perfect med-rare and extremely flavorful. My wife doesn't like steaks but enjoyed it very much. Her fish was absolutely amazing as well. The skin was crispy and full of flavor while the salmon itself was very soft. I wasn't too crazy about the potatoes gratin cause it tasted like Kraft Cheese.  For dessert we ordered the croissant bread pudding and it was sooo good. Surprisingly it wasn't that sweet and we pretty much cleaned that out.  We will definitely come back here.

50Q2h-DVElV5-xzS-32bng.text: I went here because my husband raved about the orgasmic experience he had at the Houston location. Yes, you read it correctly, "Orgasmic." If I had to describe his experience any further, my post would probably be flagged.   I, for one, am not about pass on such an experience, booked the reservation on Christmas eve when I knew we were going to be in  Vegas.   After dinning there, it was a bit of a let down.  Let me preface that the steaks were good: Just as good as any other $50 steak place. I mean, a steak house ruining steak, that's just blasphemous. However, it just was not the best I've ever had -- that's what she said.  (See what I did there. Following on the sexual theme. Ha ha.)  Service was attentive, and they displayed the steaks tartare on a cool salt slab; one you can buy for 45 bucks!   My husband agreed that it was not like Houston's. I guess the Texans just know how to cook their steaks. If I were ever in Houston, I would give this another try.

dY4bLrqOTTLjNLSHvTcvzQ.text: 16 oz. Prime Cut Rib Eye was the best steak I have ever eaten in my entire life!!! I was literally in heaven while devouring this precious piece of meat! I couldn't even open my eyes while I was chewing bc it was so mf ono just melting away in my mouth!   Thank you baby jesus to the steakhouse who closed at 930 who reccommended me to come here!!!!!   BEST STEAK EVER!!!!!!!!!!!  I am definitely going back on my next visit to Vegas!

7omDZFdw8WSXGeDB9tOZtg.text: Wonderful service, fantastic food and an overall great experience! Highly recommended! The filet was cooked perfectly, halibut with lump crab was amazing and the desserts were over the top!

4PQZroAlcR4c3V0vq4v5Zg.text: Service & ambiance 5 stars, food 3.5 stars. I ate the lobster/steak combo. My steak was a little overdone & the lobster was on the smaller side with a sauce on it (I prefer it plain). We also ordered the ribeye (HUGE) and the crabcakes, which was simply awesome. One suggestion:    I thought that was strange not to have a restroom in the restaurant.  Use the restroom in the hotel before you dine here.

BcC_pasej0Gf7UeYfjs7Aw.text: My wife, brother, cousin and I decided on this restaurant after the great reviews. We were planning on watching a show over at The Smith Center and wanted to eat somewhere within close proximity. I would not be dissappointed in our choice. First we were greated very warmly and seated right away. I would recommend making a reservation and you could easily do that on their website. The atmosphere was very warm with all the dark wood features. On to the service and dishes. The service was impeccable. My ice tea actually was filled with ice and I continued to get ice tea AND ice throughout the dinner! Perfect. Most of the time at other restaurants I get a glass with 5 cubes of ice that melt by the middle if the dinner and unless you ask for extra ice your not going to get it. It's the big things that count but all the little things count just as much. Also the wait staff was very friendly and welcoming. The dishes we had were the best I had in awhile. We had the calamari in which the caramelized onions were delicious! I had the seared tuna which I cannot even begin to describe. The dish was just amazing. The tuna melted in my mouth. Unbelievable. If you love sushi you will love this dish. My wife had the shrimp scampi which she loved. My brother had the prime rib eye which he stated was cooked to perfection and my cousin had the pork chops that were cooked just right. I have to say that previously we ate at the steakhouse inside the sunset station and I would most definitely have paid a little more to eat at Vic and Anthony's. Don't pass up the opportunity to eat here. I would probably compare the quality of food to when my wife and I ate at BOA Steakhouse about 3 years ago. Happy Dining!

eVrAXNbS5glkfILnwxCW0A.text: LOVED it.  Amazing old Vegas atmosphere which you don't find much anymore.  Had the best steak and lobster.  Worth every penny.  Then the red velvet cake.  WOW.  Big enough for 3 and was the best i had ever had.  Don't even think twice about going - just go!

F3_F6zp1_go19g3pRF4-5w.text: Dear Vic & Anthony: If, as a steakhouse you can't do french fries, its does not instill confidence that you can do anything else.

VqiV2XM_txzBa_YvZDu26A.text: On everything that doesn't involve the food this place gets a 5. Nice decor and a very professional wait staff. Great wine list as well. It's very pricey but not outrageously so considering where you are and what you expect to get.  Now onto the food. Which is what really matters when separating a steak house from a really great steakhouse.  We started out with the calamari with peppers. It was good, interesting flavor with a touch of heat. We also had the chips and strings which are exactly that. Homemade potato chips and onion string served with ketchup. Nothing special that would make me get it again.  The specials include a 27oz dry aged "Cowboy" ribeye steak for $149. Considering that the 16 oz ribeye was $48 we didn't bite. Dry aged steak is great but not at those prices and the big bone , the cowboy part, is nothing more than a gimmick adds nothing to the food.  The sides we ordered included the brussel sprouts, wild mushrooms, baked potato and mashed potatoes.  All tasty and overpriced but while in a "premium" steakhouse not unusual.  Now for the steak. I ordered the prime ribeye. Cooked exactly as I ordered it, so kudos to the cook. Unfortunately I've had a better piece of meat from Costco. It was not seasoned very well, if at all. The meat itself was tender but not what you would expect from a prime steak.    My wife had the lobster mac and cheese which she liked. The lobster tail is lightly breaded and fried. The cheese sauce was light and tasty. A good entree.  Overall not bad but there is certainly better places to spend your money for a premium steak.

74Km2irps2HDeed0Ffp_mA.text: Service was surprisingly rude. We bought a bottle of wine, and when they delivered it with a broken glass, they refused to remedy the situation. We asked for a fresh glass and they demonized us, saying we we re the bad guys. We had basic expectations of service - that they would appreciate our time and money, but Vic's decided that they could treat us how ever they wanted - that our time was not important and that they could treat us however they want. The service was extremely disappointing. I will not recommend the restaurant to others - and I hope others will recognize that Vic's does not care about the quality of their experience and that they give extremely poor service

Ubnz4l3FRIGnieLtKix_zA.text: Had our anniversary dinner there on Aug 20th 2016. We were treated like royalty the whole time loved the music and lighting. Food was out of this world. Service was the best. I highly recommend this place.

oe_DssEXR3qg9808Yl6wcg.text: Absolutely fantastic! Filet mignon was perfect and the mashed potatoes were to die for. Dessert was delicious as well. Must say, fantastic customer service!!!! A must try!

h0yq8vwNJL1emFIAmYPqJw.text: I had the 12oz filet mignon asparagus, and a glass of the ZD pinot noir. Steak was delicious and perfectly prepared. I had it cooked to medium. Wine perfectly complimented my steak. My only gripe is it bothers me to leave a restaurant spend about $70+ a person, on the low end mind you, and still be hungry. I remember looking at my plate when they brought it to me, and I thought, damn I see a lot of white plate. So my scoring is purely on how my steak tasted. Will I be back, probably not. Just can't justify the cost for such a small amount of food.

gQ4hVZoFf2VmT6Y9eBz7fg.text: The service was great but the fillet was hard to cut with the knife.?? The sides were great and the drinks were ok.

MknQZ10uHpnD5SVNp3MpJQ.text: Superb service, excellent bone in porterhouse, extensive wine list. This is place was wonderful and will return. I recommend this place to all my friends if they wanted a place to go for a special occasion or for a special evening out with your special date, make your reservations if you decide to go here. It was busy on a Saturday night.   The service is by the best I've had hands down, from bartenders, waiter, hostess etc

1tF1C4sl7Tdg2punoYAVpQ.text: Starting off this is a typical US Prime Beef cooked with a Salamander steakhouse, If you been to Ruth Chris or Mortons in other cities, you know the drill here.  This is probably one of the best nice dining spots in downtown.  Starting off, on a busy Friday night with no reservations we were seated in about 40 minutes, which isn't bad considering we had no reservations. Instead of going to the in house bar to wait, we went to the casino cocktail lounge around the the corner and watched the shark tank and sports updates until we were called by the hostess for our seats.  The venue is dark, classic steak house, it was busy, but it was also very private, as someone stated before, there are many restaurants which has a fishbowl effect with people gawking at you while dining, its not the case here. I've seen a few local celebrities here while dining. A good spot if you want to keep a low profile.  The service was top notch. Our drinks were refreshed regularly, the staff was friendly and the courses were served in a timely fashion.  Pricing is appropriate for a US prime steakhouse with market prices for beef and seafood. We never had any of the seafood so the review is focusing on the steak.  Started off with cocktails and the bread roll which was very nice, soft and warm with whipped butter and a crispy crust.  Followed that up with a Cesar salad and chili, the salad was ok, with a nice balance between tart and creamy. The chef special soup for that day was a prime beef chili which was horrible. They added sugar and what seamed to be off the shelf chili powder.. it wasn't much better than the stuff you get out of the can which is really unfortunate.  The main entrees were cooked properly, nice well marbled beef with our table having steaks cooked from rare to medium, it has the buttery flavor you often see with the Salamander prepared steaks.  The sides we had was Brussels sprouts, the potatoes au gratin, mash potatoes, asparagus and creamed spinach. All were excellent speaking from a standpoint that I hate brussel sprouts generally. The au gratin potatoes was loaded with cheese so expect a fair bit of grease.  We skipped dessert.   It's a nice option to have in downtown vegas, I'll be back again.

OnCAudO3TByzLSGGfytugg.text: The best steak house ever.  Great service, and awesome food.  We've split the porterhouse several times, and it's been perfect each time.  The other steaks and sides are wonderful.  Not much else I need to say... it's awesome!

1lM8cdM1XtZwvO7l360flQ.text: Steak so good make you wanna slap yo' momma! Lol no but seriously this place is FANTASTIC! Ate here for the mother's day dinner and I must say that they have some of the BEST customer service I've received from a steakhouse! I originally booked my reservation online on the opentable.com website because of the cool perks of dinning perks! Reservation was for 5:15 PM. We arrived a little early but no problem because we were seated promptly at 5:15! The ambiance in this place is remarkable we were sat upstairs in this more private seating area! What a plus that was because of the privacy and sharing the special Mother's Day occasion. Let's get to the food, oh but before I start let me tell you that the "Mojito 23" drink that they have on the special drink menu is terrible, if you are a regular mojito drinker like myself take my word for it, it's horrible. The main food course we ordered were mainly the Surf & Turf specials which originally came with an 8oz Filet Mignon however my brother and I upgraded our steaks to a 22OZ Bone-In-Ribeye which btw is TO DIE FOR. We added this blue cheese butter to the steak that made it mouthwatering! The lobsters that came with these orders were cooked to perfection and nice with the butter sauce. Sometimes places can over cook the lobster which makes it tough but this defiantly wasn't the case, they nailed this whole entree! The macaroni and cheese we ordered was horrible, put it like this we could have saved that $8.95 and went to Wal-mart and bought a box of Velveeta that would have been more worthwhile! Pass on that side dish FOR SURE! Over all other than the 2 minuses on the Mojito 23 and the macaroni and cheese I'll give this place a 4.5 stars! Will return for sure!

zq9kTx2QuMwIhV8jq3qcbQ.text: Located inside the Golden Nugget in Downtown Las Vegas, Vic & Anthony's is a place I'd been wanting to visit for a long time but never got around to it. Finally, while in town for meetings, I suggested it to a coworker and he agreed. So we met downtown and gave it a shot.    The atmosphere is upscale and upbeat yet relaxing. Dark cherry wood, low lighting, open spaces but with an air of privacy. There is also a bar with eight seats and I noticed there were always a couple open. There were two servers/bartenders back there which is one for every four seats. Not bad.  We were fortunate enough to get in without reservations, but I highly recommend making them. It was a Tuesday night for us so not too crowded but I'd never try walking in like that during the weekend. Unless maybe you want to dine at the bar.  I ordered the Prime Ribeye and added some Mac & Cheese. Both were absolute five star dishes. I can't say enough about them. Outstanding. One of the best steaks I've encountered on the earth thus far. The Mac & Cheese was amazing in it's own right, baked just right with the perfect combination of taste and texture. Not salty at all, like many restaurants make it.   The service was beyond courteous and professional. I'd give it six stars. Everyone there clearly wants you happy and wants you to come back. The staff combined with the pleasant atmosphere made us want to hang out a little longer than we usually would. So we did.   Of course, when I go out something a little odd has to happen to me. Tonight was no different. A guy at a nearby table ordered a side of broccoli and these two HUGE broccoli florets come out on a plate. He's shocked (and a little hammered) and starts walking around other tables with his plate begging people to take a slice of his broccoli. When he got to us, we politely declined and he was a little indignant and said: "What's wrong with you people, don't nobody like broccoli?"  Finding no takers, he sat back down at his table with the two trees still on his plate and went at it alone.   Dinner and a show.   This is a somewhat upscale place but I noticed a few patrons in shorts. I wouldn't recommend it because Vic's calls for better than that. I personally wouldn't wear them because, in this dark environment, I'm afraid my legs would glow in the dark and be the spectacle of the evening. Even more than that broccoli guy. No, I wore some dark jeans with some way cool dress shoes and a long-sleeved polo and fit in just fine.   This is a must visit if you're downtown and looking for the right place to dine. Don't wait years like I did to try Vic & Anthony's. It is a supreme steakhouse.

IFsNl8T1LUE0Jgn8wuefdQ.text: They do one thing extraordinarily well.. The steak. Sides- too rich, appetizers (seafood)- overdone, salads even- over the top rich dressing.. But the meat.. Perfect. It's why you came. The sommelier? Spot on. His knowledge? Impressive. 3 yrs ago we ordered just a bottle of wine, a baked potato (split), a bottle of 2006 J Davies cab (rare treat), perfect. Today we ordered the works.. Including an impeccable bottle of wine a cab from Lodi that tasted appropriately like a Zin (Lodi being renowned for such).. And no surprise the best parts of the dinner were the steak and the wine. As tempting as they sides sound- skip them.. You won't be disappointed.  Coodos to the very impressive and knowledgeable wait staff.. Professional over the top.

W8oA-Iquvi938ZcnDhwY5g.text: I would go back to Vegas just for dinner at this place again! 5 star service on top of 5 star food and drinks makes Vic and Anthony's an unforgettable dining experience and a MUST while your visiting  Fremont street!

nVq0d7aG6rMdCxFq9RCrUQ.text: located inside of the golden nugget hotel. nice atmosphere, our waiter seemed like he worked there forever (older gentleman), was super friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu and seemed to read us well with suggestions of sides and drinks. the food was amazing!!! potatoes cooked in duck fat? freakin yum! there is a "secret menu" that isn't listed at the restaurant, but if you print it out and take it to the restaurant, you get a set 3 course meal for $50! we didn't opt for this meal, but would definitely consider for a future visit. the crab cake was really tasty and loaded with crab! some reviews complained about the dress code, or lack there of...the restaurant is in a casino!! lol. there are many people that choose to go have a nice dinner after a day full of gambling...does it bother me that they're wearing shorts? nope! they're still paying the same $50 per steak, and it's not like they're dirty or acting like heathens. perhaps people should consider taking their dates to a nice restaurant not located in a casino. definitely recommend, awesome service, and fantastic food!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ribeye didn&#39;t look spectacular, but it sooo was!! and those potatoes?! YUM!! cooked in duck fat!!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. filet and lobster were amazing!

LWLc1r8bgmEQgglXn7WtmQ.text: Special thanks to Chef Rodriguez for his gracious hosptality and most wonderful meal. @Vic_n_Anthonys steakhouse located in downtown #Vegas' newly renovated Gold tower at the @GoldenNuggetLV Hotel & Casino   We had a reservation for 7pm and were seated immediately. The dining room was very elegant with beautiful stained glass ceiling, formal settings with low mood lighting.   The waiter came out promptly introducing himself and welcoming us with a full description of the evenings menu and specials that were currently being offered. The evenings specials were the Lobster live from the tanks and Kobe steak heated to liking on a hot salt tablet prepared tableside VERY COOL!!   We ordered drinks a couple apps and a steak dinner and a couple desserts.   The apps came out quickly-a crab cake like NO other. light and crispy full of crab covered in crab with a sauce I'm not sophisticated enough to describe but the fact I DO NOT eat seafood and I licked the plate clean here says it ALL!! WOW!!   The other appetizer Maple Glazed Quail was alot like chicken drumettes but lighter tastier with a wonderful combination of greens+tomatoes with another indesribeable sauce:) YUM   What a way to get started!!! We could hardly wait to try the steak. 16oz prime strip cooked medium-rare:) and of course a baked potato loaded with butter&sour cream!! Thats me Mr Meat & Potatoes;)   BEST STEAK EVER!!! I have only been to a handful of places that even offer steaks costing more than $20 so I have limited experience here but this was by far and away the best steak I have EVER had. Melt in your mouth delicious!! Oh and the potato wasn't bad either lol :)   After this amazing meal -Chef Rodriguez came out to thank us for coming in and then we talked about his visits to some of the #Vegas restaurants he had visited during his stay concluding there's so much to discover and it's such a fun and tasty adventure.   To our surprise the Chef presented us dessert--Cheesecake with blueberries and sauce and croissant bread pudding w/ice cream and lots of lil extras that just took it over the TOP:)   The desserts were GREAT but after taking home the bread pudding and trying it the NEXT day it seemed even BETTER   What a wonderful dining experience-pleasant atmosphere, truly fantastic personal service, and the food was to die for. I would recommend it to EVERYONE and if you are on Death Row(Texas reference) and have to select your LAST MEAl-If you wanna feel that feeling like you've REALLY lived now-ORDER it from Vic & Anthony's!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cT_oc9A7QAclFSTCsUD0Mw.text: I can't say enough about what a perfect experience we had at Vic and Anthony's. The oysters in the half shell were so fresh and perfectly briny. Had the filet, which melted in my mouth, it was spectacular. The service was impeccable.  Expect dinner to cost a grip, but for a special occasion this place is one of the top in Vegas.

eOxB5xNxp9BOtDhlzaiyYA.text: Atmosphere and service were both exceptional. The food was delicious. We had lobster bisque, iceberg salad, Caesar salad, and the ribeye. All fabulous!!  We will return!!

XUmrjxgaur4eCCMiy8Gnpg.text: Hands down, my favorite steak house in Vegas! Not only is it close to home, but I've literally never had a bad experience here....on the contrary everytime time has been amazing! From service to food and start to finish!  It blows my mind that some other restaurants in this companies portfolio disappoint? Because this place just blows not everything other steakhouse, but every other restaurant out of the water

Zjbsj0vHS2FLSAb8REge0w.text: I have been to several prime steakhouses and V&A is tops. Service was exemplary and catered to our upbeat, party style attitude with my particular group of friends. They did not miss a beat. The server was fun and courteous and not stuffy. The sommelier was the best I have encountered and catered to our requests.  We started with some oysters rockefeller and they were delectable! I had the ribeye and lobster tail. The steak was seasoned and cooked to perfection, the lobster a bit tough, but good, and the mashed potatoes were equally well prepared. She had the filet and quality was top-notch and rich in flavor.   All in the party enjoyed apps, meals and drinks and we left food-high and happy!   What a great way to celebrate my 40th B-day!

W7137snvfxihi5DEnyP2zQ.text: Enjoyable old school atmosphere with an excellent bourbon and whiskey menu which even included pappy van winkle. The steaks were done well and the sides and appetizers were excellent. I was disappointed with the lamb as the sauce was too over powering. All and all a good place for dinner with good service and a reasonable price for a steak house in Vegas.

6bCCyxT-au8ezb3Uzvy8zQ.text: The wait time on a Thursday was just 5 Minutes and the service was exceptional.  Steak and Lobster was delicious and the smash potatoes had my wishing for more... On the other hand, wines selection was not  what I expected..  At least they had Josh from Sonoma is a good cab that did an ok ... job for my steak.  Yet the over all experience was delightful and will be back soon for more.

4EF9ujVKy-o_4eaCNGCpmA.text: Vic & Anthony's has been our go to steak house for many years. Even before we moved to Vegas. However, our experience last Saturday night was somewhat disappointing and has left us wondering if things have changed. First, the good. As always the drinks and service were top notch. Our server Jay was on top of not only the menu but also the specials and recommendations for accompanying wines and desert options. The food on the other hand was another story. We've been here many times so we have a good idea of what to expect. Steaks, while cooked to order, came out an unappetizing grey on a barren plate. No exterior char whatsoever as in the past. The once reliable potatoes au gratin have morphed from very good into a disappointing way over salted stew of gooey oily cheese that had the consistency of Velveeta. The creamed spinach, while tasty, suffered from the same over salted treatment. Really unacceptable for dinners that can easily exceed $100 per person. We're hoping that what we experienced was an aberration and will probably be give V&As another chance but they need to be aware long term customers have a lot of choices in this market and need to feel that they're getting their moneys worth.

yOPt0MFuO1oDSSZsZHzuSA.text: Me and my wife  went to the Vic and Anthony steakhouse in Texas and it was one the the best in the country for steak. Had a great experience.  We got dressed up and did the whole 9 yard. So for our anniversary  we travel to Vegas . We figured hey it's a little pricey but what the heck. Let's go for it and splurge.  We both got dressed nice. Her in a fine black cocktail dress. Myself in a sport blazer,pants and a headdress. Recently I have be wearing my hair long so it keeps it nice and neat, tied back and out of my face. We were staying at Bellagio and wore something very similar to Picasso for dinner the night before. Not a single problem there.  And was treated with the utmost respect and services.  Not at Vic and Anthony steakhouse Vegas. Don't worry we will get to the food very shortly. The hostess sat us down and asked me to remove my hat in the dining room.  I told her it's not a hat it's a headdress.  She walked away.  Than the waiter came to take our order and asked, "Would the gentleman kindly remove your hat?" I told him it was not a hat and this gentleman would like not to be asked again.  Than the manager came and as me to remove it. I told him that this headdress is culturally accept around the world and is also used by many religious group and can be very offensive if asked to be removed.  He looked at me like I drew the race card on him. I noticed how the whole senerio was making the evening unpleasant for my wife so I reluctant removed it. Than we noticed a older man in jeans and a cowboy had behinds us. To the right of us a group of people in shorts and t shirts.  You know the ones with the US flag on it. The food was  2nd rate. But the service was awful.  Never have I been made to feel so uncomfortable in a restaurant before. As we sat there I noticed one more thing. The only minority present was me.

MBp4zCZ8-HjA9jJLJCMZxQ.text: Best ribeye I've ever eaten. Delicious mashed potato on the side (gluten free). Great service, and cosy atmosphere. My favourite steakhouse so far and worth every penny!

jfbZvgD8hJqSnKYkVMtZBA.text: The most amazing steal and lobster so worth the coin. Definitely coming back again!!! Creme Breulle is amazing!!

_9btvIIVsRW1LyBWMw8oNQ.text: I wanted to love this place, I didn't.  Solo dinner, sat at the bar and that was my mistake.  Food was amazing; fillet Oscar, creamed spinach, brussel sprouts, bread pudding.   There were three bartenders behind the bar providing service for five of us.....   I felt completely ignored, to the point I spoke to management.   They don't know they have a problem if no one speaks up.  He knew it was bad.  He talked to me for at least ten minutes, the entire time both my coffee and water were empty and no one did anything!   He finally said something to the bartender, and admitted he was embarrassed and sorry.  I am guessing the dining room is different.  I say again, food was amazing,I will be craving that creamed spinach!

jMiFeGQT61cZpkBoVo4RcQ.text: Service was exemplary! Food was okay. As Portland, OR foodies, we are spoiled by our city's excellent restaurants, but V&A's wine selection was AWESOME! If you want a memorable wine experience, enlist the help of the sommelier. This wonderful French gentleman picked a lovely French Chablis and Bordeaux-like Napa blend for our meal. I described our tastes (oenophile sister to Merlot Mom) and he delivered selections that exceeded our taste buds.    I ordered from the Prix Fixe menu and was a fan of the Haricot Verts. Wonderful!! Filet was ordered medium-rare but was pretty rare... too rare for me. The waiter did warn us. Creme Brulee comes in a flat dish  vs. ramekin so you get more burnt sugar than flan. My sister had the Oysters Rockerfeller and it was tasty. I ordered the bacon appetizer and yes, it tasted like a sweet bacon dish. I was expecting more of a Pork Belly phenom.   There were 7 of us for a family reunion and the reservationist delivered what I asked... a quiet area so my hard-of-hearing dad could hear the conversations over the dinner din. Bravo and Thank you! Great experience.   CON: restrooms are in the casino -- quite a walk and not a direct route.

AmyzrwTwj_NQTqEByUzXpA.text: I started with oysters on the half shell.  I would not recommend that dish.  They were kind of small.  (I should have ordered the crab cake.)  I next had a rib eye steak that was cooked to perfection, with Bearnaise sauce.  The mashed potatoes and mushrooms were outstanding side dishes.  The service was attentive.  My fellow diners all agreed that we would visit Vic & Anthony's again when we return to Vegas.

LuflTl9VIXsuBpsEBeQ9hg.text: They have some nice big boody over here: I'm talking about lobster tail....  Around Freemont there are many advertisements for $12 to $15 steak meals; I passed on those cheap deals for this place. The taxi driver and two different store clerks said that this is the best restaurant on Freemont.  They were right.  What I liked: The damn Filet Mignon that I've had!  It was so tender - it was almost tender like fish (I always order rare).  It was perfectly paired with the Peppercorn Steak Sauce.  If they sold it in a bottle, I'd buy it. The service was very friendly. The environment was classy, laidback, and filled with jazz music. The prices are far more reasonable than the prices on the main Las Vegas strip!  (The filet was around $40 something)  What could have been better? The Oyster Rockefeller had large juicy oysters, but was overall OK: too much cheese and spinach for my taste.  The chopped salad was nice but not outstanding.  Other notes: I want to return and try the FREAKIN HUGE Australian Rock Lobster tails (they are on display).  It was the largest lobster tail that I've seen in person for sure.  BTW: The people who referred me to this restaurant just called it "the restaurant at the Golden Nugget."    So definitely try the outstanding steak + peppercorn sauce and check out that lobster booty.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Australian Rock Lobster Tail @ Vic &amp; Anthony&#39;s Steakhouse on Freemont (Las Vegas)

EiT3ZwUD_9ynXNlDRkB5ag.text: My husband and I ate here for our 4th Anniversary. The Filet Mignon & Lobster was delicious. The crab cake was wow...that's the best crab cake by far. The staff & service was great. Place was very romantic. Highly recommend this place for steak & lobster. It's well worth the money.

NYZj4o9XBkG9HsSt1IURwg.text: Everything was amazing. Went here for a year end bonus and enjoyed every bit from the lobster bisque to the bourbon caramel bread pudding. The steak was perfectly cooked and wonderfully tender. The oysters frsh and the cucumber mignet was refreshing and tangy.

eM2Q5ijpto0Rp8VYdgmRMg.text: Simply put - one of the best meals ever !  Annette was our server and she was great - very professional with a sense of humor as well.  Their portion sizes are large and cooked to perfection.  Ambience was very nice - dimly lit, nice pictures on the wall to look at.  Well worth every penny.  You are actually made to feel "special" here.  Highly recommend this establishment located inside The Golden Nugget.

3QoBE6iCRPDt8141V_AEzw.text: Ive been around... to make it short when me and the fambam hit the road from Vegas to Buffalo NY 1st thing we did when we reach our hotel/motel for that night is YELP the BEST STEAKHOUSE that city can offer :) price doesent matter I will order the BEST STEAK that steakhouse has to offer... 95% of the time its going to be a BONE IN RIBEYE which is my all time fave food too... Vic and Anthonys PRIME RIBEYE is soooooo good that it seperates itself to  my 2nd place... or take it from my cousin who IS 100 X MORE EXPERIENCE THAN ME... his also is certain Vic's & Anthony wont even craack his TOP 10... he was sooooo WRONG...not only it replaced HIS #1 but Vic's is the 1st thing he'll request when he visits Vegas... it will knockout your #1 too GUARANTEED...and us a added bonus the service is GENUINE and gets my 1ST 5 star rating ON SERVICE... I dont write reviews just for one reason its NOT WORTH IT lol... Vic's and Anthony's gets my BEST STEAKHOUSE AWARD and BEST SERVICE AWARD

xQXTrA6sr4SnwRO9JhX6jw.text: This was one of the best, if not the best, surf and turf dinners I have ever had... my filet was amazing and the lobster was sweet and prepared perfectly!  We had the steakhouse salad before dinner, and it was to die for!   The restaurant itself is full of swank, lots of wood and leather with low lighting. The wine list was great and the service was awesome. The waiter went above and beyond for our party and brought out a dessert sampler that was amazing! Even the after dinner cappuccino I had was great!! Unbelievably awesome meal!

AsVSUuMmsSn79okujevdrA.text: I've eaten a lot of steak in this town, more than I should. But what a delightful surprise this restaurant was. Mother in law was in town a few weeks ago, and we were running late to the Gordie Brown show. Originally we were going to try the steakhouse at the El Cortez, because I had a restaurant.com certificate, but we took so long showing her the strip we just didn't have time to go there before the show. So we came here instead, because we could have a quick meal in the same casino. We were seated right away, without reservations. My mother in law and my husband had the fillet, and I had the ribeye. They had a really nice surf and turf going on that night and I should have ordered that, but for some reason the ribeye was calling me, even though I mostly order fillet. I guess I didn't want to copy everyone at the table. We also ordered lobster bisque, caesar salad, and the potatoes gratin, spinach, and asparagus. I have never seen my mother in law get excited about anything we have eaten, in Las Vegas or anywhere else. Mostly when we go out to eat, she constantly complains about the expensive price of restaurants outside of Montana, and acts like she is mad we went out instead of cooking. She did have a fit at first about eating here looking at the prices, but after tasting her food she loudly exclaimed "oh my god, this is so good," and shut up about how much it costs. But this is a woman who grew up on a farm mostly in poverty and worked for the government her entire career, raising my wonderful husband alone, so I cannot be mad at her attitude about it. I try to take her occasionally to nice places because, well, she deserves it. Every steakhouse in town I have eaten at always has something not executed correctly, or the quality of food isn't that great. This literally was the most perfect steakhouse meal I have had. The meat was so flavorful that my husband still dreams about it, and was executed with the right amount of char that we love at the perfect temperature. Sides were so perfect and good they could not have been better. Lobster bisque had lots of nice chunks of lobster in it. I'm not sure why Carnevino and Cut and some of the other steakhouses are considered the best in town, but this really blew everything I have eaten away, including CraftSteak which was garbage compared to this meal. Maybe I will try Carnevino and Cut next just to compare!

5qZq1D57w0aIwTHSaqJgxA.text: This meal was a HUGE disappointment. The Prime Ribeye was tough (Cooked medium). Really tough. I saw no sign of being well marbled, and it was like a steak off of an outdoor barbecue where the person buying the meat and cooking had no idea what they were doing. The side dishes of creamed corn, sauteed mushrooms, and duck fat potatoes were all mediocre at best. The creamed corn had no taste of 'creaminess', like I experienced of other 'fine dining' restaurants. Really. The corn had crunch to it, and the cream was mostly non-existent. The mushrooms were REALLY chewy. Mushrooms should not be mushy, but should definitely not be chewy. The duck fat potatoes were like home fries cooked with bacon fat. Not horrible, but something I'd expect from a breakfast house. I can't overstate the steak though. Tough, not tender, massive disappointment. This restaurant lives on it's reputation, like a lot of Vegas restaurants. I would not return to dine there. No chance.

_Fe6LY0iR7siBQN11orDYA.text: Ate here for New Year's Eve. I had  the 8 oz fillet. Was prepared perfectly. Au gratin   potatoes were good as well as mushrooms. Wife and mother in law had the salmon. They spoke highly of it. Great service from Matt. Great place on Fremont.

-TpKBFFC96uigBtn0YIyUQ.text: I finally made it to Fremont from the strip on my 6th trip to Las Vegas.  I wanted to make sure to include this dinner as part of the evening out with  my hubby.  I really don't understand the hype.  I think a chain restaurant like Ruth Chris's or Capital Grille really is a lot better than this place.  I ordered the special which was a filet with a little lobster tail on top that was supposed to have a vanilla type cream on top of that with a little pile of sauteed wild mushrooms on the side and some asparagus.  All of this was sitting on a small puree of something or other.  Parmesan polenta maybe?  It took a while to get to the table and mine was completely tepid in temperature.  The whole plate - not just one item.  Here's the kicker.  They didn't reflame anything, they just put it in the microwave.  YUCK!  How can one tell this?  The color of the filet went from brown to gray.  What was I going to do at that point?  Send it all back and have them remake it all?  No.  We just won't go back, so big deal.  The flow of the restaurant is awful..  I get it, more table and chairs, more people = more money.  But for a place that has been around this long, shouldn't they know by now comfort for both servers and patrons really makes for happy faces everywhere in the restaurant?

jo5j7I4vdpu3dHd-lAyvpQ.text: The service is very friendly AND professional (a rare combination at some restaurants) and the food was EXCELLENT.  Without a doubt the best meal on a 14 day trip across the United States.

fUrTcyaVU3KHXMvB5YSYBA.text: The food is good, but just good. The  service is good. We had crab cake appetizer, and Gordon Biersch is much better. The steak was ok, but much like a 15.00 Applebee's type. We had the ribeye. The best part of the meal was the salmon, which was very good. The seating is not appropriate for the prices charged. They are few "private" tables, and we shared a bench, with a large party (8 or so.) Not ideal for a special birthday dinner. One appetizer, one salad, and two entrees - no alcohol, and the bill was 160.00 - too much for the quality. There are too many other really nice restaurants in Vegas, to go back here. Sorry, I really hoped this was going to be a better review.

QRdMh5ofT83rlkKnX7Oq3w.text: Ok, I wanted to update this review based on the EXCELLENT management that gave me a wonderful experience for my 30th anniversary awhile back.  Really?  The best steak (and it was a New York)  I have had at any time in Las Vegas.  I love this place and so will you.  I know good restaurants and I know damn good art.  Trust me.

xldgupYzMPjkFKi4kH_5bg.text: We went on a recent trip to Las Vegas.  The food was excellent, service was professional, and staff was courteous.  Everything was a la carte and the sides were very big as was the salad.  We got the market ribeye which were $68 each.  I've been to several high end steakhouses and this was as good as the rest.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Receipt

8AXYGmYrhKf6DjmVtkio2w.text: it has been almost a year since my birthday dinner NIGHTMARE...LOL luckily we try to laugh about the nightmare that occurred and vow not to ever repeat it again  it was me, hubby, and two other couples and I'm soooooo embarrassed about this meal I could freak out...I had this "great idea" to hang Downtown and eat at V&A's that night instead of our usual Cosmo spots...  first we had made reservations weeks before and still waited over an hour for our table, meanwhile at the tiny bar area we all stood dressed up with no chairs...the bar and waitstaff KNEW we were waiting and just kept our drinks flowing and flowing  by the time we got to our poorly lit table where we had to shout at each other to talk (sooooo sooooo loud) and people bumping into the backs of all our chairs all night made it horrible...  anyway, to this day we can not remember anything other than it took 1.5 hours for our food to come out of the kitchen...meanwhile they kept the bar drinks flowing...  what we do have to remember is "Birthday Broccoli" it's a series of photos that we each took a photo with a !!!MASSIVE!!! full head of broccoli that came on my plate...  are you kidding? how embarrassing!  during the hours and hundreds of dollars $x,xxx that was wasted in this funny place these events also happened:  -constant interruption of waiters, our own cocktail waiter (not kidding) and all standing by just doing nothing  -asking for our salad or app courses over an hour after we ordered then getting the "we ARE busy"   -one person in my party had their plate served to them MINUS their steak...yep...  -they actually served a crab cake to someone that did not order it, left it at the table then later came and got it and gave it to the table next to us...  -pitches of water were over-poured literally poured over glasses flowing onto the table (guess they could not see either, too dark)  -waiters tripped into our table a few times making it embarrassing and messy    -baskets of bread were continuously sat all over the table during the hour and a half wait for the food  -a baked potato was served STONE COLD and half cooked  -the list could go on forever...ONE STAR EXPERIENCE, but they get TWO STARS for not charging us for 70% of the alcohol that was drank   as another birthday comes upon me...the idea of "having a different birthday Downtown" does not come to mind... :) :) :) :)  a guess another horrible thing about that night was how stinky, old, dirty the extra large suite we booked there was (this is a different ball of YELP wax)...reaking old cigars and smelly socks we grabbed our stuff and went back home

05PaT9U_XwKaQCBWKTrvQg.text: I have to say I was impressed. I was in Vegas for the weekend (go figure) and one of my friends said he has heard rave reviews about Vic & Anthony's, however once I heard it was in Downtown Vegas at the Nugget I questioned how good would it be? Afterall I am not really a downtown Vegas type of guy but the other guys wanted to check it out so I went along. Decor is your typical dark wood and paneling steakhouse with lots of old photos on the walls, nothing too spectacular. The food on the other hand was very very good. everyone ordered a different cut of meat from a petite fillet to a huge bone-in rib eye, each with different preparation and temp from rare to medium well and everyone's food came out to their liking. Prices are not bad at all especially when copared to steakhouses on the strip. Now if you are on a budget this is a great place to eat some great food but don't forget to factor in a cab or limo ride fromt he strip to downtown. If you are staying downtown then for sure give it a shot.

CK524TUPdK3ojI33yJeIcA.text: Third review, and very disappointed to write this one.  We were a party of 6 on a Wednesday night.  The attentiveness of the server was zilch!  Two people in our party tried, for twenty minutes to get a second drink.  When the entrees (mostly steaks) were served, they looked like little brown islands in the middle of a huge white sea (large plates).  Part of a fine dining experience is eating with our eyes.  A little garnish, or smear of color on the plate would have enhanced its appearance. Five of the entrees came pretty close together, and the 6th was several minutes behind... NOT GOOD!  Several minutes later the potatoes, and other side dishes were served.  We were halfway through our entrees when the sides arrived. This is not the kind of service one expects at a $75-$100. a plate restaurant!  I have been at inexpensive casual restaurants that send the food out with several servers at the same time, so that the meal can be enjoyed as ordered.  Don't know if they were short handed on a Wednesday night, but that problem should not be extended to the customer!

nuscblzDyslnE5SEnlkKbg.text: I want to start off by saying what a great steakhouse. Has the old school feel to it. Not trendy or fake looking. Dimmer lighting and quit. Service was impeccable. Food was to die for. I had the 8 ounce fillet and Lobster tail. Both cooked to perfection and the wife had the shrimp and pasta. Tasted great as well. We had the calamari for an appetizer and it was lime heaven. The portion was almost too much. Prices are more than fair. Definitely treat yourself to this fine steakhouse.

MR9Ja2AWmaFKuvd8Hd9a1g.text: A great place! Eight of us had dinner and all eight of us were totally happy.  The food was delightful from steaks to seafood to salads.  The service was 5 star to say the least.  The restaurant was cozy and very comfortable.  All eight ladies gave it a 5 Star both food and service. We can't wait to go back to Vegas, we will surely have dinner here again.

U4M8b_ClPHHSxmvRTYQlMw.text: Oh my! I have never tasted a steak this delicious before! I ordered medium and it was perfect. A little marbling outside and so tender and delightful inside. Had mushrooms, asparagus and baked potato for my sides, all were deliciously tender and flavorful. I will definitely put this place on my Vegas list!!

VwoRubKEz05nuhozpsXSwA.text: Loved this steakhouse. It's a classic style steakhouse with low lighting, white table cloths, servers wear ties and vests, and the music is perfect for the place (Sinatra, Dean, etc.). If you're staying on the Strip, it's a good 15-20 minute drive, but worth it. The service was great, not too pushy, around at just the right times, and our server (Mike) made great suggestions. It's expensive (for my budget), but I knew that going in, so it wasn't a shock to me. They were kind enough to split our salad and baked potato without even requesting them to do so. I had the filet and my husband had the strip. Both were cooked perfectly and the filet had a nice char on the outside, but was very tender on the inside. I would highly recommend for a date night, Birthday, or some other special celebration. I would return in my next Vegas trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lRMyhItkptpT02nkSln3tg.text: God, what a terrible experience. It started when we arrived for our dinner reservation and there's no hostess/greeter in sight for over 10 mins. Finally the manager comes and seats us in between 2 squished tables when the entire restaurant is empty. I don't need to be secluded or anything but i certainly don't want to be squeezed in between 2 other tables when there's clearly room elsewhere. Some of the items on the menu are a hit or miss. They need to clearly state proper ingredients on the menu for certain dishes. For example we ordered the calamari thinking it's your basic calamari with marinara & aioli for dipping. However the calamari came out tossed in a sweet tangy sauce with a TON of onions. The sauce I don't mind too much but my boyfriend does not eat onions so it's definitely something they should've mentioned on the menu so that we could've asked for the dish without onions. We also ordered the Szechuan peppered tuna dish and it came out looking like sashimi. There was wasabi & ginger to pair with the tuna but no sauce/soy sauce. It was weird. Our waitress didn't ask if we were done with our appetizers, she just came and cleared our table when we clearly were not finished with some of the dishes. The manager was so rude and made us feel uncomfortable throughout our entire dinner. My boyfriend didn't like how they put butter on his plate and asked for a regular plate instead and after that request the manager literally stood next to our table and stared at us for a good 15mins. It was so uncomfortable. The server should've asked us our preference on the buttered plate. Then the manager walks over to the other side of the room and stares at us with his arms folded for the remainder of our dinner. We are locals, we both work in the industry & we use to recommend this place to our guests&clients all the time, we chose to dine here out of all the other steakhouses in town and it's unfortunate that we left with such a bad taste in our mouths. Definitely would not recommend.

mNKHF04GibmrnEN_C4uGEA.text: One of the best steaks I've had. Britt and I enjoyed an amazing birthday dinner here before we went out to see done punk rock music for PRB 2017. We had this bacon  strip appetizer, an amazing potato dish, I had the filet mignon with a lobster tail. Absolutely amazing. Service was great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Us at PRB 2017
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon and lobster tail
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab

MBqK5sMdoHdaXSCqRj9Kjg.text: Have eaten here 8-10 times, LOVE IT.  One of my favorites in LV.  The best thing ever is their seafood tower appetizer, sometimes my wife and I go JUST for this, it is so good and filling and don't miss the martini glass with seafood kimchi coleslaw... it is to die for and I get the impression people miss it, thinking it is a decoration.  It may be one of the best things on the platter.  Another thing to look for, the website has a special for a meal for 2 for around $100.  A good deal for a date.

z_tOsc27346rOqaKv0ywEA.text: I can honestly say this is the best meal I can remember eating. I had the crab cake, roasted bacon, filet mignon, au gratin potatoes, and cinnamon bread pudding for dessert. Everything was cooked perfectly. Great service. If you're looking for a place to splurge at, you can't go wrong here.

YFPY7A7VJW5pmeUBYu5gCQ.text: There have never been such places. The food was very well presented. Our server was sincere and simple. Mistress welcomed and treated us like a star. I will definitely recommend and come back.

SBje2niVG3naZQkNp-m9eA.text: Excellent old school steakhouse. The atmosphere screams martini, red wine, and beef. We had a group of 12 and the service from walk in to close of the check was superb. We all started with salads or the crab cakes. Both choices were well preprepared and tasty. The table ordered a few 20oz lobster tails to share which were awesome. Everyone's steaks were cooked to order and very tender. The bottles of 2013 mica cab was an great recommendation and served at the perfect temperature. High recommend trying this place. Makes most of the restaurant that people fawn over on the strip seam subpar. Try this gem and truly enjoy your meal.

KH5aXk1miCarPuH8kjW5GA.text: I think there are certain things you expect at a steakhouse that have to be met. When you ask the steak for a certain rawness (medium rare) they should deliver that. Also, if it's undercooked they should give you a new cut. Unfortunately, they didn't satisfy either criteria. They first came back with a heated steak (which was still undercooked). They wanted to just cook it again, but then I explicitly told them we want a new cut they agreed. We had a party of 8 and that ruined the experience since everyone had to wait for me.
