They tried to make me feel better by giving us free fries....what the hell. We dropped 1k and you give us a free order of fries??? Very bad experience.

xGfa3fbbaRAl4ROMW9TUoQ.text: This was one of the best meals I've had in a long time. Beyond the food, the drinks and service were amazing as well. My wife has a seafood allergy and they were very good at making sure there was no cross contamination. Patrick was an amazing server!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

61i19JSj1ZYV1IIHIoPt7Q.text: The food here is incredible.  I was recently here for business and our group of 16 went here for a celebratory dinner.  That's not such a great idea if you're on a budget (like we were), but you'll quickly find out it's worth it, even if you are.  We were in a secluded room above the main dining area and had one server who was fantastic.  He had a lot of help, so the food was always hot and timely, but it was a feat nonetheless.  He was happy, knowledgeable, and on top of things.  He was also knowledgeable about Vegas and stuff to do, so he helped us with some useful ideas for what to do on Fremont St after dinner.   The food was the reason to come, though.  I ordered the Chicken Claire or Jaime (can't remember and it's not on the menu online), which was Chicken Scaloppine. Totally mind-blowing.  Best chicken I've ever had.  The guys sitting next to me with their filet and lobster were a little disappointed they didn't have what I was having.  The only problem was that there wasn't enough, after I shared it with half of the table.  The others said their dinner was really special, too.    We also had most of the sides (duck fat potatoes were the hit) and desserts (pass on the creme brulee and get the bread pudding), but the main courses were exceptional.  I'm sure there are a lot of amazing restaurants in Vegas, but this one was worth the price if you're looking for a quality steakhouse with great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Claire (or Jaime)? Scaloppine.  AMAZING!!

8w7pQVmP5MWKRnoS29pVAw.text: We had a reservation and we were seated quite promptly. The layout of the restaurant and the ambiance is very refreshing. There are about 3 levels of tables in this restaurant. My fiance and I were seated on the middle level with views overlooking both the level below us and the level above us. Our server (I believe his name was Henry) was absolutely excellent! He took the time and didn't seem rushed or overwhelm when I asked for recommendations. He was genuine and it seems like all of the servers are great there!  We received this deal online which made our dinner a little cheaper, and we ordered calamari as an appetizer. It was unique and flavorful. We ordered the filet as our main along with a few side plates (fried onions, au Gratin potatoes) I ordered my filet medium well, and my fiance ordered his medium. They both came out perfect and juicy. It was amazing, however I was disappointed at the size of the side plate portions, specifically the fried onions, we could not even come close to finishing the side plates because the portions were large. Everything else was excellent and on point. We both ordered a creme brulee for dessert and it was to die for!    Thank you for this wonderful meal!

SoAQ4_K-taRsVAQ5rhrG5Q.text: This was a good selection from my wife. We had a party of 6. Bring your Big wallet. The service was great. We had lamb chops, ribeye steaks and lobster. The sides where good as well. Baked potato and corn.  I love it when many services work on the table and each person has a role to play. I would come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner steak and lobster with 3 additional sides big bill
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steaks and lobster selection

NtdqZiANXjIw9C2h6oXXVA.text: Old school steakhouse filled with delicious USDA cuts.  I was so lucky to have been invited to this wonderful place for a wedding dinner.  The service was amazing.  The selection of apps and salads were wide-ranging.  Rockefeller oysters were the star for me as a Briny surprise under a gooey cheesy topping.  The crash cake was packed to the gills with lump crabmeat. Deliciously sweet and yielding meat.  For the main meal it was a delicious Tomahawk steak, prime rib And rock lobster  with sides of gratin, spinach, asparagus and onion rings.  The asparagus hit the spot as all the others were just what you would get elsewhere.    The place was small but they really deliver on exceptional service.  My wine glass was always full and they delivered the food on time.  As well they made a wonderful wedding cake for dessert.  Seriously delicious and moist!  I am over the moon to have been able to experience this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter please
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk steak
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Au gratin

xW34KwVete_37Iw5wA-4XQ.text: Pretty awesome traditional steakhouse! Nestled in the Golden Nugget downtown, V&A has that old-school feel, all dark wood and low light. It was a busy weeknight (the rodeo was in town), so while service wasn't super speedy, we were acknowledged quickly, and our server was very sweet and personable.   I had the Apple Mule, upon my server's recommendation, and it was quite tasty, a nice play on the Moscow Mule, with a green apple slice as garnish.   My business partner and I started with the calamari and crabcake as appetizers. The calamari was very good, lightly battered, tender, and piping hot. Initially, we thought there was no sauce, and requested a side of marinara. The server very nicely told us that she'd have to get it from another restaurant on property, and we told her never mind, that's ok, but she got it anyway! By that time, we'd discovered that there actually was sauce! Underneath the calamari, were sweet onions with a sweet and spicy sauce. It was great! I feel badly that she got the marinara anyway.   The crabcake... Wowzers!!! I think it was the best crabcake I've EVER tasted, and I'm a seafood fanatic. Light, barely any breading and filler, sweet, with a cream sauce.. It was amazing. I'm contemplating returning just to get another. I ate the entire thing, my partner didn't get a bite.   Now, to the meat! We both ordered the filet mignon. I ordered mine medium rare. At the first bite, I initially thought it was a little overdone, but by the third bite, it was perfect.  I think it just might not have been evenly cooked. Regardless, it was very good, and well seasoned.  We split an order of fries, and they were also tasty. Not too crisp, just enough on the outside and soft in the middle.   We didn't have enough room for dessert, so we called it an evening. The bill totaled around $150, which we thought was pretty fair.   Finally, I can check Vic & Anthony's off the list. Good showing!

i_vYG0t0blUMajpw5bfAOg.text: Expected a lot as great reviews. What I got was average. Quite frankly, I will not likely be coming back because there are way better places in comparing the food that I had to other places. To start, we ordered a glass of Syrah, which was good. We both ordered the beet salad to start. It was grossly underwhelming and I do not know what kind of sauce was under it but it almost tasted similar to ranch. I would never consider ordering it again and it is one of my favorite salads at other steakhouse restaurants. I ordered the 8 ounce filet mignon medium and broccoli as a side. The filet mignon was cooked medium well, not medium, and it was closer to well. It was dry. The port wine reduction sauce that came with it, which I had to ask for, was delicious. The broccoli was very good as well. Still, the filet mignon was the main part of the show and it was a disappointment for me. I know many restaurants that just don't get this wrong so I was disappointed that this restaurant did not get it right. I did try the key lime pie for dessert and I might as well have gotten it at a regular store because there was nothing impressive about it. My friend ordered the chocolate mousse which was way too heavy, in her opinion, for a chocolate mousse, which should be light and airy. The ambience of the restaurant seems nice. The lighting is dark so there is plenty of privacy. The problem is that the service did not do very well. Initially it started nicely but toward halfway into the service and past it, it took time for the waiter to get to our table and we had to actually chase someone down 30 minutes after we were done eating just to get our bill. That was a big disappointment for us. Glad I tried it, won't be going back. Not a bad restaurant but very average which is expensive considering the prices.

BO4AmlC5FIuzBH37_j2weQ.text: Great old school, upscale steak house playing classic vegas music in the background inside the Golden Nugget. Great food and phenomenal service. Filet was perfectly cooked and well seasoned. The highlight was the crab cake appetizer.  Just perfection. Lobster bisque and scalloped potatoes were on the salty side. Also had the mac and cheese, 2 whole heads of broccoli, and caesar salad. Decent but rather unremarkable.  Croissant bread pudding was stacked high topped with caramel ice cream and the silky chocolate mousse deserts were a great ending. Really enjoyed the great service.

D5tGtrAUSgn3j2CCSsKi-Q.text: This is one of my favorite steak houses. The dark wood, Dean Martin playing, upscale ambiance that matches the service , quality of the food and experience. Been here several times and have never been disappointed! Can't wait till next time I'm in town to run to you...#vicandanthonys, #vegassteakhouse

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More king crab legs ...
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet and Burrata. Is there anything better than burrata???
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad. Basic and fresh.

4z6YdpxTbO8xfGYZ_tN_LQ.text: The food was amazing and our sever, Miguel, was very accommodating. We ordered:  -steak and lobster entree -seafood tower (appetizer) -roasted salmon entree -broiled portobello mushrooms (appetizer) - au gratin potatoes (sides) -Mac n cheese (sides) -cream corn (sides) -Brussels sprouts (sides) -bone in rib eye (entree)  Amazing experience. Definitely worth it.

j309IdUml_dyTzy6J-qL0A.text: Wow wow wow  Excellent food all around.  Patrick the waiter WOW  what service.  Highly recommend this resteraunt to everyone.  I'll  be back, the porterhouse melts in your mouth!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BAJTatKOu9LLM6sTr6eoug.text: Three of us just had a wonderful dinner at Vic & Anthony's. We had an early reservation on Sat. We got there on time and were seated at a comfortable table right away. The room is very comfortable, lots of wood and stained glass and two of us noticed that it was a nice change that we were able talk with out shouting even though the room was busy. Our waiter, Vic, was wonderful, very professional, and helped us thru a couple high maintenance food allergy food requests.  I started with a crab  cake - excellent, no noticeable filler, just good well seasoned crab. My friends liked their salads. I had one of the best veal chops ever, my friends had a steak and a lobster tail, both excellent, the steak cooked perfectly. The sides are  big enough to share. I thought the au gratin potatoes might have been a bit too cheesy, but still quite delicious. The wines by the glass seemed reasonable, for vegas, and the pinot noir I had was a good choice, our waiters recommendation, with the veal. The deserts were good, I had a flourless chocolate cake and it was one of the richest, best ever. We casually mentioned during the meal that all three of us were celebrating our birthdays and when the check came, the deserts had been comped. Yay! nice touch. Thanks guys.  I only have one complaint  - when our waiter delivered our steaks, he asked us to cut into the middle to check that they were cooked correctly. I HATE THAT!!!!  I expressed my hatred to that bullshit practice, perhaps a bit too enthusiastically, to our waiter. It's not voodoo, its a matter of temperature and if the "cooks" cant tell if the steaks are cooked to order, they shouldn't be in the kitchen or just use an instant read thermometer. In a dim room, cutting into the center is a crap shoot, you cant see well. and even if you can, I don't want  to. Hopefully he passed my message on to management.  All in all, it was an excellent dinner. Everything, food, service and ambience were great. I plan on returning soon.

34121lfRZdLu5eLKThXPHQ.text: Very good food & very good service (& a great wine list too!)  A little pricy.  Would go again...

-ORRvN5tIpUhvmhLJ9L_sA.text: I go to Vegas once a month for work and stay downtown. This is by far my favorite steak house in Vegas. The food for the price is great. I have been to other steak house on the strip and they do no t compare in taste or price to what Vic and Anthony's has to offer. I always sit at the bar and the tenders are more than friendly and professional. I have asked for slight changes in my app and the kitchen will always accommodate, the filet always cooked to perfection. They serve a drink in a tumbler. Always good! Though someone in another review complained the key lime pie was too crusty, the key lime pie has a crust and the actual filling is the tartness it should be.

BYVzWDnYoSwttY12vb-hPA.text: A great steakhouse in the old "rat-pack" Las Vegas tradition.  Great service!    Perhaps the best creamed spinach in the country!  Pricey food.  A good, albeit pricey wine list.  But, this place is simply excellent for steakhouse cuisine, suck it up and pay for the quality....

yGj6mhiBAzEiktDOguK5lg.text: This steak house is my all time favorite. The food is delicious and the $49 3 course meal is a great deal.

6bKF993HJd-SwRFWY8kLSQ.text: idk what it is about steak...steak is just, well, steak.  maybe it's because i'm not a steak connoisseur, but it all tastes similar to me. (don't beat me with a stick!)  yes, the steak was good.  yes, the broccoli was good.  even the mashed potatoes were yummy.  but nothing spectacular or outstanding happened in my mouth.   this place seemed so ritzy, glamorous, and super fine dining but when it came to the food, it was just...ok.  is it bad that i came here expecting something more?  my dad and my brother seemed to have the same reaction as me so maybe not.

caAsYqPDfoLR8lw5uazrMQ.text: Hands down the best meal I have ever had!! The filet mignon is the best steak.  I love this restaurant.  We go to Vegas every year and we look forward to Vic and Anthony's each time.  I have recommended this place to many people and every one of them have LOVED it!!!  This place is top notch from the service to the fine dining.

0l0HfKY0_pMXUX2jzGxUDw.text: I ate here in Dec 2012 while staying at the Golden Nugget.  Both the food and service were great.  Additionally, the restaurant atmosphere was very nice.

YrUuceZJL3iK9L8l7_QQyA.text: My new York was good. Boyfriends bone in rib eye very average if that.  Mini baked potatoes inedible.  Service way too enthusiastic.  Everything was fabulous according to our waiter.  Such was not the case

h7SHI7uqvBhJfQOskXtWqQ.text: Delicious food. I had the sea bass and my husband had the bone in rib-eye.  Fabulous!

NnNVQj9RbPCqc-DabH_3_Q.text: Still to date the best steak and lobster I've ever had. Period. My one and only 5 star rating.

Ujs1qlAlLw0FLV15tT7Lfg.text: Best Steak house, went there for Father's day dinner, all of the food from appetizers and  salads,  to main course and side dishes were all amazing. The service was superb, our waiter went out of his way to make sure everything was perfect .  Also, the bar makes you any drink that you want! Highly recommend this place!

_YAQ6rlPbuVKiHt7dAK4Zw.text: OMG~ We had the most amazing meal at this steakhouse.  Perhaps because I was not expecting much, or perhaps it was the great company I was with, but I HIGHLY recommend Vic & Anthony's.  The appetizers, main dishes, drink menus, wine list were all impeccable.  It was a truly memorable meal that still makes my mouth water....

MELWHL0HgNOyierDGT19Zw.text: The steaks are seasoned to perfection, so tasty. The lobster tail is huge. You probably could feed two to three hungry people. The service is second to none. For dessert you gotta try carrot cake and the pecan ball.

HRVAd7WSCz4SHMxqpICicw.text: This is now my favorite spot to have a steak in LV. The Filet mignon was absolutely delicious. The prices are a little high, but you get what you pay for.

EFR6lBoeqwyFoBaIvIeDcA.text: We had an excellent experience.  Service, food, and just the overall experience was perfect.  If you are looking for this type of experience and are willing to stray from the Strip and pay for quality rather than popularity/trend then go! You won't be disappointed!

xYVfivV-SkwBFQBrSnuhbQ.text: We have celebrated our anniversary dinner here 3 out of the last 4 years and it is nothing less than divine.

P-NfOn3QMhL4Hj1wSFsNlQ.text: Had dinner Saturday night, very good food and service. Perfect meal.

lL3HhKx8U0iYrmWsdtJnOw.text: I love this place!!!! It was a little harder to find and on the expensive side but it is worth every penny. GREAT steak and seafood too, you know it's good when everyone at the table loves their food and you can't pick out a favorite.

ngb2_d1k9H4Xw91W29Nstg.text: top notch.  unreal good.  nuff said.

s4UJ6bX_D5nAo59yM5RFpA.text: What can I say, this is my first 1* rating.   My girlfriend and I wanted a nice dinner in Las Vegas.  We reviewed yelp and Zagat reviews and chose this place.  The decor and ambiance are terrific, but that fell apart.  We were dressed for a 5 star meal, but not everyone in restaurant shared our wardrobe.  There was literally 5 or 6 tables were men were wearing ratty cargo shorts and tee shirts.  I saw a woman in yoga pants.  I was very disappointed to pay $50 for a steak and see someone that was barely dressed for Chipotle.    Our waiter, Jay, started out great, but fell apart later (details to follow).  We both ordered the same steak (NY Strip).   The price was $55 including the blue cheese topping.  Ala Carte, this is hefty, but I am willing to pay for quality.    My girlfriends steak was cooked well, tasted great, but was tough (very tough - we mentioned it to the manager but he did not seem concerned about it).  My steak I ordered rare.  It was medium well to well when it came out.  I cut it in half and called Jay over.  He agreed and cooked me a new one.  The steak part deux was not tough (like my girlfriends), cooked perfectly, BUT, I had asked me to put blackening seasoning on it.  I took a bite and had a Pierce Brosnan reaction in Ms. Doubtfire when his shrimp was too spicy.  They used Cajun Blackening.  This seasoning made the steak way to salty (and I like salt) and very spicy (and I like spicy).  I was not what I expected.  I informed Jay about the seasoning and he said he would investigate.  After that, we surmised Jay entered the witness protection program because we did not see him until the bill came.  This was strange, because we were discrete about our concerns.  When he did bring the bill I asked him about the seasoning and he said 'oh yeah' they ran out of regular blackening and used the Cajun instead.  True story.  I finished the steak.  When Jay did finally emerge from the shadows he inexplicably gave the check to my girlfriend (she quickly shuttle passed it to me so no damage was done to her wallet). The check included $0 off for our issues.  For newbie diners, this is NOT usual for well-dressed well-mannered diner where the kitchen screws the pooch. While I am piling on complaints, one more.  There is no restroom in the restaurant.  The restroom is literally half way across a crowded, smoky, dare I say dingy casino and that restroom, well let's just say it was not as clean as it could have been.  Again, for a high end dining place, I should not have to walk 4 minutes one way and get some free longshot horse advice from a guy in the next urinal smoking a cigar.  Not what I was expecting. Overall, maybe we got unlucky.  However, I would recommend avoiding this place for 2 reasons.  1. Do not support a fine dining restaurant that does not enforce a dress code and 2. Do not support a restaurant that cannot resolve a problem. Every casino hotel has a steakhouse, avoid this one AND the Circus Circus steakhouse.  Same problem there - no dress code, no problem resolution.

vgJSd6sb7RcWybhCClZong.text: I have dined at this location several times in which I would have given a four+ star review.  We took my mother here for her birthday and, to the server's credit, he got us out right when we needed to be leaving for a show.  My mom and husband thought their steak and fish were very good.    The reasons for the lower starred review is that the bread and butter were nothing to write home about and the sides and salad were all mediocre/undercooked/or overpriced for what you got.  Specifically, we got the mushrooms, which were above-average, potatoes au gratin which were like a cheese soup with very little potatoes, and uncooked and underseasoned brussels sprouts.  My salad had watery tomatoes and a really bland dressing.  It was disappointing to have such crappy sides because 1) they were expensive and 2) they comprised all of my vegetarian meal.    Also, the waiter commented about three separate times about how much we must have liked our food or that we were hungry as he was clearing our plates  (rude).  Hey a**h*ole, if I'm paying about $4 per forkful, you had better believe we are eating all of it!!

j1DRmPY80r2wWsRXrEkaHA.text: We went out with a couple of our friends and had a great time. This was our first time here and I do have a few complaints as well as praises.  1) At first, when we arrived at the hotel, we were informed that we couldn't valet unless we were staying at the hotel, and that the garage sign said it was full. We drove around for about 10 minutes before asking again about the garage, and were then let in after telling the guy at the gate that we had reservations. When we got into the garage, it wasn't even close to full.  2) We called ahead and made reservations and then had to wait almost 30 minutes to be seated. There were people that just walked up before us, with no reservations and still got in before us. What's the point of making reservations?  3) The saving factor was that once we were in, the customer service was good and the food was excellent.   My wife and I had a whole lobster, which ran about $90 by itself. We had the crab cakes for the appetizer, which we shared with our friends. They ordered oysters that they shared with us.  For the main course, we both had blackened ribeye and a baked potato. We had other food that we tried as well, but when it was all said and done, we spent about $385 with tip. Our friends spent $140+ tip.  It was definitely worth it if you're looking for somewhere very nice to eat. We sat and talked for about 45 minutes after we finished the meal and they continued to serve us water and iced tea (what I had). Not once were we rushed.  If I didn't have the parking and reservation complaints above, they would have gotten 5 stars from me.

YaBBGGG9CVoNFwtZlORTcQ.text: Went there for dinner last night and the steak was incredible, as it always has been there.  And the service and ambiance were also top notch.  The one downside is that they replaced the AWESOME Beefsteak Tomato and Mozzarella salad was replaced with a Tomato Panzanella, which I tried.  It was ok at best, but not near as good as what they had before.  It is nothing I would even think about ordering again.

UE3VJ6CIDgxc0flbjY8hFQ.text: This restaurant is simply amazing. It is my second visit here, both times with my daughter. Both times the food, ambiance, service were nothing less than exceptional. Our server last year, Victor, remembered us and although he was not our server this time he still checked on us multiple times, as did other staff. Our server Nick was professional and efficient. He made excellent recommendation in food and beverage.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JJ8Y5LZcXGRg2mh0cck3Rw.text: I would probably give it a full five if I had just had a steak!  But as the night was, I was in the company of 4 older people, all of who were not about to indulge in a steak with me and I was not about to order one of those bad boys myself.  But it looked SOOOO GOOD in the showcase.    I did have the tartar though, which they did up in small chunks, seasoned, and plated on a salt brick.  Very nice going down.  Between the 5 of us, we had seafood, seafood, and seafood.  I won't comment on the Alaskan King Crab legs because I think that they are all the same.  The AKC pasta though, was wonderfully light and fresh.  My dad had the special which was scallops, shrimp and swordfish over polenta with a baked potato on the side.  Perfectly done.  HUGE SIDES! I suggest sharing, especially if you order the mashed potatoes.     Salmon was also done well.    Nice ambiance - dark like a real classy restaurant, but like Hawaii, because it's Vegas, the dress code is not that strict.  I wore shorts. But in True Vegas fashion, there were large screen tvs through out the place that played sports non stop.  Service was great, quick and friendly.  I look forward to going back with a meat eater and killing one of those $90 porterhouses or $60 rib eyes.

gpIKMGPbsFFJpC4OcKTHXA.text: It was good.  Good service.  Tasty food.  Cool location.    The quality off the meat though doesn't match the price.  Filet mignon was kind of tough.  Ordered medium rare, was served medium well and half of it had a black hard carbon shell.  The crab cake was good!  I've had better steak at home or even at chains like saltgrass.

Yu3NGeI6YM48YQkr1OcfFg.text: Ask to see the set menu.  It's a great deal if you like fillet.  Complete meal $52.00

D1pXevCuKFIL895CC5_Whw.text: This place is AMAZING. My friends and I had the best meal we've ever eaten, here. We received great service, as well, including a table visit from the Executive Chef. This is, by far, the best steak place we've ever eaten.  If you go to Vegas, do NOT miss this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome desserts!

mMS5NqnMP_9eaDQUa9PRdg.text: I would recommend having creme spinach as an appetizer. Lobster bisque was 5 stars. I had chopped salad and it was refreshing. Steak was under cooked but still delicious.

b8fHLsSfJoJtWsjNvkxWyg.text: We decided to stop into this gem of a steakhouse due being indecisive about where we wanted to eat. Little did we know it was an excellent decision. This restaurant has a ton of charm and the classy feel of an old school steakhouse restaurant. The wine selection is out of this world and the menu doesn't disappoint. My husband had the steak and lobster special and I had the stuffed salmon. Both entrees were like nothing I have ever had. Very unique and delicious! Our server (and I'm going to butcher her name, Ayko??) was fabulous. Gave us amazing drink and menu recommendations, and was at the top of her game with service. Best server we have ever had. And if you have room for desert, get the croissant bread pudding. YUM!!!

0PQvc53TzpGGeVpT26IuDw.text: When I go to bed at night and dream it's not about Brad or Johnny (Pitt and Depp)  It's Vic & Anthony.  Yes, as the rating indicates, it is "as good as it gets!" This is the perfect description of a dining experience.  Vic & Anthony's will always be my first and only choice for upscale dining downtown in Las Vegas. No wait "Scratch that",  I only visit Vegas to dine here!  Steakhouse cuisine is unparalleled in its simplicity.  succulent porterhouse dripping in natural juices and butter.  Either way, steak proves that the simplest foods can constitute great dinners.  They know how to carry out fully here.  We are fully convinced that this is The Best of the Best of the BEST!    In fact whenever  our dearest Friends, Family, or clients are visiting the Vegas Area we Call Vic and Anthony's and run a Comp Charge via our credit card and treat them to the experience of there lifetime!   Let's just say we are pretty popular after this ;0)

fin1z1qXVsi1ZbsdTMuIfQ.text: A friend from London and I went because he wanted old school Vegas. He got it! This place was great! I loved the pictures on the walls.  The food was outstanding. I got the porterhouse (my favorite cut), it was cooked perfect and mouthwatering. All the servers were attentive and knowledgable.  I highly recommend the place!

l7Z8Fo4Xf_Odkksr7iBeVA.text: Over priced, over rated, and too big headed!  If only they had told us the creamed spinach side was the same glop that had put on the oysters rockefeller, we wouldn't have paid another $10 for it.  This food is mediocre at best. I had the Halibut special.  The fish was dried out and fishy.  My husband had the Steak which was dried out on the outside and almost raw on the inside.  It was definitely not medium rare.   Nothing comes with your meal and every side is almost $10. Would have been better off at the coffee shop.

9HZ7MzugYKwpDV3mKeaV8A.text: The service was great but the food was very disappointing.  My $50 ribeye was overcooked and lacked seasoning.  The crab cake and the asparagus was good,but the mac n cheese and bland.  I would not recommend this place to anyone

riVOvYk5QPH3XLpJEgkcLg.text: We came here because we read the reviews. We got a reservation and we were twenty minutes late. The staff was very friendly, kind and honored our reservation by attending us immediately. The waiter was perfect. We had high expectations from the reviews. My wife is a sea food lover and I love steak. The food didn't meet our expectations at all. We came out very disappointed when the food didn't meet all the great service provided. The lobster bisque was very salty, and the steak was over cooked and dry with very little flavor.

1KAytVbmZ1t2slnmR-rJDQ.text: Vic & Anthony's is one of the finest restaurants I've ever eaten in.   Began with French onion soup, followed by lettuce wedge w/ Roquefort chunks, then small fillet Mignon (rare) for the entree, and ending with a desert of bread pudding to die for, (made with croissants).  --I don't usually rave about bread pudding, which you can find at any L.V. buffet, but this one was recommended to me by my server, and turned out to be incredible, (served with a small scoop of vanilla ice cream).   The service was impeccable and the food was prepared flawlessly.  --One of the finest pieces of beef I've ever eaten.  I will return to Las Vegas in three weeks and Vic & Anthony's is a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vic &amp; Anthony&#39;s Bread Pudding

iEyMWDtLEaEEw1A-TdGH4g.text: 8-9-2015 When the waiter spilled a full glass of water on my wife and drenched her blouse and pant suit, she received an apology.....a few new napkins and a table cloth to dry off. No manager ever came to speak to us. Isn't the GOLD Standard for fine dining to check on Your client after mishaps. No accommodations or adjustments were made. Also, the waiter said its hot outside so, your "Clothes will dry quick".....We had not even started our meal and my wife was soaked. What we should have done was left, changed and had your staff made us new meals. But we stayed and kind of expected a manager to make things right. It never happened.  We won't be back.

VMycZJWmn3hu7ww7psYP3Q.text: Everything about this place was great. We went here for my birthday. Our server Matt was awesome.  We wanted to try so many things... We went with the chips and strings, bacon, baked potato, salad, Mac and cheese, and a steak... All great!

2Dvla3Vxq-tWVA8NzLZfVg.text: This place is a hidden gem in downtown Las Vegas. I went last night and can say it is easily one of the best meals AND the best service that I've had in Vegas. If you go, I would request Luciano to be your server because he is so attentive and knows every detail about the menu. I loved everything that we ordered- calamari, the stuffed salmon, filet, ribeye, Mac and cheese, duck fat potatoes, and asparagus. Everything is worth the price!

mGfzD4EfXbbyYx0o3A-d6A.text: Coming to stay at the Golden Nugget I started looking at the restaurants located in the hotel and saw the great reviews for Vic and Anthonys. This is one of those spots that live up to the hype behind the reviews.  Our server was so amazing. The guy knew his stuff when it came to food and wine pairing.   A lot of yelpers talked about the lobster bisque so we had to try that. My wife said it was one of the best she ever had. The waiter even brought me a sample of the potato and cheese soup because I mentioned two my wife it sounded good. (ahh the little things) I threw down for some Kobe Beer and my lady got the Filet and Lobster (Dammnn girl *like Jaime Fox in Booty Call) Seriously her filet was so freaking good I had a little bit of food envy.   Vegas is known for getting you to stuff your belly for as cheap as possible. But Vic & Anthonys is a reason to avoid that $1.95 buffet that will call from some tums later on and spend some cash (hopefully winnings) on a great meal. Get in here and dont be afraid to order that after dinner shot of cognac, and I hate cognac but when in rome....CHEERS!!!

aJnIBT7GfXgNZ8orUZsDGg.text: We had dinner at Vic & Anthony's a week ago . Our host at the Golden Nugget { Mr. Desanctis } was wonderful . He wanted  us to try the Steakhouse because we were staying at the Wynn . WOW ~ it was spectacular ! The best meal we had all the time we spent in Vegas . We are now considering staying at the Golden Nugget next trip ! Great Casino ~ Host ~ and Vic and Anthony's was first class . The best Las Vegas has to offer !

8xCjaMdbHyJ75Vpk4_8-Uw.text: Outstanding Steak and wonderful bar service.  We missed our reservation at another place, and the hostess put us at the bar, which was top notch, and great entertainment

YuQYFLpx5inbQstahTdgIA.text: We were rather apprehensive when we arrived to the lights of downtown Las Vegas in that night, but felt like you were stepping in to a different world when we went in the restaurant. Very traditional surroundings. My brother and a friend of mine loved their steaks and thought the filet mignon was one of the best they had had and cooked perfectly to their taste. The sides were good and the waiter was helpful and friendly. The only small negatives were that the restrooms were a trek through the casino which wasn't ideal and the red wine was rather too chilled. The air con was also a little fierce. We were too full for a pudding put the neighbouring table ordered what looked and they confirmed was a rather spectacular cheesecake. A lovely evening and would recommend if you are a steak lover.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-tH8lW3QgaRJYrUSCjQfIA.text: Was sort of intrigued with the rating for the place even though it's in downtown LV. (Golden Nugget)  Typically highly rated places here don't really warrant their ratings IMO (Hugo's cellar, Second Street Grill)   I thought this place has either got to be really good or really overrated.  But since we were going to be pretty close to it around dinner, and we wanted some steak, I thought let's try it.  Got the Prime Ribeye (no bone) med rare.  Perfectly cooked, the meat had great texture throughout.  Seasoned just right as well, it was succulent and tasty.  Sometimes these prime or prime prime meats have chunks of fat in them; not this though, it was a nice and even. I even got the port peppercorn sauce on the side just in case but it wasn't really needed.  Parents had the Filet Mignon and Veal Chop.   I think my dad liked the chop since it disappeared pretty quickly.  Got the au gratin potatoes and the risotto (crab based) as sides.  The Au Gratin Potatoes had that nice deep cheddar flavor with a good crust as well.  I'm not a real 'crab' person but I appreciated how the risotto was so smooth with that good 'crabby' flavor.  Both sides were so tasty with a depth of flavor that seemed truffle oil-ish, but it wasn't overwhelming (so probably not?).  Even though we were full from that, we got the Caramel croissant bread pudding.  It comes with a scoop of ice cream and toffee chips in the sauce (see pict). Each bite was sweet and succulent.  Although price is usually a factor in my rating, this place's rating will be different.  The quality of each dish at this steakhouse matches the best steakhouse dinner I have ever had before (Mastros BH). Even being in downtown, it crushed other steaks I've had on the Strip (Craftsteak, Prime).  I haven't tried the very top steakhouses in LV but I know if I want some great steak in the future and I'm over here in downtown, I'll try to come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel croissant bread pudding
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mm, 16 oz prime ribeye with the au gratin and risotto (crab) in the background.

htAR56E7W0VmT5BVrGqWjQ.text: Love that salmon. Love the heirloom salad. Lobster of always fantastic. Wedge salad. Yum. Club soda yum. Ribeye very good. And cremes brulee

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cafe
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad w mozz

3qCspWNVmV_NU5gpAU7dAg.text: Everything was delicious !! Loved the Chicken Paige was the most delicious I have ever tasted. My husband loved his steak. Kids loved the loaded potatoes and Mac and cheeses. Loved it.

jRqqN9APDaZMs6mfc3og7w.text: One of the best experiences ever when it comes to food. Hector was an amazing server and the food was second to none. Cannot wait for our next Vegas trip, definitely making sure to come back here to eat!!!

FH9X7Ob0Oxza2ZnuuCf_cw.text: Absolutely superb! Service, food, and atmosphere. This place can compete with any steakhouse on the LVS. Steak was fantastic, but if you don't order the crab cake, you have missed something special. Ask about the off menu 4 course dinner. Will be eating here every time I am in town!

ajwlZDnGUW08EQykv8CU4A.text: Definitely as good as it gets in Las Vegas!  The restaurant was really busy last night but we were lucky enough to grab one seat at the bar. Sean, the GM, saw that I was standing in an open spot and without skipping a beat brought out another bar stool from the back room. That's what I call service! Now it was time to get down to business. I was in the mood for a good cab and was poured a taste of their house...I must of had a certain look on my face because before I knew it Efrain brought me a new glass with a taste of Peju - Amazing choice. We ended up having three glasses and one of the best Manhattans in Las Vegas. For appetizers we had the Calamari which was amazing and the Bacon which was out of this world. If you only have room for one starter the Bacon should be your choice. I then had one of the best steaks I've ever had. An 8 oz filet cooked to perfection with a side of au gratin potatoes. My friend had the Chicken Paige which was an unbelievable dish too! We ended our meal with the bread pudding which sent us over the edge in a cloud nine way of course. Great service and amazing food!  Next time we will make a reservation for sure.

E7eDnw2z8eIQrHUOrDCK2Q.text: The food was awesome. We especially enjoyed the lobster bisque and the ribeye. The servers were on point and never needed to ask for anything.

BPX3XDC9osi-VCI2tU4GnQ.text: They were absolutely fantastic. Took my boyfriend here for his birthday and we had a great time. Service was great and the food was out of this world. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone!

qREWlyCiZ84pmo-P-NdntQ.text: This is my favorite steakhouse in Vegas!  I always make time for at least one dinner here when I'm in town and they never disappoint.

hzsq8yZ_1Ub0647sdaoQGg.text: I would 100% give this Steakhouse a 5 star. If I could give them more than a 5 start review, I absolutely would.   I checked out the website prior to our arrival and was pleasantly surprised to see their "Pre-Fixed Menu" that was offered for $49 a person. Although the pre-fixed menu is not offered on the menu when you enter the building it does share online if you bring the menu with you that they will offer/validate the price.    The menu included one of the following: 1.) Salad or Soup 2.) Filet Mignon/Salmon or Pasta 3.) Side dish of Au Potatoes, green beans or Creamy spinach. 4.) Dessert (I had the Creme Brule) but they also had the option of a Chocolate Cake (one other but I am not sure off hand what it was)  A few Co-Workers and I got all different dishes for our side and we were able to share them since they are more of a "Family Style." All dishes were great but I would highly recommend the potatoes or creamy spinach.   I go the Filet Mignon and it was immaculate. It was perfectly cooked and all flavors were absolutely perfect throughout each bite.   For the cost, ambiance and service I would absolutely be back!

jRGOFPI7eO3ntRbPX87oxw.text: Service was excellent, wait staff was very well versed on the wine selection and pairing options based upon our aggregate food order. The food was perfectly cooked with high quality ingredients. Be sure to indulge in a shared dessert as you won't be disappointed.  The creme brule was to die for.

RJTIX_wjKWdSqhthKvMZSA.text: I have to say that this restaurant was wonderful.  Being that the Golden Nugget is a bit of a dive, I didn't expect much from this place.  My mind changed when I walked in though.  Very classy place, very alert server, and one heck of a meal.  You absolutely must try the lobster bisque.  It is incredible!  Also, the oysters tasted very fresh.  Lastly, I had the lobster mac n' cheese.  It doesn't sound fancy, but it blew my mind.  They take 4oz of fresh lobster and mix it in with a super cheesy pasta dish.  They then fry an entire lobster tail and drop it on top.  It was insanely good!

u2vll8uhbcvzIlKTZRqr2g.text: I like this place the steaks are solid..the sides are the usual fare...the lobster mac n cheese is over hyped but not horrible ($38)....the service is also pretty solid depending upon how busy they are. I like to play at the nugget so its pretty convenient. The mood is dark and old schoolish except for the flat screens over the bar..kinda odd..but i don't really mind it just don't ever remember seeing it before. The lobster tails are from fukushima nuclear plant....I have never seen them so big....serious 3 eye action there. All and all pretty solid..but not the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old school feel and ambiance..excellent service and food!
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York strip...lobster tail..creamed corn...life is good ! :)
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal chop and asparagus

Tlk8VNHjXv3gJ1hbobXbfQ.text: As usual, everything was amazing at Vic & Anthony's. My husband and I agreed that we shouldn't even go eat anywhere else for nice dinners except here. At least every meal we could have some different and it's guarantee to be great. The food is always on point and the service is always prompt and courteous. Couldn't recommend this place enough to anyone asking for the best place to eat.

XXmKamGsjTtEDKwNzBViqg.text: Take it from a local who has been everywhere - Vic and Anthony's is not only the best steakhouse in Vegas, It is one of the best restaurants in the whole city. Please do yourself a favor and just try this place. It is our new favorite! The prices on the strip are outrageous for what you get and quite a number don't deliver. This place is worth every penny for a special evening. My wife and I went recently to celebrate her birthday this year. The original Vic and Anthony's in Houston is consistently ranked as one of the best in the country. This is their second location, if I remember correctly, and it is every bit as good. Before I say anything about the food, let me just express how incredible the service was. From beginning to end, my wife said it was the best service she has ever experienced and she used to work in the food and service industry for years. They hire excellent people and they will take care of you. The restaurant is located in the best hotel off the strip, the Golden Nugget, and it has a beautifully focused menu. To start the lobster bisque was perfect and the crab cake - Best I have ever had. Furthermore, the drinks are excellent and well priced. The steaks are all cooked to perfection and are served all by themselves, with an optional sauce, topping or any of several sides you can order. The key here is that the steaks are of such high quality and seasoned so immaculately that they don't need anything. I am not a filet man, as like most chefs, I agree it has less flavor than other cuts. However, my surf and turf was sublime! My wife's new york was equally good. We finished with dessert wine and a killer red velvet cake. Everything will be so good you will have to share dishes just so everyone can try a few things.

AGjyS7FNnkZTgqb6m0NZNA.text: Food was mediocre.  The calamari with spicy peppers was extremely soggy.  The bread they served was actually stale.  In their defense, My filet was perfectly cooked and quite delicious.  Our waiter was nice but spilled my husbands beer all over the table and didn't offer a new one.  It's not a bad place but it's really nothing special .  Not what I expected for a $60 steak.

aPo03JcDNlT5j_HToz0A_Q.text: I loved this spot. It's off strip but it's got that old school steak house vibe, including great service. I was nervous, as a table of one (who wants a single-person table in their section?) but the waiter treated me with great respect and attention. The meal was great, cadenced almost perfectly, too. I used an Open Table dining rewards gift certificate to pay for part of my meal so that was probably annoying or alarming but I never saw that expressed on the waiter's face or heard it in his voice.  Sidenote: naturally I tipped extra as I have been a waiter for 15 years up until recently.   Enough about me -- great place to take your steak craving!

HLX222n0tYGgXnZrmQH21g.text: We were looking for a business dinner away from the strip and I heard about this place so we decided to make reservations for 6 people.  A couple of our team got there first but we're not seated immediately.  We had to have everyone in our party present in order for them to have us seated.  Once we were all there.  We were given the menu and drinks were ordered.    The duck-fat mash potato was amazing.  I ordered the ribeye steak and it was cooked to perfection .  And desert was absolutely decadent.   They only thing I was not impressed with the place is how loud the music was and the tables are so close together.  We kept bumping into the other patrons whenever one of us stood up.    Service was great.  The food came in a timely manner.   I would definitely dine here again.

s3j1nNKOZgdIfHikH6bwpg.text: 3.5. Pretty over it.  Distinctive Dining deal is now $59, and you don't get to choose your own side any longer. Instead you get a mediocre mash that I was not compelled to eat.  Filet is still excellent and seasoned very well. Crab cake is bomb. Salmon was served with a really heavy, rich sauce that was just too much.   For some reason V&A's just doesn't deliver on sides and sauces.  If you dine here and self-park, make sure to bring your ticket stub into the restaurant to get it validated.

ieh7A8vzb7Q-d5S_iA_jdA.text: One of the best steakhouses I've ever been! I am very picky about my steak, but this place absolutely exceeds my expectation. I ordered Surf and Turf with a beautiful lobster tail. Worth every penny ($74 to $85, depending on the type of steak you get and I had ribeye, yum)! Excellent service. Will definitely go back when I have the chance!

II8GW5Zf32tPzloO7jUZOg.text: Vic & Anthony's has never been on my radar. In fact, when I think of steaks in Vegas I have many other places in my mental bookmarks, more flashy places like Bazaar come to mind. My point is, I am glad that my father in law took us here because otherwise I would not have come on my own.   It was my mother in law's birthday and as such she chose where we went to dinner. We (my husband and I) had just started an extremely limiting diet, but thankfully many menu items were "compliant" without (much) modification!  Obviously this is a steak house, but many of the non-steak options caught my attention. Organic lamb chops? Oh my God yes please. Seared ahi tuna? Sounds delicious but I can't have soy right now. Dry-aged Duroc pork chop? Seeing that I'm a big fan of aged meat (my husband is 19 years older than me after all-LOL) that is what I went with.   Aged pork (medium temp) was delicious, the dry aging really adds a whole new level of flavor, one which I've enjoyed many times with steaks..but never with pork. Thankfully my sister in law chose the lamb chops (rare temp) so I had the opportunity to sample some of that as well.. best of both worlds!  My husband got the ribeye which was also  very good. It was cooked to his temp specifications and was well seasoned. We had several sides, my favorites were the brussel sprouts and the duck fat potatoes (mmmmh, duck fat). They also pour a damn good cocktail here; I strayed a bit by drinking alcohol and ordered a Makers Mark old fashioned, which was great.

yfaif43X_9ORGNbT1c63HQ.text: Great ambience, historic photos of OLDE Las Vegas entertainers, wonderful service. Only thing missing is a LIVE jazz combo or pianist. A place like this shouldn't have music piped in!?!

3ZR946Ct6w0xnhx7TKkLgA.text: Very great steaks here i ordered the 320z tomahawk bone in with side of cream of spinach and lobster macncheese amazing.

HADJAYCjB1diODmSwLfEyg.text: Went here for dinner - service was great. Restaurant is relatively quiet from some places on the strip. Staff kept the tables clean if any dishes and such as you ate. We got two dishes: steak and salmon. The steak was cooked (medium) well and the salmon was great. Salmon was stuffed with other things and very delicious flavor. I would say it's priced as most steakhouses ads but maybe a little pricey in general for a restaurant.

FeqYfjorAQ2Q1YsQK5kdlA.text: I was seeing a show at the Golden Nugget and I decided to try Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse for dinner.  I was taken upstairs and given the first table at the top of the stairs.  It gave me a good view down the steps of the people walking by the restaurant.  That area of the upstairs is somewhat narrow and I had my back to the room so I couldn't see more of it.  Very quickly, I was brought water and my order for iced tea was taken.  My server, Victor, came by and told me about the specials for the evening with prices--a nice touch that some restaurants don't do.  You have to ask them about the pricing.  I ordered lobster bisque for a starter, their 12 ounce filet, an order of sea salt fries (I was advised that this was small and manageable for one person, and then chocolate mousse for dessert.  I was brought warm bread and a plate with piper butter.  Nice presentation.  The lobster bisque  was finished with cognac and it had a fair amount of the cognac flavor in it.    I ordered my steak blue--Victor asked if I wanted it seared 1/3 inch on all sides and I said yes.  The steak was about 2 inches thick and the searing was just perfect for not cooking it too much.  The interior was very rare, exactly the way I like my steak.  The fries were good with a large amount of salt on them.  If you're watching your sodium intake, get something else.  When it came time for dessert, I asked for suggestions.  Victor recommended either the creme brulee or the chocolate mousse cake.  For the most part, I find creme brulee to be almost the same from one place to another so I opted for the chocolate mousse cake.  That was the correct choice.  It was creamy, chocolaty, and simply a great way to end the meal.  Service throughout was great!  My iced tea was replaced several times with no need to ask.  The only detriment was the group of five very loud men at the next table.  Because of the narrowness of the restaurant here, I heard the whole conversation including talk of Leonardo DiCaprio and other personalities from an insurance guy.  Go figure.  All this while using four letter words quite liberally.  This was something the restaurant can't control, but it was a drawback from the overall enjoyment of the meal.  Finally, you're paying close to Strip prices for a downtown steakhouse.  It is worth it because the filet was very, very good.

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea salt fries.
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 ounce filet with bleu cheese bacon butter topping.

amoy5Xf-cYNlLr5_Le7J-Q.text: Fantastic service, food, and atmosphere. Our server was very knowledgeable and skilled at the art of upselling. We were a party of six and everyone loved their food. I had the seared tuna and easily cut it with a fork.

OtrDQ5F35ZlIUG0MzZCy6g.text: I had a good experience at Vic and Anthony's.   It was my first time to downtown Vegas and I was expecting nothing but questionable but cheap buffets so this was a very nice upscale surprise.  I loved the atmosphere.  The darker quieter steakhouse that gives you the sense that Don Corleone is sitting in a corner.  And the only drinks you should have are either red wine or a dirty martini.   My kind of place!  The service was fine.  He was friendly and informative but I would have preferred a little more energy.       I ordered the 8oz filet and although it was good, I have to say I have had better at both Mastro's and N9NE.   The perfect medium was just not as tender as I had hoped.  The brussel sprouts were amazing!   Probably the best I have ever had.  However, the au gratin potatoes were strange.  I guess I'm just used to them in layers but they were potato chunks in a very yellow cheese sauce.  Almost tasted like velveeta.  I would have probably gotten something different.  All in all a positive experience and I'm glad I tried it, but would probably try other steakhouses before coming back.

THusfVFwqIPKPeCJgqdzfQ.text: I am appalled this place has 4 1/2 stars. I'm a Vegas born and raised native but I've lived in LA for the last three years after attending culinary school. I visited with my husband recently & we decided to celebrate an anniversary here after seeing a positive rating (????) & I  truly can't believe what passes as "fine-dining level" food here. Over cooked on the outside, undercooked on the inside medium rare steak for $100 (something we absolutely never spend that much money on but were splurging for a special occasion). I should know, an Italian restaurant where the free bread isn't very good at all is going to be awful... Crab cake "appetizer" was so heavy & filling with so much buttery sauce we were feeling full & sick before we got the entree. Everything here is low quality & full of fat in the worst way. My chicken was over cooked & the oil was pooling in a way that made me sick & I honestly started to cry at how awful the meal was & how much my anniversary was ruined. Thankfully sending it back (which I absolutely never do as a Chef) resulting in just paying for the wine. The wine selection being the literal only thing that one star is good for. Save your money, this place is grossly overpriced culinary trash.

T_SQXNTwP8lMy-380sntxg.text: Stopped in for dinner on Thursday night. Decided to sit at the bar.  Not only was the food superb the service from the bartender on duty was exceptional.  I didn't catch his name but he has a beard, Marine Corp and Air Force Veteran. Watching him work was a True pleasure....a True master of his craft. The 22oz ribeye was cooked to perfection and the bacon appetizer melted in your mouth.  I can't wait to come Back to Vegas to eat here again.

jDL3eIq-dhQ2i0_Vsgh9sw.text: My wife and I have been coming here each of the last three years when in town for the PAC 12 Basketball Tournament. Overall I feel that it's better than a 4 Star, but I can't give a quarter or half. For a upper quality steakhouse, the prices are pretty much in line with the others.   This year we had the roast quail in chipotle glaze and the crab cake. Both were exceptional. The crab cake might be the best I've ever had.  My wife had the salmon which she thought was ok, but could have had a bit more flavor. I had the bone in rib eye with the bourdelaise sauce and the sides of scalloped potatoes and mushrooms. The one thing about V & C is that they tend to undercook the steaks. This is the second year where I have had to send back the steak because it was rare rather than medium rare. If was better when they flashed it for a couple minutes, but the crust was a bit burnt after that.  The previous year they undercooked my wife's and they gave her the steak for free after they re-cooked it and it came out medium instead of medium rare. When they get the steaks right though, they are very good.  As for the sides...they are big enough for two people, maybe even three. The scallop potatoes are almost to rich. I love my cheese, but these potatoes are cheese bombs. Really hard to eat more than a few bites because the the richness. The mushrooms were very good. I've had the creamed spinach before and that was super rich as well.   Service is excellent. Love that they fill your water every few minutes. They are also understanding if something is not to your liking and very well may comp your for it.   I'd say give it a try for sure. Probably not the best steakhouse in Vegas, but one of the top ones for sure. We also like Binion's Steakhouse.

eraIaGcDh3lVwQiSWp2nGw.text: By far the best steakhouse I have been to. Especially for the quality and quantity. I had the tomahawk steak. It was cooked to perfection! The crab cake was to die for. Great atmosphere and friendly servers which made my first visit even betterI would definitely recommend this restaurant!

M9wPx7WnMJtL47jPw9pNGA.text: This place was unexpectedly good.  The cuts of steak were very good and the side were plenty.  One thing I must say is that the waiter was awesome!   Great outgoing guy and he gave us tons of tips on activities to look for in DT Vegas!  All in all, great little steakhouse.

TK3mtBiOoq0qlJoK7PIYbA.text: (Review based on 3.5 stars)  Located at The Golden Nugget in Downtown Las Vegas, directly across from the Chocolate Box and very close to the hotel lobby check in.  My husband and I arrived here for dinner on Christmas day while spending a little vacation getaway in Las Vegas. We arrived right on time for our 5:30 pm reservations (another couple had walked in and asked how long would the wait be since they did not have a reservation and the seating hostess told him it would be about 45 minutes).   After we were seated and greeted by our server (unfortunately I do not recall his name), we were given menus. We ended up ordering:  Sourdough Bread- This basket of complementary bread was pretty "meh". Although it was served warm, it did not have much of a taste. It is served with butter (with good reason). But since we were both feeling hungry, we ended up eating 1/2 of it.   Jump Lump Crab Cake, $21 prior to tax- Although this crab cake was a large size (and a fair amount to share for 2 as an appetizer), I wasn't really impressed with it. I thought the breading was not seasoned well. But the crab pieces itself was good. The butter sauce on this crab cake was good but the crab was good all by itself. I wouldn't say this is worth ordering again.  Roasted Salmon, $32 prior to tax- This salmon is served on a bed of potato puree (mashed potatoes) and a delicious lump of crab. This dish is also served with asparagus. I had requested for the asparagus to be steamed. According to our server, normally the asparagus is sauteed in butter. I thought this salmon was perfectly cooked. The sauce was wonderful and I liked the diced tomatoes on the salmon. However I didn't find the capers to really enhance the flavor of the salmon and rather overpowered the delicate flavors of the fish. The crab cake that was served was much better seasoned and better tasting than our appetizer. The portion of this entree is more than perfect for one person.   Prime Ribeye (16 oz), $47 prior to tax- My husband ordered this (since he is a big steak fan and we are in a steak house). We were both actually surprised that this prime ribeye entree was just meat and no side like my salmon. When we had dined at other steakhouses in the past, the steak entree always comes with some kind of vegetable and/ or starch. So this was a little disappointing. In general, the prime rib was cooked a bit more than my husband wanted (he ordered it medium rare). But the steak was still juicy. It would have been nice to have an accompaniment of sauces to be served with this steak (unfortunately that is not free).   Haricot Verts, $10 prior to tax- I requested to have these green beans steamed. Normally this would be served with a buttery sauce. I thought these green beans were cooked perfectly. It was nice to be able to taste the natural sweetness and tenderness of the vegetables.   -------------------------- (Total= $150 after tax and tip)  This was quite a special meal for us to celebrate Christmas. Our server in general was friendly. But was not quite as attentive, but that seems to be the norm for steak houses (so that isn't what caused me to deduct stars on this rating).   We were disappointed with my husband's entree not coming with a side dish, also disappointed that his steak was cooked a little more than he had requested. We were also disappointed with the bread they served (thank goodness it was free at least because we have been to a steakhouse that served bread for a $5 charge and it wasn't even good). Another thing that did annoy my husband was that there is no restroom inside this restaurant. And so you have to use the restaurant in the casino (a short walk, but you still have to leave the restaurant to use it). And lastly, the crab cake we ordered as an appetizer was not worth it. Overall. this place is worth a solid 3.5 stars.  The couple next to our table did order the bread pudding and it truly looked amazing but we were too full to make an order. If you do come here, I would recommend you consider making room for this dessert.   By the way, this restaurant will validate your parking ticket for 3 hours. (Parking is not free at the Golden Nugget unfortunately but with validation and for hotel guest only it is free).

zVCSMQkTD8ZNf9SsMVUGBw.text: Vic and Anthony's is a downtown gem. Tucked in the Golden Nugget with a dark and cozy atmosphere, prime steaks and an excellent wine list are on offer. Ingredients are top notch, servers are professionals and there is great excellent attention to details, like the always hot/soft bread and whipped butter. The small but lively bar is a pretty good spot to watch a game and devour some meat.

Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dark cozy atmosphere

_H_mfKlLR7ZJDmmlDkz3NQ.text: Pros and Cons to this place. We wanted to go to a vintage Vegas steakhouse and picked this one. The look is great..very dark, cool pictures.  Our server was great. Fantastic food too. However, given the prices,  I expected a more upscale place. Jackets for men are requested but not required per their website so I figured it would be a nice fine dining experience. But not even close. People in jeans and tshirts. One left his cowboy hat on (rodeo was in town). But the most annoying part was the larger table in the corner hootin and hollerin, forcing everyone in the place to yell to be heard. Meanwhile the manager and some servers were busy chatting up some couple, I assume friends or something, and didn't pay attention to anything else. Yeah, I know I sound old and crotchety but come on people. Have some class. So basically good food but you're not going to get that fine dining experience you might assume or be looking for. Maybe stick to the 'new' strip.

Nep0kbio7nKnyOgC7dzNdQ.text: There's something special about steakhouse's located in Downtown Las Vegas. My husband and I came here for a romantic date night. We'd heard so much about the service and food and the restaurant lived up to the hype!   FOOD & DRINKS: We had the Bone Marrow w/ bruschetta, which is a phenomenal dish. However, it is heavy. I was only about to eat about half the bone marrow before I was ready to move on to something lighter. My two favorite dishes was the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake and Steak tartare, which was both the best I've ever had! I would come back to just eat both dishes all day. The crab cake was juicy, meaty and the sauce really made it a well-rounded appetizer. The steak tartare was unique and different. The rare steak went well with the chips and whole grain mustard. It's served on top of a Himalayan Salt Block too! The steak was tasty and cooked well.   SERVICE: Excellent service, but they did seat us near the entrance so it was a little noisy and we were hit a few times by the traffic coming in and out of the entrance.   AMBIANCE: Typical steakhouse that is dark and busy with a lot of fun conversations happening around us, which I absolutely love!  PRICE: Great value for what we received. The dishes were unique, the presentation was pretty and the service was great.   Overall, I give this place a 4 out of 5. I would definitely come back again. :-)   Happy DIning,   J Tran

AcNJ_N1_0t8g16qsiwKcbA.text: Food is amazing which is the only reason for the 3 stars BUT please have someone speak to Hazel. I was very disappointed and uncomfortable around her. I couldn't help but notice how bad her attitude was! I felt like she did not want to help me and that she probably just didn't want to be at work. I have spoken to a couple of my friends about their experience and they pretty much had a similar vibe with her. This makes me not want to return. Management needs to have a talk with her.

d2lDQ9GOqGJNEwlxZFUHOA.text: 1st timers, suggested by friends.  Food was excellent!!!!  Give service 2 stars due to was hardly around , but food was excellent.  kind of dark, couldn't see the menu,  had to use our cell phones to see the menu.   also it was a good thing that we sat near the window. a little pricey for a party of four.

dm4BNHOpo5nMPWT6xptWQg.text: The atmosphere is great. Old school Vegas vibe. The service was really good, very attentive and friendly. The sides were pretty good. The pureed potatoes were on point. The asparagus were the size of small trees (not my preference). But here's where the 3 star review comes into play... the steak. I mean it's a steakhouse. A $50 steak should taste, well amazing. Unfortunately it didn't. I ordered the 16 oz prime ribeye. I've had better steaks at the Texas Roadhouse. Not only was it improperly seasoned (under seasoned) it was overly charred and fairly tough. Definitely not a $50 steak. More like a $12.99 steak at best. Hopefully I'm in the minority but my experience fell short of s 4.5 star rated steakhouse in Vegas.

PgqZty97lw-z6unAKw_7vg.text: I love, love, LOVE this restaurant! It's the second time we've been here (first time was last year), and so now it's kind-of a tradition for celebrating the completion of our annual Fantasy Football draft. Plus, this year we stayed at the Golden Nugget, so it was sooooo convenient not having to leave the hotel to get to a quality steak dinner.  Tip 1: Make reservations, if you can. Really helps, especially if you have a larger group (we had 7ppl).  Tip 2: If you're not already, become a member of Landry's Select Club, since Vic & Anthony's is part of that (along with Claimjumper and Chart House, among others). You score point and earn rewards, which is cool.  Tip 3: Check the Landry's website for deals, because they can worth a lot and just awesome. Case in point: 6 of the 7 of us used the "Distinctive Dining Deal" they were running...a 3-course meal for only $52. Seriously, only $52. First course was lobster bisque or caesar salad; second course was protein (8oz filet mignon, salmon, or shrimp scampi) and side (broccoli, onion strings, au grain potatoes, or cream corn), and dessert (creme brulee, chocolate mousse cake, or croissant bread pudding). And let me tell y'all, the portions were not scaled down...they were the full, real deal.  I started with the lobster bisque, which was flavorful and chock-full of lobster. Sooooo delicious. For the second round, I went with the shrimp scampi, which consisted of 6 large shrimp with lemon and a bit of bite from the seasoning. I picked the onion strings as my side, but between 6 of us ordering a huge side each, we all shared all four sides, and each was fantastic. Lastly, 4 of us had the chocolate mousse cake, and 2 had the croissant bread pudding. We were all so full from the amount of food we already had, none of us finished our dessert, but gave it the ol' college try.  Our server was great, and we had absolutely no issues with anything. Food came out in perfect order at the perfect temperature. The drinks were kept refilled at all times, and the bar orders came out quickly and flavorful (not watered down, decent size).  Give this great steakhouse a try, folks! I know we love it, and we'll be back :)

mg7-TdxF4Khvw4wHPFvnFw.text: I am giving this a 2 star; as our Waiter Jay took our cocktail order I asked that he go ahead and put in an order for seafood tower as we were still looking over menu. He said that he would be back to take our order all at once. I replied please go ahead and order the seafood tower we would like to start on appetizer first. He displayed a bit of attitude that I did not appreciate and felt he rushed us on our order on his return. Later through the night he apologized how  he handled situation.  I also asked how comp food vs tipping is handled. He replied I don't know, it seemed more like he did not care. I discussed this with Casino Host Winnie about the situation.   How I am treated really makes or breaks the comfort and experience of a restaurant. We are a party of 5.

Or__vWSa9yPOC1j8MvO5RQ.text: First time in this restaurant inside the Golden Nugget at Vegas. Great ambiance and excellent service. We ordered a delicious crab cake as appetizer. I order the special of the day which was a lobster tail and an 8 oz rib eye. The meat just melted in my mouth. My husband order a steak that was also very good. Our side dishes were fry potatoes and asparagus. We ended our night with a delicious creme brulee. We recommend this restaurant

MCiPzgYJvxCfS_-hnw8Mzg.text: Excellent.  Great service.  Filet and crabcake were very good.  Au Gratin potatoes were done really well.  Brussels were good.  Drinks were strong.

guETEYNgtdnwCTCfbXaYdQ.text: If I could rate higher than a 5 I would. We visit this Steakhouse every time we are in Vegas. It is a must. I keep thinking, there is no way the steak could have been as good as I remember. Then I take my first taste and it is even better. I had the 8 ounce fillet. It simply melts in your mouth. The seasoning is wonderful. Sides are served family style, so I recommend sharing. However, even knowing this, my husband and I always order two. We figure it will be awhile before we get here again. The asparagus is decadent. We tried it grilled this time. It had a lovely balsamic reduction, which was fantastic. The au gratin potatoes were also delicious. The sommelier found a wonderful red which was available by the glass, since I only wanted one glass this evening. Service was also incredibly friendly. We recommend this steakhouse to everyone who we know visiting Vegas. Please check it out, you will not be disappointed.

LAB-fTlaAjcy7fMkM7ATBg.text: We had a great time- only reasons we did not give 5 stars were: way to cramped seating, my husbands chair was bumped into at least 4 times before he got up and physically  moved the table, our waiter was awesome, the host was awesome and even ran into my husbands chair and stopped immediately and apologized but there was another waiter who repeatedly bumped his chair and never once said a word.  The sommelier's recommendation was fantastic and is a bottle we plan to drink again.  My steak was a bit over cooked and yes I should have sent it back but the majority was cooked fine and great flavor but last quarter not so much. Huge portions and nice selection, crab cake fresh and large but just so you know it is ONE cake. Presentation outstanding and desserts looked amazing we did not have one bit of room left!  Totally worth the trip for a very special dinner!
