VPYXJUPipqpjCc5Bs68fjA.text: Old school steakhouse, great servers! Had some tasty steaks. Had a tasty Basil Hayden old fashioned. Nice experience overall.  Go watch the fish in the tank by the pool.

s-bK56nyES6EpXuG3WlqwA.text: Friendly staff (check) Awesome food (check) Great service (check) Tasty drinks (check) The vibe here is amazing and soothing at the same time!  I can definitely get used to this Vegas lifestyle! Awesome steakhouse. Muchas Gracias Vic and Anthony's

J-F-v284LW_T-npvBJMmEA.text: By far the best kept secret in Las Vegas. If you want the best experience, sit at the bar and watch Noah's magic

sfTaWaDs2pXRL70rmL8oNg.text: I wasn't impressed. In fact, I wish we would've followed my instinct to just go back to N9NE.   We started out with Caesar salads. They were good.  I ordered the Chefs Special; an 8 oz filet and lobster with pureed potatoes. Not sure they know how to. cook a steak medium well vice medium. I asked for my filet to be cooked medium well. It came out medium. Our server then proceeded to take the steak off my plate so that they could cook it to medium well. When it came back out it was significantly charred on the outside, and still medium on the inside - unbelievable.  The lobster was delicious. It was served atop a garlic butter sauce. This was the perfect accompaniment. The pureed potatoes were too salty to eat.  My mate ordered the ribeye. From my understanding it was just "alright".   We also ordered the scalloped potatoes. They were good but very rich.   The manager comped my filet and offered to have something else made for me, but I politely declined.   We thought we'd pay our bill and then hit the strip, but suddenly a ginormous piece of red velvet cake and two mini cakes aside it came to our table. We were informed that the cake was made in house. We were doubtful of this as it was ice cold and appeared to be store bought. It was okay nevertheless.  Will I return? No. There are too many far better steakhouses in Las Vegas.  5 stars for the service. 2.5 stars for the food. My total rating for Vic & Anthony's is 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chefs Special - 8 oz filet and lobster
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Red Velvet Cake

0M7n_UensbJ6R6uZmtTiWg.text: Absolutely Phenomenal!!!! The Food and service was off the charts!!! Our server Mike was fantastic!!! I highly recommend this Restaurant!!! Go Hungry!!!

xR_-_UFIGUUr52GlMkbo8w.text: An "old school" looking restaurant with a great ambiance. My lady and I had dinner there for our anniversary.  A fabulous choice.  Not only is it decorated fabulously vintage black and white pics of Vegas and old stars, but the dimmed lighting, leather seats and impeccably dressed wait staff provided for a classy and romantic evening.  The wait staff was the exceptional. Our waiter was friendly and professional, and never over bearing with his attention. The Crab cake was quite sizable and full of large lumps of crab. The rib eye steak was cooked perfectly to order, medium rare. And the salmon was moist and not overly cooked.

wGXNEGHCsJDcaOhqfQjrKQ.text: Ate there Wednesday at 6pm . I had the Fillet which was cooked as ordered but did not taste as expected. It was burnt around edges and tough. Very disappointed in flavor. The chocolate desert  tasted more like coffee. Place is very nice but overpriced. Service was good. I was sick for next 18 hrs after eating there.

zvPQUAyP0vaO9n_motIjRg.text: This place was fantastic. What a wonderful place for a steak in Downtown Vegas. I ordered the Ribeye and it was cooked to perfection. My wife ordered the lobster and was not as pleased. I'm not sure what it was, but maybe $100 should have brought something a bit better. The butter was terrible and after making a request for some different kind, it wasn't much better. My wife chose not to continue to complain about it though despite management's offer to make it right. We didn't  see the point in waiting for another lobster tail when it would most likely taste the same. Once again the steak was amazing though and the service was very good as well. Perhaps, we will go back, but will definitely skip the lobster tail!

8VsORVtadM51fenK5xNyEQ.text: This is my favorite steakhouse. The meats are always great and the service is really good. Love the prime rib. Can say I have never had a bad meal here.

9VBxWM23Ew8pKZnmvDyDaQ.text: Old style steakhouse- like going back in time with the decor and the waiters. Found a special on website for a complete 4 course dinner for about $53 a person. Started with a delicious lobster bisque. Followed by a great filet steak, accompanied by scalloped potatoes and cream corn.dinner ended with 2 great desserts. Extensive wine list - went with argyle- with a huge mark-up. Fun time and would recommend this place to anyone!

v2udHnqCVEveVrZw9KWfRA.text: While on vacation and starving! The wife and I decided to checkout this place and we were very impressed! Being in Vegas and hearing Frank Sinatra playing majority of the time was awesome. The ambiance of this location was beyond expectations and definitely worth it! The lobster Mac & cheese was by far the best part of the meal. Definitely will come back to this location.

rtvYUHCUv0IkwPCTmVWCVQ.text: I go here once a year. I often bring new people to try it as well. It's interior is dark wood with dark red drapes and it's dimly lit. I can picture Frank Sinatra sitting in a corner booth, smoking cigars and sipping a glass of scotch here. I love the feel of the place and it doesn't hurt that I've never had better service in my life.   We have easily eaten every appetiser they have on the menu. All good. I've had a few steaks on the menu, all of which were incredible, but my personal favourite is the veal chop. It is so mouth wateringly delicious and getting sweat on my brow typing about it. They have a great wine selection as well and out waiters have always been good at helping with the pairings.  I will go here for as long as I go to Las Vegas.

HMr_iLIvCsU7hWGfQ8-uVA.text: Try the 3 course dinner for $52.  It is the best deal in town!  Delicious food, great atmosphere and service.  My husband and I enjoyed a Christmas Eve dinner here and were delighted.  The croissant bread pudding was amazing!  Love this place :)

ZAsLmgKoiTi_cGt5995Ljw.text: We travel to Las Vegas about four times per year, and we love the dining adventures. Vic and Anthony's is an amazing experience. Start at the bar with Noah and the gang. This place provides excellent food, whether you want appetizers or a complete dinner. Thank you to all....

8wcjyvqWlfm5hhPCMiU2NA.text: Victor our waiter was great and the food was fantastic. Great place for a wonderful meal with a beautiful woman..... Highly recommended.

8YDX8Fq_z6JSXOTM0bQTiQ.text: All i can say is WOW! This Place in old Vegas is incredible. I got the filet...perfect. The service is outstanding. Little pricey...but hey, you are in vegas! Rat pack feel. Dim and 40s music playing. Definitely one of the best steak houses I've ever eaten out.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

A7VP_CM5qoOBGDGhBIM1gg.text: Chef Gary brings an inspired touch to a great steak dinner.  The quail appetizer was tasty with a nice sauce offering a little bite.  The thick sliced bacon appetizer is almost like a desert.  Call for reservations.  He will keep this Resturant full.  If you don't make reservations, you can enjoy a classic cocktail while you wait.  We had a great time - food, atmosphere, bartender, waiter plus James who seated us could not have been more accommodating.

USEr1EUTtWov4NooxkQtEQ.text: Excellent deal and meal had by all. Had my 47th birthday meal here with two of my boys. Had reservations for 7:30pm and moved it to 9pm with no trouble. Had the Distinctive Dinning Deal, three course meal and a side for $49.99. Had the wedge salad, 8oz. Filet mignon, green bean, and chocolate mousse cake. Was great! Highly recommend this steakhouse and that V&A, keep this deal. It brought me in and I'd use it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great meal and cost
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kLDtzEUF39ua5ndLUabaXg.text: Get to Vegas about 1-2 times per year and will typically do a steak dinner one of those nights and with so many places to choose from often am eager to try new places.  VIc and Anthony's reviews made it sound like a must try and it certainly did not disappoint.   1. Service - fantastic and very helpful and knowledgeable their wine list was extensive so this helped narrow the choices to type and profile we were looking for   2.  Food - best Filet I have ever had.  So tender almost felt I could of just cut it with my fork.  There was a special that night filet and Lobster tail which was also fantastic.   We also split a wedge and an order of oysters Rockefeller both were on point the wedge used Roquefort dressing and it was phenomenal   Been to many great steakhouses around the country Vic and Anthony's is among the best experiences I have had

4C1IqKXkLNJmeV0TvlyReg.text: MOUTH WATERING!!! Sat at the bar had two sides ....mash pots and asparagus with a massive Rib Eye that so coulda been split for two...great service ....perfectly cooked...I may go again but if I really wanted a mean steak I'd go to Charlie Palmer at Four Seasons

a1awpAU8itGvk-uORu2F9Q.text: My favorite hidden gem in Las Vegas for a great steak! Classic wooden decor. Lump crab cake is a must and steak there is good u can't go wrong!

FxRrhvGBNBFdhoNTzwjImA.text: To. Die. For.   This is my absolute favorite place to eat in Vegas and really, everywhere else. A perfect gem in the otherwise wacky Fremont Street area. Exceptional service, gorgeous atmosphere and beyond excellent food every single time. Pretty pricey, but not as expensive as lots of other fancy steakhouses that aren't as good and this place is worth every penny. Everything I've had here has been beyond delicious, but my favorite things to order are the filet mignon (it doesn't need it, but the blue cheese bacon butter is a delicious addition!), the potatoes au gratin, the wild mushrooms, and the bread pudding! While you're there you can't help but think that meals and dining experiences should always be this perfect.

6iIsdgNZnglDD4i2wzll5g.text: Everything about my experience at Vic and Anthony's was perfect; the drinks, service and especially the food! All around a great experience and worth every dollar. I will definitely be coming back here again.

lQiE_T99vl-yqisj8zzqAA.text: There are some experiences in life you have to live at least once, and dinner at Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse is definitely one of them.   I've had the privilege of coming here for a third time; two previously with my fave uncle, and this time with my husband, my cousin, and her husband. We sat at a table tucked in a balcony area, where our server, Ben, gave us superb service as he provided us with dinner specials, suggestions for drink pairings, a little bit of history, and entertaining jokes throughout our evening.   The four of us shared a bottle of Pinot Noir that Ben recommended. We followed this delicious and smooth wine with individual cocktails, I had the Spiced Pear Martini, which might not have been the best choice to pair with my filet and lobster tail, but it hit a great spot my taste buds were desiring.   We shared a calamari appetizer that was mixed with shishito peppers. The plate was just right for the four of us, especially since two of us aren't big fans of this particular seafood.   For our second course, we chose different salads. I enjoyed the heirloom tomato penzanella, which seemed to be a variation of caprese. It was rich, light, and scrumptious. Around the rest of the table were Caesar salaf and Spinach salad.   The main course consisted of two specials of 8oz filet and I think 12oz lobster tails with fingerling potatoes and sauteed mushrooms (yellowfoot, bluefoot...and one other that I can't recall at the moment, mostly because I have them to my man to enjoy since he is the only fun-guy I like! lol). The other two plates were filled with porter house ribeyes that my cousin and my husband savored until they couldn't eat anymore. Yes, leftover meat taken back to the room and chewed up for breakfast.   Our additional sides were au gratin potatoes, roasted Brussels sprouts, asparagus, and in house made creamed corn. We covered the table with our feast, everything set in a wonderful presentation, flavored amazingly, and eaten with great delight.   Ben paid attention when we mentioned we were there to celebrate my cousin and her husband's wedding anniversary, and he generously brought out a creme brulee with a candle. It was just the right amount of sweet for four spoons that filled us to our limit.   It was a fabulous evening of food, conversation, service and overall memory making that the four of us will get to share and enjoy the rest of our days.

BREsMOJhsBs0n-1HM7dJug.text: A wonderful Steakhouse-Experience. Classical, dark-wood ambiance - awesome staff and the food was fantastic. We went there and had a Three-Course-Distinctive-Dinging-Menu. Its only 52$ - which makes it one of the best bargains in Las Vegas you can get! You have to print out a coupon which is avalible on the Golden Nugget website.

MshgQR33tPginU2T8D65lg.text: If you've ever eaten at an upscale restaurant on the strip, you probably have had the experience of feeling like you're in a fishbowl with everyone staring at you & judging how you're dressed. I know I have.   What I really liked about dining at Vic & Anthonys, apart from the food (which was fabulous, more on this in a minute) was that I didn't get that "fishbowl feeling."  Not once. And the service was just as good as any of the five-star dining experiences on the strip. There were waiters, bussers, and servers filling your cup at every turn, never intrusive, always on the ball. I was impressed.   The ambiance is old-school Vegas steakhouse, with old black & white photographs of celebrities gracing the walls, dark wood, wrought iron details, and lighting which made it cozy but not so dark that you couldnt read your menu (dont you hate that?)  We ordered the lobster bisque with cognac - some of the best bisque Ive ever had - and the quail for an appetizer. Id never tried quail before, it was tender, juicy, and the skin was crisped perfectly. My mouth is watering now just thinking about it!  I ordered the stuffed salmon in an attempt to eat (somewhat) healthfully. Salmon can be iffy, but I figured this place got a 4.5 stars, its bound to be good. I was mot disappointed. Wow, was it good! Lots of capers, just the right amount of sauce, i savored every bite. Surprisingly, the mashed potatoes were some of the best Ive ever had at a restaurant. My hubby was sneaking bites of them off my plate!  He ordered the special, a snapper dish that he also enjoyed immensely.   Then we shared the vanilla bean creme brulee, which was big enough for two and also some of the best creme brulee ive ever had.   Thats three items that were the top of the list for me, EVER. Id say that makes this place a 5+ stars.   A few side notes: there seemed to be a lot of men dining here with other men. I think the ambiance made them feel more comfortable (back to the goldfish bowl thing again).  Also, it WAS pricey. Most of the entrees were in the $40- $50 range. A few were lower, like the chicken and salmon. The alcohol was pricey too, the low end was $15 per glass. You're not going to get away with less than $100 for two. More like $200. But well worth it for a special occasion.   Hubby said he'd love to make this his go-to place for special occasions. I wholeheartedly agree.  Kudos to the Golden Nugget. I really enjoyed dining here and will certainly do so again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsters death row

0jO9-1SpNvD9ak7z8qVziQ.text: Visiting from out of town and my wife recommended Vic & Anthony's. We both had fillets and were cooked perfectly. We picked from the Distinctive Dinner menu. Look at the website or ask the waitress for details. Its a very good deal for $52. You choose a starter, entree, side and dessert. Menu is limited, but great choice if it fits your appetite. I recommend V&A and look forward to coming back.

WPDg4Jag6eTw9A0I3YhRmQ.text: I won't lie, I was not expecting much from a steakhouse inside the Golden Nugget. It was only due booking a hotel for a last minute trade show that we found ourselves at this hotel and had no other choice for dinner as all other reservations in the city were completely filled. But I am happy to say Vic and Anthony's became the shining, mouth-watering, reputation boosting, savior of my entire stay.  I've had Morton's, Mastro's, and Ruth Chris, and honestly on more than one of my visits to these places, I've had to send my steak back due to it being overcooked or undercooked, and once received the most horrid service.  The 21oz bone in rib eye was nothing less than DIVINE. And standing at 5'1" 105 lbs, I ate every single last bite of it, down to scraping off the bone.   Every single bite was so tender, juicy, and full of flavor and as consistent as it could be throughout. I've found in other rib eyes, the outer rim of the steak was always much more well done than the center. Our waiter was so helpful and suggested that we order the steak rare, since the plate is very hot and it will continue to cook at the table. I am so thankful we did this as my steak was a consistent medium rare throughout the entire meal.   We shared a crabcake for an appetizer, and all I have to say is you MUST get this. I was worried about it being too heavy before our entrees but there is very little breading, so it was more crab than cake, which worked wonderfully.  We were a party of 3 and ordered a side of broccoli (which comes out in 3 GIANT florets, simply cooked) and a side of the duck fat potatoes. The duck fat potatoes were fingerling potatoes soaked in a confit, and i simply must order anything and everything with the word "confit". However, these were a bit underwhelming. Definitely delicious but they actually just tasted like breakfast potatoes. Which felt out of place with everything else we were eating.  We also ordered a side of bearnaise and peppercorn sauce for our steaks. I ended up not using either as I thought the steak was perfectly delicious on its own.  I guess I'll be coming back to the Golden Nugget after all.

CCkAAYzuewKcvrFb2XyI1g.text: This is my second time to Vic & Anthonys and i was really impressed with both the service and the food on my first visit a couple of years ago but a couple of things on this visit was not quite up there at the "Vic & Anthony Standard". I started with the Tuna tartare with citrus vinaigrette and chips. The tuna was really fresh and high quality and with the classic company of avocado and the crispy chips it was a great start. My company had the scallops with appleslaw/bacon and a tabascovinaigrette. This was even better then mine and the combination of perfectly seared scallops and the appleslaw together with the spicyness of the tabascovinaigrette was awesome!   For a maincourse i took the medium file that was juicy and good pared with a peppercorn sauce that was ok but nothing special. Me and my company shared a side of mashed potatoes and this was the big dissapointment. I prefer my mash silky smooth like for example at the Boa Steakhouse in L.A or the now closed Dakota Steakhouse but this mash was full of lumps and the potatoes had its skin left. I know that some people think lumpy mash has this good old home feeling but that aside the mash lacked any flavor. So this was a real downside.   I rounded of the dinner with a classic creme brulee with berrys wich was good but nothing i will remember. My companys chocolate cake was a step up and she was really happy with it.   If the steaks and vibe of the place is worth a 4 there something more then the bad mash wich brings the points down. The service was not close to the service i remembered from my first visit. Our waiter made us feel rushed and felt a bit annoyed by the fact that we wanted to eat the appetizer before deciding on our main dishes. Whats the problem?   So for us the appetizers wich should not be missed gets 4,5 , the steaks gets 4, the sides and the service gets 2. All and all a solid 3 pointer. Would go back but hopefully get a better waiter. And skip the mash and try the gratin or potatoes lyonaise instead.

y-gGfDIYNkIH0C6BLsj6TQ.text: I love this resturant, I wish I could afford to eat here more often. Our favorite waiter Ben was off so we had Patrick taking care of us. Everyone that work at this resturant is so freindly, we really enjoy the atmosphere here. Those darn crab cakes are so delicious. The bartender always make drinks really strong.

w7GqW-yYwCL1DHfvHW6Jyw.text: Okay I want to start off by saying that Vic and Anthony's is literally my favorite restaurant EVER. It is SO SO SO good - and I've never even had their steak.   I had a wedge salad, crab cake and lobster bisque. Holy cow, it was amazing. We had an awesome server, and the place is so classy and nice.   I've spent the last year dreaming about that crab cake, btw. UGH. The next time I come to Vegas I promise you the first thing I do will be getting one of those crab cakes!

QbHN8OECwf295WcUDKn5kw.text: I am often in Vegas and have had many great meals.  Vic' s took it over the top though.  The meal was phenomenal. Our waiter, Miguel was attentive and helpful.  I am skeptical of warm water fresh oysters but he encouraged me to try the Baja oysters and they were wonderful.  The Ahi tuna was perfectly seared. One of our guests raved about the steak tarare. This meal was truly memorable.

qR6BqpwWVDAkawBTfnrmTA.text: I went there last night with my wife. I ordered a Filet medium and it taste real bad. To soft and no taste. Never recommend that.

KRe9FJJXW4gHg9Oblzcamw.text: Very Good.  The Steaks are Cooked with perfection. I have been 3 times and the Service was just OK until I had the Server with the Handle Bar Mustache now he was what I want in a server at a establishment such as Vic & Anthony's    Desert to get is the Bread Pudding but ask for more Ice Cream... it's needed. The Cheesecake is a Large Portion and can be shared.  I tried the special of Lobster and Pasta.... NOPE  didn't work for me... taste like Mac & Cheese with some Lobster in it...  I hated every Side Dish except the Baked Potato   & Risotto    I will go back again & again when in Vegas.

K_Vorgahx6T943FKc2qzsg.text: This place is seriously amazing. 5+++ stars with a silver lining that shines.  I made reservations here for a pre-birthday dinner after seeing some of the reviews on yelp & taking in different factors (price, food variety, wine list.) Seriously did not disappoint & the food lived up to the hype. Quite possibly one of the top 2 most delicious filet mignons I've ever had in my life - and I have had my fair share, it's usually my go-to.   Reservations were for 4, and I decided to have their prix-fix which included lobster bisque, filet mignon, creamed spinach & creme brulee all for $50. The filet alone was worth $50 and everything else was delicious too... I actually gave my meat an applause & saluted the last piece before I ate it. If a vegetarian would have tried it, I'm sure they would have been happy that the animal turned into a fine mouthwatering morsel. Life changing it was.  Other food at the table included an oyster platter, where the oysters were very big but our oyster expert friend was amazed at how good they were for being so big (I don't eat them.) A wedge salad that looked big & satisfying, a large cheese & meat plate that our friends mostly wrapped up to eat later. My dinner date had some chocolate cake souffle thing and I - who doesn't care a whole lot for chocolate - would really like to eat it again.   If you love wine - they have an amazing wine list as well. I only had a Malbec & a sparkling wine but I could have moved into their wine cellar.   Ambiance was great, staff was pleasant & attentive, the only thing I could possibly think of that I didn't like was the restrooms were out in the casino. But I'll gladly walk 10 times for the food here, especially with great service at a decent price.  Everyone in our group loved it & will definitely be going back!

O4ReERGtQZS11urgzAY__w.text: This was our best meal in Vegas.  Service from Shaun was fantastic.  He was friendly, knowledgeable, and served us at just the right pace.  We even got to meet the Chef to tell him how great the meal was.  Wedge salad was beautiful and delicious, but the star of the show was the lobster tail.  It was more than enough for two of us to share and was cooked absolutely perfectly.  I don't remember having better lobster anywhere.  We also loved the au gratin potatoes-rich, cheesy, and delicious.  The old school vibe brought me back to what I imagine it was like in the old days of Vegas.  Very relaxing.  Vic and Anthony's knocked it out of the park!  Fantastic experience from beginning to end.  We will definitely return on our next trip.

zFhowbwpitkTuG6Dl60COA.text: This has slowly escalated to be my favorite steakhouse in America, and I've been to them all. What I also love about this V&A's is the consistency of quality through the years. I've been to other steak houses that were hit or miss, but not here!  Best damn crab cake outside of the North East. True lumpy crab meat, not all shredded up and mixed with fillers.  Great oysters rockefeller.  Insane scallops and grits with tobacco vinaigrette!  An australian lobster tail that probably can feed 3.  And how do you add to the creaminess of ice cream? By adding foie gras! So they did. It sounds crazy, but very good! We walked out of here 5 pounds heavier, with smiles on our faces.

FZjv-QELa5ST7dPoaRmewA.text: Oh so fabulous!!!!  Best steakhouse we have ever been to.  The filet steak and fish are out of this world!  Best au gratin potatoes loaded with cheese.  Friendly servers!  Love the music as well.  Have been here 3 times and will always return.  The desserts are also amazing!

AWcJoouiouCqWsNTLHcDIg.text: I think after reading the reviews from everyone we had really really high expectations and few were met. This place is good but nothing to run home and tell my mom about.   Pros: Server was kind, food was served quickly, steak was cooked as we asked, proportions were large, drinks were strong, dessert was comped because we were celebrating our anniversary, water glasses were always promptly refilled  Cons: We were NEVER addressed by our last names although we had a reservation, tons of people were wearing shorts and flip flops, we were never offered bottled water (automatically served tap), not the best steak we've ever had :(  For appetizers we ordered the crab cake, one large cake with a butter sauce that is richer than Bill Gates and the oysters Rockefeller, good but was just an oyster with spinach, bread crumbs and cheese. Entrees were both steak, better than most places but nowhere near the best. For sides we had the au gratin potatoes which needed more potatoes for all the cheese and creamed spinach which was a bowl of the same stuff on top of our oysters Rockefeller. Dessert was pretty darn good though. Croissant bread pudding was the highlight of our meal.  Bottom line is that the place is good but not great, I say check out the band in the lounge area....they are awesome!!! Prime in the Bellagio and Anthonys in The M Resort are still my top two steaks in Vegas!

_pweXr9aE53uqw7RDYAYRA.text: Lovely, old school vibe. The lobster bisque and filet mignon are good. The mac and cheese was beyond salty.   Great service.

tOZRQ3itegBdx88WSBj2vA.text: My husband and I were looking for a classy restaurant with a great steak dinner so we chose to try out this place. The hostess and the waiter were very polite and attentive. I ordered the filet mignon 8 oz steak and my husband ordered the rib eye. We also ordered asparagus and the pear and saga salad. The salad was great, my husbands ribeye was very tender but my filet mignon was way too dry, and lacked flavor. The asparagus lacked flavor as well. The ambience was nice for about 25 minutes, then the restaurant became really loud, to where I couldn't even hear what my husband was telling me and we were sitting next to one another. Maybe I went on the wrong night, not sure. But I probably won't be going again.

dqlpETjL8i4EKUvxZChsxQ.text: We ate here Monday June 7th.  My wife had the lobster bisque which was good (A-)and the spinich salad, also good (B+).  I had the bone in filet, which was very tender, I'd guess 14oz as advertised but really tasteless. After two bites and a conversation with our waiter, I was compelled to order a sauce to add some taste.  It helped but I was charged the three bucks for the sauce -which I thought odd under the circumstances. Additionally this steak was $67.00!  Now I try to never let the price of a meal affect my opinion but I must admit it may have this time.  Steak gets a shaky C.  As a a side we had the chips and strings and they were OK but pale in comparison to The Palms version. (B-).  The hostess greeting was OK, if a bit lackluster but we found it odd that a couple who checked in right behind us without a reservation were seated ahead of us (we had reservations). Give her a C.  Our waiter was competent but offered little help in menu discussion, showed no personality and seemed to be doing little other than going through the motions. Another C.  Landry's and The Golden Nugget need much more from this place if they want to compete with the strip.  Our meal at Andiamo (at the D) was far superior in every way.

V50bb6nT2L1zWh6yP6D0qg.text: Was there last night and Got the oysters as app with the tomato salad.  Oysters were awesome.   Salad was just ok.  Split Australian lobster and the 60 oz tomahawk steak for the table.  Perfect.  Augratin potatoes were to die for!!!  Service was adequate.  Server was attentive but not overly friendly.  Drinks were good. Bit pricey but that what you pay at a steakhouse! Very good!

fA0NuFTQguV-q7czidHV0Q.text: Let me start by saying it was simply outstanding.  The ambiance was first rate, as was the food and service.  I frequent a lot of steak restaurants,  up this is now on my short list of favorites.  Our steaks were perfect and most delicious, the side dishes were large and delicious and desert was delicious.  Prices were perfectly typical for a fine quality steak restaurant, so no complaints there...I felt it was a good value.  The real standout, as funny as this may sound, was the creamed spinach...wow...really.  There are a few other very good steak restaurants downtown, but I might say the Golden Nugget may have an edge because IMHO it is the nicest downtown property.

pyXckA0MMJxEKLZZPZijaQ.text: Went here to celebrate the bf's birthday a few nights ago and it didn't disappoint in any way.  The restaurant is gorgeous, with a classic old time ambience.  We had the Alaskan king crab legs and rib eye with a huge baked potato and asparagus, both large enough for two big eaters!  The server and wait staff are wonderful without being overly attentive.  We'll be back!!!!!

yBTeZ7rd-UMsJTwI7qHhsA.text: Not the best steakhouse meal I've had, but far from the worst.   We started with cocktails. I wanted a vermouth - they didn't have the very specific one I was looking for but they gave me a short pour of a really perfect replacement on the house. My partner and I both ordered steak, he started with the roasted bacon and I ordered the bisque.   The bacon was just absolutely sublime, but the portion was far too large. It was a full 8oz of bacon, people. In two rashers. They were enormous. But the fat rendered perfectly, and they really were delicious. The bisque was standard steakhouse lobster bisque - good, but nothing lifechanging, which is fine.  My steak was cooked perfectly, but there just was something...not great about it. It was a bit chewy, and required a bearnaise. Last year when I was in Vegas I went to Cut and had the steak I compare all steaks to, and this one didn't meet that standard.   We ordered coffees, and split. I didn't see the bill.  The place was convenient (right in the hotel!), the service was phenomenal, and the food was about what I'd expect. Not a bad choice, and probably the best choice on Fremont street (unless you're in the mood for chicken in which case go to Chart House).

rHx-D0LEPCMk5kjB_oGNtw.text: My wife and I had dinner at Vic and Anthony's on Tuesday 11-18-14.  We both had the New York cut Steaks,  They were very good with much flavor to them.  Small suggestion.......trim a little more fat off of the edges.  Price was reasonable for what you get.  The deserts were very good to great.  Wait staff was excellent.  The tables are a little to close (the size of the restaurant is small) Overall, less expensive then Ramsey's Steakhouse at the Paris or Delmonico's at the Venetian but also not quite as good overall.

TIp9QvOr4SMM9PM5Jzgcfg.text: All the food was full of flavor...  Cream corn is the shit...  The risotto kicks ass...  The porterhouse was on point... Service was 10stars...

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse baby
Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar

7yKvIuQKZWwzfBqZgVa_pA.text: This place is very dark and looks quite old. The service is very professional, but behaves unfriendly and got very angry at us for deciding our order a little bit slower than normal. The waiter was very rude and pushy. The kitchen is just fine. Their filet mignon is good, and the prime ribeye was just fine. Both of them were a little bit undercooked. I asked for medium, and they were medium-rare. Their shrimp scampi and cold water Australian rock lobster tail were also just okay. Among side dishes, their wild mushrooms is good, but very buttery. The asparagus and brussels sprouts were just fine. Overall the service was so bad that I do not recommend the experience for the price.

faOnM5Tp90pV2X62rTw9Bg.text: Do yourself a favor and choose V&A among the many ..many ...many ..steakhouse choices in LV. V&A has a great neo old school vibe with it's dim lighting and Sinatra playing. The decor is rich and modern. The food is scrumptious. Just dive in with rib-eye bit make sure to cover it in the blue cheese bacon butter. Make sure you include a side of mushrooms and of course don't miss the duck fat potatoes (scalloped potatoes fried in duck with bacon and caramelized onions) ....perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TxeTpIkFEh0HudEu5ixn_g.text: Had dinner here last night ate at the bar. Jose the bartender was very accomodating although  a woman bartender also interjected. Did not get here name but she was fantastic. Had the steak and lobster with garlic mushrooms. Steak and lobster was yummy! Atomosphere was old school Vegas with Sinatra and Dean playing in the background.

VfD3JPRvxXO2C5j2VVq0-g.text: Yeah, it was very very good. Not the best high end steak (filet) I've ever eaten but close to it. Usually not a fan of over-priced steak houses.  Vic and Anthony's is top notch.

6rvGjjxJHFdcZYkVVpN7TA.text: Amazing Dinner at the Vegas location!! We made a reservation but arrived early and opted to dine at the bar. Service was fantastic, great recommendations on both food and wine. Scallops cooked perfectly, the potatoes au gratin were the best I've ever had! All that being said the steaks were still the star!! We were too full for dessert but finished with a 100 proof Irish whiskey the bartenders recommended that perfectly finished off the experience! With full bellies and hot cheeks we hit the floors to gamble.  Definitely a recommend!!

Q_tyLikAaPdcP4xi4cjzng.text: This place is so classy!! It's like old Vegas with all the modern flare! Try the lobster!!! You can see what your about to eat right when you walk in the front door!!!

gVTDpRYlpmUSviCFEwckFA.text: Amazing! You can't do better if you're crazing a steak while in Vegas. From the moment we walked in everything was perfect. Delicious ribeye cooked medium rare along with a side of potatoes and asparagus, both sides are big enough to share. Thanks to Shawn for picking out our wine and servers Luciano and John who both took great care of us on separate nights. Next time I'm in town I'll make sure to come back!

QtN27-PrRsu6YmLG9U9ujA.text: Wife and I ate here the first day we got to Vegas.  After a 6 hour flight and time spend getting to the hotel we were looking for a nice quiet dinner.  We were not disappointed.  We both thought it wouldn't be too busy on a Tuesday evening, but we were wrong.  It was about an hour to hour and a half wait, but that is on us, since we didn't make reservations.  They did take my cell phone # and would call when our table was ready.  We headed out to the casino.   I got a call after about an hour and we headed back to the restaurant.  The atmosphere is dark, quite, very nice.  We received bread and water almost immediately after we were seated.  Our waiter came over and went through the specials and menu.  We ordered the tomato and mozzarella salad for an appetizer.  I ordered the special which was a filet with three shrimp in scampi sauce, garlic mashed potatoes,and sauteed fresh vegetables.  My wife opted for the ribeye with baked potato.  We received our appetizer quickly and it had been split onto two plates which was nice.  Our steaks arrived shortly after we finished the appetizer.  Our waiter asked us to cut into them to check that they were done to our liking and they were.  The filet was melt in your mouth tender.  The veggies were a little under cooked, but I like them al dente.  The mashed potatoes had way too much garlic for my taste and I really like garlic.  My wifes steak had that nice intense beef flavor and was cooked perfectly.  The skin on her baked potato was a little tough, but inside was light and fluffy.  The service was awesome and we had a truly pleasant dining experience and were able to de-stress after traveling.

27wL4t1sUfRpq-KhF2qJyg.text: Wow!  What a meal!  I was there with 3 other guys and we totally feasted! The atmosphere inside was perfect.  It was dimly lit, great pictures on the wall, inside the Golden Nugget and just the perfect MAN CAVE.  Big goblets of wine, very attentive staff and the food was excellent.    I suggest the bone-in rib-eye...you will not be disappointed. Typing about it now makes me want to go back.  The sides are huge and enough to share so - if you have a table of four - each of you get different sides so you can try something else.  The onion straws, the sauteed mushrooms, the potatoes...all excellent!  I love this place and would go back in a heartbeat and would tell everyone to check it out!   It's totally worth it!  Plus...you're in Vegas, c'mon! Live a little!!!

Qqb4gfvXFuNIxxYQYywU5w.text: This place is outstanding. it beats my expectations everytime. Shawn Norris is an exceptional general manager and the food is out of this world.

C0uv-S_uduLaTEVM0q4qrA.text: Our waiter Dennis was excellent food was very good the croissant bread pudding was to die for. I would go here in second again.

czW8Ypg43TBzEjmcedwJFA.text: Rivals any steakhouse in Las Vegas and that says a lot because this city has some INCREDIBLE steakhouses. I would place it in the top 3.  The bone-in ribeye has so much flavor that it is remarkable. DO NOT MISS A CHANCE TO EAT HERE!  It's heavenly.

nBqQVA_lBkwDx_bR44__hg.text: I live in Vegas and this by far is a hidden gem. I think its the best steakhouse in Las Vegas

exeu0X7MSIOiflYaBcHuuA.text: Once again, yelpers did not disappoint!  Based on the reviews, I ordered the bone-in rib-eye, which my partner and I shared.    It was juice and flavorful and even though it was pink and bleeding just a little (which would ordinarily gross us both out), we thoroughly enjoyed it.   We very nearly went back the next night to have the identical steak but couldn't justify being in Vegas and not trying another glam restaurant.  (We headed to the Eiffel Tower restaurant instead.)  We also ordered the steakhouse fries and the green beans, both of which were not stellar.   I was also not impressed with the creme brulee -- not warm enough and just didn't have the kind of flavorful zing to justify all those calories.   We're not big wine drinkers and relied on the waiter to suggest something.  He suggested a $20 glass which we passed up so he brought us a taste of the Shiraz instead.  I could swear that the full pour he brought was not the wine we tasted.  In fact, it tasted damn near close to two-buck chuck shiraz.    However the steak was the saving grace.  If I went back, I would have ordered different side dishes and not relied on the waiter for the wine (or get a cocktail instead), but that steak justifies the 4 stars.

7e0awlliwisJE-TaRg3trQ.text: Went there for dinner last night.  It is spot on!!! Great ambiance and food. Bottle of wine, Kobe beef for the bf, steak and lobster for me-$350!! Worth every penny!! Make sure you ask to sit with Victor. Amazing server and nice on the eyes lady's :). Definitely will be back when were back in Vegas!!!

YRkg6P-j3eLNKivPtI3N8Q.text: My brother and I ate here Friday night. We got a reservation for 6:15. We arrived and were promptly seated. Luckily, we got a really cool waitress, Annette. She wasn't stuffy or snobby like some of the waiters at the tables near us.  We ordered;  fresh water oysters  wedge salad with blue cheese crumbles  2 bone in rib-eyes  au gratin potatoes  asparagus  shiner bock  tea   The oysters were surprisingly good. We'd never tried freshwater before. The wedge salad was basically a half head of lettuce. I wasn't expecting it to be that big. The crumbled blue cheese was really good. The steaks were as big as my head. They were cooked to order, juicy, and delicious. The au gratin potatoes were all right. It tasted like they just melted Velveeta cheese over the top. And the asparagus were cooked just right.  Was it expensive? Yes ($200; tip included).  Was it worth it? Definitely!  I mean, it's not like you do this everyday. And, you're on vacation. So splurge!

E7tEIXGCne-FFbTI90F85Q.text: Fantastic dinner  and the waiter was a older gentleman who knew his stuff and gave a great recommendation on the perfect glass of wine to go with my filet. A little expensive but worth every penny since it is a experience not just sitting down to eat your normal dinner. If you get a chance and your on Fremont street and you want a True dining experience hit this place up!!!!

DmpyikVIKDwd7MwIkU6xdw.text: Absolutely incredible steak and a great meal overall. The Golden Nugget had a ad in the room that you can take the restaurant where you get an appetizer (I got the Wedge Salad), main course (8oz  filet mignon and mash potatoes for me) and a desert (Went with the chocolate cake) for less than $50, a great deal. It was one of the best steaks I've ever eaten, no joke.   The side that you get is more than enough for two people, so my wife and I ordered two different sides, she got the creamed spinach, both were excellent. The service of course is top notch. I didn't eat much of the desert, not only because I was really full from the meal, but the chocolate cake was really too rich for me. However, I loved the steak so much, I could have cared less about the cake!  It is pricey of course, but if you're staying on Fremont and want to go all out for one a great meal, this is a good spot to do it!

7amD3ZU5Hs83kXQ5hIn-nw.text: My first love is Smith & Wollensky in NY so I could only give 4 stars.    The porterhouse was amazing. The creamed spinach yummy.  We were leaning back trying to breathe after the steak but I had to try the croissant bread pudding. It was worth the gluttony. One of the men at the table never partakes of dessert and he ate almost half of it  !!!  You have to try it.  It is definitely 5 stars.  Yum.  Yum.  The service was fantastic, attentive and entertaining, not intrusive at all.    Looking forward to going back for an absolutely fantastic steak and dessert.

oCbLwAag0Z5zgnrf2sDWZQ.text: We hit Vic and Anthony's on a Thursday night with a reservation and it was delicious!  I had the filet mignon 8 oz which was cooked to perfection and a side of the Brussels sprouts which was great. When the food came to our table (of 4), it was all extremely hot which makes you feel like it just came out of the kitchen and straight to your table, none of this waiting under a heat lamp for service. One of my friends happened to look online and find a great 3 course alternate menu for a significantly cheaper price than if you ordered it all separately.  It was presented to us by the server from her billfold when we inquired about it, leading us to believe it is a unadvertised special. It must be asked for. A few small complaints, which are actually pretty minor, the wine list is veeeeeery long. Almost overwhelmingly long, it took us forever just to decide on a wine to enjoy with dinner. Also, you must physically leave the restaurant and walk through the casino to find a bathroom.  However our server was great and the staff was fantastic. Plates cleared within seconds of finishing. Enjoy!

4BuYPfFvlQBGsDce0xocag.text: Good food good service.  Roasted beet salad & oyster Rockefeller to die for.  Potatoes au gratin on a salty side.  Told our server about it, a nice young man from Romania, he took it off our final bill without us asking for us.  Nice touch. Shared a prime rib eye steak with a side of peppercorn sauce. Good sauteed wild mushroom.  Ample portion.  Nice atmosphere.  We would do it again.

X22rtV4udeFHKje_JxvMYw.text: A great treasure for me to find. I love this place . If you love .It was in the Golden Nugget Casino. I had the lamb chops wich  were cooked to perfection. and my friend had the sole wich was great. It was expensive ,but well worth it service was great and ,I FELT LIKE ONE OF THE SOPRANO'S ACTORS WERE GONNA COME INTO THE JOINT AT MINUTE.

Cb4Ac6jvJY91mdxKFi-kww.text: I feel like a broken record as all of the reviews are similar but it really was that good.  The setting is really romantic and we were upstairs in a private area with only a few other tables.  The lobster bisque is truly the best I have ever had with chunks of Maine lobster. The portobello mushroom app was large with large chunks of tomato, mozzarella & basil.  I had the chilean seabass a la nage at it was buttery and amazing.  My fiance had a 4 1/2 lobster ($140) (the waiter recommended we share but it was his birthday) and he couldn't even eat half of it but it was cooked perfectly! I had creme brulee served in a wide, narrow dish so there was a lot of crust and it was pretty good and they brought the birthday boy a beautiful (complimentary) croissant bread pudding that was pretty great!  This place is high end so it isn't cheap but I thought it was worth the money!  Victor was a truly gracious waiter and glasses never were empty and he anticipated everything. The only thing I didn't love was the hot tea; it was bitter but I just assume the water was too hot so it didn't steep properly.  Definitely will be back.  For a great deal, go to their website for the "distinctive" dinner...four courses for $50!  I had it and was so full I couldn't move!
